Reviews.Title: “2nd visit still great”
Reviews.Author: LondonJammer
Reviews.Content: If you don"t mind spending a little extra then choose the valley wing which is in my opinion the best part of this hotel,breakfast is amazing in the summit room,free drinks inc champagne all day,afternoon tea and evening canopies are great. The rooms are lovely a big with everything you"ll need,the service is first class...

Reviews.Title: “Rip off Drinks”
Reviews.Author: kernow123Plymouth
Reviews.Content: Always stay at the Shangri la in Singapore, over the years have stayed in the garden, valley and Horizon club rooms in the tower wing as we have this time. Room is nice, staff are very friendly overall a very nice hotel. However the bar prices are a complete rip off, its not so much the prices as you would expect it to be high but what they dont tell you is the size of the measures so a S$22 whisky (£11) is actually tiny, not sure it is even a 25ml single at the absolute most, a glass of wine is at best 100ml. Spent over £2000 for 5 nights here and the rip off of the bar leaves a very bad taste so I would go out and buy elsewhere, drink your duty free in your room or go tee total if you stay here, I wont stay here ever again as I dont like the feeling of being ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: lvndrgrl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights for a business trip. Enjoyed my stay in the hotel. The hotel has a shuttle service to orchard. Enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stop over on the way to Australia”
Reviews.Author: jmreng
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, although not helpful at reception would not accommodate on early arrival from uk, understand procedures and all that, but we're not helpful after a 13 hour flight, exhausted jet lagged etc. Hotel def worthy of 5 star rating, staff let this down. Loved singapore

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Dan542
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel as an alternative to Marina Bay Sands. The reviews I had seen of the Marina Bay put me off as there were regular complaints about it not being ready to be open. I could not be happier with my choice, from the warm welcome to the wonderful room. Check in was a breeze and we were led to our room by a porter who was too polite to accept a tip! My kind of person! We paid a little extra for a room upgrade and stayed in a business suite. Everything in the room could be operated by buttons next to the bed - I did not get bored of opening and closing the curtains at the push of a button! Our room upgrade allowed us access to the bar I think on the 22nd floor, excellent views from there. The lobby could best be described as cavernous with plenty of people nearby should you require any assistance. The location of the hotel was my only gripe. It is just a five minute walk to Orchard Road which is great but found that it was a bit of a distance to anywhere else. Although, with that being said, Singapore is a pretty small place. So, all in all, I highly recommend this hotel and the next time I am in Singapore I am very likely to be staying in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: laura d
Reviews.Content: love love loved! breakfast amazing everything you could ask for, including moet champagne. Staff excellent. rooms like something off james bond, pure luxury. pity it was only for a night.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: MissWizzy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Valley Wing section of the Shangrila and it is the best hotel I have ever stayed at in my life. From the moment I checked in I was treated like royalty. Nothing is too difficult for the lovely staff. I loved the doormen and the lady who escorted me to my room to check me into the hotel. It was such a personalized service. The room was absolutely spotless and the turndown service each night was just delightful. I loved the bath it was massive with every creature comfort. It was a beautiful room without being over the top. The best thing about Valley Wing was the lounge where you could sit and relax over a glass of complimentary Moet and delicious and beautiful snacks all day. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff at Valley Wing. I loved the breakfast in the state room too it was so refined and elegant and just so relaxing. I stayed here on business and would have no hesitation to stay here again if I were to come for leisure. Location is great and taxis are plentiful. I love this hotel so much! I have to rate this ten out of ten for everything!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great room”
Reviews.Author: Trawor
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a room on the 22nd floor. When checking in we were upgraded; the staff was very friendly. Our room belonged to the so called Horizon club, meaning we could have drinks and canapes from 6PM to 8PM. The room was spacious and clean, very nice and big bathroom. Breakfast at Blu was nice, with a nice selection of fruits, cereals and bread. The swimmingpool is also nice, unfortunately there were some renovations going on at the hotel, so there was a bit of noise. The hotel is located just off Orchard Road; you can walk to it and enjoy all the shopping there. We also enjoyed the Sunday brunch at the hotel, which consists of a buffet containing seafood, sushi, salads, meat, indian food and desserts. Unlimited champagne is also included in the price ( I think it was SD 178). Best hotel I stayed in so far in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: GVAtraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here now five or six times over the past ten years. Favorite place in Singapore. Location is good, quiet, yet a quick taxi cab away from town and all the attractions. The pool is great for families, with a small wading pool attached. The staff have always been helpful, even upgrading to a suite to make things easier with young kids. Breakfast is amazing with tons to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “For quality and service and location the shangri la is best”
Reviews.Author: barnton
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned from a 3 week trip which took in Dubai, Sydney, Melbourne, Port Douglas and finally Singapore. We booked the trip through Trailfinders and are so grateful we were given the Shangri La for the Singapore part of our trip. Not only is its location perfect in a quiet street close to Orchard Road and all it's shops, but the service and quality make it the best hotel I have had the pleasure of staying in. Nothing was too much trouble for the fantastic staff. We paid an extra S$150 per night for a suite in the Valley wing. The room was huge and beautifully appointed with views over the garden and pitch and putt course. Valley wing residents receive fresh fruit and newspapers delivered to their room every day. The bathroom had his and her basins, a bath with a tv at one end, walk in shower and separate toilet. It was marble top to bottom and fresh L,occitane toiletries were provided daily. The room had a 40 inch plasma with integrated cd and DVD sound bar. We ordered our evening meal on room service and it was set up by a butler on a table with tablecloth cutlery and flowers, and the food kept warm on an integrated Bain Marie. When you add in the spa and the pool and prestivge restaurants on site, this wonderful hotel really ticks all the boxes.

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous building noise”
Reviews.Author: Mglepd
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this from my eighth floor room, unable to rest due to the dawn-to-dusk renovations at the garden wing and pool area. Hammering, welding, grinding, hammer drills. I've been coming here for 15 years on business and liked the calm poolside environment so much I prepaid for a week's vacation with my wife. Big mistake! The letter of apology from the hotel manager Tina Sim, which we found in our room, says the "refurbishment works will be carried out from 9am to 6 pm". Actually today (Saturday) it was 08:10 am and drove us from our breakfast. You have been warned!

Reviews.Title: “fifth visit and still fantastic”
Reviews.Author: mrtoadhall
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from my fifth stay at the Shangri-La and once again it more than exceeded our expectations. From the moment we stepped out of the taxi on arrival to the moment we enterered the taxi on departure we were treated with warmth, respect and courtesy. The staff are friendly and professional, the room was great and the welcome jasmine tea was refreshing. The fruit bowl was kept replenished and the turn down service great. Loved the bookmarkers. We will return again. Thankyou.

Reviews.Title: “Sultry Singapore and Super Shangri-La”
Reviews.Author: 1sue22
Reviews.Content: We chose Singapore for the third part of a 3-centre break with Fremantle WA and Sydney and opted for the Shangri-La hotel close to Orchard Road. We found this to be a perfect choice. The Shangri--La is a beautiful hotel with helpful, courteous staff and rates among some of the better hotels we have stayed in over the years. From the friendly check-in, hot tea and fresh fruit on arrival to the high level of service this hotel fully deserves its 5 star rating. Our room was a good size and spotless with a large, comfortable bed and spacious bathroom. During our stay there was building work going on as the Garden wing is currently undergoing a major refurbishment. This made the pool area rather noisy during the day but the work was cordoned off and the pool staff worked hard to keep the pool area clean and safe. Whilst we were there guests had full use of the pool. We opted to have breakfast in 'The Line' buffet restaurant each morning but prices are high so expect to pay around £20 per head for a continental breakfast. There is a huge choice of different types of breakfast but some options could work out quite expensive for a family of 4. Getting out and about in Singapore is easy. Take the tourist bus from the hotel to Sentosa Island (basically a large theme park) for the day. The bus is free if you show the driver your disembarkation card from the airport when you arrived and also your passport. You can also catch the yellow Hop On Hop Off buses which will only cost $6 if you show the driver your Flight ticket. The bus runs every 20 minutes and you catch it on Orchard Road. It passes all the places of interest including Raffles, Boat Quay in the business district and lined with old fashioned restaurants, and Chinatown. On the way back stop off at the Botanical Gardens and see the Orchid House..well worth a visit. Orchard Road is only a 15 minute walk from the hotel and is lined with designer shops, huge shopping malls, restaurants and bars, and tons of traffic! But if you want to get away from the bustle for a couple of hours go to Dan Ryan's Pub on Tanglin Road next to the Tudor Court Shopping Centre for a pub atmosphere and food served in huge portions. The walk from the hotel will only take about 15 to 20 minutes. Singapore's weather is hot and humid with regular thunderstorms which are usually short and sharp. The humidity tends to be at its worst early evening or just after a storm but everywhere is air conditioned so you can easilly get quick relief from it. Singapore is a place I have always wanted to visit and I was not disappointed. However, a week spent there was too long and with hindsight I would have preferred to have spent more time in Australia and only 3 or 4 days in Singapore. But would I go again? Well for a short stopover destination..most definately. Would I choose the Shangri-La again? Absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some not so good”
Reviews.Author: j889814672
Reviews.Content: We really looked forward to a stay at the Shang during a 3 day weekend for the family in Singapore. We had 2 rooms connecting. Check in was bizarre... had to do it about 3 times because of the connecting room thing. Staff were very friendly and nice and it was nice to see the same faces repeatedly in the Horizon club. Food was very average. No flavor in many items and a lot of the sauces were very salty. We enjoy spicy Asian food but the Shang seems to have mellowed things for their western clientele. The pool area is great and the service there is fantastic. The gym is nice and well equipped. Can be accessed 24/7. The beds were quite hard, but were also quite worn... they had "valleys" on both sides! I guess for $450/night ++ x 2 rooms I expect something close to perfection, and the Shang did not reach that level. I feel like I get a lot more for my money at Traders in Singapore - especially better food - and there are lots of better choices in Singapore such as the Fairmont and the Hyatt and probably others.

Reviews.Title: “Where is the Shang of yesteryears?”
Reviews.Author: Taipan888
Reviews.Content: The Shangri La in Singapore defined Asian Luxury. From the moment you stepped in you were transported into a different world. The space, smell, look, service, people, dresses, food everything was enchanted. The hotel has kept a lot of these unique and differentiated aspects that set it apart. However, it has fallen behind on the most basic requirement: rooms! Is it the competition of new hotels with bigger and better appointed rooms or is it the years that are starting to show? They are narrow, cramped, bathrooms outdated. Even the restaurants show their age. The main dining restaurant, buffet style was packed, seating a bit like a cafeteria, Nadaman the Japanese restaurant with its wooden tables and chairs is a bit old fashioned, the pool area small, the tiny golf ship and put going a bit wild. There was work going on in the garden wing for a major renovation and that made the pool area noisy and parts of the pool was restricted. The lounge however maintained its character as did the service which was absolutely perfect. The main hotel needs a complete renovation and the rooms need to be knocked down to allow for more space...unless they knock down the entire building which is what's happening with most residential buildings in the neighborhood of the age of the Shangri La!

Reviews.Title: “from a shangri la fan...this was a bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Dorsetman_10
Reviews.Content: If you are planning to go to this hotel between now and the summer (may/june?)..i suggest ..you dont ! The swimming pool ,which is perhaps the Hotels best feature is dominated by building works.Noise and dust dominate the area...we did not use it once.i was not made aware of this when we booked...which considering it was a direct booking with the hotel ,is bad form. secondly we had two rooms...both were affected by the noise from the lifts.on checking in i asked specifically not to have this problem.one tends to accept the promises of reception...my mistake. they did move me to valley wing ..an apparent upgrade.it was quiet (gratefully received)but the Valley wing is souless and very snooty...only go there if you are a snooty type. on location....not bad,bad...but there are many better.next time i would go down by the water,near the Raffles Hotel location.Shangri la is a short walk (10-12 mins to shops) but nothing of real note.the best part of town is a £7-10 taxi ride away. i have stayed in a good number of shangri las,and like their style and service.for me this one fell far short and i would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute pleasure”
Reviews.Author: twofourseven
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel on a corporate rate while on business in town before heading to Kuala Lumpur. The room was fantastic in the main buildng with a very comfy bed. Staff were helpful and attentive. The gardens and pool were great, though the hotel was refurbishing the garden wing. A quality hotel in Singapore, though a mark down because of the building work.

Reviews.Title: “A truly beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: EmptyseaNZ
Reviews.Content: A stunning hotel located close to Orchard Road. Decor in the public areas is amazing - I don't think I've ever seen so many huge chandeliers! Room was tastefully decorated, spacious and the bathroom was enormous. All in all a lovely place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: David C
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Shangri-La. It is a very gracious hotel, quiet and a bit away from the bustle of Orchard Road, but within easy walking distance. On our first night we had a problem. There was a slight smell of mould in the bedroom, enough to trigger my wife's asthma. We thought we could manage but at 1.00am had to engage the night staff who were superb. The night manager, Julian Wiederholz, found us another room on a different floor, helped us move, kept both rooms going so we could sleep in the new room and pack up the first room in the morning - all done with such care and courtesy. The restaurants were outstanding for all meals, high quality food and meticulous friendly service. We went to the first class Shang Palace restaurant in the hotel for dinner on 3 occasions and the manager, Calvin Ng Wee Boon, went to no end of trouble to make sure that our allergies to gluten and milk products were catered for and that there was variety in the meals. Nothing was too much trouble for him and his staff. The spa with its excellent massage services were clean, efficient and therapeutic. Altogether this was a fantastic experience and we would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Superb Mgr. Comes to our Rescue !”
Reviews.Author: seatrav65
Reviews.Content: In January, we spent three nights in the Valley Wing of the Shangri-la Hotel, Singapore, along with two other couples, prior to our boarding Regent Voyager for a 17 day cruise to Sydney. I had made in depth arrangements with the Concierge of the Main Bldg. of this hotel for three days of intensive touring with guide, driver and van. These arrangements were not honored by that concierge because of poor communications within the hotel. I explained the problem to the manager of the Valley Wing, the most prestigious wing of the hotel---Mr. Raj Rajagopal. He was simply marvelous, and arranged for all of our touring within one hour. Our room in the Valley wing was spacious, well furnished, featured a large bathroom, was quiet, and offered a fine view. The food in the restaurant was first rate. I have been staying at this hotel since the mid-1970s, and it just keeps getting better and better !

Reviews.Title: “Singapore is blessed with another amazing "S"- the Shangri-La Singapore.”
Reviews.Author: ShortsTrip
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th time in SIngapore and definitely the Lion City just enamored me in all aspects: the shopping malls (great buys on December, though the weather is still warm with some rain showers), the food (wherever you want to take it: on the streets like Lau Pa Sat) or at the hotels) Shangri-La's The Line offers an excellent array of choices. The sweet treats just melt in your mouth. I'm no foodie but it made me think to try being one. ha ha ha. The Japanese restaurant is so placid - like ancient Japan with great food and simple but classic interior. I stayed at the Tower Wing - with a portion view of the swimming pool. The Wifi is great - you can have have connection while sipping your cappucino at the pool area. The service is great and always ready with smiles. the staff are intelligent...you dont need to explain more to get your message across. The place is not noisy. You wont hear cars and taxis coming. It is located at the "forest" area of Singapore where "eden" used to be. Truly Shangri-La SIngapore lives to its name - the Shangri-la.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hospitality”
Reviews.Author: shirlloyd
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from our first experience of Singapore and especially the Shangri-La hotel. We arrived from an overnight flight to find our luggage had not followed us from London! The hotel staff could not have been more helpful and provided us with the health club facilities to freshen up and gave us complimentary bags with polo shirts,shorts and toiletries. The room was made ready for us very quickly so we could rest and relax and start our holiday in the best possible way.The concierge contacted the airport to advise of our room so our luggage could be delivered directly to us. We cannot thank the staff enough for what they did at the beginning and throughout our stay there. Everyone was so friendly and the hotel very comfortable and luxurious.The breakfasts were unbelievable and irresistible. Thank you Shangri-La.

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit”
Reviews.Author: Louis M
Reviews.Content: Our first visit here was on a stop over en route to Malaysia and albeit we were only there for a couple of days it was excellant. So when we were planning a trip to Bali and wanted to stop over somewhere......thwere was only one choice for us. the whole ambience of the hotel reception sets the scene, the rooms are excellant and the staff especially in the lounge are superb. They remember you and go that extra mile to make you feel welcome and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: royalruby
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year what a fab hotel . Nothing is to much trouble the breakfeast was unbelievable we counted 18 different breakfeast stations catering for every taste . I cannot find one fault with hotel . I found it great for the shopping easy to walk from the hotel to the main shopping area .

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Valley Wing”
Reviews.Author: Chelsey80
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week long family holiday at the Shangri-La... the hotel was absolutely stunning, we stayed the valley wing and the room was lovely! The bathroom was huge and was a great size for 2 adults and 2 kids. The only downside is no one told us that there were renovations happening right next to the pool area, which was dissappointing and not very relaxing when the kids were swimming. The food was great, the service was excellent! But I probably wouldnt recommend this hotel for a family with small children.

Reviews.Title: “5 star lux in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: vivek000
Reviews.Content: Pros: Stunning public spaces Superb, flawless service with a smile Contacted us before and after our visit Remarkably good food and bars within the hotel Allowed us a very early check Hotel room had wonderful views in the best part of town Cons: Shower head in the room was strong but was a mess. Had a lake in the bathroom. Complimentary fruit was missing in the room Concierge could have been much better. His recommendations for a short tour were not that good. Signature beer was missing from the bar Most of my cons are nitpicking, and this is a truly deluxe hotel. It is expensive for sure, but I really felt it is worth it for how well they take care of you.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Debra2011
Reviews.Content: The hotel and the staff were amazing. They truly understand customer service. The food was outstanding also.

Reviews.Title: “a Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: MelsPerth_Australia Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Staff were amazing and coped with their noisy renovation magnificently. Pool area still suffering from building noise .The Premier room was spacious and well appointed. The Worlds Best Breakfast Title at the Line Restaurant still applies! A great place to relax , enjoy and explore Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: worldman1
Reviews.Content: First time in a Shangri-La Hotel. The service and facilities were good. The breakfast was truly outstanding. Well located. Nice pool.

Reviews.Title: “A luxury break”
Reviews.Author: Potterers
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel a few times as a stop over to and from New Zealand. We do pay the extra for the Horizon Club room and facilities and each time have been delighted with the ambience and service. We think it is well worth it. Staff are helpful and courteous. The hotel pool and gardens are excellent for 'chill out' time after long flights and the hotel provides a shuttle to the shops of Orchard Road and the MRT. Equally, it is only a ten minute walk from the same places. The Botanic gardens are only twenty minutes walk away providing another excellent option after hours on aircraft! Breakfast is in a bright dining room with ample choice. Food is fresh and tasty. This hotel provides the ideal combination of well-maintained and attractive outside space with easy access to transport to the attractions of Singapore. We would not want to stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Ulrich H
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults, 2 kids 8 months and 2.3 years) stayed for 4 nights. Got up-graded from Horizon Premier Room (which is already super spacious) to Suite. Baby Cod as booked was already room, but they even provided Baby Shampoo, Body Wash etc. All staff very helpful and accommodating with children. Breakfast at "The Line" is outstanding - so difficult to control yourself. We did not use the pool, so the construction in Garden Wing did not bother us. Well equipped gym overlooking garden / pool.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel, unfriendly for the wallet”
Reviews.Author: Irfan M
Reviews.Content: The Shangri-la in Singapore keeps its promise of homely welcome, extremely welcoming and friendly staff, speedy check-in and check-out and probably one of the largest buffet spreads. Its a great hotel, situated conveniently though little expensive on the wallet.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Palmtree2000
Reviews.Content: My friend and I arrived at the Shangri-La at 2am after traveling 24 hours from New York. We arrived with reservations for two rooms in the Tower Wing for non-smoking rooms made months in advance. You can imagine how we felt when we were escorted to our room on a smoking floor. As soon as I stepped out of the elevator I could smell it reeking. So we went back down to the lobby to be told they had nothing else for that night. We had to grin and bear the stench. We were not happy campers. However, the next day we were sought out by Duty Manager Julian Wiederholz who with profuse apologies changed our rooms not to another room in the Tower Wing but to the ultra-luxurious Valley Wing which is a separate building with its own entrance, lobby, frontdesk, concierge and restaurant. All of this was done free of charge even though rooms in the Valley Wing go for more than twice the price of a room in the Tower Wing. And Mr. Wiederholz included free breakfast every morning of our one week stay. Rooms in The Valley Wing are huge and provide every amenity one could possibly want. Many thanks to Mr. Wiederholz for making what started out as a rocky stay a superb stay. The Shang, living up to its reputation all over the world, is a superb urban resort with beautifully landscaped grounds and a lovely pool for relaxing. The hotel lobbies both for The Valley Wing and The Tower Wing are gorgeous. The Shang is located about three block from Orchard Road, the main shopping street in Singapore. The hotel provides free shuttle service to Orchard Road. Be advised that if you choose to walk, the walk back from Orchard Road is uphill.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrskosasih
Reviews.Content: Was there for work - the hotel is overall good, adequate room size for Singapore, and I like the fact that they have lots of elevators so we never have to wait long to go up/down. The hotel is just a bit old. The location is a 7 minute walk from Orchard but it's a bit hilly so expect a little workout.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but a little below our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Nick L
Reviews.Content: Its a great hotel, but for the price, it would have to be! The lobby and dining areas are immaculate and quite stunning, the rooms are a bit of a let down as they are quite dated. Service is first-class. The staff will go out of their way to assist at all times. We stayed here on our honeymoon and so felt a bit out of place with all the corporates who stay here - in hindsight, its not a good hotel for holiday-makers. Dining at the hotel is very expensive - best to walk to Orchard Rd or catch a taxi into the city for meals. For example, we called the lobby for some milk for a cup of tea and were told it would cost S$10! Lesson learned - go to a 7 Eleven for milk, drinks, snacks while you stay here. The pool is OK but nothing outstanding - certainly not resort standard but sufficient for a city hotel. Gym facilities were fantastic - lots of equipment and very modern. The hotel is a little bit out of the way - you will need to catch a cab or walk about 15 to 20 mins to Orchard Rd.

Reviews.Title: “No better place to stay in Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: sleeplessinseoul
Reviews.Content: When our car pulled up to hotel entrance receptionist and bellman walked up to our car and took us to valley wing for check in. Wow! The valley wing was beautifully laid out and we were offered to have us checked in our room since we had our little one. The room was perfect and my daughter 5 years old immediately fell in love with the place. During our 5 nights at the Shangri La we had complimentary breakfast at the valley wing lounge and canapes, finger sandwiches and coffee through out the day. We did not dine at the hotel but amount of food we were given everyday from valley wing staff was enough to hold us over for days. When we were leaving the hotel there must have been entire valley wing staff standing in fron of the entrance to see us off. My family has never experienced anything like this before and we look forward to our next stay at the valley wing. Until next time thank you all at the Shangri La valley wing.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Facilities & Service - Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravellerPaul123
Reviews.Content: This was the last destination on our honeymoon so we splurged and purchased the Horizon Club Premier Suite in the Tower Wing, which I must say was expensive even though we purchased it through a discount travel site. However it was worth EVERY penny. The room although a little dated and needing a few modern lines was absolutely massive, some 72sqm. It is quite rare to find such a large sized room in Singapore especially in the older hotels (the Shangri-la isn't exactly new - although sometimes its hard to tell). There was a study desk, two and a half seater lounge, 2 single sofa chairs, a desk, large minibar, what looked like a foyer to the walkin wardrobe, king sized bed and what was the largest bathroom I have ever seen in a hotel - massive shower, seperate bath with a marble dance floor to the sink/basin. To top it off the hotel offers L'occitane bath products in the room which help you smell absolutely devine in the sweltering humidity of Singapore. The Shangri-la is a resort even though most people may think of it as a ritzy business hotel. I guess this is why it blows so many people away - It really is like you've escaped the busy city and entered a tranquil paradise, as cliche as it sounds - but it isn't a stiff upperlip Hitlon. From the moment you step out of the taxi you are met by a fleet of friendly staff waiting to help carry your bags, open the door for you, to simply say hi or to escort you to check-in and all sporting that elusive smile that some hotels forget put us all at ease. The entrance foyer is huge and very grand with its check in desks, sunken cocktail/reception lounge, large staircase, 1st floor lounge and conference rooms all visible as you step through the front doors - and just incase you needed more attention or got past the front doors without getting noticed there are more staff dotted behind the front doors who politely nod or attend to your needs as required. This service never ends during your stay at the Shangri-la, be it from the house keepers, front desk staff, concierge, lift attendants or waitresses - they never seem to be too busy or important to smile, bid you good day or offer assistance if you look perplexed or lost. Even the lifts do their bit to remind you what day of the week it is as the carpets are changed daily and announces the name of the day, SATURDAY! Following on from the oppulent entry the ground floors are dotted with little extras that just remind you that even though it seems like you are in a small boutique hotel with servants at your beckon call, you really are in a large resort. There is an inhouse cake shop to make that special cake for you if you deside to have a wedding in a conference room or celebrate that special occassion - we recieve a 'congratulations on your honeymoon' cake which was waiting in our room, it was not requested nor expected but tasted even better because we hadn't. There is a tailor, gift shop, hair dresser, a rather large gym, beautician and what seems to be a theme in the Shangri-la hotels I've stayed in - Possibly the biggest and best buffet you have ever experienced, yes it is expensive but well worth the experience and culinary journey. One of the biggest draw cards for us as honeymooners before we considered any of the above was the pool and private gardens. The Shangri-la has one of Singapore's biggest pools and because the hotel is frequented by so many business people that meant that there wasn't many people around to enjoy it. The Shangri-La is set back from the busy Orchard Road, but it is a quick 5 minute stroll to the first shop or a quick taxi hop to Clarke Quay or Marina Bay. You'll notice that Singapore has something very right in that it is one of the rare cities in the world were you can sit in a taxi for 30 mins and only spend $15. Everyone says that quality and service comes at a price, but often travellers wonder how much more do I have to pay to get this quality and service? Where's my value? The Shangri-La is not cheap, but neither is the intrinsic value you will get out of your stay there. It is from my experience one of the most enjoyable hotels I have ever stayed in, they really do make you feel like the most important customer they have, yet you are only one of several hundred. Did I ever stop to consider this during my stay? during the times when I went to the 20th floor to get to my room? No, never! Couple this with the quality offerings, facilities and location then I don't understand why you would want to stay anywhere else in Singapore - If you can afford it. If you can afford more, why bother? It seems to be all right here.

Reviews.Title: “They know how to look after you”
Reviews.Author: digitalruggerman
Reviews.Content: We got upgraded to the Horizon Club. Maybe that coloured our treatment, but whatever the staff were brilliant and we certainly felt well looked after. The lounge is great for doing some work in peace before setting out on your day and breakfast in the restaurant was great with waiter service rather than buffet. All in all a great hotel that we will go back to. Almost certainly pay the extra for the Horizon Club as well.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS in every way”
Reviews.Author: bossladyCalifornia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were there just before Christmas. We are from the US and we were impressed that their huge lobby was decorated with trees and also Christmas music. The grounds are to die for, very tropical. The rooms are huge, we had a room on the Horizon Club level. Enormous shower and whirlpool tub, large area with two sinks. The staff is so friendly and polite. We loved the Horizon Club and the evening cocktails. Breakfast was great and included. There is absolutely nothing to say negative about this property or the employees. We ate at their restaurant and the food was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Mor66
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located perfectly for getting around Singapore. Is attached to a shopping mall. Rooms are very comfortable and spacious, great views across Singapore. The room was not ready when we arrived late afternoon, which is always a bug bear after travelling, we were offered free food and drink while we waited which was very nice. We did not eat in the hotel as Singapore is a place to explore with plenty of great restaurants apart from our free snack on arrival which was lovely. Staff very friendly. Would definately recommend

Reviews.Title: “A mother of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hildegull
Reviews.Content: At Shangri-La in Orange Grove Road I was taken care of as if I had brought my mother to Singapore. The staff are so friendly, helpful, positive and polite and they all made me feel welcome and comfortable. The room is nice, but room service is even better. And visit the restaurant BLU while you are there; the staff there is the best and the view is fantastic. This hotel really lives up to its reputation. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Your haven in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: ANDY T
Reviews.Content: A truly excellent hotel with all the amenities you need and several restaurants in-house to suit every palate. The restaurants are pricey but quality is first class. Wouldnt think of staying anywhere else in Singapore when I return there. Situated on a hill with green surroundings makes it wonderfully quiet and palatial. Just a stone-throw away from the main shopping streets. You may even use the free shuttle to get there but I found walking there ok too (5 minutes walk). Rooms are beautifully furnished and the bed left you feeling great when waking up. The reception and the staff in general were all very polite and helpful whenever approached. You really felt like being the special guest they wanted to care for. It is sad to realize that this level of luxury, service and courtesy you hardly find in other parts of the world than certain Asian destinations like Singapore and Thailand

Reviews.Title: “The hotel that feels like home.”
Reviews.Author: Leoca
Reviews.Content: We love Singapore and the Shangri La is the best hotel. Stay in the towers, though. They've tried to upgrade us to the garden suite and we preferred the towers. The driver of your car will call ahead and there'll be a charming girl to meet you on the footpath outside, who will whisk you to your room for checkin. The bags just follow. The restaurants are great, but our preferred one is the eatery with the quaint name of "The Line". It's a buffet but not really -- twenty or so salads, soups they make while you wait, Indian food, Chinese, English, Japanese, twenty kinds of seafood and you pick your own. Then there's the desserts -- icecream made on a cold bench, custards, fresh fruit it goes on and on. The service is slick, smiling and very efficient. Breakfast on the top floor is also something special. And the canapés at night, too. That's why we like the tower, because it's all there.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in the City”
Reviews.Author: Meredith_8255103
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a true respite from the hustle and flow of downtown Singapore -you literally breathe a sigh of relief when you see the doorman and his amazing headgear! The staff are friendly, the food is wonderful (the room service kway teow noodles are fantastic) and the ambience of the entire hotel is something you need to experience. The pool staff are outstanding ( thank you Bernard and Raymond) and the pool itself is really beautiful. It is only a short walk to Orchard MRT and Ion Orchard or there is a very convenient shuttle to the main shopping precinct.

Reviews.Title: “Goog location, excellent service, oldish but comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sergio P
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at the Shangri-La on a business trip. This is the oldest Shangr-La and it has a certain grandeur given its size, usual style and great common areas. Food is good (excellent, even if expensive breakfast buffet) and service is excellent. I like the location and the rooms have a certain charm even if they are getting a bit oldish. A nice choice for a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jessandjohontheroad
Reviews.Content: Fantastic experience from time we arrived to when we checked out. Friendly professional staff.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive Singapore Hotels - One of the many gems in the city”
Reviews.Author: HardlyUseful
Reviews.Content: Shangri - La is a very good hotel to stay. Their service is very good and the rooms are well done with all amenities present in the rooms. The city view is good with orchard street residences being visible from the rooms. Hotel - The line buffet at the hotel is pretty amazing. With cuisines from all over the world including India, Japanese, Thai, Korean, European, American, Local food etc. The pool and the gym are up to the mark. They also have a fine dining restaurant blu which I haven tried yet. Value: Well! Staying in Singapore is expensive. Hence i would say this place is a good value. Location: A mile from Orchard street shops. A cab is usually necessary. No shops around the corner. The street is usally open 24 hrs. Cabs are available in plenty. Sometimes a wait for few minutes. PS - They have shuttles every hour to orchard street malls. Also, sentosa has there bus come every 45mins. Quality: I think the quality is really good. No complaints. Timing: There is construction going on till July 2012 so if you do get affected by sounds every now and then. Visit them after July. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Plush Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Anne C
Reviews.Content: This was a stop over for two nights on the way to New Zealand and it was such a relaxing place to stay. The door man in traditional costumn welcomed me and there were always friendly staff on hand to answer any queries. They suggested day and evening trips and as I was travelling alone this was so important. The rooms were spotless and elegant, the surrounding grounds and pools were beautiful. The breakfast had every choice imaginable and I had a delicius eveing meal. One very helpful and amusing touch was the fact that the carpet in the lift was changed every day, with the name of the day printed on it. For the long distance traveller this was great. It was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very elegant and grand”
Reviews.Author: ZainBattikhi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights over the Christmas weekend and had a wonderful time. Very efficient staff - especially concierge who would reply to my emails within hours of sending them. The rooms are very comfortable, spacious and well-maintained. In fact, the entire property and its grounds are just stunning and very zen - true to the Shangri-la philosophy. Singapore is a small country but it runs like clockwork. Definitely worth a few days' visit if you are in the region.

Reviews.Title: “Meets expectations of Shangri-La brand”
Reviews.Author: ariellek_bj
Reviews.Content: The hotel has the appearance and the substance of luxury. I arrived at 6am and although there was no room available, I was offered a complimentary breakfast at the executive floor so that I could wait for a room. The concierge was also extremely helpful is providing suggestions for restaurants and helping me with booking a table. All in all I have nothing to complain about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Every stay there has been wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Froggie_traveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed several times at the Shangri-la and could never find a fault. Staff is attentive, caring, helpful and without being snob in any way. The rooms are lovely (both in tower and garden), the pool and gardens are magical, you forget you are close to the city centre, breakfast is somptuous, shuttles to the MRT are practical. It will be hard to stay anywhere else in Singapore now!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel just off the busy area”
Reviews.Author: SampleTheCulture
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice, the staff was nice, pool was great, and the breakfast was delicious. My only slight complaint was that the rooms look a little dated. They are clean just decor wise they could use a slight update. The location is slightly off the main area and it is a 5-10 min walk to the MRT. They did offer a free shuttle which was helpful. When you make reservations try and negotiate a rate with breakfast included. They have a spectacular spread for the morning buffett. Other than the slight drawbacks of the walk to the main area and the room decor, this is a very nice hotel and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else!!!”
Reviews.Author: Wonderwoman82
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved everything about this hotel!! The service is first class and the breakfast is the BEST breakfast I have ever seen! There is an enormous variety of choice covering all regions and everything was so tasty. We have travelled extensively throughout Asia, Europe and America staying at many luxurious hotels but this hotel is one of the best. Orchard Road is only a 5 to 10 minute walk away and "Johnny" at the Concierge desk was most helpful with his advice on restaurants and tours. The pool area is lovely and if the lounge chairs were taken there were many more on the lawn area nearby. The rooms and bathrooms were large and modern. All in all it was a fabulous 4 night stay! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't quite live up to our expectations”
Reviews.Author: BusyBeeBuzzBuzz
Reviews.Content: This was our choice of hotel on the second leg of our 3 week honeymoon. We were incredibly impressed having spent our 2007 Christmas Celebrations in The Line Restaurant and we couldn't wait to actually stay here. We had reserved a Deluxe Garden Wing Pool View Room at our booking and we were bitterly disappointed to be given a room without a view apart from the main entrance and road which was also very noisey. We complained straight away and was advised that we were on a 'reserved list' and we would be moved the following day. We had to wait in until 1pm which wasn't a very good start to our Singapore break. When we did move, it was much quieter, however the pool was barely visible and if you are a fan of brown corrugated roof tops, you are in for a win! We brought it to the attention of the hotel concierge and he duly informed us that our 'block' was going to be destroyed and re-built and hardly anyone was staying in these rooms. We were not filled with much confidence, especially when our curtains didn't close properly and we didn't have any hot water. This was rectified eventually. We have stayed in Singapore three times in the past and stayed at The Robinson Quay Hotel, Copthorne Orchid Hotel and Orchard Parade Hotel (5 mins away from Shangri-La) which are much cheaper, and exceeded our expectations. We agree with other reviewers that the Shangri-La is immaculate in all of the public areas and staff are incredibly polite and attentive. We were also given several gifts during our stay including a honeymoon cake, chocolates and wine by way of apology, but we felt like we didn't quite fit in with the businessmen and women who frequented the hotel for their meetings. We complained to our Travel Agency on our return home and we given a voucher for a complimentary upgrade on our return to Singapore and I was also sent a beautiful hamper from Kuoni as I felt this had impacted on our honeymoon a little.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel with some small negatives”
Reviews.Author: SharatMendu
Reviews.Content: I checked in Shangrila-La for a weekend holiday break. Pricing is expensive but very apt for hotel of that size and grandeur. Accessibility from MRT is poor due to location of hotel being very far from nearest MRT stations. if you are a brisk walker and love walking in clean streets with lot of green trees, then Shangrila is a good hotel present in heart of city but away from bustle of orchard road. Food and rooms are ok but very old style in nature.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: Chris-Mansfield
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few nights at the end of a cruise around asia.. The Hotel is mega luxurious but looking a little frayed around the corners.. service, food were impeccable .. the building itself could do with a bit of an update but still extremely nice .. Its a 10 minute walk from Orchard road .

Reviews.Title: “Incredible paradise”
Reviews.Author: ValueSeekerRW
Reviews.Content: Stayed for almost a week for business, and met clients at The Line and Nadaman. Upon arrival, I was upgraded to the Valley wing. I don't know what staying at the other part of the hotel was like, but wow!! Every morning had breakfast at the Valley wing's dining room and was waited upon by the incomparable Jegan. The room was very spacious and thoughtfully appointed. I swam almost every early morning in their gigantic, gorgeous pool and pretty much had it to myself. The Line has incredible selection and more casual vibe. Nadaman has a serene atmosphere, and the food was solid but not notable. It was hard to go back to normal life after being in "Shangri-La".

Reviews.Title: “Wow. One of the best hotels I have stayed in...”
Reviews.Author: TravellerTokyo6058
Reviews.Content: The Shangri-La Hotel in Singapore has to be one of the best hotels I have stayed in PERIOD. From a warm reception at check-in, to a staff that learns to know its guests by name, to its outstanding location in Singapore, a superb place to spend vacation or business time.

Reviews.Title: “As always-Shangri La for great (p)leasure”
Reviews.Author: thoschdo
Reviews.Content: we stayed 8 days in the SLS and it was as always a relaxing time. Staff is professionell and polite and also with kids is never a problem. The pool is big and good and makes fun at all. And the rooms are Shangri-La style means very good. The breakfadt is awesome and if you like the varity of food in The Line restaurant you will love the breakfast there too.

Reviews.Title: “Best in class - Singapore”
Reviews.Author: krisgksrk
Reviews.Content: Amazing locality - the Orchard Road - Orange Very close to Little India and China town where you can shop The food - buffet lunch is lavish and amazing Beautiful swimming pool and conference room. its also the central point for most spots in Singapore like the Fyler you can reach the Night safari by taxi by paying 20odd Singapore Dollars and get an exquisite night life experience of jungle life

Reviews.Title: “Great stopover”
Reviews.Author: Lucyleopard
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at the hotel. We arrived in the evening after overnight flight from London. We were quickly checked in and shown to our corner room in the Tower Wing. The room was spacious and well equipped. We had dinner in the Chinese Restaurant which was good although we were probably too tired to really appreciate it! We made full use of the Horizon Club for breakfast ( very good selection), cocktails and to have coffee whilst watching an amazing storm. The gymi is well equipped and the pool spacious. Would recommend the hotel even though Singapores awful traffic make for lengthy transfers. A visit to the zoo is also advised. World Class

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: CassGeorge
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Shangri La for 2 nights before a cruise to Borneo. We had a corner suite in the Tower which was enormous and beautifully appointed. Great views, very comfortable and a beautiful bathroom. There is construction going on, but luckily we were at the opposite end of the hotel. We arrived very late at night from Sydney, and check in was very smooth and professional and done in our room, which was very welcome. I thought the Club lounge was ok - but not that great. The food was pretty average and it was very crowded, and often hard to get a seat. The service however was excellent. The Line was great fun for breakfast with so many choices from many cuisines - we loved the dumplings and the tasty yoghurt (not together!). I also had a facial at the Spa which was excellent, as was the hairdresser.We also dined in the Japanese restaurant which was very good. Overall, we loved Singapore and loved this hotel. However, it is a bit out of the way, and we may try somewhere on the Bay next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: RUTHANDPAULLondon
Reviews.Content: I was attending a large conference and expected a busy reception - it was speedy, efficient and welcoming. I booked the most basic room as I was trying to be cost conscious for my business and it was very good. Big TV, lovely shower, desk area and large bed. IMpecably clean, nice toiletries. Food at the hotel is very good especially sweet and sour dishes from room service and ice creams. Main restaurant is very busy and a little noisy in the evenings but there is HUGE choice available and good quality food. They have a trasnfer service to local shops and staff are friendly offering advice of where to go and what to do in your spare time. One of the best things about this hotel is that it's set back from the main road in grounds unlike many other Singapore hotels. service was very good - my bathroom light broke and I didn't have time to call up maintenance - by the time I got back to my room it was fixed without even asking! All in all a very good stay and I would rebook for business or holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel.. but a bit dated”
Reviews.Author: doitwhileyoucan71
Reviews.Content: This is one of the largest hotels in Singapore in terms of the number of rooms and is therefore popular for conferences etc. The staff is very attentive and courteous. The restaurants are pretty decent as well. In fact the breakfast buffet is one of the largest I have seen in terms of variety. However the hotel facilities and the furnishing are a bit dated ... like a bit of a flashback ( not in an entirely unpleasant way) to the late eighties. I have stayed there a few times on business... and it suited my needs well. However if we were taking a family holiday, Singapore has better options at that price.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lisa2053
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a 4 night stay at the Shangri La and it really is a beautiful hotel! The staff are incredibly attentive and the rooms are spacious and stylish with great facilities. I was greeted with traditional Chinese welcome tea delivered to my room which I thought was a lovely touch. At the moment the Garden Wing of the hotel is being rennovated so the pool can be a little noisy but it really didn't bother me, I just put my IPod on and it was the perfect oasis for catching up on some paperwork. The Breakfast buffet is delicious and nobody would go hungry as they cater for all needs. We also had dinner in the Line one evening then the Shang Palace - both were delicious but a little on the expensive side (but Singapore is considered to be expensive these days). Even though in walking distance, the hotel runs a complimentary shuttle bus which runs to various spots including Traders Hotel and to one of the main shopping centres on Orchard Road. One of my absolute fav quirks of this hotel was the fact that the carpet in the lifts are changed daily, displaying the day of the week, just so that you are without doubt what day it is lol.

Reviews.Title: “Good stopover”
Reviews.Author: chaangfans
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the Valley Wing at this hotel many times on short stops in Singapore. The rooms are delightful and comfortable and the facilities offered in this area of the hotel are pleasing. We have noted on our latest stay that there appear to have been cutbacks in some areas and that things are not quite the same as they were, but nevertheless, the staff remain charming and helpful. A good place for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel, overcrowded Club Lounge, noisy pool”
Reviews.Author: HONkiev
Reviews.Content: It was the first Shangri-La as we were told, from 1971 - and this can be seen. I love the original early 70's style as it still can be seen inside the elevators, but @ a Shangri-La you should expect that everything is preserved perfectly. Unfortunately they didn't and lots of things have chips & dents, what a petty. The room furniture doesn't look 5* anymore, I would rate it 4* with its light wood/green scheme. Some of the furniture doesn't fit the style, look IKEA cheap. The Club Floor is huge - but overcrowded. When you join breakfast in Jeans (long), Lacoste Polo shirt & fashion Flip-Flops they tell you that's not allowed & you've to change to join breakfast - even 25% of the people are already sitting wearing Flip-Flops. Then, after I informed the supervisor he went to each guest wearing Flip-Flops, disturbed their breakfast, telling them that next day they should dress properly. So, even the waiters got stuck in 1971! The pool, overcrowded & very noisy. We planned to spend the weekend @ the pool, relaxing. No chance! There're much better hotels in Singapore. If you want style, view & a perfect pool there's no choice than the Fullerton Bay Hotel (not the original Fullerton Hotel!).

Reviews.Title: “Recommended....... But.”
Reviews.Author: splithead
Reviews.Content: Great hotel but the first thing to say is that until later this year the pool side is a bit of a write-off because of surrounding building work both at the hotel and the site opposite and therefore it is unpleasantly noisy to be at the pool except on Sundays. The Valley Wing have a complimentary bar in their lobby up to and including champagne and the service is excellent. The hotel based restaurants are formal and quite expensive while The Line is a modern canteen style restaurant where the breakfast offer is wide ranging but the ambiance tends to be a bit chaotic compared with the more stately Summit Room as the fellow residents from the Tower Wing descend for their extensive morning feed. The Line becomes an international buffet in the evenings with an a la carte alternative offer also located there but it is questionable as to how much food you would need to eat to make the buffet good value at nearly £40 per head and as ours needed to be reheated at our request in the microwave we were happy to successfully challenge what we were going to be charged. We experienced a couple of lapses in communication from the beautifully presented Reception staff who would probably benefit from having the means of booking the hotel based restaurants at their disposal rather than having to phone them like a guest would have to. One of the erstwhile excellent waiters had an apparent brainstorm over what marmalade was one morning and finally delivered it to our table in apparent mild frustration at our twice repeated request but otherwise the service was excellent. I don't know if the lady in question was trying out her management skills but in an episode that felt on reflection like blatant discrimination on our last morning I was told that I would need to change my linen shorts if I wanted to enter the Summit room for breakfast.It was a lady that we hadn't seen before but I was wearing shorts that I had certainly worn to breakfast before without a problem and it was only when we spotted another guest leaving the breakfast room in sports shorts that it was accepted that 'on this occasion' it would be ok......for the record more than one subsequent breakfast diner was allowed in afterwards wearing shorts but these were women and I was eagle eyed watching for any men to enter in shorts unchallenged and if they had been I could guarantee you that there would have been a serious complaint.This issue was untypical of the hotel but we could have easily done without it. We loved Singapore but would advise against the tired touristy offer of afternoon tea at Raffles which was offered with minimal effort,style or imagination while we were there( despite the hotel being a lovely looking building) and we much preferred the offer at TWG tea boutique at ION Orchard Mall. As for Singapore Slings in the Long Bar......the naff chalkboard signs on the way to the bar should have warned us......over-priced and sickly and not even made to order and I'm afraid the Long Bar has no more character and style than your average boozer.

Reviews.Title: “Valley Wing visit”
Reviews.Author: CharltonSydney
Reviews.Content: We returned to the Valley Wing in November this year and enjoyed our stay. It was our third visit and in most areas the quality of their offering has been maintained. If you are looking for an all inclusive luxury experience, they deliver this in terms of room quality, food and beverages. Travelling with young children, I would question the merit of us selecting this option again as you don't really get to experience it all and do it justice. Their staff were very good with our children and the pool facilities are great. I would recommend this to those looking to be spoilt for a few days in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Horizon Club Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: PASP123
Reviews.Content: Have stayed 3 times in Valley Wing and 3 times in the Tower Wing. This visit did not come up to previous good experiences. Having booked a Horizon Club room, previous 'preferences' were not known (had been on previous visits) and advised Club rooms had been overbooked and this was obvious in the lounge which was very busy and difficult to find a seat in the evening. Our room was not club designated either, appearing to have a lower spec. Nothing else was available until offered a room change some hours later after having settled in. Breakfast and service was good. Responded to request for feedback and received a good response from the hotel manager, who apologised and would be investigating issues raised.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in town - and a deal to be made”
Reviews.Author: IndoTrader
Reviews.Content: I stay with my wife at the Shangri-La regularly, latest over the 2011 Christmas holiday. The hotel is always perfect - the rooms are spotless, service is always impeccable and food - well, breakfast at The Line is worth the the rate alone! A good tip: the last four times we have booked the hotel at the Hotel Reservation service at Changi Airport at arrival - and we always got a room, with a rate of 310 Singdollars, taxes and breakfast included. Best deal in town!

Reviews.Title: “Most favorite hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: TirelessDragon
Reviews.Content: Lobby is magnificent. Room is spacious with very nice sitting area. Breakfast buffet is the best around town. Staff is attentive. Welcoming tea and fruit plate become my expected norm. Bed is comfy. Bathroom is very big with separate shower and tub. The concierge can reserve the taxi for you if you preferred eventhough they will call if there is a line anyway. Always expect to see exotic Ferrari , Porche, parking in the front. Close to shopping (10-15 minute walk or using the hotel shuttle) but completely off and quiet from Orchard area. Pool is big but oblong shape, but not very good for lap swim. Complimentary breakfast and internet make it the best value.

Reviews.Title: “Most amazing breakfast buffet ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tippiehall
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel to start our Asian adventure! It's beautiful, clean, the service was top notch. The buffet is like an international tour, in three, days I didn't have the same breakfast twice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: ynotcracker
Reviews.Content: A genuine 5 star hotel, fantastic breakfast but let down by very high priced drinks .They are currently refurbishing one wing of the hotel so check out where you might be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Opulent Asia in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: PandEKew
Reviews.Content: As a regular business traveller to Singapore I always look forward to staying at the Shangri-La. Great service, attention to detail and the ever present taxi-hailer - make it feel like coming home. Rooms are spacious and comfortable with quiet aircon and welcoming tea and fruit. Room service is of a good standard and reasonably priced. One improvement could be to remember details such as non-smoking preferences - I had to really push for the hotel to move me to a non-smoking room, which they did have available, though at a higher level. Given i was checking in at midnight, for just one night, I really was disappointed that I had to push - who else would have taken the room at that time! That said, generally no complaints and a great hotel with a few extras that you don't always find in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “It did not disappoint!”
Reviews.Author: happyholidays082010
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from spending New Year 2012 at this Shangri-La Hotel. It really was excellent and New Year's Eve was a fantastic experience: great food, great entertainment (fantastic band) and great service. We can really recommend Blu (their restaurant on the top floor) - we had one of the best meals we have EVER had there ... the chef is superb! It's expensive but worth it for a special occasion. The main restaurant is great for breakfast. The staff are all helpful and smiling and the service is good. The hotel is ideally situated just 10 mins walk from the top of Orchard Road, so near enough to walk but far enough away to avoid all the noise. They are currently renovating one of their wings - so it is a little noisy - but this will be finished by May 2012. A great trip to a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wingz64
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three days and found this a truly great hotel. The attention to detail is amazing, the room was great and the breakfast is simply the best with almost unlimited choice and great quality.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: jenjenrossco
Reviews.Content: I arrived late at night and was escorted toa huge suite. Breakfast next morning was nothing special, although view was spectacular. Went to business club, three girls on desk, lots of gossip, I requested a hotel limo to take me to a business meeting and it was inferred that I couldn't afford to hire one, andI should take a taxi instead. I was left than happy. Met business guests in business lounge, it took 25 minutes to get a cup of tea. This was repeated in the afternoon with other guests. Happy hour goes for 2 hours however food is not available for that complete period, and the happy hour drinks were only available for one hour. I checked out early and had refreshments in thevairport lounge. The limo to the airport was ridiculously expensive. This hotel sees you coming from a long distance wff

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort style hotel away from the hustle and bustle , but close enough to walk to Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: MichaelwEnglish
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Singapore and after travelling for past 2 weeks through Vietnam and Cambodia this is wonderful place to chill and relax in, the service by every single member of staff who we meet was a excellent. Yes there is building work going on around pool and gardens, but this should not spoil the overall enjoyment of this hotel. 10 minute walk to underground station at Orchard Road.

Reviews.Title: “The best !”
Reviews.Author: SKIIERTORBAY
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with friends on our trip of a life time -- what a Hotel, this has to be the best in Singapore.Nothing disappointed, prices are reasonable for what you get, and that is 5 star treatment all the way.had a little problem with the plumbing but a word with reception had it sorted straight away. What more can I say -- an experience.

Reviews.Title: “Shangri-La Quality”
Reviews.Author: banzai0
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for an overnight stay due to an emergency business meeting in Singapore. As in other Shangri-La properties, this hotel shared the same upscale ambiance and good service that one expects from this property chain. With the rate they charge, anything less is a rip-off. Breakfast at The Line restaurant was superb with many choices to suit one's taste. The room was clean, spacious, and modern. The room rate I availed of included complimentary internet access which allowed me to check my e-mails and surf the net. The only complaints I have are 1.) I did not get the king size bed room I requested during my online reservation and 2.) the front desk insisted that I booked two nights instead of an overnight stay. I had to vigorously complain about this mistake on their part before they relented.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Tinker561
Reviews.Content: I first stayed in the Singapore Shangri La 10 years ago on a 3 week business trip and I had promised my wife I would take her there one day. She was as impressed as I expected. I had booked a Garden Wing Room, but it was been refurbished, so we were upgraded to a Horizon Club room, so value for money was significantly upgraded! Singapore is expensive, but meals out are obtainable at reasonable prices, so we did not eat in the hotel, other than breakfast. We were en-route to New Zealand so stayed only two days, but, as a special treat the Singapore Shangri La is ideal. A measure of the place is that all the lifts have a carpet with the day of the week in the centre - they are all changed at midnight to the next day - what attention to detail! We stayed at the Shangri La Singapore on the way back - very good, but not a patch on that in Sigapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great first stay at Shangri-La SIN”
Reviews.Author: JC_PARIS09
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Singapore. We chose to stay comfortable at a nice hotel and discover the city quietly with no rush. We stayed there 5 nights and booked a room called Horizon Premier at the executive level of the Tower Wing. Rate included access to the executive lounge, free Wifi (in all places of the hotel – and speed was OK) and breakfast either at the lounge or at basement where you have access to a buffet breakfast which is quite amazing. Different cuisine style: Japanese, Chinese and international. All you can think of including an ice cream bar... The only negative point is the coffee quality: horrible. Ask for a freshly brewed coffee instead – much better! We only tested the restaurant for dinner and we chose the buffet again. We usually don’t like buffets for dinner, but in this case this was truly a wonderful try. Again you can taste different type of cuisine: Indian, Chinese, Japanese (sushis and sashimis excellent), French, Italian. You wish to have two stomachs! Desserts are French style and very good. Service is excellent, room cleaned and refilled with mineral water and L’Occitane amenities in the bathroom. Be cautious with the bed as it is very hard. You can feel your back at the end of the night. You can’t really stay at the pool as the construction work is heavily noisy. Or you should wear a noise reducer helmet! All in one: very pleasant stay, wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but expensive.”
Reviews.Author: Amyk282
Reviews.Content: I have learnt that you can always rely on Shangri La's never to disappoint and this hotel is no different. The rooms were of a high standard and the breakfast buffet was amazing. I also hurt my neck when I was staying there (my own fault NOT the hotels) and so I had a massage before getting on a 13hr flight. Wow! It was almost a miracle cure. The masseuse took such care and really seemed to care about making me feel more comfortable. (I was in agony before) The only downside is the food is overpriced and costs a fortune. Don't eat there unless it is included.

Reviews.Title: “If only”
Reviews.Author: kiwisterling
Reviews.Content: If only the Management's policy towards guests matched that of the wonderful staff then this would be a five star rating. This review relates to the Valley Wing but is applicable to the other areas of the hotel. We have stayed here annually for over 20 years but not in 2010. At some time in the past two years the Shangri-La Group has implemented a policy of charging the whole of the cost of the accommodation plus a margin to one's credit card even before one's cases are unpacked. On enquiry you will be told that this is a holding charge and that it will not actually be paid by your card issuer until the final bill is signed off by you unless, presumably, you leave without signing it off or else what is the point in being charged up front in the first place? Being dubious about this statement I took the trouble to ring my bank who kindly monitor my Credit Card account in real time. They told me that the full amount had been taken from my account the minute I authorised the up front "holding charge". On being confronted the hotel would not accept this until I insisted they talk to my bank directly. So be aware - you ARE being charged from the minute you arrive for the full length of your stay. Should your final bill come to less than the initial amount charged, which is possible , remember a "margin" has also been charged up front, then don't expect an immediate refund, it takes days. This is not unique to the Shangri-La Group and possibly does not apply to those, particularly from the USA, who do not use Chip and Pin cards but still sign slips. I have not tested the system for those who pay cash to see what one is asked for up front. Perhaps some Trip Advisor member will research this and let us all know. All the foregoing has been shared with the hotel at the time personally. At present the Garden Wing is undergoing full renovation probably until early summer 2012 so the noise is too loud to use the pool area during working hours, about 9 to 5, also Saturday mornings. If you can tolerate the Management's attitude to the creditworthiness even of its Golden Circle members then the Valley Wing is still a very good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Mutton dressed as lamb”
Reviews.Author: tim.tilford
Reviews.Content: The Shangri-La sets itself up as a top class, top quality hotel and falls way short. It is well located and looks quite smart and there are staff there to genuflect before you, but stay there a while and some issues become apparent. Service is actually really poor. I made the room booking through their website well in advance of my stay but they were unable to provide me with the type of room that I had booked. They said they would move me half way through my stay but then didn't bother. The room was really showing it's age and was shabby in some areas - notably the shower. I could of done a better job of the tiling myself which is a rather damning indictment. One of the light switches was not working and a couple of others looked like they were about to pack up. The internet was complementary which was nice but it was also incredibly slow which was less welcome. The food available was quite high quality but massively overpriced. I though that the $46 breakfast was a complete rip-off. I have stayed in a number of other hotels in Singapore - all were cheaper and all were better. Stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great 5-Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OliviaSage
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful atmosphere and a great room for a great price. The breakfast buffet was out of this world. The room was gorgeous. Service was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: RDE411
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at this fabulous hotel during a recent business trip. Excellant service and staff. Rooms are large and standard of cleanlines is very high. Wifi access free throughout the hotel with great connectivity. Hotel is within walking distance of the Orchard Road shopping area, however I believe the hotel also offer a free shuttle service. Hotel has a gym and swimming pool. Buffet breakfast was great, with a huge choice and fresh products. As my departure flight was at 11pm, the hotel allowed freshing up in the health club, with towels etc provided for shower. Would definately return to this hotel for both business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Nice rooftop bar. Dated rooms but being renovated.”
Reviews.Author: FarWanderer
Reviews.Content: Great Orchard location. Common spaces and restaurants and bars are good. Friendly service. Rooms however feel like they are from the 80s. A renovation program is underway so ask for a remodeled room.

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: david255060
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent 5 nights at the Shangrila Hotel in Singapore. The hotel is a little away from the main Orchard Rd shopping area which suited us as we like to get away from the mayhem on that street. For those who enjoy the mayhem a free shuttle service is available The service, food, amenities, and everything was terrific,even though one of hte wings is being renovated and there was noise during the day ,we had a wonderful break It has been some years since we last visited Singapore. next visit, we'll certaainly return to the Shangri la

Reviews.Title: “Very classy place”
Reviews.Author: dhanalakshmi525
Reviews.Content: Our family had a superb time here. Though we spent more time outside shopping, this place was a great place to relax in the evenings. The view of the city is great and the bathrooms were very classy with excellent fittings. The service is very very good and the staff are super friendly and go out of the way to make your stay comfortable. We had absolutely no complaints here.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and world class service!”
Reviews.Author: Nina961
Reviews.Content: I can not even think what could be done to improve the hotel experience. Rooms are beautiful and elegant. Very quiet and comfortable. Beds are firm by western standards. The bathroom has both a shower and a tab with high end marble and finished. The staff is superb, well training and willing to help any way they can. Even checking in a 2 am people were fresh and helpful! The gym has a great view of the garden and is spacious and well equipped. Breakfast has ever imaginable found that could be considered for "breakfast" in any continent.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond hotel”
Reviews.Author: DiamondNiklas
Reviews.Content: I'm now a Diamond member at Shangri-La. I have spent more that 50 nights this year, and always stays at Shangri-La Singapore (I have tried a lot of different hotels in Singapore aswell). That says something about the quality at this hotel. Lovely! See you soon again... //N

Reviews.Title: “Not our first choice but the best choice”
Reviews.Author: scorpioLZ
Reviews.Content: We had originally preferred another hotel on recommendation but as they were slow to respond to emails and never quite had their facts right we changed to Shangri-La. A great decision as they proved ultra efficient, helpful and friendly with very well trained staff at every level. The rooms were kept very clean and made up promptly. Ideally situated within easy walking distance of the shopping area of Orchard Street. The Concierge service proved extremely helpful and organised many excursions for us and they also provide a Left Luggage service for those travellers who, like us, are spending a few days away at the outlying islands. There is a huge big attractive Lobby with music and all sorts of interesting people passing by. The food in The Line restaurant is excellent as are the hairdressing and manicure services, put the Shangri-La at the top of your list when considering a hotel in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “No longer the jewel?”
Reviews.Author: second row
Reviews.Content: On visits to Singapore this has always been the hotel of choice.This time however it failed to match the heights of previous visits and next time I will try elsewhere. Check in was an issue.I was told that they only had smoking rooms left.Not acceptable said I. The room will be well cleaned they said.Not acceptable said I.It will be ionized they said.Not acceptable said I.Find me a non smoking room or another hotel said I.Miracoulously a non smoking room was suddenly available but all this nonsense after a 13 hour flight was really frustrating. The room itself was Ok but looking dated.The light veneer panelling is neither classical or contemporary.It just looks tired.
