Yes one of the wings is being refurbished but it will be sometime before the whole hotel is up to speed. Its a shame as the location remains excellent and the pool a delight.

Reviews.Title: “A great place for resting”
Reviews.Author: BigBen62
Reviews.Content: I was once told that Singapore is Asia for beginners. I understand why. Singapore is the sort of gateway and where you land and spend a day or two before continuing your journey. And of course the perfect spot to rejuvenate and get some energy before your long-haul flight back to Europe or wherever you are heading. Shangri-La Hotel in Singapore is the perfect place to stay when travelling through. You probably don´t spend that many nights here due to the fact it is quite expensive. But it´s worth every SGD spent. The breakfast is fantastic, the setting is beautiful. The rooms are spacious and you actually feel "at home". The food is good although expensive. You ask for something special and they fix it. You pay a little extra and you get very late checkout and drinks and afternoon snacks on the business lounge floor. Not cheap either but, again, worth every Sing dollar spent. I have stayed at various hotels in Singapore and some have had seaview which is nice but that still can´t beat Shangri-La for the price anyway. I totally agree with bighalders. Needless to say I am sure, you can book a limo pickup at the airport taking you straight to the hotel. Doesn´t cost much more than a taxi and well spent money if tired.

Reviews.Title: “Words can't possibly explain”
Reviews.Author: Robyn12
Reviews.Content: Just how good this hotel is. The Shangri-la in Singapore is a faultless hotel that is hard to describe. From flawless check-in to the enormous breakfast to the stunning rooms, the Shanri-la gets it right in so many areas. Highly recommended...did I mention just how good this hotel is?

Reviews.Title: “spacious”
Reviews.Author: jnr641802
Reviews.Content: Stayed May 2011.A large impressive hotel away from the business/main hotel area.The hotel is in a quiet residential area but only 10 mins walk from every designer store imagineable/many restaurants. Pros : Superb Shangrila service as standard.Reasonable rates (May) compared to business area.Location perfect for peace and quiet in major city.Large impressive lobby,very large pool area(for Singapore city) with spacious gardens and grassy sunbathing area if desired.Large very clean/modern/peaceful rooms ,very little traffic noise.Short walk to many shops/restaurants,taxi ride to Raffles/business district etc, cons :None (unusual for me.....) ,my favourite Singapore Hotel which will now be my first choice for future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Ill be back”
Reviews.Author: Christopher3965
Reviews.Content: You have to love the far east. The hotels are the best in the world and the Shangri la is up there amoungst the very best, From check in to the room every thing was seamless and calm. This is a word "calm" that i would use to describe the Shangri la a lot. The subtle touches like the changing of the carpet in the lift showing the day of the week, to cold water and iced face towels around the pool. Service cannot be faulted and the old world touch of kneeling to serve although a shock to someone from the west was done with such style and grace you grow to enjoy the gesture.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: pickledpipa
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel !!! Perfect location, perfect service: they are very helpfull and competent Design of this hotel made a tremendous impression on me.

Reviews.Title: “There are other hotels and then .....”
Reviews.Author: PhileasMole
Reviews.Content: .... there is the 'Shang' . These hotels have long been synonymous with high quality but the original Shangri-La in Singapore surppasses all. The Garden Wing is currently underging refurbishment but the rest of the hotelmaintains the same superb atandards that have come to be expected from one of Singapore's hospitality greats. I have no other comment ssave to say that if you haven't stayed there (and particularly in the Valley Wing), you haven't Done All That There Is To Do in world hotels!!

Reviews.Title: “Oh my! Simply magnificent.”
Reviews.Author: FourFishFingers
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Horizon Club Premier Room which was just stunning. The room is probably the best I've ever stayed in, with an overall high standard of luxury, attention to detail and everything you could wish for. The bed was simply superb and we slept so well we didn't want to leave. Staying in a Horizon Club room gives you access to the Horizon Club Lounge where free alcoholic drinks are served for a limited period in the evening - non-alcoholic drinks are free all day. The staff were extremely helpful and treated us with the utmost respect. We spent some time relaxing by the pool, sipping long drinks and taking the occasional dip. Heaven! The hotel is just a short walk from Orchard Road, though you will almost certainly want to come back in a taxi, especially if you are laden with purchases.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding time and time again”
Reviews.Author: joelaws
Reviews.Content: Just had another three night stay with the family. We had a horizon club premier room. Everything perfect and nothing too much trouble for the staff. From the greetings you get when you arrive to the quality of room service, concierge and horizon club staff it truly is faultless. If only all hotels in Singapore were this good.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Vulasson
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Shangri-La Singapore for two nights and was extremely satistified with the service, room and pool quality. Surely, the breakfast was top-notch. Hotel is located in an acceptable distance to the Orchard Street and has a very nice lobby where you can enjoy live music in selected nights. Highly recommendable hotel for S'pore...

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: gr00vychick
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in November, the staff was very polite and always willing to help. The breakfast at The Line was one of the best i have ever had, love the Teh tahrik the local tea yum! The rooms were very clean, spacious and i wish i could have stolen the pillows. We were given daily fruits everyday. The location was good a 10 minute walk to Orchard street but they do have a free shuttle every hour, there is also a bus stop 5 min down the road where we did the hop on hop off and enjoyed it a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: keredewor
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is just right, you will not regret booking it, the amount of staff, the service attitude, the cleanliness, the cuisine, the public areas, the restaurants and bedrooms are first class, a very good hotel, the only (minor) issue is access to the hotel if you are foot, you have to traverse the busy exit road, it needs a pedestrian footpath

Reviews.Title: “One of the best I have stayed in - outstanding”
Reviews.Author: obrij1
Reviews.Content: Fabulous service, outstanding rooms. the restaurant is just breath taking. A fun and exotic location for business or pleasure. have been several times and going back again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury personified”
Reviews.Author: PamDerbyshire
Reviews.Content: This is definitely the best hotel in singapore particularly if you opt for the valley wing, a gentle, high quality service. The Blu on the top floor is always worth a visit and is consistenly high qulaity. Best thing about the valley wing is the head butler Edward, look no further for help and advice

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant service”
Reviews.Author: xMike
Reviews.Content: I stay in shangri-la for the best service in Singapore... Breakfast is a great experience not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional in every way. 5*”
Reviews.Author: worm5546
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Shangri La en route to Melbourne. From the moment we arrived we were all, including our 12 month old son treated like royalty. We stayed in a Horizon Club suite. It was fabulous. I can't fault the facilities, service and environment.

Reviews.Title: “Top resort style hotel”
Reviews.Author: bundeera
Reviews.Content: In the past we have stayed at the Grand Hyatt in Scotts Rd and have always been impressed with this hotel (have reviewed it in the past).We thought a change to a resort style hotel was worth a go as we had just completed a driving holiday in France and a quiet resort style hotel seemed like a good idea before returning home. The Shangri-La turned out to be just that - Shanri-la. It is set in a quiet area up a hill away from the crowds. While not as convenient to shopping as the Hyatt, it is only a relatively short, pleasant walk of about 1.2km to the corner of Scotts & Orchard Rds. However some may find it a little arduous in the heat But the hotel offers an hourly free shuttle service or you can take a taxi which are quite inexpensive in Singapore. The hotel is genuine 5 star accommodation. While it is not new, it has been continuously maintained. The service is very, very good throughout the hotel - caring without being obsequious. When you return to the hotel after a shopping mission, to be greeted at the hotel entrance is unnecessary but it is a nice welcoming touch. We stayed in the Tower Wing in a Deluxe room. We also booked in the Horizon Club which was well worth the extra expense in consideration of the extras offered. The rooms were spacious, clean and well looked after. The bed was comfortable. The pool area is very nice indeed. It is a large (about 40 Meters at it's longest axis) & clean. There are lots of comfortable lounges around it and many umbrellas to reduce the effect of the sun. Lying there is very pleasant indeed and it is quite easy to fall asleep (particularly when you are jet lagged - but getting outdoors in the sun is a good strategy to combat jet lag). When we were there we were not unduly annoyed by young kids, possibly due to the size of the area. The gym is very well equipped and should satisfy all fitness needs. The only downside is the cost of food & drink which is a little on the expensive side. There are a few restaurants just down the hill and of course many more as you progress downtown. However happy hour/s between 6 & 8pm in the Horizon Club does compensate with food & drink (and all day tea & coffee). There are numerous good inexpensive cafes around Singapore. Our favourite is the Coffee Club chain. (It is not the same as The Coffee Club in Australia) Would we stay there again? We are booked in for August next year.....

Reviews.Title: “Everything perfect - almost”
Reviews.Author: thehound181
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri-La Singapore for 4 nights in the executive Valley Wing in October 2011. There's no doubt that this is an excellent hotel - the rooms are beautifully appointed, the bathroom is huge, the service is impeccable, and the executive wing lounge and Summit Room (with champagne, canapes etc) was well done. The seclusion and feeling of space at this property was great, and you really feel that you're away from the hustle and bustle of the city whilst being right in it. The pool and grounds are also very nice, and free wifi is available in all areas of the property. The only downside to this hotel was the bed - it really was like sleeping on a wooden plank. Unfortunately, we have found hard mattresses to be a common trait amongst the three Shangri-La properties we've stayed in (Rasa Sayang Penang, Hong Kong and now Singapore). Even with housekeeping placing an additional comforter on top, it did little to provide us with a good night's sleep. And in the end, as beautiful as a hotel may be, and as exceptional as the service is, you should have a comfortable bed to flop into at the end of the day. They also did not have a 'pillow menu', so we found it difficult to obtain some decent pillows to use. They really need to buy some latex pillows, or at least something in between rock hard contour pillows or collapsing feather ones. Overall, this hotel is luxurious in all respects, and the staff could not be more helpful. But for us, the bed is a dealbreaker, and we will be unlikely to stay at another Shangri-La hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Business Travel to Singapore”
Reviews.Author: ColonelBangkok
Reviews.Content: The hotel is one of the nicer Shangrila properties. Very elegant. The rooms are very comfortable, service superb. You can walk to restaurants and shops but most of the time you will want to take a taxi as the hotel is tucked away.

Reviews.Title: “Time Traveller Experience”
Reviews.Author: RUMABADA
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed in this hotel was July 2011, we had interconnecting rooms for our boys, although the rooms were very small but it was comfortable. Each day we were supplied with fresh fruits which we all enjoy very much.The most AMAZING part of this stay was the breakfast!!!!!, you could be anywhere in the world by just what they offered and the staff are more than professional to accommodate your needs and nothing was ever too small..well done!!!! The fitness center was also a nice place to either unwind or take time away, as they have a separate area for Male and Female. The hotel ground itself was rather old but nice, not much to see but the pool area was lovely for us to cool our bodies after a long day of shopping or sightseeing. The only drawback will be, it seemed so dark in the foyer as you walk in for our check-in on arrival, maybe it is their way to captured the old Casablanca ambience. The main shopping / Eateries and Entertainments to Orchard Rd was within 5-10mins walking distance.. Thank you for our pleasant stay there..:):)

Reviews.Title: “A Slice of City Luxury and a Brief Guide to Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: mellymoobailey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri-La Singapore for 4 nights in September 2011. The hotel is fairly large with 3 "wings" - valley wing, garden wing and the tower wing: we stayed in the tower wing and our room was spacious and comfortable with a huge bed and a lovely bathroom with separate bath and walk in shower. We also had a big flatscreen TV and there is free wifi in all hotel rooms. The hotel itself is maintained to a very high standard with an impressive lobby area, and a lovely cake shop/bakery! YUM! The breakfast spread was among the best I have ever seen - the buffet was so huge it took me about 20 mins to decide what to eat, they really do have everything including 6 different flavours of yoghurt from a fresh yoghurt bar!! Western fried english,malaysian, japanese - they really had everything, and the most amazing cakes and pastries!! We were so busy making the most of our time in Singapore that we didnt have dinner in the hotel so cannot comment on the restaurants and dinners, but they are supposed to be good! The hotel is located on Orange Grove Road, and about a 10-15 walk to the start of Orchard Roas - the main shopping strip. There are what feels like hundreds of shopping malls in Singapore - so if shopping is your thing, you are in for a real treat! The pool area is surrounded by trees and beautifully manicured gardens, and the staff were always very friendly and welcoming, and would help find you sunbeds either in the shade or sun according to your preference. There is also a lovely jacuzzi at the poolside, and the pool is open til 10pm which is ideal for a refreshing dip after a hard days sightseeing! As for Singapore itself there really is so much to see and do here! I would strongly suggest you plan as much as possible what you want to do so you can maximise your time in this amazingly clean city! Sentosa Island, just off the coast is being established as a "resort" in itself with large resort style hotels, a huge man made beach, underwater world (where you can pre-book to swim with the pink dolphins!), universal studios (not as large as american counterparts but still good fun!), zip park, go karting, bird and butterfly sanctuary, 3D simulator rides etc! This is also where you can see "songs of the sea" a light and water show, which has two show times every evening. The zoo is also a must - you can pre-book a jungle breakfast where you actually get to eat alongside the orang-utans (!) and whilst going round the zoo itself you can feed the elephants and see loads of other really amazing animals. The night safari (next to the zoo) is also definitely worth a visit - you get to do a tram tour of the safari park in the dark, and see the animal show and fire show etc! No trip to Singapore would be complete without a trip to Raffles Hotel! Steeped in history and so beautiful! we went for afternoon tea (pre-booked) which was really lovely, and then we had "singapore slings" in the place where they were first invented - The Long Bar at Raffles (and incidentally the only place you will see anything dropped on the floor in Singapore - monkey nut shells!) For nightlife, Clarke Quay is where you want to head for a great selection of bars with live music, and any sort of music you would want really! Great atmosphere! For food, I cannot recommend the "hawker food centres" enough! There is one at newton (which is closest to the hotel) and there is one called La Pao Sat, which is near Raffles Place. These are outdoor foodcourts where you can eat from a range of small stalls that cook everything fresh to order. Treat yourself to some delicious Singapore Chilli Crab, and also Black Pepper Crab - best thing Ive ever tasted! Singapore is very very expensive, particularly when it comes to alcohol - beware the 10% service charge and 9.5% gov tax added on to EVERYTHING - means that a glass of wine and a beer can cost up to S$48 - just over £25!! Other than that, it is a fantastic place - so enjoy! If there is anything else you want to know about the Shangri-La Singapore, or the city itself - please feel free to message me and I will do my very best to answer!

Reviews.Title: “We just love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: FreoBob
Reviews.Content: We returned to the Shangri-La on our way home from our European holiday, staying in the Horizon Club. The experience was as wonderful as ever, with wonderful staff, a fantastic room and great facilities. This renmains probably the best hotel we have stayed in

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: AuldCreamery9
Reviews.Content: If as they say, first impressions count, then this hotel knows how to get a top score. We had high expectations and were not disappointed. Rooms, leisure facilities, dining facilites, shops and location are all superb and the service is of course what you would expect from a 5 star hotel. The rooms do not have a balcony but as long as you know that, then you won't be disappointed. It isn't cheap but it is what you would expect for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Shangri-La is just outrageously good”
Reviews.Author: Drift_Cafe
Reviews.Content: We ended our holiday here with a week in the Valley wing. What a sanctuary!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with a couple of hickups!”
Reviews.Author: Caris25
Reviews.Content: This hotel remains one of the top hotels in Asia......My stay was overall a good one; I was disappointed by the Breakfast Room ( a massive self service area where somebody can get lost with a large number of food stations) and two housekeeping issues in my room: the desk chair was broken and the scales in the bathroom were not working ( I panicked when standing on it I was weighing 30 kgs more than my usual weight...). The housekeeping department quickly changed both of them (A pity that their check list does not have them checking on all items in the room before a guest comes across a faulty item). Upon checking out, I was accompanied by a Duty Manager from the Cashier's to the taxi taking me to the airport who inquired how my stay was- when I replied ok- he was surprised and asked me why? I was able to then let him know of the issues I encountered; he apologized profoundly and hoped sincerely that I would be back. A great last minute catch!....

Reviews.Title: “Shangri La Hotel set in lush tropical gardens close to Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: Maturity
Reviews.Content: Shangri La is a beautiful hotel set in peaceful tropical gardens with a huge swimming pool, a choice of restaurants and Horizon Club. This latter enables you to breakfast in the restaurant on top of the hotel and enjoy nibbles/drinks during the day. Cocktails etc served in the early evening. The hotel runs a shuttle bus to Orchard Road shopping area which is quite close by. Staff were very pleasant, friendly and very helpful. We can thoroughly recommend the hotel. However, it is quite expensive when you add on the city taxes and service charges which need to be taken into account.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic as always”
Reviews.Author: MrGreenHampshire
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Shangri La last week on a business trip. i am there usually 3 times a year and always go back to this hotel, its a home from home when we are there and you can always rely on the service and product! On arrival after a long (delayed) flight i was taken off to check in at the Valley Wing where I was given a nice room up on the 14th floor. Room was perfectly clean and well presented. very big, fantastic bathroom and shower, huge bed, what else do you need.... We had arrived late and missed our Reservation at Nadaman's resturant but they were more than happy to find a spot on a busy night. We also ate at the Blu resturant up on 24th floor during the week, was execllent food and service. Breakfast is so diverse you will find whatever you are after, bar service is prompt and attentive. There is a real sense of class about this hotel and simply nothing is too much trouble for any of the staff. i have stayed here a good 10 times now and will not stay anywhere else when i am in Singapore! without doubt, one of the very best hotels i have stayed in anywhere in the world!

Reviews.Title: “Top Class”
Reviews.Author: Bishop866
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a number of times, service is without fault, entire hotel spotlessly clean, staff friendly and knowledgeable, rooms well equipped and quiet. Don't stay anywhere else when in Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Lamlim13
Reviews.Content: Decided to spoil ourselves for a long long weekend away recently and stayed at the Shangri La. What an oasis. You would not know you were in the heart of Singapore. The staff was excellent - friendly, helpful, courteous and genuine. The room was a good size - we stayed at the Tower, clean and had everything you wanted. Negatives - only one, tower block is due for a refit soon as its starting to show signs of wear but having said that, we are abit fussy so its probably not that obvious to others. Positives - breakfast was amazing, they even had a 'help yourself' sparkling Chandon, we did as it was a special birthday treat and then there was the food - the selection was just amazing. Also the pool area was great - huge in fact. The gym was well used, the steam and sauna were top class. Overall, could not really fault it. A very typical Shangri La standard - very high and very good. It was just far enough away from Orchard Road that you can comfortably walk to and not be affected by the noise and traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and a birthday suprise”
Reviews.Author: basingboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Shangri La for 3 nights in September. The room was superb and the service as good. The breakfast buffet was one of the best we've ever seen. The day we left was my husband's birthday, and during the evening before there was a knock at the door and there was waiter with a bottle of wine and a birthday card from the hotel. We thought this was alovely gesture. We would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with super service...”
Reviews.Author: RWA11
Reviews.Content: We travelled as a family of 6 (four kids aged between 8 and 15) and had three nights at the hotel. We had two rooms, both Horizon Premier rooms. They were large and very well appointed, with all the things you expect in a five star hotel, plus amazing bathrooms! We had two roll-away beds in one room and still had more than enough space to feel comfortable. The hotel's location is good...a bit away from the CBD, but only a short walk to Orchard Rd (or a very short ride in their shuttle bus, which runs every hour free of charge). We were there during the Grand Prix weekend and it didn't feel like it. One of the reasons is that the hotel is large, spacious, on amazing grounds, so people are spread out. The lobby is grand and great, as are the grounds and the pool. The gym is the best I have seen in any hotel I have stayed at in the world. The service is remarkable. First class every time for everything. We ate at the Line restaurant most nights - it is the most amazing buffet we have ever had!!! They spoil you for choice, with several styles of food available every night ...Indian, Malayan, Italian, Seafood etc etc. We all loved it! Our stay at the Shangri-La made our stay in Singapore even better than we thought...we loved Singapore, but we loved it more because of the Shangri-La!!!

Reviews.Title: “Liked it but not the best of rooms”
Reviews.Author: BWOverseas
Reviews.Content: I have seen other comments about Garden Wing rooms - the gardens are not much to look at and worse if situated on ground floor level as we were. We paid a fortune but is was the F1 event. We both throught the breakfast one of the best we have ever experienced in our travels - really good.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, good service”
Reviews.Author: coolchique
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the horizon floor and had a lovely stay. The room was big and spacious, amenities was sufficient and the food was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome break in Europe - Oz trip”
Reviews.Author: tiredman_10
Reviews.Content: Flying back from family holiday in Europe we decided to break the trip by staying in Singapore for a couple of days. We couldnt have picked a better place to stay! from the moment we arrived all the staff were fantastic, expcially to our little 2 year old. The room was wonderful as were all the facilities, especially the pool. Its not a cheap hotel but we thought it was worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect every time”
Reviews.Author: GreenSLR
Reviews.Content: I stay here for business trips and I cannot fault the place in any way. The hotel staff are what you would expect from a 5 star resort and more. I am also very impressed with the breakfast, and the cleanliness of the rooms and pool area. It is an oasis in the Singapore, it makes the terrible business trips to singapore almost worth the trip!

Reviews.Title: “FAULTLESS SERVICE & QUALITY”
Reviews.Author: phil y
Reviews.Content: As part of our honeymoon we thoroughly enjoyed 3 nights at this stunning hotel, staying in the Tower Wing. Service, attention to detail & ammenities were superb. Richly deserves the 5-star rating. A minor point is the hourly shuttle bus available from the hotel to Orchard shopping centre. It takes quite a circular route often with a journey time of approx 20' minutes. Fine if you are tired & weary (& the heat, humidity of Singapore certainly takes its toll) but once you have your bearings it is better to walk from the hotel. Note also that taxi fares are extremely cheap (& government fixed so you are assured of fair honest price from driver) so make use of them. If you need a top-quality hotel in Singapore look no further than the Shangri-La.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - best in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Hefen
Reviews.Content: My wife and our three (young) children stayed at this hotel over the past 4 nights. It was exceptionally good. The gym is outstanding, the breakfast was the best buffet I have ever had, the staff were wonderfully warm and accommodating including for our young kids in the Level 1 Valley Wing where- unlike Hyatt Club and other club type arrangements, you can get a drink - hot or cold, alcoholic or non - at any time of day. Concierge was great, we had a wonderfully warm young American woman called Cory who helped us organise ourselves for days out and dinner etc, We will be back, the entire staff were outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Phil G
Reviews.Content: This was our first experience of Singapore Service and cleanliness. The hotel staff were fantastic and couldn't do enough for us. The buffet style breakfast has the most amazing choice of food and similarly the evening buffet. The hotel's location is excellent for Singapore's shopping district. If I had to be critical it would be that the rooms look a little tired but overall our experience there was really good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent romantic stay!”
Reviews.Author: Shafazinc
Reviews.Content: I am a local who decides to celebrate my 10 years GF/BF Anniversary (We're married by the way) in Shang Ri-La and stayed at the Garden Wing for a night stay. Even tho' we did not get the pool view, the other side facing the obscured road is not too bad either...very quiet at night and cheery with birds chirping and all in the morning. Our room was fantastic, we were suprised with a cake, chocolates and roses all prepared in our room plus they have many tv cable channels, even football channel to my husband's delight! Our overall stay has been delightful and service from staff----Exceptional! I would definitely bring my family there next time!

Reviews.Title: “Welcome back, how was your day?”
Reviews.Author: Alan I
Reviews.Content: The hotel exceeded my needs. My room on the 9th floor was quiet with a superior view of the swimming pool and the Singapore skyline. My room was very comfortable with modern linens and ample work space. The hotel’s finest point was stressing the little things, for example, thoughtful greetings, daily free fruit, free bottled drinking water, and eloquent turndown service. My only criticism experienced throughout my stay was below average, free wireless and wired internet connectivity. Often times, remote work tasks and connecting with family at home were more challenging than desired.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience in a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: broadbeachboy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 3 days at the Shangri-La Singapore as part of a Singapore Stopover Holiday from Singapore Airlines. The check-in was smooth and efficient and we had a great view from our room on the 8th floor.The staff throughout the hotel were always extremely helpful and courteous. We ate on two nights at the inhouse buffet styled restaurant called The Line and it was an excellent choice with an amazing array of individual food stations. It was an easy walk to Orchard Road and the shops and restaurants there.The hotel concierge had an answer to all of our many questions. A great experience in a great hotel,

Reviews.Title: “Service Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: Grant72
Reviews.Content: I ha I have stayed at the Shangri-La Singapore many times while on business in Singapore and what stands out for me is the service. On a recent stay I had what I thought was appendicitis, on Sunday night I asked the concierge directions to a local hospital, I took a taxi, was admitted to hospital and had my appendix removed. First thing Monday morning the customer relations manager from the hotel arrived at my hospital room with a get well card and a big basket of orchids and fruit. They must have phoned the hospital to see if I had been admitted. It was so nice to have a visitor in hospital while away from home. In my experience you don't get such personal touches like that at some of the other big hotel chains.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel near Orchard Road...”
Reviews.Author: relaxed_dude
Reviews.Content: This is my first stay in this hotel. In my previous visit to Singapore, I stayed in the Mandarin or the Ritz Carlton. Needless to say, all three are very nice. But the Shang is located near the busy Orchard Road area, so one can walk to the shops and restaurants in the evening. As usual with all Shangri La hotels in Asia, the breakfast buffet is expansive and my favorite. In this one I also enjoyed the afternoon Tea. The staff were friendly and lobby was large and festive. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A heavenly stopover”
Reviews.Author: gypsy49
Reviews.Content: We stopped over on our way home from from Europe recently where we found a truly first class hotel. The ambiance perfect for weary travelers after a long flight. Check in was quick and attentive. Our Valley Wing room did not disappoint. Luxurious, tasteful furnishings, superb quality in every minor detail.. our view overlooked the pool surrounded by lush tropical gardens. Breakfast in the Summit room was a treat, every possible want catered for. I cannot fault this hotel in anyway, its excellence is a credit to management who set an extremely high benchmark for others to follow.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Bloxhambebe
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Valley Wing in February, it has a seperate entrance to the rear of the hotel. Don't let this put you of, the staff can't do enough to help you, nothing is too much trouble for them. The rooms are large suites with luxury marble bathrooms, pure bliss!!! Breakfast in the Valley Wing restaurant is relaxing with a view over the gardens, we couldn't fault the food or service. The Valley Wing lounge is small and intimate serving complimentary Moet and nibbles, very welcome after a hectic day sightseeing. It is well worth the extra to stay in this part of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in all aspects!”
Reviews.Author: nikkiq
Reviews.Content: Great location, lovely rooms, perfect service and an outstanding breakfast buffet!

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: xoxprincetongirlxox
Reviews.Content: The best hotel i have ever been to. Excellent breakfast, fitness gym, service and very kind staff. Also centrally located making it very conveniant for shopping and sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chakra123
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel - wonderful rooms, great beds, fruit in the room every day, extensive gym....could not have asked for more. A few minutes walk from Orchard Road so when I wanted to do a bit of shopping it was close but far enough away to not hear the noise. The gym and LINE restaurant were WONDERFUL. I will definitely stay here again - perfect for my business trips to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful attention to little details”
Reviews.Author: paulksyin
Reviews.Content: Everyone knows to expect a lot from a Shangri-la so there will be little that should actually surprise you. With excellence being in such abundance and the bar having been set so high, the truly noteworthy becomes the rarest of gems - it's small, in the finest detail & shines out... noticing my novel by the bedside, the housekeeping crew left me a bookmark. The standard coffee & tea-making set in the room also includes a little saucer of the type you have in Chinese restaurants for soy sauce for you to rest your teaspoon so that it doesn't drip or leave excess tea or coffee everywhere. Everything else is of the mundane high standards you'd expect of a Shangri-la. The breakfast place - The Line - has a very wide variety on both their breakfast and buffet spreads. The rooms are big by Singapore standards, premises immaculate, surroundings lush, quiet yet just a stone's throw away from all the action of HRC & Orchard Road.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Luxary Hotel of Singapore.”
Reviews.Author: amit2207
Reviews.Content: It is fine Luxary Hotel little away from crowded city area, with great tradition and excellent services. One of the out of the world place to stay if you like quite and cozy place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: yss97
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I was happy that I was given a room in the Tower block. The room was spacious, with a decent desk. Comfy bed. Free Wifi in the room was a definite plus point. The breakfast buffet was extensive and champagne was available on Sunday! On the negative side, there was dust on 1 of the shelves in the room. Housekeeping left a dirty rag on the coffee bar 1 day, & I thought that the shower cubicle tiles looked very old - they shd be replaced with marble or similar. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: GaryHalb
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to have a club room at the Shangri-la that offered amazing views over the city at night. You also get access to the club lounge on the top floor which offers an incredible selection of complimentary snacks and drinks every night. Well worth the additional cost of a club room when you see how expensive drinks are in Singapore. This hotel has an amazing pool area that makes you feel you are on a tropical holiday rather than in the middle of a busy city. Gym area is large and includes a full change area and steam and sauna facilities. You can also make use of these facilities after check-out to have a shower and relax before heading off to the airport. The only draw-back to this hotel are the drink prices, but these are high throughout Singapore. But for instance, a coffee at the cafe downstairs was almost double the price of the Starbucks in Orchard Road, which makes it a bit difficult to swallow. All in all though a great place that I would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it - just magic!”
Reviews.Author: Jetsetwendy
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel and first class service. All the facilities were very luxurious. Food was great and the patisserie down stairs amazing. Staff were excellent and very attentive. It reflected the magic of Singapore. It is a short walk into the main shopping area. so it is very convenient yet private. Felt very safe. Would recommend it to anyone stopping over for a short stay on a long haul flight. it is extremely comfortable and relaxing We couldn't fault anything.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning tropical hotel in the middle of the city”
Reviews.Author: gweilo97
Reviews.Content: Stayed back in October 2009 - not 2010. Amazing hotel, a tropical oasis in the middle of the city and set up perfectly for holiday travellers and business travellers. Great pool for adults and kids and staff all very friendly, helpful and attentive - in true Shangri-La style. Buffet breakfasts and dinners are mind blowing - not cheap but well worth it (be prepared to take your time to enjoy it properly). Rooms are spectacular. We were very lucky and got upgrade to a family suite complete with champagne, chocolates, flowers and gifts for the kids when we arrive - special family occasion. Stayed for 3 nights on the way back to the UK from a trip to Bali with family. A great way to break up the trip and finish the holiday before getting back to reality. Hotel allows you to relax by the pool and chill out and at the same time have easy access to Singapore's top sites and the city and up the pace a bit before heading back. Highly recommended. Will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel with resort feel only a few minutes away from the centre of Orchard street”
Reviews.Author: Judy20652
Reviews.Content: My husband,son and I just returned from 4 nights in the horizon suite at Shangri-la. We found it to be really luxurious, especially our" Huge" suite which easily accommodated all three of us. The bathroom too is enormous and very well stocked with toiletries and towels. We enjoyed our breakfasts at the line hotel ,and my husband used the horizon facilities as he was there to have business meetings. Overall the staff was obliging and helpful especially in the restaurant...........We would definately stay here again when in Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: bourets
Reviews.Content: I may be a bit biased as I am a fan of Shagri-la hotels but this hotel it really nice. Amazing service, incredible comfort, great pools, superb restaurants and bars and great location. I have quite high expectations but everything was just perfect at the Singapore Shangri-la.

Reviews.Title: “Sensational Service”
Reviews.Author: domesticgodess007
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a short trip to Singapore. We were recommended the Shangri-La by many friends. The service at this place is the best we have received. You are meeted on arrival at the hotel and taken straight to your room to check in, all the staff new our names for the entire visit...how do they do that? We had two interconnecting rooms in the Tower Wing, as part of the Horizon Club. The Horizon Club was good for us, because I could just take the kids upstairs when they felt like a snack! The pool was lovely, a real resort pool at a city hotel. There was a big complimentary fruit basket available too which was a lovely touch. We had lunch by the pool one day: pizza and salad and this was great. The rooms were very clean, and nicely decorated. The children liked the "day of the week" carpet in the lift! It was my husbands birthday while we were there and so we also appreciated the complimentary birthday cakes. On his birthday night we had dinner at The Line restaurant which was a fantastic buffet. Everyone enjoyed it, especially the children! It was very busy in the restaurant but the service, again, was excellent. They went out of there way to make us comfortable and were very nice to the children, especially my daughter who spilt her drink and was very upset at having caused a mess. My husband and I both used the gym, it is the best hotel gym I have ever seen. Be warned though, the best are quite "firm". OK for me, but my mother in law found it too hard. Whilst the hotel is a bit dated, the service from the wonderful staff more than made up for this. Would recommend the Shangri-La and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Quite Get to 5 Stars”
Reviews.Author: Chicago60657
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel for 15+ years. I am fairly loyal to the Shangri La chain and have stayed in their hotels across Asia. Throughout most of the chain, it's the service that distinguish this chain over the others. The Shangri La Singapore property on Orange Grove Road is situated on beautiful grounds with lush vegetation and one of the most awesome swimming pools you could ever imagine. There are 3 different guest room buildings, each with a distinct personality. So you should pick the right building for your accommodations to match the purpose of your visit, your expectations, and your budget. The Garden Wing is a low slung building with more a resort feel it. Many rooms have large balconies overlooking the pool. The balconies are spilling over with flowering bushes and the whole building is surrounded by palm trees and waterfalls and ponds. The Valley Wing is sedate and sophisticated with plenty of gold gilt and crystal chandeliers. It is where the visiting heads of state stay. (And you often see discreet body guards stationed around when someone important is staying there). The rooms are huge and lushly furnished with heavy drapery. There is a dressing room and bath which can be closed off with doors for privacy if you're not traveling alone. There is a harpist playing in the lobby each evening during cocktails and they serve a limited breakfast in the semi circular dining room off the lobby, with its starched white table linens. The Tower Wing is between these two buildings, both in style and location, and the decor is somewhat "post modern". Many of the larger guest rooms of this older building were created by combining two adjoining rooms. The Tower Wing features the hotel's Horizon Club on the top floor (24) with a large, nicely furnished lounge serving morning breakfast and evening cocktails for those who have upgrade to the Tower Wing's Horizon Club floors. They also serve coffee and pastries during the day. It has always been a good place to have casual business meetings and I've negotiated a lot of business deals there. The club also has 2 conference rooms available for small private meetings and a small area with 3 computers where you can check your emails. Free wireless is available for guests throughout the hotel. The Tower Wing also houses a large, well equipped gym on the ground floor with sauna, steam and whirlpool off the locker rooms. It serves the entire hotel, regardless of which building you stay in. They also offer spa services. I can't recommend the massage offered in the spa. A Horizon Club room in the Tower Wing has always been my choice due to these immediate amenities. The largest room category (where they combined two rooms to form one generous guest room) features a huge desk which most business travelers would appreciate. Lots of plugs and a broadband connection but surprisingly no in-room printer / fax. (For that you have to go up the Horizon Club or down to the business center.) Closet space is adequate and there is an iron and ironing board. The marble bath is enormous and offers a big walk-in shower and separate tub (although not jetted). Bedside controls for the draperies, lighting, and air con are hard to operate in the middle of night or without your glasses on. In the last few years the Tower Wing has become almost too popular, especially when the hotel is hosting a conference. Some evenings, as happened to me on my last 3 visits, I went up to the Horizon Club to read the day's paper and have a cocktail, only to find there was no place to sit. (The option was to share an already intimate table with strangers.) And for the some, finding children rummaging through the canapes and running around unattended may not be your idea of relaxing at the end of a long day of meetings. (Go next door to the bar where they will serve you in a much quieter setting, albeit without the cheeses and canapes.) The Horizon Club guests are offered complimentary breakfast in the adjacent 24th floor dining room of BLU, the hotel's late night dining spot. Breakfast service lately has bordered on inept. Save yourself the aggravation and go downstairs to The Line for breakfast. The options are greater and, since it's basically self service, you can pace your own meal. So while you pay a premium for Horizon Club benefits, it is not often money well spent when you cannot avail yourself to what you are paying for. The Line is the Shangri La's buffet style dining option on the ground floor between the Tower Wing and the Valley Wing. Open from breakfast to dinner, it features usually very good food. But the experience can bring new meaning to "self service". Trying to get a glass of water or coffee can be difficult as the servers are instead focused on clearing tables. And while The Line is casual dining, the noise from the kitchen areas and frequent opening of the sliding doors leading to the terrace can make for a warm, humid and noisy dining experience. Fine if you are there in shorts and t-shirts with family. But perhaps not so good if you are in a suit and tie and with clients. But the hotel features multiple dining options, so just choose carefully. I give the Shangri La an 'A' for effort but a 'B' on execution. They do their best to offer something for both the guests on holiday and those there on business. Over the years the service levels withing this particular hotel have clearly fallen off. Still, if you don't want to be down in center of town, this is an appealing option. Just walking around the beautiful grounds can be a great way to unwind.

Reviews.Title: “The Valley Wing - a lesson in luxury and good service”
Reviews.Author: emily79
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in the Valley Wing of the Shangri-La in Singapore. Not sure how I ended up there (I booked via Opodo) but so very glad a I did. The service is INCREDIBLE, the rooms spacious, spotless and charming. I would highly recommend the Valley Wing but must say that the main part of the hotel looks a little tired these days. I would definately stay at the Shangri-La again, but only in the Valley Wing!

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Gallivantingall
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay from the moment we got there. Staff were really friendly and efficient - nice welcome, smooth check-in, excellent service at breakfast, helpful business centre staff and very cheerful chamber maid! Facilities really good - well appointed and lovely clean rooms, absolutely wonderful breakfast (what a choice!), excellent gym, nice pool and the complimentary internet access is a standard everywhere should have. Location was good too, only 10 mins from Orchard Road if you wanted to walk but there was also the frequent shuttle bus service which dropped you off at the MRT station. Can't praise the place and staff enough and we will definitely choose to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, I loved this place”
Reviews.Author: nictry
Reviews.Content: So I do travel a fair bit for business and although mainly in the US I also get out and about to far away locations and upon being sent to Singapore I was fortunate enough to pick the Shangri-La as my hotel for a week and all I can say is wow. I loved this place, from the minute I was greeted at the door and taken to the front desk to be checked in I felt a little bit special. The room was excellent along with the whole 'look' and 'feel' of the hotel, this was a quality hotel and it was obvious. As mentioned I stayed a week and sometimes on your own for business it can be a little dull and boring but there always seemed to be something to do (either in the hotel or from my trips out and about either shopping or sightseeing after work) I also took the opportunity to eat with some colleagues in the 'BLU' restaurant on the 24th floor, again this was something special (pics of the food attached) the view was also pretty special. I wont lie, the bill took my breath away but luckily it was exspensed so I could just enjoy the food and wine without too much stress but this is a special place to eat so just check the prices before booking but go for it if you get the chance! Would love to go back to Singapore some day and will certainly stay at the Shangri-La again

Reviews.Title: “great location but did not meet expectation”
Reviews.Author: istee
Reviews.Content: When i got to know we are going to stay in this hotel...i did a bit of online search and read somewhere that Obama had stayed here during his trip. So i landed there with very high hopes. We were checked into the garden wing....which had nice views but seemed very old. The hotel was nice but i think i expected exceptional service and interiors...that didnmt happen. but still its a nice hotel...with an amazing breakfast buffet. Only problem we had was with the staff that checked us out....they seemed a bit slow ith ther work. But it is located just a 5 min walk from the famous Orchard road and all the malls....so i was a very happy woman :)

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as other Shangri-La hotels”
Reviews.Author: Pasen255060
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby looks impressive, but as others have mentioned before, the Garden Wing rooms are horribly dated, boring and even had a mold smell. The stuff was friendly but not very attentive and never smiling. I stayed at other Shangri-La hotels before and the quality of the Shangri-La in Singapore seems to be way below average and neither the room nor the service was worth the money. On the positive side I liked the breakfast buffet and I very appreciated the free wireless internet.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: NickBkk
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels in Singapore. Service is excellent and the staff is very well trained. Rooms, even not new are well appointed. Bed is very comfortable. Location is good in a quiet area and just 10 minutes away from Orchard Road. Taxis are very easy to get (at least this time). The only minus could be possibly the breakfast place (The Line) as it is very big with many guests (the hotel has a lot of rooms), so service sometimes is not consistent and you may have a feeling that you are rather in a university canteen than a 5 stars hotel. Food quality is food, but they are short in some food selection (for instance, low fat yoghourt is not provided, although if you ask the manager she will get one from you). Overall a very good hotel in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “This is a beautiful 5 star plus, hotel”
Reviews.Author: patmary68
Reviews.Content: What a relaxing and luxurious stay one can have here. Set in tropical gardens with a lovely pool and wonderful restaurants that overlook the lush outside areas, one doesn't have to move far if recovering from long haul or wanting a complete relaxing stay. The rooms and bathrooms are all large and I was lucky to be upgraded to the Valley Wing on this visit, with true individual and personal service. Previousy the Tower Wing room I had as a solo, and the same on another occasion with my husband, gave us every facility and amenity we could possibly want including beautiful comfortable beds and a choice of pillows, and best of all space and room for all our luggage. I like the way you are enveloped in peace and tranquillity here, and set away from the main city traffic yet a short walk takes you to the MRT, the bustle of the city and buses to everywhere. Taxis are plentiful at the door and don't have to be booked and concierge and door service is charming and helpful. The hotel restaurants we have tried have not disappointed in the least, and even the magnificent lobby is perfect to sit in for a drink or snacks. My first choice for Singapore where several days stay are required.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: prclements
Reviews.Content: The Shangri La has everything you would want in a hotel and is within walking distance to the Orchard Rd shopping precinct. The staff are lovely, the wine bar is a great place to relax and the restaurant is excellent for a buffet style with many choices of meal. The huge swimming pool is exceptionally good too.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel..”
Reviews.Author: CaptainChristopher
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable room. Average customer service, a small dispute over an amount ended up taking over an hour to resolve. Love the breakfast love the room. Overall, this is a great hotel, and I would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Our little bit of Luxury in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: miltonj
Reviews.Content: Great Stay, very friendly staff who made you feel welcome, even the gardening and grounds staff will give a friendly good morning if you pass them in the grounds. We have stayed at the Shangri-La (Singapore) a number of times before and we keep coming back for the comfort the service and the food !

Reviews.Title: “Amazing but watch out for the Tower Wing rooms”
Reviews.Author: dipset33
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Shangri La for 3 days. The foyer/ lobby is grand and very impressive on arrival. We did find that check in was a bit slow as they took some time allocating us to a room in the Tower Wing. We were intially allocated a room on the 14th floor. However, when we arrived we were disappointed. The corridor on the 14th floor felt with stuffy and the room itself felt stale. The ceiling had visible mould which were extremely disappointed to see. We immediately called reception and told them we were not happy. They offered us an upgrade to the Garden Wing, which we did go and view but again were disappointed with the features. In the end, following much to-ing and fro-ing and a conversation with the duty manager, we were were offered a complimentary upgrade to a Horizon Club Room in the Tower Wing. They said there were no other Tower Wing rooms available. We were very pleased with the Horizon Club Suite on the 7th floor. It was very nice, had all facilites, everything you would expect from a 5* hotel. There was access to the Horizon lounge on the top floor, well stocked, airy and great views of the skyline. There is also free breakfast with a buffet and a la carte service available. Again, very good. However, breakfast can be expensive so watch out for that. Probably better off walking up to Orchard Road where there are better and cheaper options. Hotel is about a 15 min walk from Orchard Road MRT station and a short walk to the Singapore Botanic Gardens, which are amazing!!! An absolute must.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: SydneyTraveller123
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel and excellent service. Arrived at 8am after long flight from Paris for a stopover (Sydney-bound) and were checked in without a hitch (actually, we had asked for a non-smoking room, but they said these would not be available until the afternoon - ie regular check-in time. We were more than happy to put up with a little pong in exchange for the free early check in). The pool is fantastic and the rooms (Garden Wing) very spacious (although maybe a tiny bit dated - I believe the Tower wing is more modern, but without balconies). 2 small bottles of water free every day - very nice touch. Complimentary shuttle bus to Orchard road - at ten minutes not really too far to walk, but in the humidity of Singapore it's nice to have the option of taking the bus. On the second day we asked for late check-out and stayed two extra hours. After that we toured the city and came back for another splash in the pool before taking off for the airport. Showered in the well equipped fitness studio. What a treat. This is exactly what you'd expect (but don't often get) from a five star hotel. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: HMB05
Reviews.Content: The staff at the lobby lounge don't know how to smile, it seems they don't want to be there at all. The room is old, and has an odd shape. Overall is good but should be better as its Shangrila.

Reviews.Title: “Completely Deserves 5*”
Reviews.Author: endofcity
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations of this hotel and I'm happy to say they were met during my stay here. Although the Shangri-La is not located right next to Orchard Road, it is just a short walk away and the hotel benefits from a slightly more quiet situation in very nicely landscaped gardens. When you first walk in, you will be very impressed by it's huge, marble lobby. We had opted for a Horizon Club Room and the dedicated check in service was first class. We had arrived at the hotel quite early but we were checked in quickly and no fuss was made. The room was extremely large by Singapore standards and was very well kitted out. The bed was very comfortable, the air-con was efficient and there were some nice touches like motorised curtains. The bathroom was also excellent with plenty of amenities. Cleanliness was excellent. Breakfast service was again, absolutely excellent with attentive and polite staff. Quality of food was very good and even the toast was nearly hot! The hotel has a lovely pool area, tennis courts, gym and a good selection of other restaurants and bars. One small disappointment was when we went to play tennis, the hotel loaned tennis rackets (one had a broken string) and balls were of very low quality - not what I would have expected for a hotel of this standard and could easily be remedied. When we left, we also requested a late checkout and they allowed us to keep our room until 6pm - can't really say fairer than that. Overall, a fantastic hotel and can't really think of anything significantly negative to say. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Valley Wing is the best”
Reviews.Author: nadarien
Reviews.Content: I can't speak for other hotels in Singapore as I've only stayed at the Sheraton Hotel by Newton, Pan Pacific @ City/Marina, Conrad Hotel @ City/Marina, Rasa Shangri-La Sentosa, Hilton @ Orchard, Traders near Orchard. This is by far my fave hotel in Singapore. It's secluded and you will need a car to get here. There's no buses or trains and the easiest way to get in and out is by cab. The service is excellent. The rooms are spacious and the bathroom is cut generously. Simply love it... Would recommend this place if you value privacy and appreciate luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel overall, but slightly disappointed with the Garden Wing”
Reviews.Author: corruptlawyer
Reviews.Content: I chose Shangri-La Singapore on a recommendation and chose the Garden Wing for a brief stop-over. The hotel provides nice touches - Jasmine tea and fruit brought to your room soon after you arrive.. a separate check-in desk for residents in the Garden Wing.. balconies with the rooms. Lovely main hotel lobby for drinks ('lobby' does it a disservice). Generally, the room felt quite tired but at least it had some character. Good location if you want to shop on Orchard Road. Probably wouldn't stay in Garden Wing again but I'd be tempted to return to try out the Valley Wing having heard rave reviews.

Reviews.Title: “shangrila”
Reviews.Author: omsai_108
Reviews.Content: the pool , food and overall ambience was great .would love to be back the buffet breakfast was very lavish and the quality of food was great . the location is very awesome just 5 minuates from oxford street .

Reviews.Title: “Top Of The Range!!! Absolutely Nicest Hotel Ever Visited”
Reviews.Author: Weemaz23
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights there as last stop on our honeymoon & as some say "save the best till last". Hotel staff extremely friendly, complimentary bottle of wine, chocolates & fruit basket for honeymoon couple. Breakfast was buffet with food from every continent, you name it they had it. Fantastic gym & swimming pool area. Room had pool view also over looking the city. Plus the cocktail "singapore sling" on the top floor overlooking the whole of singapore was quite amazing!!! If you are going I would spend the extra money to stay at this hotel, it is so worth every penny!!! The hotel was a 5 minute walk to the top of the main orchard road shopping area.

Reviews.Title: “stayed here in 2009”
Reviews.Author: MarkBrowne_Monkey_
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, good service and a nice pool area. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Valley Wing - The most opulent and spoilt holiday ever”
Reviews.Author: ShannonAdelaide
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from holidays and stayed at the Shangri-la (Valley Wing). We spent 7 days there and can honestly say it was the best accommodation we have ever stayed at (we have been on quite alot of holidays all over the world). The room was just spectacular and the staff even better. They treat you like royalty, they are impeccably dressed all the time, they greet you with enthusiasm, and the premises of the Shangri-la is just amazing. We have 2 boys (5 & 7) and they loved the swimming pool and of course the vast choice for breakfast. You do have to be smartly dressed in the Valley Wing area, which we loved to get dressed up, relaxing in the lobby drinking champagne and eating canapes and chocolates - we were blown away by it all every day. We just didn't get used to it at all. The lift had a different day on the carpet, we had mats put down for us next to our bed at night - just unreal. If you want to spoil yourself - stay in the Valley Wing, you will never forget the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic city cente hotel”
Reviews.Author: twoplustwoMidlands
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri-la for 5 nights in April with two children (5 and 7). They have the most amazing pool (40 metres long) and gardens and you would not believe it is about a 10 minute walk from Orchard Road. We had interconnecting rooms in the garden wing and the rooms were very comfortable with lots of nice toiletries and other things (hair bungees - especially good having two girls). We had a fantastically efficient check in (the garden wing has its own check in desk. The staff were incredibly helpful. Breakfast was AMAZING - you name it, you could eat it. It is definitely worth paying for a B&B deal. The kids loved the pool and it was a great location for getting out and about the city. A real gem.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: munse
Reviews.Content: We stopped as part of the Singapore Airlines stopover deal - did feel somewhat under-dressed on arrival but were greeted, whisked across the grand entrance hall and looked after exceptionally well. After exploring the city and returning to the hotel, within seconds of arrival back in our room we were greeted with wine, cake and chocolates as a celebration of our honeymoon! Good pool and gym, and we were able to use the facilities after checking out whilst waiting for our flight. Very comfortable rooms with a good view over the city. Excellent food in the hotel restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Top service, great eye for detail, good location”
Reviews.Author: AgPag
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many hotels for work through the years, and many where at 5 star and occassional 5+ level. (See my W Barcelona review for example). The Shangri La is easily a 5+. I arrived by taxi and a staff member walked me to the check in desk, someone else took care of my suitcase. After I arrived in my room a pot of Chinese tea with 2 small cups was delivered in a cute wicker basket, as a welcome gesture. The room was spacious, and everything can be switched on, opened etc from a console next to the bed. The breakfast is the most complete and extensive I have ever seen, cereals, fruit, fresh juices, pastries, pancakes, full english, japanese, chinese etc etc and all of the above with 6 different kinds of each and fresh. The bar on the top floor gives a nice view over Singapore, you can get better views from some restaurants down town in Singapore, but it was still nice. The gym is very well kitted out, modern machines, weights, tv's everywhere and a gym attended was there every time I visited. The outdoor pool was lovely, busy with families, but that is to be expected. Orchard Road is a 10 minute walk away, or take the courtesy bus. All in all, I cannot fault this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Tosind
Reviews.Content: I actually went here in February 2010 (option wasnt available in the drop down box) The Shangri La Hotel is probably the best hotel i've ever stayed in. Their service was impeccable,the staff very welcoming and courteous (?). The hotel itself is so gorgeous,my room was on the 18th floor,very spacious,i loved my bathroom the most. The bath was absolutely divine :-)Room service was wonderful but a bit expensive though worth it. For me the location was great,didnt seem far from places i wanted to go and shop or sight see. Shopping centres are open till 10pm/10.30pm, Singapore also has one of the few 24 hours shopping malls in the world. The hotel staff were very helpful with directions & tips on getting around. Everyone i spoke to spoke English,the city itself is the cleanest i've ever visited in the world prob because of their strict fines. A must do/see is a ride (or two) on a bum boat,the Esplanade Theatre on The Bay and so many things too numerous to write. All in all a great hotel and a great city. I hope to visit again one day

Reviews.Title: “The best lace to stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: jannomood
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights recently in the Valley Wing. It was a perfect experience and would recommend this hotel and especially this wing to anyone wanting to experience the luxury that this hotel offers. We couldn't have been happier. This is a top end hotel within walking distance from Orchard Rd and we will be staying there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as it Ought to Be”
Reviews.Author: StoaGroningen
Reviews.Content: Had been here before a couple of years ago and decided to stop-over again. Excellent and Fine and Marvellous: from the great airport pick-up service to the hassle free check-in by really very pretty people to the pleasant room. Of course, this is all to be expected from Shangri-La hotels, but it's always a nice surprise again. Magnificent lobby, fine swimming pool, even a little golf course, a lovely tropical garden for short ambles. Restaurants are good: especially 'Fine'. The much touted 'Blu' is bland and is so dark you can hardly read the menu card and certainly not a book or newspaper if you're alone. The food in 'Blu' is nothing extraordinary (such as that of the Cebu Shangri-La, which is Depravedly Delicious); just relatively common international cooking of a good level. The guest rooms are good: clean, roomy, most have nice views. My suite this time was really very good, but is beginning to show signs of deterioriation (the light switches were almost broken, e.g.). Room service was fine; but why such a measly plate with two near-dead New Zealand apples and a couple of plums rockhard (though nicely purple). Still: highly recommended even though the price is stiff. The service is Great! The location is fine with easy access to the great Botanic gardens and also to shopping areas.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Vladimir57
Reviews.Content: From the time we first entered the hotel at 1.30am. We were greeted with wide smiles and warm hearts. Nothing was to difficult to undertake. The pleasant Shangri La scent really makes this hotel special along with all the stunning Singapore Orchids flowers located everywhere . The stay which was over 6 days was extremely enjoyable and the breakfast buffet is the most expansive that I have seen. The rooms are clean and well decked out. All in all an excellent establishment. Also my wife enjoyed the garden tour which highlites the whole wonderful landscaped gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - 10 days of luxury”
Reviews.Author: Oscarik
Reviews.Content: Great place, Stayed on 20th Floor. Nice Suite, breakfast on 24th floor was also cool. Great restaurants, pool, sauna, gym. The lot. Rik

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay at Shangri-La”
Reviews.Author: ksinaustin
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fabulous stay at Shangri-La. Beautiful hotel with luxurious accomodations and extremely hospitable staff. Definitely was a 5 star hotel and enjoyed every minute. Would recommend opting for the Horizon Club and staying in the Tower Wing.

Reviews.Title: “Garden Wing is getting old”
Reviews.Author: TunkuHalim
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Garden Wing and was surprised at how old it was looking. It certainly didn't have any luxurious feel about it nor was the high price justified. Water pressure in the bathroom was low and there was a certain whiff about it. The main hotel itself does feel exclusive however and the swimming pool is wonderful with lots of greenery and a hot spa. The gym and business centre were great. Hotel staff were very polite and helpful. Pity about the Garden Wing rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Really loved this hotel and hope to be back soon!”
Reviews.Author: Rojo71
Reviews.Content: From the moment I stepped out of my cab on arrival I was greeted by Cory and she walked with me right upto the check-in desk and stayed with me until I was fully checked in. She was so nice after such a long flight from Heathrow. All the staff at this hotel were top notch, so well done on your customer service. My room was fantastic and the free Wi-Fi was great. I would have felt a bit more confident if the Wi-Fi was secure and had a password. The hotel is about a 10 minute stroll down to the hussle and bussel of Orchard Road, which was great for a bit of shopping. The choice of restaurants, while a little bit expensive, were very good. The Line Restaurant, where I had breakfast every morning is vast! I did go to that restaurant twice in the evening, and each time, I sat around at the coffee shop as it was much quieter, where I could enjoy my food and read my book. All in all, I had a wonderful stay here. It can be a bonus when you are travelling on your own and on business that you feel very welcome at your nominated hotel. Thank you to all the staff

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay in an 80s Retro Way ...”
Reviews.Author: YasmineinSydney
Reviews.Content: I stayed from 10-17 June 2011 - partly personal and partly business at a corp rate of $250 per night incl breakfast and internet (+ tax). I was in room 1030 (10th floor) in the high rise tower (24 floors) overlooking a huge green rooftop below and the pool area to the left. There is a fantastic restaurant and bar with viewing deck up on level 24 - BLU - superb to go around sunset 6.30pm - 7pm. Overall I really enjoyed my stay at Shangri-La. It is a huge complex - there is a high rise tower, geared more to the business traveller (you cant open the windows) and there is a low-rise wing around the pool with balconies, I presume geared more to the leisure traveller. The lush tropical gardens around the pool and surrounding the breakfast/lunch restaurant ("In Line") are beautiful. It is hard to believe you are 10-15 mins walk from the busiest intersection in all of Singapore - corner Orchard Road and Scotts Road. Apart from the refurbed "In Line" restaurant (very modern white/orange decor) the rest of the hotel feels somewhat tired and probably saw its best days quite a while ago! Attention to detail is also lacking - 2 globes in my room were broken, my bathroom switch was cracked and posed a safety risk, the huge mirrors in the level 10 lift area were dirty for a week and nobody noticed to clean the dirty fingerprints from them. I did however like the 2 pieces of fruit left for me each day in my room and the quality of towels, bed linen and bathroom products - all very good quality. The king sized bed was very firm but I had an excellent sleep. I liked the remote control panel next to the bed where you could activate all lights, air con, and curtains. The buffet breakfast and lunch in "In Line" were FANTASTIC. No matter what you wanted for breakfast, it was there - pancakes, waffles, sausages, quiche, individually made omelettes/eggs, Japanese sushi, Indian curries, nasi goreng rice dishes, pastries, home made breads, 8 different kinds of fresh fruits - just amazing! Just make sure you ask for an individually made cappuccino - the filter coffee in the pot is luke warm and not very nice. Note - The dessert buffet at lunch time just makes your eyes pop out of your head!! I had the nicest rare roast beef and Chinese style pork dish. Really good. We also used the Business Centre which had 3 meeting rooms for hire - very up to date modern facilities. All in all, I would recommend Shangri-La to leisure travellers who want to be in a resort-style complex away from the crazy Orchard Road shopping district in a spacious, tranquil setting. For me personally, I prefer the Marriott on the corner of Orchard/Scotts. It is a high rise tower, with pool on level 3 or 4 from memory over looking the city and down Orchard Road and the whole hotel is more modern and feels newer and more sophisticated. I also like Marriott location better - smack bang in the centre of all the Orchard Road action - the Tangs Dept store is in the same building and Isetan Dept store is across the road as is the Ion Plaza and Wheelock Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “This is truly a 5-star hotel with exquistie service”
Reviews.Author: GloriaAnchio
Reviews.Content: If you have heard about top class hotels in Asia, with superb service, the Shangri La Hotel in Singapore exemplifies this description. From the moment, you step out of the taxi, everyone is there to make your stay more pleasant. The doorman, the check in person, the man standing at the elevators, the housekeepers, etc. Moreover, they seem genuinely pleased to be of help (not required by management to smile). If you are a repeat visitor, some of the staff will recognize you (and not by looking at a computer and seeing "repeat guest" noted, but by looking at your face)! On the rare occasion when one has a problem, it is handled promptly. Even more remarkably, if you note a problem on the followup online survey, one gets a personalized response within 24 hours, and you asked if you want them to call you about the problem. The Line -- the buffet casual restaurant, is fabulous. And the fitness center is spectacular. Unlike most hotels (who use mirrors to make a tiny fitness center look big), this hotel has a large, extremely well equipped fitness center AND a staff member there to assist you (with how to adjust the equipment).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: lee_down_under
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in a standard room for 3 nights and had a lovely time. Staff were attentive although looked officious. Courtious concierge and front door staff. Location is about 15 minute walk from Orchard road and from the nearest tube station. Taxis in Singapore are cheap though. Rooms are relatively spacious and comfortable. Beds very restful and big marble bathroom with seperate shower and bath. Basic own branded toilettries with toothbrushes, comb, hair bobble!! and soap. Big shaving mirrow and plush towels and bathrobes. Shame that the room was very dusty above the arch - obviously not cleaned for a few months above the bed and in the alcove, but everywhere else clean. Fruit left each day with evening turn down service. A fantastic breakfast selction of all nationalities - and staff pleasant too. Ate out most nights with mate. Bar on top of the hotel was lovely and had bottle of wine overlooking Singapore. Well presented staff, although it did look like 2 guys at the bar had brought back a little trade. Nice pool and gym, plus sauna and spa. Woudl stay here again but would like to check out some other places.

Reviews.Title: “most fantastic luxurious hotel we have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: johnsheen
Reviews.Content: if you want high quality i would say stay here at the valley wing where NOTHINg is too much trouble for brilliant staff. Also a great country to visit so clean safe and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: AustG
Reviews.Content: Just came back from trip to Singapore first 3 days stayed in Valley Wing of Shangri La. It was luxury all the way with the most attentive service we have ever had they made us feel so special from check in to departure. The room was just lovely with a huge bathroom that included a tv above the bath so you could have a relaxing soak and watch a movie. Complimentary Moet in the salon with high tea and other treats in the evening was just wonderful and definitely worth the extra cost to stay in this area of the hotel. We will definitely stay here again just loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mannnnnn
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. Rooms are nice. The room somehow was not ready when I checked in . They gave me complimentary wine to compensate for that. (how I wish I get it everytime. Wont mind waiting :) ). They have a separate wing for smokers where my colleagues stayed and if you like balcony opening to the sky, insist on smoking room which faces swimming pool. Food was the best part of the restaurant. They have superb Indian spread similar to any Indian restaurants and I tries some of the best Indian dishes in this hotel. Highly recommended place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: joshdotcom
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel. Great room, great bathroom, excellent food. We came in from a tiring few days of travel and found this hotel to be the perfect rejuvenation spot. The hotel restaurant is open 24 hours. The hotel staff was extremely attentive. We simply couldn't have asked for a better hotel in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “heavenly experience”
Reviews.Author: priya14
Reviews.Content: the hotel is superb with superb staff and everything excellent .. the staff is too good and had a great time with my family . we enjoyed the stay so much that we didnt want to get out of the hotel . its 5 mins walking to the city center and shopping district .

Reviews.Title: “good 'n bad”
Reviews.Author: LightUser
