Reviews.Content: Sorry for a mixed review. We booked into a delux room in the Tower Wing. First room was musty and so transferred. Second room was also musty and transferred again. Third room was ok until 4 days in when cigarette smoke started to pour into the room from a vent in the bathroom so transferred again, but this time with an upgrade to a bigger room with Horizon Club benefits. The smaller Delux rooms are nice, but with dated decor. But this decor is perfect for the larger rooms ! The reception area is stunning, the pool is great and the service is excellent. The line restraurant food is good and the Horizon Club benefits are also good. The views from the Horizon Club, Blu Restraurant and rooms are fantastic, especially at night. If I could afford it, I would stay again, but in the larger rooms. If I could not afford this, I would go to the Holiday Inn Orchard road which has recently refurbished its rooms and is where we stayed last year.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: littlerosepetal
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for part of our honeymoon. Service was great, a few honeymoon touches were applied to the room which was very sweet, also got a honeymoon cake which was delicious. We stayed in one of the club rooms. The club lounge had good views, the canapes were delicious, drinks were okay (they didnt have sparkling available, that had to be purchased seperately). Breakfast selection was good.

Reviews.Title: “Shangri-La Hotel in Singapore is the best”
Reviews.Author: Happy2011Sydney
Reviews.Content: We stopped over in Singapore for our honeymoon last June. We got upgraded to a luxury suite, which had decent size and elegant interior decoration. The staffs were very friendly and they were almost like bowed on your knees. The best part of this hotel was the Horizon Club, which we could enjoy different type of snacks and cooktails every day. The complimentary breakfasts in the Club were very tasty too. We felt that we were the king and queens living in nice kingdom. Though the daily rate was very pricy, we felt every dollar was worth for the stay. Thank you so much for making our honeymoon so memorable, we are definitely coming back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: trooper777
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights on our 2nd leg of our honeymoon tour. Beautiful hotel, good service, good food and drink. This hotel is really geared for the business travaller really rather than holiday makers, although it has a nice pool. Singapore is a haven for shopping along the Orachard Road, shops, restaurants and more. Shangri La hotel is situated at the top of the Orchard Road in a quiet residential area. We walked the entire length of the Orchard road on our first day, popping in to shops and cafe's along the way all the way to the Sky Wheel Flyer. The walk took us 5 hours! fantastic. Be warned it will rain on occasion so take a brolly just in case. I would definately go back to Singapore, but probably stay in one of the hotels on Orchard road, as like I said it was too commercialised, but really worth the visit. My only negative was the house keeping, not really on par with other 5 star service. Our maid would turn up late in the day to do the rooms, although they would clean the room etc, they did'nt move anything we may have left on the floor, ie shoes, clothes etc. Other 5 star hotels I have stayed in, they have folded our clothes and put shoes etc away for us. May be we just got a lazy maid. Oe last thing, go try the Singapore Sling...when in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it- Wonderful staff and amenities”
Reviews.Author: doctordiana
Reviews.Content: Stayed at beginning of my honeymoon- they could not have been more welcome or helpful. Stayed in very large suite with wonderful views- though interior seems like could use more updated furnishings was spotlessly clean and lovely. Breakfasts on the 25th floor and the pools/surrounding gardens also a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Shangri-La holiday”
Reviews.Author: krumel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights and think it's the best hotel ! The staff are extremely friendly, offering you tea when u arrive and going the extra mile :) The rooms were extremely clean & modern. We stayed in one of the cheaper double rooms and was very impressed! The shower was great with hot water every time, hairdryer, AC, heating, mini bar and even umbrellas for the wetter days! Breakfast is also included which is the best we've had so far, starts at 7:30-10, make sure you get there before 9:30 as it runs out fast!

Reviews.Title: “I dare anyone to find better rooms than valley wing..”
Reviews.Author: HkgMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We booked horizon club and were upgraded to valley wing, the room is actually smaller than the horizon club room I had booked but was so beautiful and not small in any way so we were happy to stay. The ability to have french champagne all day is a bonus i guess although we are not big drinkers... The valley wing area to have complimentary snacks etc is nice but I prefer the horizon club lounge on the 24 th floor which you can use anyway if you are in the valley wing... We enjoyed both. The service is flawless and even with a busy demanding one year old the staff were gracious. Most club level parts of hotels will not allow under 13 years so we were appreciative. The Line breakfast buffet is excellent, I can not think of a bigger better selection anywhere in the world.... As yet have not tried out the valley wing breakfast area... The bathroom and amenities are simply gorgeous and the plentiful towels etc, silver service room service( even for the baby meal!) proves this hotel deserves its five star rating.the dressing room area is stunning, the personalized stationary made me feel like a princess.... I do feel the pool shows the age of the hotel though and is small for such a big hotel. Overall I highly recommend this hotel...although unless you are a big drinker the valley wing is not worth it, book horizon club...maybe you will be lucky to get an upgrade...

Reviews.Title: “A little slice of luxury.”
Reviews.Author: jperth
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in the Valley View Wing with our 3 year old and a 7month baby. Arrived after a long haul flight at 8am and where offered to have complimentary breakfast or check in in our room, which we choose. Room had enough space to have a port a cot and roll away bed without feeling cramped. Afternoon tea was offered 2-4pm and Canapes 5-7pm. All day refreshments were also available. Staff and management were very friendly and made us feel very welcome, Mae was wonderful and would take our eldest for little walks, mostly to the canape table at her requeat, although it did take us a day or to feel really comfortable. We did get some glances from some of the guests when children cried or were a little too loud(as inevitability they will). The hotel is about 10 mins walk with children to orchard road which we found fine.

Reviews.Title: “Top Class hotel in singapore”
Reviews.Author: paultsurrey_UK
Reviews.Content: Simply excellent. Service - superb and the hotel itself beatuiful. The buffet at "the line' restaurant is absoutely top notch both from a quality fo offod and presentation perspective and pretty reasonable at $S80 all inlcusinve per head. The staff are ,without exception, in my finding , excellent.

Reviews.Title: “We cant stop talking about the Shangri-La”
Reviews.Author: woodlands8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri-La for four nights in the Garden Wing. We arrived at 8.30 in the morning from Changi airport. When we arrived in the taxi the doors were opened and all our luggage etc were carried in for us. We escorted into the hotel like royalty and speedily checked into our room by 8.40am ! What a wonderful hotel, the staff were all so polite and helpful, nothing too much trouble. In fact we had everything done for us. Our room attendant put fresh fruit in our room each evening, the pool attendants immediately found you a sunbed and placed towels over them. We really felt like valued guests. We were so glad we chose the Shangri-La.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot be faulted”
Reviews.Author: rach_patterson
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a Singaporean holiday and the Shangri-La was one of the main reasons the trip was so memorable. From the moment we arrived to the minute we left the hotel, the entire experience was beyond words amazing. The staff and facilities certainly exceeded expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what i expected”
Reviews.Author: DimiP
Reviews.Content: Exactly what i expected from a Shangri - La. Majestic and luxurious commons spaces, and impecable service from all the staff. Only opportunity, the room looked like it needed a refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Loo15
Reviews.Content: We stayed here four four nights this year and have never received such excellent service. The hotel is fabulous, in a perfect location for doing as much or as little as you like and the cleanest hotel I have ever stayed in. The staff could not be more helpful and I would definitely return. The hotel restaurant on the top floor, blu I think it was called was excellent. We had the taster menu which was a fifth of the cost of a similar menu at the al mahara restaurant at the bur al Arab and was significantly better in quality and taste

Reviews.Title: “Stunning , service , style , the complete package”
Reviews.Author: sq318
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel, superb service , rooms delightful. We had an overnight stay on the way back from Australia and wished we had stayed longer . The Lime restaraunt for breakfast was great with a huge range of foods

Reviews.Title: “If i could give this hotel 10 stars i would”
Reviews.Author: LondonLockwood
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 17 yrs ago and was impressed by it then. Picked a far east tour over the long Easter period and decided to start here. I was not disappointed.The hotel itself is lavish,grand and more. The gardens were beautiful, the pool area superb. When we arrived we were offered for 175 sing ( 75 gbps ) a room upgrade inclusive of breakfast and free champagne and wine from morning till night. It has to be the best deal of all time ! If you are offered grab it with both hands ! The room itself was huge with a top range of products. Hot tea was immediately bought to our room . I cannot praise the staff here highly enough. Gail was our personal favourite but the team in the valley wing were terrific and nothing was too much trouble.Throughout the day drinks were available as well as snacks ,cakes , sandwiches and a buffet was offered at 5 five o,clock in case you needed a little something else. Amazing ! The icing on the cake for us was that we left for two days to go to Bintan Island . The staff kept our cases and on return we were offered use of the gym to freshen up on our return. Its also in a great location at the top of Orchard Road where there are more restaurants,shopping malls than anyone could ever want. They also run a free bus service to a mall in case you have over indulged during the day. If you are intending to visit Singapore in the future this has to be the place. If the upgrade is offered its a no-brainer !

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: DukeOfCumberland
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel for a conference. It is a magnificent hotel. The huge foyer is very impressive, and although I didn't get time to use it, the pool looked great. It is not on the front but it is at the top of the big shopping drag, and the taxis are always on hand for the waterfront bars and restaurants. The only gripe was...£8 for a half of locally brewed beer ? Drink out.

Reviews.Title: “TOP CLASS!!”
Reviews.Author: LondonJammer
Reviews.Content: we had a nights stopover in singapore so decided to book the valley wing...we were met at the airport by the shangri la"s rep and whisked off in an s class mercedes to the hotel..on our arrival at the hotel we were upgraded to a suite which was superb,separate living room,2 bathrooms,2 lcd tv"s and another small one in the wall of the master bathroom,plus a huge bedroom with a huge comfortable bed..after about an hour there was a knock at our room door and our personal butler delivered a complimentary bottle of wine in an ice bucket..the valley wing was superb,free drinks served in the lobby bar including champagne,free canapes and snacks served all evening..breakfast was an a la carte affair in the summit room and was superb..well worth the extra money for the valley wing..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service At This Green Oasis”
Reviews.Author: poleinahole1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for seven nights on two separate occasions over ten days. The hotel is celebrating its 40 th anniversary but is till going strong. Some guests have styed here nearly 200 times which gives you an idea of how good the service is. Check in was quick and efficient. There are ladies greeting you as you come in who wisk you to the reception desk and everyone is so uncomfortable if you insist on carrying one of your bags. I had stored some baggage the second time and the front desk arranged for the bellboy to deliver it--not like some other five star hotels where they tell you to go to the concierge after check-in and talk to the bellboy yourself. On both occasions my rooms were spacious (I had the standard category of room), modern and spotlessly clean. There is lots of complimentary water and fresh fruit everyday. Internet is speedy (cable or WIFI) and free. The only issue I had was that the room was very cold (18-19C) at night and the duvet very thin. There was no way to regulate the aircon so I had to take the key out of the electricty slot to stop the airconditioning and wear a bathrobe over my pjs. Bathroom is also spacious and has good amenities. The gym is fantastic. Unlike many first class hotels, they don't close the gym during the night., which is greatly appreciated by night owls or jet lagged travellers! After midnight when there are no attendants you just use your card key to get in. The food in the coffee shop is mediocre and service alate at night when it was not so busy was a bit slow. I couldn't possibly get value for money with the huge buffet breakfast so I ate a la carte and the waitress remembered exactly how I liked all my food items the next day and even arranged for her colleague to deliver my breakfast the way I liked it during her off day. Really incredible service in the morning. I also tried room service for breakfast which had an excellent "Healthy Start" selection not on the a la caret menu in the coffee shop. It takes under 30 minutes to get your food from the time you order. The Chinese restaurant is frequented mostly by Chinese and is excellent, especially the Chef's signature dishes. They have a shuttle that leaves every hour to Orchard Road. and taxis abound. But the hotel has a tailor (the one Bill Clinton ordered from), an excellent hair salon and a nail salon on the premises. I will definitely be staying here again when next in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly luxury”
Reviews.Author: BRLS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Valley Wing, in some respects very different from from the Garden Wing and the main hotel. The Valley Wing is the ideal small hotel in a big hotel: All the facilities of a big hotel, all the personality of a small. The free champagne, served from 11-23 in the lobby, might dim ones judgement, but the staff is very friendly and very professional. Rooms are large and totally up to date (excluding an outdated WiFi system). It is a very plesant Singapore hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great traditional hotel with impeccable service!”
Reviews.Author: Totti5
Reviews.Content: When I first check-in I was a little bit disappointed of the rooms except with the service. I had problem of plug and lamps not working in the room and I complain about this. The result they change me without charge to a room at the Horizon club floor and there the room was great! Nothing to say about the service attentive and very smiling always with some elegant touch like the complimentary fruit sorbet at the pool this afternoon. Try the restaurant on top floor very nice views, nice cuisine and impeccable service as always. I will certainly return to the Shangri-La!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lauren25c
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, well situated in the City, but far enough away from Orchard Road so as not to be disturbed by the crowds. Rooms were elegant and spacious, ultra clean. Views were amazing. Communal areas were very tastefully decorated, clean and uncrowded. Breakfast was incredible, with hundreds of options avalibale, literally. Staff were polite and friendly. Amazing chocolate carvings in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed Twice this week - Upgrade to The Valley Wing was awesome!”
Reviews.Author: 81globetrotter81
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel near Orchard Road, 30 minutes taxi from airport. The grounds provide a constant reminder that this is a tropical paridise. The hotel has a staff of people who just seem to be standing ready in the lobby to proactively greet fuests and anticipate their needs. The Fitness Center was also very nice. I stayed 3 nights in a Tower Wing deluxe room. The room was large, with a seating area with a loveseat seat overlooking the lush pool area. The bed was just a bit firm for my taste but I slept very well. Nice bathroom with amenities, bathrobes. Very nice. Carpet in hallways was just a bit worn, but overall very impressive property. Here is the tip: After going to Kuala Lumpur for one night, I returned to the room for 1 night before flying back to the US. I stayed in The Valley Wing, which was an amazing experience. After checking in, the staff lead me to the 'Valley Lobby', a totally separate lobby and reception area. Then up to a very large room with sitting room, dressing room, and ourstanding bathroom with full bath tub and separate large shower. Even nicer amenities and this was just a wonderful room. Know it is more expensive, but if you get a decent rate versus the tower room, go for it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: Gert1965
Reviews.Content: The Shangri-La hotel is home away from home, 5* in every aspect and I cannot believe it is not ranked amongst the top 3 hotels in Singapore. Book a Horizon club room for the best possible stay.

Reviews.Title: “good service”
Reviews.Author: merc43
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Valley Wing room for 4 nights, although check in was quite poor girl hopeless,after that things improved immensely, room was very spacious view was not much, staff in the valley wing could not do enough for you. After 5pm you got your drinks and canopies or afternoon tea which was impeccably served. only other slight fault is the location a bit out of the center but you can walk there, then again it is very quite where it is situated.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and far too expensive”
Reviews.Author: farmergirlyorkshire
Reviews.Content: As usual thought it would be amazing and it wasn't! Shabby tired decor in rooms,poor service in restaurants-the Line servicewas dreadful-untrained staff and disinterested management. All of them too important to bring water! Woken by hotel cleaning staff 3 times-even with do not disturb-possibly main land chinese and not able to read signs? Noisy air con and parking $50 a day

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but looking a little jaded in places”
Reviews.Author: Cuttingblade
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in the Shangri la in the Garden Wing which we were told was an upgrade on our original booking although it seemed to be the lowest grade of available room so I don't know how they worked it out! The hotel is large and the public areas are very impressive. Our room was very comfortable but the bathroom was in need of refurbishment and the furniture in the room had seen better days. We did have free internet access and the breakfast was amazing - I have never seen so much on offer - English, American, Asian, hot, cold, delicious fresh fruit and juices. The hotel is not very central at the far end of Orchard Rd and has probably been overtaken by the more modern towers near the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade for waiting”
Reviews.Author: nfjfmfsf
Reviews.Content: Excellent Service at Check in. Our room was not ready when we checked it. We told them that they don't have to hurry. We will go shopping and so on. We came back at around 9 p.m. an got an upgrade, because of this. Also the room maid was very friendly, brought us many extras allthough we said that it is not necessary. Treated like VIP's.

Reviews.Title: “A classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: expert186605
Reviews.Content: Singapore for many is a stop over to Australia or back to Europe. After 11 hours flt a hotel of real quality is required for 2 nights or more. Hotel very well situated, about 500 metres from one of the main shopping streets (but far away for peace and quiet). Smart, sophisticated,very well appointed in public areas. Staff absolutely first class. This hotel should enjoy your company. A few $ more but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: mcoopersmith
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, great pool and gym. The staff is very helpful and polite. Rooms are nice with comfy beds. This also comes with a price, breakfast was not included and cocktails were very expensive. Super clean and elegant.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis”
Reviews.Author: TonyNorwich
Reviews.Content: A resort hotel situated in a quiet neighbourhood, out of the city centre. We chose it as we prefer a quiet location to immediate access to attractions and that is just what we got. There is not much space to spare in Singapore but the Shangri-La has beautiful gardens - go for a Garden Wing room if you can. They have a complimentary shuttle bus at set times though we never used it as the timing didn't work for us. Taxis outside and not too expensive, though heavy traffic can mean it takes longer than you might think to reach the centre. In walking distance of Orchard Road. Very satisfied and an excellent choice if you don't need to be at the heart of the action.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: anotherbroom38
Reviews.Content: This was the last of four Shangri La hotels we have stayed in in the last month and was far and away the best. There was nothing about this hotel that was anything less than 1st Class. It was my wife's Birthday and they upgraded us to a Valley Wing room. This is the best hotel room we have ever stay in. All the staff made us feel special and if I visit Singapore again there is no where else I would stay.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel very good location”
Reviews.Author: naz0685
Reviews.Content: we arrived late to the hotel and therefore didnt do anything but sleep on the first night. it was a beautiful room and the fruit and cake were a very welcome surprise. i particularly enjoyed the breakfast although the valley wing only allows a formal dress code so do keep that in mind. the location was ideal for a city break and also the shuttle bus which was included were very frequent and an ideal way of travel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: julesjoker
Reviews.Content: Just back from a few days in Singapore at this plush hotel. Very luxurious - quite a range of rooms, worth asking about opportunities to upgrade, we paid £50 extra/night to upgrade to one of the valley wing rooms - which includes access to their lobby lounge with free alcoholic and soft drinks; afternoon tea, canapes etc and a lovely big regency style room, and plush bathroom. Singapore feels pretty pricy just now, probably the exchange rate mostly, but it is difficult to eat out for less than £70 per couple, even for pizza. And that is for a fairly modest meal - 2 courses, and a couple of drinks each. Beer and wine is pretty expensive at £6-7 for a glass of wine/beer. We did not eat in the hotel - apart from breakfast which is great. Good location for Orchard Road shopping/eating etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: PaulCC
Reviews.Content: Absolutely first class, well situated , nice pool , great service... rooms very good, and the food superb if you choose not to eat at the many excellent restaurants in Singapore. stayed three nights en-route to Bali... which is enough to see this fine city.. Tip : Do the 'boat key' for the best in sea food...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, excellent breakfast buffet!”
Reviews.Author: JMfromTO
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel! Great rooms, staff, food, etc. Breakfast buffet was the best I've ever had. Fresh food from all over the world. The pool is fantastic. I had a haircut on site... I wouldn't do that again. The only bad thing I can say about the place.

Reviews.Title: “Mrs H....”
Reviews.Author: Elle9
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Shangril la for years and the service, especially Singapore was excellent. I was thoroughly dissapointed with the service this time around and the cost cutting going on in the hotel. We booked a Suite with Horizon Club benefits, but on our first morning to breakfast were given the option of waiting as there were no tables or go to THE LINE on the 3rd floor. We gave them the benefitof doubt and went on down stairs to THE LINE and then to our disgust this happened every morning.....Sorry Sir/Madam would yhou mind waiting. So after 30 mins my Husband got anoyed to they tried hushing him up by putting him in the front of the que. We wouldn't allow that to happen when others were waiting far longer than us. However to cut the stoy short, we eventually proceeded down to the 3rd floor again as we had to do every other day due to the same old excuse. Then we went to the Coctail hourfrom 6pm till 9pm only to find when we walked in at 7pm we were asked to come back as there were no seats available. We were horrified and my husband was very verbal ( not swearing of course) with them the next morning as this went on everyday. We paid BIG BUCKS for our suite and H Club. We after found out the reason for the crowds...the H Club is no longer exclusive and every man and his DOG can join, therefore it's no over crowded. Did they REFUND US our HCLUB benefits that we did not receive.....NO NO NO NO!! of course not, they are in control of your credit card and can do what they like. After many years of travelling and forming a friendship with this one hotel chain it's now time to move on.....GOOD luck with you FREEBIES to all new customers of Shangri la.....it won;t last LONG.. After good customers like me don't book with them they have to look to new customer service GIMMICKS. Take what ever yhou can Now as it won;t last LONG.....GOOD BYE Shangri La.I could once say Singapore was the best branch. Gone are those days. Best you look into your new Management. IT SUCKS!!! This review is by no way FAKE.....Thank you....

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious stay”
Reviews.Author: AsexualSydney
Reviews.Content: This is what hospitality is all about - great service with a smile always. Staff make all requests possible! I think the guests abuse the hotel - unreasonable guests that reserve the poolside chairs for hours and not turning up and the management didn't do anything about it.

Reviews.Title: “Truly 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Kenken088
Reviews.Content: This Shangri-La Singapore lives up to its reputation as a five star hotel. Our only complaint is that because the hotel facilities are so all embracing there is a temptation to spend the whole time in the hotel and not go out and see the real Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful surroundings and lovely atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Johnny63
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Shangri La often and this time visited the Valley Wing for five nights. My partner and I really enjoyed our stay. This wing has more of a family atmosphere as it is smaller than the main hotel. I think that adult guests will very much enjoy the sophistication and quality of the Valley Wing (as well as the complimentary Moet and nibbles throughout the day!).

Reviews.Title: “Great Haven Amidst the City”
Reviews.Author: Public_Dave
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri-La in Singapore for six nights over Chinese New Year. I have stayed at the hotel several times before, including once just before our wedding. In fact, I used to live with my late parents for several years just 50 meters from the hotel, and came quite often to the hotel for a nice meal, so there was a poignancy to this visit. The hotel is tucked just 5-10 minutes from Orchard Road (I recommend taking Anderson Rd and Claymore Rd as a shortcut and my favorite route) on a verdant, winding green street called Orange Grove Road; there are still a couple of mock Tudor houses that remind one of what it was like in decades past. Your taxi will take you up the driveway to a wide, yet secluded area, where red and black liveried bellmen will assist you with your baggage as you are welcomed by senior staff at the hotel. The lobby has been reconfigured several times over the years, but what has been constant is the soaringly high ceilings gently suffused with some natural light, almost like a cathedral. Check-in was immediate, and we were quickly in our room. The standard room itself was attractive, with a circular alcove with a bay window at the far end, a dresser near the king-sized bed, a good sized desk, and the bathroom using semi-opaque glass tiles for walls to provide more lighting to the room without being see-through as in some other hotel designs. The bathroom was large and lovely, with a big tub and a generously-sized circular shower. My only criticism of the room is that because it operates on the system that your keycard turns on the power, the power and the airconditioning is actually off in a lot of rooms for much of the day. This is eco-friendly, but does leave a faint trace of a mildewy smell in the room given the tropical climate, carpets etc. We were somewhat disappointed with The Line restaurant, which we ate at on our first night, but maybe it was not representative because we ate a la carte, and it was Chinese New Year's Eve. However, the food was only average approximations of local specialties, costing 5-6x the price, and because we love coming to Singapore to eat it was a bit of a let down, given how many great meals I've had at this hotel, in their coffee shop, over the decades. A subsequent trip for breakfast though did make up for that, which was quite impressive. A nice feature is the shuttle bus that takes guests to the Orchard road area and back on the hour. Cabs are always on hand, which is great given the perennial taxi shortage in Singapore. Also what is wonderful is simply the grounds of the hotel, which you can stroll around in probably for a good 20 minutes. You are also very close to the Botanical Gardens, which is about 20 minutes' walk (via Fernhill, Nassim, Lermit and Cluny) and which is a great place for a run in the early morning (the hotel also has a great gym and spa). My daughter was delighted with the property and I do think it is very welcoming to families. I would definitely recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Blaze14
Reviews.Content: Before we left the UK, I was quite concerned about staying here after reading some of the reviews about this hotel, however they were all totally unfounded. Upon our arrival we were swiftly and very politely greeted and welcomed to our check in. We were upgraded from a Horizon Club Room to a Horizon Premier Club Room, they had very kindly left us a pot of Jasmine Tea and cakes in our room and the benefits of the Horizon Club were explained. Breakfast every day on the 24th Floor was relaxed and there was never ever any problem in getting a table unlike some other reviewers’ comments regarding this matter. Again, cocktails and canapés in the Club Lounge were exceptional, although there are clearly some guests who abuse the system and use it as dinner time! I can honestly say that the service we received was second to none, up to now it must have been one of the best hotels for service and politeness we have ever stayed in throughout the world.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is older, but OK...Avoid the apartments!”
Reviews.Author: foodnfinance
Reviews.Content: k, I have stayed at many shangri la hotels, from hong kong to bangkok. In Singapore, they have a premium location. The Line rocks, even though they charge 10$ for an iced tea. This isn't a cool hip modern hotel.....I stayed in the "apartments "......straight up awful. The decor is granny circa 1970, and not the cool 1970... If you avoid smoking, don't stay here......I brought every spray I could find in LA...........It still smells like smoke. The worst though is the TV. They have cable in the living room.....only selected channels, i have to pay to get the rest. OK Then there are only chinese channels in the bedroom? A cable box costs 12 bucks a month. No cable box in the bedroom. They cut every freaking corner here.....

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, treated like royalty”
Reviews.Author: maggieallington
Reviews.Content: On arrival a warm welcome by front of house staff in national livery. Stunningly beautiful. Wonderful rooms,grounds, facilities, food. etc. All cultures catered for. Lovely staff who really listen to what you have to say. Upgrade to the Horizon Club for even more specialist treatment. Frequent, free shuttle bus to the world famous Orchard Road shopping district.

Reviews.Title: “Superb with only The Line to let it down”
Reviews.Author: jjj036
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Garden Wing for three nights. Room in need of modernisation/updating, old TV with sellotaped remote controller but really very comfortable indeed, quiet and easy to sleep in, free Internet, no ice unless you ordered it. Lovely staff as ever in SE Asia. Our only complaint was the chaos that was The Line restaurant. We had one dinner and three (included) breakfasts there. It was noisy with bad acoustics, screaming children and too busy for the overstretched staff. It was also appallingly bad value for dinner when we overpaid for some very bland local cuisine, which was much better for a twentieth of the price at a hawker stall the following day. The BLU restaurant for dinner one night was by contrast quite superb with exceptional food and service and, from the top of the Tower Wing, a stunning outside verandah for coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great hotel but rooms in dire need of a spruce-up”
Reviews.Author: dingo_hb
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms in the Garden Wing and, even though we arrived at about 4am and official check-in time is at 2pm, we were pleasantly surprised to be assigned rooms at 7:30am (probably because the sight of 4 people sleeping in the opulent foyer is not really 5-star material!). Our 2 boys were allocated their room first and, I must say, we were a little disappointed. We'd stayed in this hotel a few years earlier - also in the Garden Wing - and the rooms hadn't changed at all, apart from more wear and tear! The wall beside the desk had black marks on it, the faux-wood floor had quite a few black streaks on it and one of the glass ledges in the bathroom cabinet basically collapsed. The plastic handle on the shower screen was also badly chipped. The phone didn't work! And when it did there were annoying dialling tones in the background making it impossible for anyone to hear us. When I eventually got through to the front desk they immediately sent up lots of people to check everything out - can't complain about the service! A new phone didn't fix our telecommunications problems - not that I ever thought it would - so they logged a maintenance call (which duly fixed the problem later that day). We were offered another room on the top (9th) floor but, in the end, I asked them to fix all the other superficial problems because everyone was tired and we needed to rest. The room for me and my wife was in better condition. They delivered 2 small boxes of chocolates later in the day to our rooms to help us 'overcome' all the issues we'd encountered. I must make a special mention of the televisions: it's insane that they still have CRT TVs in these Garden Wing rooms!! This is 2011 folks and we're talking about a 5-star hotel in a pretty advanced country! Not acceptable. Our room bookings came with buffet breakfasts at The Line restaurant. All very nice - lots of wonderful food - but the service was a little lacking on the last two days. Plates not cleared promptly (had to continually move them to an empty table) and generally slow table service. Not sure why this was the case when the service on the 1st two days was impeccable. Staff at the front desks, concierge, room-keeping, gym etc were all top notch! So, in as much as I've always loved the 'Shang', I don't think I'll be staying there next time we visit Singapore until I find out that they've finally renovated the rooms. Given the high room rates, I think they're in dire need of sprucing up.

Reviews.Title: “Grande old dame”
Reviews.Author: RatmanKL
Reviews.Content: Location is wonderful: The Shangri-La Singapore sits on a huge plot of land very centrally located yet tucked away from the nearby buzz of Orchard road. No spectacular view but set in beautiful gardens. The huge hotel built in the 70s and 80s itself is nothing to write home about but the service is absolutely top notch and as personal as it can be in a hotel of this size. Rooms are well appointed (only downside is that wireless internet is not available on many floors) and house keeping is excellent. Concierge and bell men are wonderful. The only downside was the quality of the poolside food, the Croque Monsieur was truly awful. Not even the wonderfully witty pool service could make up for it. All in all, still and excellent choice and Shangri-La has finally introduced a points system for their loyal members.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms but it they don't enforce no-smoking policy - YUCK”
Reviews.Author: VorlonKosh
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend the Shangri-La because they do not enforce their no-smoking policy. Another guest on my "no smoking" floor was chain smoking in their room, creating an awful stench. My feedback to management was rebuffed with a "there is nothing we can do" attitude. They offered to spray air freshener in my room but were unwilling to stop the other guest's behavior. This was very disappointing. The hotel isn't all bad. The interior of the rooms are well appointed and very comfortable. The dining experience is also very good in their on-site restaurants. On the downside, housekeeping was not entirely consistent. On some days I received no fresh washcloths, for example. The wireless internet connection was unreliable and it was often inaccessible (bring your own long ethernet cable if you want to roam about your room and stay connected). Also, the hotel is a bit of a walk from Orchard street. If you are coming to Singapore to shop, best to stay a bit closer if you want to avoid being soaked in sweat by the walk. Next visit I will be staying elsewhere. One gets the sense that this hotel is past its heyday. There are newer and nicer hotels in the same price category. I will try them next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base for exploring Singapore”
Reviews.Author: TeamTangerine
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have stayed in Singapore a few times over the years but now we have a young family we decided to try it for our first family holiday. We used TripAdvisor to find our Hotel and as this was one of the most popular in Singapore we decided to give it a try. We booked 2 Horizon Club rooms as Breakfast is notoriously expensive in most Hotels we've stayed at and for the included Breakfast with Canapes and Cocktails in the evening, this more than made up for the extra charge for Horizon Club. We were on the 16th Floor but I have a suspicion that is the "Family Floor" as most other guests there seemed to be travelling with Children which was fine. Alcohol is expensive almost everywhere in Singapore and Shangri-La is no exception. Expect to pay S$20 for any alcoholic beverage, regardless of whether its a glass of beer or a cocktail, which was a bit bizarre and the cocktails seemed like they were more lolly water than containing any actual alcohol, but since they were free between 6 and 8 in the Horizon Club, no big deal. The staff were always extremely courteous and helpful, the doorman in the setdown area even paid for our taxi at one point when the taxi-driver's Credit Card machine had stopped working. I'm not sure if this is a common practice or not, but it was a huge help at the time. Our 3 year old daughter was at all times treated like a princess, none of the staff ever spoke over her, they always specifically said hello to her and asked her how she was. This was such a relief to have her so welcomed because we weren't sure how the hotel would feel about having young children, but there was no cause for concern at all. All in all, Shangri-La has impressed beyond our expectations and we will be looking forward to staying here again when we next stop in Singapore and at some of their other properties when we next travel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: SweetheartSurrey
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful trip to Australia and NZ via Singapore. We stayed at the Shangri La hotel in Singapore which was as good as you can possibly get. The hotel, rooms, food, staff etc. were absolutely incredible. We will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance and Efficiency”
Reviews.Author: HelenNorthants
Reviews.Content: Our first impression of this hotel is efficiency and elegance from the doorman in his wonderful uniform and hat and the beautiful young women who greet you upon arrival. My spouse and I were very tired after a long flight from London and were keen to get settled into our room. Many reviewers place a great deal of emphasis on the check in (not me) and for this reason I will mention it. It was quick and painless, but the ever hoped for upgrade was not forthcoming because it is a very busy time of the year. (29th December). We were quickly taken to our rooms but not before we had a chance to take in the opulent lofty lobby with huge Christmas tree and stunning chandeliers. The first impression of the room was the view of Singapore. I could have sat and looked at it for hours. The room was not huge, but it was not a bad size. The bed was very large and comfortable, the curtains were remote control from the console panel by the bed. The bathroom had everything I expected from a bathroom including a walk in shower, bathrobes, hair drier, slippers,good toiletries and modern weighing scales. As with most hotel bedrooms, there never seems to be enough space for stowing clothing etc, but as we were only staying for 3 days, this was a very minor niggle. There was an ironing board and iron to get rid of those unwanted wrinkles. The air conditioning was efficient, but not quiet enough for my husband. The next morning, it was off to the gym to check it out. There were five treadmills, two cross trainers, two rowing machines, recumbent bike and upright bike, two further cross trainers with a different leg action (forget the name) and a good range of free standing weights and a standalone weight machine. The equipment looked quite new and was in excellent order. I did not have the time to try out the pool or sauna, but be aware that the sauna facilities are single sex. There was help on hand, if required. There was only one small niggle and this was half our fault. We went to bed early the first evening as jet lag had caught up with us and the turndown service knocked on the door and we said that we did not need it. Half an hour later it happened again waking us up! We realised the next morning that we had not pressed the do not disturb button which displays outside the room. We had breakfast in the Line Restaurant each morning during our stay and the range and quality of food was excellent from the freshly squeezed juices (try the Mango and Mint – delicious) to the Sushi Bar. There was food to cater for every taste and nationality. One morning I tried the vegetable curry and parathas and it was very good indeed. (It may seem to be a rather bizarre choice of breakfast for westerners, but go on, try it!). After dining out one evening, we returned to the hotel for a nightcap and were entertained with live music and a female singer which was very pleasant. Drinks were served with a selection of nuts and nibbles. Service was quick and beautifully delivered as mentioned by a previous poster. The staff were always concerned for our well-being. One morning we were waiting for the complimentary tour of Singapore and our pick up was late. This was noticed by a member of staff who quickly phoned the operator to find out what had happened. A taxi was sent to pick us up to catch up with the tour. This became a bit of a farce because we missed half of the tour and there were many tours going on but none of them seemed to want to be responsible for us. We played catch up for most of the tour, with the driver taking us from one spot to another to try to place us. The problem was not anything to do with the hotel, but an administrative error on the part of the tour operator who seemed to think that we were stopping at a different hotel. The location of the hotel is off the Orchard Road, which can be a bit of a trek to get to certain parts, particularly in this climate, but we found it to be convenient for our needs and the taxis were very efficient and reasonable. The harbour is spectacular with the interesting architecture – particularly the newish hotel (nicknamed the Banana Boat by our taxi driver). The must do activity in Singapore is go for a Singapore Sling in the Raffles Hotel. We did it of course but it was only memorable for the cost of the pink drinks and the custom of discarding empty ground nut shells on the floor. Only residents and diners can enter the hotel and the Long Bar (which is not particularly long) is accessed from outside the hotel. It seems that the dress code for the bar is ‘anything goes’. We trekked around the McRitchie Reservoir (approx 15 km) which included rainforest and water locations. This was much needed exercise and definitely worthwhile as we were able to experience rainforest flora and fauna (skinks, water monitor, macaque monkies etc). The sounds of the rainforest were amazing. The exercise was vigorous and not for the unfit. It took approximately 3.5 hours. Good walking footwear is needed and remember to apply sunscreen and bug repellent. My enduring memory of Singapore is the friendliness of the people and the immaculate surroundings. There was absolutely no litter or gum on the pavements and the whole place was like a very well tended garden. We felt completely safe at all times and there is virtually no crime at all because of the harsh penalties. The Botanical Gardens are very close by and are worth a visit. There is an extra charge for the Orchid Garden. We were sorry to leave as we did not think that 3 days were enough to see all of Singapore and we would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel, but not the best in town”
Reviews.Author: tenvsrini
Reviews.Content: We had a booking for 3 adults in 2 rooms through Agoda. When we arrived for check-in, the agent noted that of the 2 rooms, 1 had been cancelled! She then spoke to her manager over phone and took a while to sort the problem out. All the while - about 15 minutes - we were made to stand at the front desk. It appears that booking more than 1 room from Agoda creates separate booking segments for each room, with a different guest name on each. Surely, the hotel should have been aware of this and had a mechanism to deal with it? We had rooms 816 and 817 in the Tower wing. Rooms are as plush and comfortable as you would expect in any 5-star luxury property. Breakfast was not included our rate, so we ordered breakfast in-room both days. Tried dinner and dessert as well, and thoroughly enjoyed all our meals. On our second morning we worked out at the gym with a view of the pool. Later, we walked around the lush mini-garden with its koi pond at the Garden wing. There is a free shuttle to Orchard Road every hour. Unfortunately, on the one occasion we tried to catch it, we had to wait 20 minutes at the lobby before being told that the tyre had lost air and was being fixed. We chose to take a taxi rather than wait further. Plenty of taxis at the door.

Reviews.Title: “Contradictory Experience”
Reviews.Author: EddieN51
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Horizon Club room on the 16th floor which was disapointing. As another reviewer has noted it really did have the appearance of a Motel room in some respects with pine effect wood and poor shower etc. I think some of the rooms are in desperate need of updating (bearing in mind the status of the hotel) which was especially obvious to us as we had just come directly from the Shrangli La Rasa Wing Hotel in Penang where the rooms were fabulous compared to the one we stayed in at Singapore (it was quite astonishing the difference between the two rooms). The lobby and greeting etc is totally amazing I agree, but this hardly makes the stay. The facilities are definately 5 star though in terms of gymn, pools, restaurants etc The previous reviewer who has stated there are too many Club rooms has hit the nail on the head as we had the same problem at Breakfast - hardly a relaxing start to the day, and our room just wasn't "Club" standard Staff were all very pleasant and friendly but sometimes not as efficient as you'd expect.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not wow!”
Reviews.Author: TiggeronTour
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed from the 29th Dec for 3 nights over New Year ahead of our onward trip to Langkawi. Fortunately our room was ready in the Tower Wing as we had arrived in the morning, unfortunately no one told us a fire drill would be taking place 1/2 hour after checking in and we had gone to bed to get a couple of hours sleep. No such luck announcements and alarms continued until we decided to get up and find out what was going on, a drill! The hotel is in a good location if you want to venture down to Orchard Road without being in the hub. However if you wnat to socialise around Clarke Quay etc in the evening which we did, you are a little further out. The Line restaurant was always busy in the morning, with a q, however we were given orange juice while waiting. The hotel although grand is dated and I have stayed in better hotels in Dubai, that siad we had a nice time and this is a lovely hotel just not wow as I said.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely faultless”
Reviews.Author: Gilbertgreen
Reviews.Content: We had been aware from articles on the internet that this hotel was something special. We were not disappointed. The Shangri-La was pure elegance. Enormous, but with totally understated style. As we entered the gigantic lobby we were met by one of the many greeting staff, all of whom were tiny Malay girls in kimono style dresses. The colour of the dresses blended subtly with the area of the lobby where they were stationed. We were ushered to the reception desk, but as we gave our name, another girl in a black kimono, which seemed to signify some degree of seniority, glided up to us and informed us that we had been upgraded to be guests of the Hotel’s “Horizon Club”. She took us to the bank of lifts and accompanied us to a private reception area on the 24th floor, where she introduced us to yet more reception staff. We were advised that if we required anything at any time of the day or night, we should call that desk. We were shown the private “members” breakfast room, and also the members lounge, which was open all day. We were then shown to our Club Suite on the 22nd floor. It was enormous. There was even an office/study area with a semi-circular desk complete with a leather swivel chair. The outer wall was entirely glass from floor to ceiling, giving spectacular views over the city. I had begun to worry about the strain of manoeuvring the enormous volume of curtaining that hung at these windows, so I was extremely relieved to find a control panel by the bed from which the curtains, lights, and air-conditioning could be controlled electronically. We took breakfast in the Horizon Lounge, which was excellent, and also ate in the Hotel's buffet restaurant called "The Line". This is an extremely modern facility which is totally at odds with the period charm of the hotel itself, but nevertheless extremely good. In fact last time I looked it had a Trip Advisor popularity rating of 6th out of 1600 Singapore restaurants. We also enjoyed the huge lobby cocktail lounge where a singer accompanied by a small jazz combo performs each evening. As we relaxed in the huge leather chairs a young waitress came to take our order. She was wearing the standard kimono type dress as worn by other employees in the hotel, only it was a pale olive green which toned perfectly with the décor in the lounge, and it was slashed to the hip on both sides. When she returned with the order she did not bend down to place the glasses on the table. Keeping a perfectly straight back she bent her knees and slowly descended until she was kneeling on the ground. She placed the glasses on the table, rocked back very gently on her heels and rose to stand upright, again keeping her back completely straight. We were quite astonished. We sat at the table for some time watching the waitresses, who all performed in the same gymnastic fashion, regardless of the weight of stuff being carried on their trays. This extraordinary method of serving was unique to this Lobby Lounge. On reflection I would say that the Shangri-La is undoubtedly one of the finest hotels I have ever experienced. The service was incredible without being obtrusive, the attention to detail was amazing. The carpets in the lifts had the day of the week subtly incorporated in their design. These were, of course, changed every day. On our last morning as we were leaving the room a cleaner appeared. We told her that the room did not need doing as we were checking out later that day. She said that we might be in the room until later in the afternoon so she must clean it for us. We would unreservedly recommend this hotel, and very much hope to return in the not too distant future.

Reviews.Title: “DISAPPOINTING”
Reviews.Author: PigsEar1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Horizon Club Room for 3 nights at end of Dec and were v disappointed. The room was OK, no complaints. HOWEVER, the service within the hotel was pathetic. On the first morning, we went up to Blu where we were supposed to get our Club Floor breakfast only to find a queue of 10+ people as all the tables were taken. We were told that they had set up a small buffet in the Club Lounge and we should go there only to find the tables set for breakfast were all taken. We complained to one of the lounge assistants and they took us down to The Line for the buffet breakfast but it was not to be - the queue at The Line was enormous with 20+ people waiting to be seated. So back up to Blu was the best bet and half an hour later we sat down for breakfast. Once seated, service was again non existent when a glass of water ordered never arrived and there were no glasses left for orange juice at the buffet. SO, the lesson, we had to get up v early each subsequent morning to ensure we were first in Blu. For the first eveing we wanted to book The Line for dinner as one of us is vegetarian and it was by far the best option. We tried to book at 8am and it was full so we then asked to book for the following night but it was full ALL night. After kicking up a fuss i.e. 5* hotel where we can't get breakfast or dinner the Club Lounge assistant got us a place at the restaurant albeit at an inconvenient time. Our conclusions: 1. There are too many Club rooms for the Lounge or the facilities- virtually the entire Tower Wing seems to be Club rooms. We expect to be in a minority not the majority when on Club Floor i.e. top 2 floors only 2. The hotel as a whole does not have enough eating facilities or staff for the number of rooms. Honestly this hotel gave the worst service we have ever experienced and we have been all over the world staying in everything from Private Game Reserves to 2* motels in the USA.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a place....fantastic !”
Reviews.Author: Like2getaway01
Reviews.Content: The Shangri-la is fantastic, we stayed in the Valley wing (VW) over New year which has large suites, huge marble bathrooms etc, one of the best parts was the residents of the VW can have afternoon tea from 3 (plates of sandwiches, cakes etc) and then from 5ish they serve canapes and you can order drinks with either...and its all included, excellent value especially when travelling with two professional sleepers that only just make breakfast at 10.55 each morning (wife/child !), we skip lunch and eat at 3. The Hotel facilities are all great from the pool to the most amazing breakfast buffet we've ever seen at 'The Line' restaurant. It's well located as you can walk to Orchard road where there are loads of restaurants, bars, shops etc, the taxi's are all regulated and are good value for money. We toured around and did most of the attractions in Singapore which I have to say is a fantastic city, dont miss the Sinagapore Flyer, the Megazip on Sentosa island (which is great in itself !) and the 'Jewel' restaurant on Mt Faber where you can get low price cable car tickets if eating there...great views, I'd recommend the Shangri-la and Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing rooms and staff need lessons in customer service.”
Reviews.Author: n4pla
Reviews.Content: ON the final leg on our honeymoon in asia and this was both of our first times to Singapore. Hotel good location for orchard rd but that is the only saving grace for the hotel. The staff are rude esp in the garden wing reception area, the manager especially has very poor communication skills, does not listen, interupts, tuts when you speak and is extremely rude. We were originally in the garden wing, upon entering the room it smelt of damp and there was even a humidifier in the room, I assume to try and mask the problem. The whole room looked like a 3 star motel in america and very outdated. There was even a plug socket on the wall that bwas not straight and upon inspection appeared to be styuck on the wall with tape or glue! We complained and were moved rooms, 8 hrs later after explaining the story to 3 people becasue the staff dont communicate and the manager in the reception of the graden wing cant be bothered to listen. Luckily the porters were more helpful! We were moved to the tower wing to rooms which were better,. Thwe showers could do with re-masticking as the black grout was disgusting but the rest of the room was ok. We didnt get a turn down service the 1st night and out chinese tea set that we were given to use as a honeymoon couple never was brought over frokm the original even after asking 3 times but the breakfast in the club floor served by the staff, esp Abigail, who was amazing! She was so helpful and polite. A real gem to this hote, helped to make up for the rest of the place. The breakfast in the Line rest, well what chaos, Not eneough staff, tables not cleared quickly resulting in customers having to queue for about 15 mins until they can eat! Clearly the hotel when at capacity cannot cope.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - WIll not recommend!”
Reviews.Author: PremiumTravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tower Wing for a week at Shangrila Singapore. Location is not too bad as it's away from the busy Orchard road. Shuttle bus service is a plus. Stayed previously at tower and garden wing many years back. Well-maintained room considering it's about 10 years old since last renovation. Doorway to the alcove in tower wing is very dusty. Although we stayed on a non-smoking floor, there were obviously some idiots who smoked and the smoke got into our ac and along the corridor. Complained to the hotel and an ioniser was brought in to the rescue. Imagine the kids coughing the sneezing. Most disappointing was our experience at the Line for breakfast. Average time to get a pot of coffee was 15 mins. Longest I had to wait was 25 mins! Totally ridiculous. How long do you need to brew a pot of coffee. In fact they should have all the pots standby every morning since it's breakfast time. Wrote a feedback to GM and receive no response. GM must response whenever a guest takes time to provide feedback (good or bad ones) since it's free feedback. It would show very well that indeed the hotel is interested in providing better service. I find it an irony that they always provide cards that read "we value your feedback" and don't response. Sadly, this hotel will not have my business anymore. Will not recommend to any of my friends. The raffles hotel sent an email to acknowledge and response to feedback within 24 hours. That's professionalism!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: popoaroundtheworld
Reviews.Content: i will recommend to anyone this is a great place looks like you are far way from city even it is 5 min by walk from the center.

Reviews.Title: “friendly & honest employees”
Reviews.Author: basaa
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel twice already. i love the location, tucked in a quiet lane on the backside of the orchard road. great to go out for a morning run & just few minutes away orchard road in the evening. breakfast menu has a great choice. best thing happened to me on last visit was, i dropped my credit card on the lobby floor and didn't realize it. one of employees found it & delivered it to my room within 20 minutes. that was really great! will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in singapore”
Reviews.Author: MumbaiChamp
Reviews.Content: I stayed in hotel Shangrila during my business trip to singapre. I found the hotel is good. Rooms are clean and nice. Hotel has one drawback in terms of its location its location. cleanliness, ambience is very good in hotel. The staff is co-operative. Only challenge is about Indian food. Menu doesnot have many options for vegetarian indian food. Health club is best. Enjoy very heavy brunch on Sunday in their continental international restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: lavinalincolnuk
Reviews.Content: this hotel is just fantastic lovely attentive staff super clean very near all amenities good pool area where they bring you water to drink good resturant for breakfast or dinner

Reviews.Title: “Is it really Shangri-La?? What's wrong with it???”
Reviews.Author: CoolHusky
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Shangri-La Hotels several times in other cities with wonderful memories but this was the first time I stayed in Shangri-La Singapore. Before telling my bad experience I need to mention the good things first. The bed was very comfortable and I had good sleep every night after working busily for a whole day. The breakfast was great with various choices. The staff was polite, particularly those helpful guys at the taxi stand and inside the lobby. I stayed there for 3 nights for a business trip at the end of November. As the booking was tight the staying plan was different in these 3 nights: it was cheaper with no breakfast for the first night. During check-in I was told that I needed to check out on next morning in order to change to another plan. I asked if I could have the same room coz I didn't want to pack my luggage (not to mention it's more expensive for the next two nights) but the lady said "no, coz the plan would be upgraded". Okay. I understood. On next morning at the check-out counter I was told to go back to my room!!! After a time-consuming check-out and check-in procedure I went back to the original room...for an "upgraded" plan with breakfast and fruit and drinks. In the second night when I went back from work, late at night, after unpacking my luggage, I found there was no fruit for me. Two handkerchieves were missing but one more medium sized towel was found. I consumed two tea bags in the morning but no one brought them back to me. As no one told me where to have breakfast and drinks, I phoned to the front desk. During the conversation the line was cut but no one called me back. I was too tired to call again so I hurried to bed after a shower. In the third night I saw two bananas in the room. They finally remembered it!! The missing tea bags still hadn't returned. The two handkerchieves came back and the third medium-sized towel had gone. However, something was found on the floor of the bathroom: glass fragments!! Didn't the one who broke the glass know this may hurt when someone stepped on it with bare feet???? Another thing was that I brought my own toothbrush with a little plastic case covering the brush but someone threw the case away. My good memories with "Shangri-La" in other cities were ruined after this stay...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: suzukigsxr1000k1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Shangri La for two nights on route to Oz as a start to our holiday. What a great hotel much nicer then we expected. As it was our first time in Singapore Raffles was first choice,but this was fully booked. As you do we went to the long bar for the obligatory "sinagapore sling" after visiting how glad we were to be staying at the Shangri La the gardens where beautiful and the hotel secluded and private, unlike Raffles which seemed more of a theme park.. We would definitely stay again, from check iin to leaving the staff and service where excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cdel10
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights and were booked into Horizon Club room with all the benefits of breakfast included and free drinks and canopes in the evening,. All excellent. we had a city view room which was fine. Room was excellent and all the expectations of a 5 star hotel. The staff were extremely helpful. Short 10 minute walk to Orchard Road the main shopping street so very easy. Enjoyed our time in SInapore, highly recommend the Botanical Gardens, and we visited the main temples etc which was all very interesting. Little India and Kampong Glam were well worth a visit. Free internt access very good. The outdoor pool was lovely and we were given a free icecream whilst relaxing. Try and find a small eating place instead of a posh restaurant as food can be exceptional for a small cost. We went up the Sands Sky Park to observation deck - this has to be done and far better than the wheel, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “What a fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: Phillipsclan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pure luxury, the rooms are large very well maintained and clean. The bed was massive, and the bathroom was big -shower and bath separate, and it was very clean. The reception area is huge and very spacious, everyone is very helpful and polite. The garden and pool area are beautiful very well kept. The food in the hotel (we were bed and breakfast) was lovely and a truely a wonderful selection. We also had a lunch around the pool which was also of very high quaility. I cannot wait to go back. The hotel is in a really good area to be able to get around singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Had a fab, fab time at the wonderful Shangrila Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: toohardtoplease
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at this hotel in a Horizon Club Room with all the little extras that come with it - worth every penny! From arriving to leaving it was hard to find fault with any of the facilities. The room on the 19th floor, was spotless, comfortable and had an amazing view - but have to say lacked the wow factor - actually thought it was a little on the small side in comparison to other Shangrila Hotels. The Horizon Club Lounge on the 24th floor was fantastic, serving beverages and snacks all day, then in the evening from 6-8 you can have canapes and cocktails - all beautifully presented and really yummy! We had breakfast on 4 mornings in the Blu Restuarant again on the 24th floor - lots of choice, hot and delicious not forgetting the spectacular view over the city! We tried The Line one morning, but thought it very noisy, bit like a canteen, loads of choice but the food we had was only warm! As other guests have mentioned, the pool area was lovely and we were given sorbet, fresh fruit plus cold drinks. We also had a foot massage by Jacky (not complimentary) which was superb! Also must mention the gardens which were beautifully kept! Watch out for mozzies, if you play golf in the hotel grounds - it had rained quite heavily the night before so they were out in force just in that area!! We enjoyed the 10 min walk to Orchard Road, with the MRT station a little futher on. The MRT is very efficent, cheap and super clean! Taxis also provide a very good service and very reasonable! Must do's - Marina Bay Sands and Skypark - amazing view, beautiful Botanic Gardens and the wonderful Chinatown! Singapore is a beautiful, friendly and very clean city - we absolutely loved it! Have to finish by saying the staff at the Shangrila Hotel are absolutely wonderful, friendly, efficient and always have a smile! We just loved our stay at this hotel and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Located at heart of lovely Singapore, Shangri La is place to be in”
Reviews.Author: RohitKatyal
Reviews.Content: Singapore is a mega city, well planned and one of the most beautifull cities in world. Shangri La is located near the busiest shopping street in Singapore known as Orchard road (5 minutes walking distance) which is full of malls and eateries. The breakfast lounge is nice and spacious and provides good selection of food. There are other options also for dining within the hotel premises else one can walk to Orchard road and he/she will be spoilt for choice there. Rooms are spacious and have all modern amenities which a business travellor needs at end of a hectic working day. The pool is nice and they also have tennis courts for ardent sports fans. Its within 15 minutes of walking distance to the MRT station and taxis are easily available at hotel. Orchard road is almost at heart of Singapore island and one can go to any area within 30-45 minutes on a cab. Shangri la Singapore is bit expensive hotel and that is probably only drawback of this property.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: sidroy100
Reviews.Content: Most deluxe and grand hotels worldwide are uniform in their superior grade of service and amenities offered. What endeared me to my last visit to the Shangri La Hotel however was their extent of personalisation specially in their club section in their top floor where most of our meetings were conducted.I could not figure out how the hotel personnel appeared to to know us instinctively and addressed us individually in our own names.Even the drinks and beverages that we liked seemed to be known to the hostesses on the club floor as well.The desire to go the extra mile in delivering service quality seemed to be ingrained in the hotel staff. I must emphasise that we were not special guests on the club floor and that there were other meetings (much more high profile than ours) simultaneously taking place and yet we seemed to get a feeling of being personally looked after and which I would term simply as a 'Shangri La hall-mark' after my recent experience. Even though the Shangri La Hotel is probably more renowned for its tranquility and its

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Pool and tranquil surrounds around the corner from a bustling city.”
Reviews.Author: SunnyPerth_10
Reviews.Content: You can't help but be impressed when arriving at the Shangri-la with her huge marble foyer and glistening crystal chandeliers and a bevy of doorman and staff to greet you. It does give you that "rock star" feel.The rooms although a little tired have everything you would want or expect in a five star hotel. I loved the curved glass ensuite with marble bathroom and deep bath . The King size bed was very comfortable and linen always clean and good quality. Loved the novelty of being able to open your curtains at the touch of a bedside button.The pool and garden area were a relaxing oasis just around tOhe corner from what is now such a busy city. The pool staff were friendly and if you spent the day around the pool little refreshing surprises would be delivered including chilled water, watermellon cups, sorbet and cold hand towels .Next time i would definately upgrade to a club room it was to late for me as the hotel had full capacity.The club lounge with it's constant snacks and drinks sounds amazing and although i didn't dine there Blu looks amazing it's definately on the "to do" list for my return. The daily shoppers shuttle left every day on the hour after 10 and runs until around 8 in the evening.It really is only a short walk to orchard road but once you find yourself in one of it's huge shopping complexes be warned, it takes a while to find your way out !Overall loved my stay and will definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: roxygrl80
Reviews.Content: It is obvious that this hotel takes pride in providing impeccable service. Very friendly, courteous, attentive and helpful staff, be it the bellhop, concierge, reception, cleaner, a staff member you bump into on the lift, etc. The rooms are very large with a separate dresser and desk; small sitting area; and large, plush and comfortable king sized bed. The bathroom is spacious with separate bath and shower. Did not go down to the pool as it was raining, but it looked nice from a distance. Hotel lobby is grand with very high ceilings. The location is slightly out of the way if you do not have a car and will be relying on public transport. But there is a free hotel shuttle that goes to Orchard Road every hour, and there is never a wait for taxis which for $5 will take you to the middle of Orchard Road, or for $10 will take you to most places you need to be in Singapore. Overall, we had a wonderful experience at the Shangri-La as we did not mind getting taxis to places.

Reviews.Title: “Notch Above”
Reviews.Author: Chestnutmash
Reviews.Content: I haven't been back to the Shangri-La for over 15 years, and recently returned since my colleague insisted that this was the only hotel she stays every time she travels to Singapore. I've always preferred the Hyatt, but was very pleasantly surprised by all the little touches that puts it a notch above the compatible hotels I've stayed in the area. Things I was happy with : Great staff - attentive and courteous; Well maintained, clean, and up to date rooms; The motorized curtains were easy to operate and closed out all light allowing me to sleep in the first day (arrived at 4:00AM after a long flight, I was checked in and shown to my room quickly and efficiently); The bed was a little stiffer than I preferred, but the pillows (full size with various softness) and covers were just right; Complementary internet (only hard wired, though), bottled water, and fresh fruit were well appreciated; The extensive lobby and common areas (including the grounds) were very fitting for this grand hotel; The seafood buffet offered on Thursdays was the most extensive I've every seen; Lastly, the carpeting in the elevator is changed daily to show the day of the week - something little that makes it seem that much more special. I stayed in the main wing, but I heard the rooms in the garden wing are even more spectacular. Some downsides: The price is on the high side and can be extremely variable as with most Singapore hotels depending on the time of year and demand, but seems compatible to most high end business hotels. The property is set off the main Orchard road, so does take an extra 10 min walk to the main Orchard shopping areas, and the MRT station. (On the plus side, it can avoid having to go through some of the heavy traffic during peak hours.) Overall, I'm extremely happy with the Shangri-La and will likely make this my regular hotel when I visit Singapore the next time.

Reviews.Title: “One of the great hotels”
Reviews.Author: MontagueMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Simply put.. The Shangri-la Singapore is one of the great hotels of Asia. My recent stay in the Valley wing could not have been better, from being shown to my room for check in, to the service in the lobby and Summit room (Breakfast) this hotel excels on service and recognition. I was constantly amazed how all the staff could remember my name but also my coffee order and other preferences. Nothing is to much trouble for the Valley Wing staff and I believe that they truly do enjoy having you stay with them. I believe this alone (recognition and service) sets the Shangri-la apart from other hotels in Singapore, and I have stayed at many. The service at the pool includes fresh fruit, ice cold water and frozen ices, the foot massages (not complimentary) are sublime and also the height of indulgence… try one! The Line is a busy buffet that is open 24 hours a day, but I am sure you will find many dishes freshly cooked that will delight and again the service is excellent. The Line also has theme nights, Oyster night, sea food night etc, all freshly cooked or prepared to your liking. The Shang Palace is top end Chinese with some truly great signature dishes. It’s very popular with guest and locals alike, so I would recommend booking. The staff is really well informed about the menu and will easily provide guidance once your preferences are know. Overall, to just get away from it all, this is the hotel, to do business this is one of the top rated hotels in the world. This hotel is an experience, one that I would recommend and one that I look forward to experiencing again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaBroons
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights here on the way home from a holiday in Langkawi. It is a stunning hotel and the staff are wonderful. Location is ideal being in a quiet spot but a short stroll to the bustling Orchard Road. The pool is in a beautiful setting and lots of little touches like providing magazines and bringing round raspberry sorbet, iced water and cold towels to cool you down while sunbathing are lovely. We stayed in a club room and it is well worth the additional money for the added benefits such as drinks before you go out at night, lovely quiet breakfast area etc. This is our second stay at the Shangri-La and we would not stay anywhere else in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Valley wing certainly has a wow factor”
Reviews.Author: MolCheltenham
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Singapore after a 3 night stay on our way home from a holiday in Bali. We booked the holiday with Kuoni and were not sure at the time of booking whether we were in the Garden Wing or Valley Wing. Luckily we were in the Valley Wing which has a big WOW factor. We were welcomed by the receptionist and a couple of doormen and presented with a beautiful orchid. We were shown straight up to our bedroom on the 12th floor and as soon as we walked in, we were amazed at the facilities. As we were celebrating our 35th wedding anniversary, they had decorated the bed with rose petals, a rose on each pillow and a lovely chocolate cake. TV was massive with a wide range of channels, fresh fruit replemished daily and full chargeable mini bar. Bathroom was massive with separate walk-in shower with lovely toiletries.
