All Valley Wing guests are able to get free champagne, wine and canapes from 10.30am to 10.30pm, but be careful if you eat all the canapes on offer, you will not be able to eat a full meal in the evening. Blu restaurant in the Tower Wing was very nice, but a bit expensive. Breakfast in Valley Wing was great but don't bother to go to the Line Restaurant for breakfast as it is less relaxing. We had a massage whilst there but were unaware that there is a sauna and steam room there until our last day. Swimming pool and sunbathing areas of a good size for a city Hotel. Location of Hotel is about a 5 minute walk to Orchard Road Shopping Malls. Getting around Singapore is very easy on the trains, apart from getting lost in the huge Shopping Malls which are around every station. Don't miss out on going to the Botanical Gardens with the lovely Orchid Garden. Can't wait to go back to Shangri La again

Reviews.Title: “Service is good but overall is ok !!”
Reviews.Author: seanTaipei
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights during Oct 4-8. The service was ok but not that special. They provide the service as expected at 5 star hotel. The french restaurant at 34F or 38F ( sorry! can't recall correctly) is just ok compared with the price. I had 2 glass of white wine and a set menu, it costs around sin$210 ( for 1 person). Food looks pretty but not to the extend of amazing. The deco in the room is very old. Bed is not comfortable compared with M.O. The only thing I like is the free internet in the room but it's not wireless. You will like it if less pay. Overall, it's just ok. Oh! the hotel is a bit far away from the metro station ( 10-15 minutes walk)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience..”
Reviews.Author: adelmum
Reviews.Content: We had a four day stay at the Shangri-La en-route home to Australia from England. This is a beautiful hotel and the service is impecable. Stayed in the Garden Wing and the room was extremely large with a super size balcony and wonderful bathroom. Room was very clean and housekeeping were very efficient daily. Room service was prompt and the food was of a very high standard. The Line Restaurant is a real treat, and the selection of food for breakfast was immense. The hotel is a little back from Orchard Road, but quite within walking distance. Taxis are always available with only a short wait if required. All tour buses seem to pick up and drop off at the Shangi-La as well. Pool is lovely and in a superb tropical setting. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis set in Beautiful Gardens”
Reviews.Author: Budge_8
Reviews.Content: My wife and I usually stay at the Shangri-La's sister hotel on Sentosa, but due to this hotel being closed for refurbishment we decided to stay at their flagship hotel in Singapore. The hotel is located in a quiet area about five minutes walk from the main shopping area in Singapore - Orchard Road. On arrival at the hotel we were greeted by friendly hotel staff who whisked us to reception to complete our checkin formalities with ease. The reception itself is very large and plush with crystal chandeliers hanging from the ceiling. Our room was located in the Tower Wing of the hotel and it was of a good size. The view from the enclosed balcony window over looked the pool area, which was an oasis set in beautiful landscaped gardens. As we were celebrating our wedding anniversary the hotel had placed rose petals in a heart shape on the bed and placed two red roses on our pillows, which was a wonderful gesture and really thoughtful of the staff. The cleanliness of the room was exceptional and the furnishings where of a very high standard. The bathroom was also spotless and it had a separate walk in shower, as well as the usual bath. The room was serviced twice a day and there was complimentary bottled drinking water left in our room each day. Breakfast was served in The Line restaurant and there was an excellent choice of food available. My only criticism would be that on a couple of occasions there were coffee/tea stained mugs laid out on the breakfast table and one morning we had to wait 30 minutes for someone to bring us the drinks we had ordered. I would, however, say that once the staff were made aware of these problems they were rectified straight away. The hotel also has an excellent health club with the gym being open 24 hours (useful for those guests who are jet lagged and find it difficult to sleep at night). Also in the health club was a sauna, steam room and jacuzzi, and if you wanted there was a list of treatments available. The majority of staff we encountered during our two week stay were very friendly and nothing was too much trouble for them. They always greeted you with a smile and were happy to offer assistance when required. If you are looking for somewhere to stay in Singapore which is not too far from the hustle and bustle of Orchard Road, but set in a quiet area then the Shangri-La would be the ideal choice.

Reviews.Title: “Garden Wing feels like a tropical resort”
Reviews.Author: Sandjay
Reviews.Content: Worth staying here just for the breakfast - so much choice you need a map to find it all - thankfully, they provide one (the place mat!). We were in the garden wing and it was a great start to our holiday - very relaxing with a lovely view over the pool and the pool itself was great. Not too far to the Botanic Gardens (worth a visit) and Orchard Road close by if you enjoy shopping

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel at a price”
Reviews.Author: barryheeps
Reviews.Content: this is a lovely hotel but seems to cater for the business market where the cost of things is not so important to a Managing director of a large company, firstly they do not offer an early check in service to long haul customers, so we had to pay an extra $365 (singapore) to get into our room at 9.30am or sit around the lobby untill 2.0pm the normal check-in time, the LINE resturant is also very good but very pricy, i would advise anyone to seek out a deal that includes breakfast or be prepared to pay up to $92(singapore) per couple, we went down to the "line" for a light lunch on the sunday that we arrived after getting our room, sleeping untill 1.30pm we got our table at 2.04pm, tierd and weary we were asked if we wanted the buffet? that sounded ok, we had a small main couse, a dessert and coffee, you can imagine my surprise when i was presented with a bill for $198(singapore) that is approx £100, which was the most expensive meal of the whole holiday

Reviews.Title: “Still one the the best in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Middleagedfamilydude
Reviews.Content: I've been a frequent guest at the Shangri-La Singapore over the past few years, and have to say that it remains one of my favourite hotels in the City (or in any city). Like many Shangri-La's the service is excellent (always greeted at door, check-in/out efficient and helpful, random requests always followed up well, even if not able to produce, etc.) and rooms are well-appointed. The CRM system must be good, as the hotel always remembers that I like certain things (e.g. sparkling water, Diet Cokes), and always has some "gratis" left in the room. This hotel could do with some upgrading, but really just nit-picking. The Shangri-La is also by far the best hotel in the City (not counting Sentosa/new resorts, as I haven't been there) for families as well. Great pool and resort-like grounds for a city hotel, a great gym, and a fantastic buffet and other restaurants (again, like most of the city Shangri-La hotels). Only downside here is very average/no spa facilities (done in gym - not great compared to Chi spas in other Shangri-Las. For those coming for business - great facilities All in all - slightly aging, but still a great option in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely sheer luxury..”
Reviews.Author: Alka70
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Shangri-la Singapore for a week. We had booked horizon club premium room. The hotels was one of the best in all of the Shangri-la world wide. Right from lobby to room to decor, gym, spa all was absolutely fantastic. Could not ask for more. Will surely stay here again and again when in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing”
Reviews.Author: MarzenaDublin
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel, real 5* hotel and everything was perfect. Fantastic service, amazing staff - friendly, smiling and honestly helpfull. Stunning view from the restaurant where we had a breakfast every day on 24th floor. Rooms fantastic with everything what you need provided and very clean and comfortable. Only one disappointment: to go to the bar for a drink my husband needed long trousers and black shoes, what was a big problem for us because as a honeymoon couple we didn't have packed formal wear - only shorts and flip-flops. I had also not very nice situation - when we went for abreakfast waitress has asked me to change my flip-flops to more formal shoes - very disappoining. To be honest on my honeymoon I wanted to feel comfortable and change every day suits and formal wear to flip-flops and beach dresses. We have been invited in the hotel as a honeymoon couple but later wasn't very nice. Any way Shangri La is fabulous and I would recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless, friendly, fuss-free.... fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Roastduck65
Reviews.Content: My husband, 9 yr old son and I stayed in a Horizon Club premium room for our Singapore Stopover, on our way home from Europe. Knowing we'd be bleary-eyed and cranky from a long-haul flight, our criteria for selecting accommodation was: 1. Quiet rooms with thick walls and cloud-like pillows and beds. 2. Easy, fuss-free, check-in/check-out, with an early arrival, late departure. 3. A sumptuous breakfast, catering for a health nut, a gourmet fiend and a fussy-with-food kid. 4. Enough on-site facilities to keep us relaxed, entertained and rejuvenated. 5. A location that was away from the crowds, yet a stone's throw from retail therapy if needed. 6. A gorgeous view, exemplary service and a few extra little luxuries wouldn't go astray. The Shangri-La ticked every box for us. Plus (equally important), it's stamped with a calm, tranquility and luxury, WITHOUT the pretention normally associated with 5-star hotels. Or 5-star hotel business clubs, for that matter. The Horizon Club rooms are HUGE. You could have a party in the bathroom alone. The pillow menu allows the choice of a great sleep, a deep sleep or a sleep where you think you're in heaven. The private breakfast lounge on the 22nd floor, the all day refreshments, the private check-in desk, the free broadband, all make a very comfortable package. Downstairs, the pool is big enough to get some reasonable laps in, the gym is well faciiltated and the tennis courts kept in good order. The cafe serves decent cafe lattes (hard to find in Asia!). The staff are efficient but warm and personable. In short, it's a lovely hotel. If you want a luxury hotel, it's probably the most well-rounded luxury hotels in Singapore. It's 5-star priced. But if you want 4-star prices, look for a 4-star hotel. (Having said that, we checked in at 7.30am, departed 7.30pm the following night and only paid 1 night. Now work out the excellent value on that!)

Reviews.Title: “A Little Piece of Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Australia016
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time we have stayed at the Shangri La. First time we were so disappointed with our room in the Garden Wing. This time we stayed in a Horizon Premier Room over looking the City - the room was well worth the extra, to be able to relax when we came back from shopping etc, just to be able to sit and relax in a comfy chair or bed and look at the lovely greenery opposite. We arrived early in the morning, shortly after 6.30am, arriving on the overnight flight from Zurich, we were a little concerned that our room would not be ready, to our immense relief it was and just to walk into the room and be able to get to sleep, heaven, there were no sounds from anywhere else around us. The breakfast selection available to Horizon people well worth it and the evening drinks another plus. We would walk to and from Orchard Rd everyday and even to Tanglin Village about a 10 minute walk. We love Singapore and have stayed in another hotel similar to this one near Clarke Quay, we even went there for a drink one night, Shangri La wins this time!

Reviews.Title: “Champagne, Chandeliers and a TV in the marble bathroom”
Reviews.Author: iamawanderer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the high end of the hotel, the Valley Wing. With it's own private entrance butler and silver service breakfast room this was a rare traveling luxury. It is a pricy option, but if you have a great reason for it, this was bliss. French Champagne served in the evenings in the foyer complimentary was more than appreciated. Access to the hotels great restaurants ( the chinese one was incredible) and sporting activities large grounds - with several golf holes, are all a plus as is the location in close vicinity to Orchard rd. The marble bathroom with a tv in the bath was luxe, in their prestige rooms their bath products and complimentary nail clippers etc are so well thought out. The managers all knowing our names, and up with the best service I have ever experienced. I could quite happily use this hotel for all my stays in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Double standards”
Reviews.Author: beyondwords
Reviews.Content: Firstly getting thru the reservations will take you ages but that I am still able to understand as sometimes the volume of calls may be overwhelming. When we arrived at the Hotel, we were greeted by the wonderful Doormen who were and genuinely nice. The guy in the long coat did not look too friendly. (Maybe the suit looked too hot for him) I was greeted by pleasant looking ladies in their elegant unique dresses but they sounded more like the buzzer when you enter the convenient store. (No warmth or soul to it) The staff during checkin was very bubbly and friendly but we were standing there for a full 10mins before they sorted out my room. The room I was staying in was far different from the grand lobby. It looked tired with the wooden flooring was popping out several times during our stay. The marble in the toilet were yellowish n gross looking but I realy liked the extra large sized balcony. (Walking to the room was a good exercise though) Breakfast was really good. The variety was worth the money I paid for but if I was given a choice, never will I pay for the service charge. (Not of what you expect from a USD35 bfast) The landscape and pool area was beautiful. It really felt like you were in a resort. But there was an incident that made me have a bad taste about this unique property. I was going out one evening when I saw a group of staff at the lobby. They were a group of hotel staff whom I believe was waiting for a very important guest. Of course I know the person who is coming is not as important as me but for the sake of other guests who are still paying, the least you are able to do is smile and acknowledge unimportant people like us. There's segregation of service there and that is something I am not able to tolerate. It is unacceptable and I do want to voice out to the people there that we contribute to your paychecks as well. Please be sincere and genuine with your service. If 'It is not in your Nature', please do not fake it...

Reviews.Title: “This was the first stint of our 3 week...”
Reviews.Author: Mrsflercher
Reviews.Content: This was the first stint of our 3 week honeymoon. Firstly Singapore is amazing then Arriving at the shangri la made our experience ten times better! From the greeting we received on arrival to the pool side service everything about this hotel was 5* plus!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great home base in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: scatalano
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a very large room on the Heritage Club floor at the Shangri-La. The staff was always attentive and helpful. Everything we could possibly want was available for us. The bathroom amenities were fabulous...as well as a huge walk-in shower and a separate tub. The beds were heaven. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected, friendly and helpful staff, perfect services...”
Reviews.Author: livien
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Singapore with a group of friends during end of August 2010. We intended to stay a night in Shangri-La Traders Hotel, but the friend who in-charge of room-booking had made a mistake and booked Shangri-La Hotel and none of us realized it until we reached Traders Hotel. We were exhausted of walking under the sun from the Orchard MRT Station to Traders Hotel. Everyone of us had agreed that we're going to take a cab instead of walking to the Shangri-La Hotel from Traders Hotel. By then, one of my friend got to know from the staff that Shangri-La actually provide free shuttle bus service for the hotel and apartment guests...and we can actually board the free shuttle bus at Orchard MRT Station to Shangri-La Hotel, Shangri-La Traders Hotel or even Shangri-La Apartments... Finally, when we reached Shangri-La Hotel, we were welcomed by the staff with smiling faces and warm greetings. The bell-boy walked to us and offered to carry our luggage even before we stepped into the lobby. This was actually our first time staying in a 5-Star hotel, we were so amazed at the decoration, and the services provided by the staffs. Without waiting long, we got our room key and checked in to our rooms. It was at the 10th floor. We were served with chinese tea in a classical chinese teapot in a woven bamboo basket to keep it warm. Every room was served with fruit of the day... We were out for dinner that night and when we were back to our room again, our room is tidied...slippers and floor mats were taken out and laid on the floor at both sides of our beds.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel with a great service level - Tower Wing better than Garden Wing”
Reviews.Author: ChrisUKinHanoi
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights here, and I think this is a very impressive hotel with amazingly beautiful public spaces (the gardens, the foyer, the swimming pool, etc). The staff are incredibly friendly and helpful too. I have to personally thank them as I was given a free upgrade on arrival too. Location-wise you are a short walk from Orchard Road, the shopping mecca of Singapore. If you want to get out into the more 'real' parts of Sing then you can jump on an MRT from Orchard and explore the city at more length. So in general the location is very good. My only negative comment would be that the Garden Wing rooms are in need of some modernisation perhaps. It is understandable as the Garden Wing appears to be the oldest part of the hotel and so it is a little outshone by the Tower Wing. That said, given the price of the rooms I would expect some more modern furnishings in the bedroom and bathroom (flat-screen tv, wireless internet, power shower, etc). Mind you, I never spent that much time in the room anyway so I guess it didn't make any real difference to my stay. Just an observation. Overall though, a very good hotel with a great service level. Would recommend to the business traveller in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to its name - Paradise and Tranquility! Bit Pricey Though”
Reviews.Author: Fruitylou
Reviews.Content: We upgraded to the Valley Wing section of Shangri La - so our room was Deluxe..the room was HUGE! gorgeous plush decor - a real treat if you want to spoil yourself! The First impression as you walk into the Hotel lobby is Opulence...chandeliers and marble flooring and plush couches and chairs all over the place..Reminded me of the Versace Palazzo Hotel in Brisbane. We arrived very tired and was instantly whisked to our room and checked in there - we had a HUGE king size PLUS bed along with a 3 seater couch, gorgeous winged back chair, desk with personalised stationary (yep they had our name printed on the letterheard paper!) a dressing table and chair. The bathroom was very large with separate walk in shower, toilet and large corner bath with TV and 2 sinks. The amenities were top notch from the usuall Shower products, toothbrushes, body scrub, shoe polish etc. We even had a dressing room which was perfect for storing our cases and keeping the mess contained! The service was wonderful - very friendly attentive staff. The pool was lovely and the pool attendants were very quick to organise seating and towels for us each time. We dined at The LINE restaurant...quite pricey - but it's the cheaper of all restaurant options. Can of Sprite was S$8, kiddy chicken nuggets and chips poolside was S$19.90...every price you see they add about 10+ service charge. We ordered 2 Singapore Sling cocktails and the bill came to S$44.00!! The Hotel is only one block away from Orchard Road which is perfect for shopping - but also for eating out...we were able to get drinks for S$2-$4 and meals from S$5-10 which was more ideal for our budget! We had breakfast included in our package and because we were in the Valley wing - the service was Silver Service, butlers on hand to assist at all times!! We had to dress up quite formal for breakfast and as we were travelling with a 3.5yr i don't the Valley Wing is suitable for young families - as you need to be smart attire to be in the lobby. There was complimentary tea and coffee and cocktail and canapes throughout the day for those registered in the valley wing as well...we didn't take advantage of that though with a young boy..but it was pure luxury and indulgence. I would stay there again - but i'd stay in the main Tower Lobby - where you could get away with wearing shorts and jandals in the lobby...unlike the Valley Wing...however i have to say that they catered to my boys needs very well and treated us all very well.

Reviews.Title: “A real 5* treat.As good as it gets”
Reviews.Author: rahul412
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 6 nites in garden wing with my wife.Its truly a 5 star hotel. My stay was really wonderful a big thanks to the staff for making my trip memorable..Service was truly fantastic.Location of the hotel was great its peaceful yet only a 5-10 walk from famous orchard road.its hard to bring out any negative points but if i must then I could only thing of two. a) tv-there are no LCDs but 29inch CRTs b) broadband is thru vable/lan no wifi... but these things didnt really matter to me..rest everything was just perfect infact much better than my expectations. I would recommend Shangri-la to everyone..its a beautiful hotel and wont disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully groomed hotel, with live orchids growing on the property!”
Reviews.Author: Beancake
Reviews.Content: A stunning pool, surrounded by palm trees and tropical flowers. A most amazingly delicious breakfast buffet featuring foods from many different countries ~ excellent customer service as well!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, avoid the Chinese restauarnt”
Reviews.Author: MikeandPippa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good position not far from the shopping of Orchard Road, the facilities are good, with a lovely pool area, staff are very helpful and the concierges brilliant giving very helpful advice. Breakfast closes bang on the dot, so don’t be late and it can be very busy. The biggest disappointment was the Chinese Restaurant, which we used the first night. It was expensive and very bland. It is rated as one of the best in Singapore according to our guidebook, but on the night we used it, it simply didn’t meet expectations. We were given some great other alternative venues, such as on the front at One Fullerton, where the food was far better and the setting perfect, for a similar cost.

Reviews.Title: “A Singapore classic”
Reviews.Author: czechqueen
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, love their garden wing expecially. Our company takes the hotel over every January for a huge conference. I have been part of conference organizing team and the hotel always provides excellent service. Also love the spa, its heavenly! And the Line buffet restaurant is a must, great for brunches. I have lived in Singapore for a year and often came to the spa and for brunch. Great location for shopping close to Orchard road, and close to the Botanical gardens for wonderful walks.

Reviews.Title: “What heaven should be like”
Reviews.Author: marduk1
Reviews.Content: The Shangri-La Hotel in Singapore is simply one of the very best hotels in Asia. The service at all levels is superb. The rooms have everything you are ever likely to need (especially the extraordinary Valley Wing) and the beds are wonderfully comfortable. The gym is the best equipped I have ever seen in a hotel and the pool (which opens at 6.00am) is awesome. The Line cafe does great food especially for breakfast. I am not the easiest guest to please and I couldn't fault this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: atsingapore
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Shangri la hotel with my mother for three nights. We had a Horizon Club room and it was amazing- very spacious with a huge bathroom and spotlessly clean. We checked in at the Horizon Club on the 24th floor and everything went very smoothly. Between 6pm and 8pm cocktails and snacks are served in the club lounge . The snacks were of a high standard and there was a wide variety. On the first evening my mother was unwell and the staff were so caring and helpful . On subsquent visits they were so friendly and always asked how she was feeling. Swaran and Azura really went out of their way to make our holiday special. When Azura knew we had a midnight flight she extended our check out time without me asking. We had our breakfast at the Line and the choice of food was excellent. The swiming pool is huge and the staff there are also very friendly and helpful. We have been to Singapore several times on holiday. This is the first time we have stayed in the Shangri la but it certainly won't be the last. I can honestly say it is the best hotel I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - luxurious rooms and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: mumtips
Reviews.Content: We cannot fault this hotel - the staff are all excellent, and the rooms are luxurious (we stayed in the Valley Wing). Everything you could want has been thought of, and we could not help but feel pampered and relaxed. We would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Loacation but Rooms are tired and so are the Staff”
Reviews.Author: turalatas
Reviews.Content: Recently went to Singapore for a conference. A colleague and I stayed a the Shangri-la. While we were both very comfortable and the room was clean. The staff was not as attentive as I'm used to. I wasn't too fond of the Horizan lounge there as they have a pretty strict dress code and at the end of the day I would appreciate not being told that I have to wear something specific. I just want to be comfortable. The rooms look like they are due for a renovation as well. They are still very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: Ealingmum
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Shangri La (Tower Wing) in August 2010 with my husband and 2 teenage children and we couldn't fault it. We chose this hotel for the lovely gardens and pool and we were not disappointed, but we were especially impressed with all the service. Everybody was so friendly and helpful. The food and drinks were expensive, but on a typical day by the pool, we were served with iced water and free icecream and the lovely staff at the pool will find you a sunbed. The buffet breakfast was especially impressive in the quality and choice of the food although it did help that we had free breakfast with our particular deal as otherwise it would have been expensive. But the Shrangri La is a lovely, lovely hotel and the staff were all superb. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A room with a view, but let down by small things”
Reviews.Author: GulfWanderer
Reviews.Content: I liked my room, spacious, good work space, free Internet for corporates, good shower, all supplemented by a nice view over the city. The breakfast buffet was outstanding - one of the best selections I've seen out there. The staff, without fail, were extremely friendly and helpful. So far, so Shangri-La... What let the place down a bit is attention to detail. My bedside control panel had a loose connection, so sometimes worked and sometimes didn't. When it didn't work, there was no way to operate the AC or even the curtains. My bed sheet had a clearly visible tear tear in it, the sink in the bathroom did not drain properly and somebody had left a pile of black hair under the bathroom scales (which was, however, removed after the first night). All in all, still a very nice place. I liked the location, too, good for exploring Orchard Road after a business day.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service and food”
Reviews.Author: Brian M
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Club Horizon Deluxe Room for 4 nights in July 2010. Checking in on the 24th floor was quick and easy. While we were checking in our luggage was brought to our room on the 19th floor. Very pleased with room, as it was well appointed and attention to detail was excellent. Good size bathroom with L’Occitaine toiletries and good fluffy robes and memory foam slippers. Very comfortable bed and bedside console to control lighting and drapes. Breakfast was taken in BLU restaurant which was on the 24th floor, superb service and a magnificent selection of food to suit all tastes. Club Horizon patrons have access to the Club Horizon lounge again situated on the 24th floor, tea, coffee and soft drinks were complimentary all day as well as some delicious canapés and other little hot and cold snacks and desserts. Cocktails and other alcoholic drinks were complimentary between 6 and 8 pm. Also just off the lounge was a business centre which was free to guests; I found this very good as I was able to check in my flights online and print boarding passes etc. The staff members working here and in fact throughout the hotel were superb, always friendly and more than happy to help with any queries or problems, not that we had any problems. The Line Restaurant. If you are staying in this hotel or anywhere in Singapore you must try one of the buffet nights in The Line. As has been stated before there are about 16 show kitchens with the vastest array of top quality food I have ever seen and tasted. I have a sweet tooth and I thought I had died and gone to heaven. The pool area is very nice with beautiful gardens and all the public areas are lovely. Once again a great thank you to all the management and staff for making our visit memorable

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've ever stayed at-simply wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: Williwillinui
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic. The rooms are gorgeous-the beds are super comfortable. The lobby is very nice and never a wait to check-in or out. They had a large pool. Our room had a balcony-no real view-but you felt like you had privacy out there. We got a great rate on our room that included the breakfast buffet. Many people not staying in the hotel will come here to eat breakfast because it is that good. They have endless options from all parts of the world including India, China, England, and American. They had fruit there I've never seen before. The food was amazing-and you could get as many plates as you wanted. We also had free Wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant”
Reviews.Author: CharlieCatAus
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a Valley wing room and I have to say the perks that come with doing so are well worth paying the extra money! For breakfast we had a choice of either the buffet or being served in the valley wing-exclusive Summit room. Breakfast in the summit room consisted of a continental breakfast + a selection of hot breakfast options made to order - we tried all of the items on the menu and could not fault one. Access to the business centre was extremely handy for internet use. 'High Tea' which was served in the middle of the day and afternoon was wonderful - thank you to all staff who always remembered our favourite sandwiches and who served us our endless glasses of moet champagne and Singapore slings! (which were, by the way, all included in our nightly rate!) Our room in the valley wing was fabulous - loved the large comfy bed and complimentary bottles of water, as well as the beautiful l'occitane toiletries (which by the way I am now addicted to). The tea which was delivered to our room as a welcome on our first day was a lovely touch. The pool was large and clean and surrounded by lush gardens which seemed to provide a very serene environment for a bit of sunbaking. Eating at the Line Restaurant is a must for every visitor - the buffet was extensive, and the rack of lamb was the best I've ever had! We greatly appreciated the complimentary shuttle bus which runs every hour and takes you into some excellent shopping areas, as well as giving you better access to the metro. Many people don't seem to like the location of the hotel but we enjoyed being a little out of the way, surrounded by lush gardens and being away from the hustle and bustle - the shuttle got us close enough to all the action! Finally, I have to say that all the staff were fantastic - they were immaculately dressed and always willing to help and offer the highest level of service - I have not come across such people anywhere else in the world and I can not commend them enough - you are all a credit to the hotel! My husband and I fell in love with Singapore and without a doubt the Shangri-La hotel had a lot to do with that - I would not stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great for business or leisure”
Reviews.Author: calty
Reviews.Content: Good location near Orchard road shopping and Botanical gardens. Concierge is very helpful with leisure activities, dinner reservations and sight seeing. Fantastic outdoor pool to unwind and cool off and amazing breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and quality”
Reviews.Author: 3rdimension
Reviews.Content: Our room was on one of high floors in a Horizon Club room so there may have been a few additional benefits from this (free wi-fi, welcome presents for the children) but it was just what we were looking for. The pool was fine though not exceptional. Shang Palace, the Chinese restaurant was very good (we had lunch there).

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: sang10
Reviews.Content: This is a spectacular hotel, has a busy feel to it, but nevertheless, its beautiful. The location is also great (right next to Orchard) . The rooms are spacious and have good amenities, the lobby itself is huge. The staff is extremely friendly, the service is good. Some rooms in the main tower are a bit older looking but overall the hotel is great to stay in. It might be expensive for leisure travelers but for business trips its great

Reviews.Title: “I am The Line fan”
Reviews.Author: chabuqueque
Reviews.Content: great food, makes buffet underated, the spread is crazy but manage to try bits of everything. Seafood night (thursday only) happens to be the best ever! everything else is simply amazing too, pool is ok but need a bit of cleaning. bed and pillow r comfy. not a convenient location, but got shuttle now and then. too huge a hotel, but feels very elagant by just stepping into their lobby, i wouldn't dare wearing mysummer casuals here. overall a great experience

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has been around in Singapore...”
Reviews.Author: drjoeng
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been around in Singapore long enough to be a landmark. I've been in many hotels that have been around a fifth of the time as long as The Shang and looked five times as shabby, threadbare and rundown. The pool is a little dated in design but clean and safe. I recommend The Line and any of the buffet spreads, but especially the seafood buffet. Seasoned travelers should cast aside everything they know about hotel restaurants and VISIT The Line. This is where local foodies flock. 'nuff said. It's a 10 min walk to Orchard Road.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: presidentdelhi
Reviews.Content: This is an extraordinary hotel. great rooms, excellecnt service. the only down side is that the hotel has a very busy feel, perhaps more suited for conferences than quiet lesuire

Reviews.Title: “Can't imagine better...”
Reviews.Author: Lux_Row_World
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent. Staff always politely greeted you in the public spaces. The room is very comfortable and quiet. I especially liked the alcove seat in the room. Shower and other bathroom fixtures were fine. This is one of the few hotels that actually doesn't launder towels that you hang to be reused. Towels and bedsheets were comfortable. Location is quite good. Walking distance to many malls. There's also a shuttle service, but it takes longer than walking. There was only one tiny miss with the housekeeping service, but this was a trivial matter. In summary, I've been to many many business hotels, but there are few hotels that I enjoyed as much as this one.

Reviews.Title: “A good experience, almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: fivestarholidays
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Singapore airport feeling unwell and was received by a young airport facilitator from the hotel who insisted on walking me to the cab. Was greeted on arrival at the hotel and thereafter my experience was almost perfect. the staff is very very efficient and courteous. The breakfast great and the service even better. The concierge service was good but to me it did not match the high level of professionalism exhibited in the rest of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “one of my best experiences !”
Reviews.Author: rajeshtrips
Reviews.Content: most beautiful rooms ( horizon ), awesome staff, yummy food, huge pool !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Manasi29
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Valley wing for 3 nights...The room was great, the bathroom was amazing with 2 washbasins, separate bath and shower and a TV in front of the tub! They reception was great with orchids presented to me. The lounge in the Valley wing serves free champagne and drinks throughout the day. We would definitely go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend this hotel - great location, fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: jlhols
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Shangri-La Singapore with our 6 month old baby and cannot recommend it highly enough. The staff went out of their way to ensure our stay was memorable, ensuring we were collected from the airport with a baby car seat, providing early check-in for our arrival at 6.30am and late check-out at 2pm. All of the staff assisted us with the baby when required from the staff at the restaurants, pool and room service. The hotel is ideally located just off Orchard Rd within walking distance to all of the shopping centres. We have stayed in 2 Shangri-La hotels now (Rasa Ria at Kota Kinabalu and here) and both experiences have been fantastic. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect spot to splurge on a stopover in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Julieon
Reviews.Content: As I was meeting my daughter who I hadn't seen for several months we decided to spurge on our one night stop over in Singapore and got a good deal on the internet for a Tower Room which turned out to be Horizon Club room with all the extra benefits that offered. My daughter arrived from Australia very early in the morning and well before normal check in but she was given our room straight away and immediate access to snacks in the Horizon Club. By the time I arrived in early evening she had discovered all the delights of the spa, the wonderful pool set in tropical gardens and the gym. The next day they allowed us hold on to our room until lunch time and of course we were able to use the pool and the wonderful changing rooms until we left in the late afternoon. This place is not cheap but you could go there for a stop over just to unwind, never leave the hotel grounds and come awayn feeling it was worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: “and the journey of excellence continues with Shangri La Singapore”
Reviews.Author: anandberia
Reviews.Content: Here was another trip to the South East after an investor conference in October in HK. Back in Oct had stayed at the Shangri La at Kowloon and this time in December, we had our company off-site and bang...once again landed up at Shangri-La. This one is located perfectly right off Orchard. Singapore is anyway my favourite place, one can cover the entire place in 45 minutes flat! I've stayed at the Rasa Sentosa earlier (even have a review uploaded) and this one too takes excellence to another level. The lobby is one massive reception area which even when buzzy give a very quiet feel to the whole place. Room are relatively small but are very cosy and well equipped. There is a big banquet hall where we had our company conference (sorry can't write much about the resturants since the food was provided in our package). The in-room service is outstanding with turnaround time being the quickest I've seen. Briefly used the fitness center and like any other Shangri La this one too was very well equipped with state of the art equipments. The staff is warm and hospitable and overall I would recommend people to have a go at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “beautiful and elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bert3d
Reviews.Content: feels like you're in a little tropical paradise, very nice and elegant

Reviews.Title: “Restful luxury hotel set in nice gardens”
Reviews.Author: ShonaWard
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel . We were upgraded to the Valley wing and treated like royalty. Free champagne,other drinks and canapes and tea and sandwiches in the wing's beautiful lobby whenever wanted. Wing had private dining room for breakfast. Attention superb. Dress code for lobby lounge and dining room. Watched t.v in bath. Beautiful large all marble bathroom. Huge bedroom. Booked through Trailfinders---excellent tour operator.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing city hotel”
Reviews.Author: rjf48
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights May 17-18th in Tower Wing Room, easy check in, very tired after long flight from LHR, taken straight to room, freshen up, out to explore. Should have taken few mins to check location of room. Make sure you are not near any of the lift shafts if staying in the Tower Wing, First night although extemely tired constantly woken by lift noise ( had I been there several days would have asked to move) Having said that the room was clean/comfortable with all the amenities you would expect, good bathroom super shower etc. Food excellent in the Line Restaurant - breakfast top class, dinner very expensive in Hotel (singapore is expensive anyway) Orchard Road 5mins walk, use the MRT system to get around, its cheap, clean and safe - ideal for getting to Chinatown, Little India and Clarke Quay. Had dinner at Clarke Quay second night at restaurant on river very good. Recommend a river cruise at night and a trip to Raffles for a Sling in the long bar. The hotel has a nice pool very quiet when we were there its very relaxing after a walk round the city. Staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Tower Rooms Are Old”
Reviews.Author: maptraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is not far from Orchard Road, but in a more residential neighborhood, at the far-end. So premium location, but not convenient for walking to get to shops and restaurants. Need to take a taxi everywhere, which is getting more expensive these days with all the surcharges that the Singapore government allows to be added on to the base fare. Did not have time to explore the gardens or use the pool and gym. Lobby is very grand. Elevators could be spruced up a bit as they are looking old. There are 3 sections to the hotel. I stayed in the main tower, which probably has the oldest renovation. Photos on the hotel website look much better than the actual rooms. Carpet is worn looking, furniture and bathroom a bit dated looking, at least 20 years old. Bed, however, is very comfortable as are the pillows. TV is a good Philips LCD, and rooms comes with a Sharp DVD player. Internet is fast and the desk is fairly large. In the standard rooms, you get standard toiletries. In the Horizon Club rooms, you get L'Occitane toiletries. Service overall in the hotel is very good, and typical of Shangri-la, there are staff everywhere trying to be helpful. However, during my week long stay, I encountered a few problems. 1. early one morning (around 6am) there was a lot of banging and staff chatter in the hallways which woke me up. 2. welcome amenities were not what I ordered, and came on my last day rather than the first. "The Line" cafe/restaurant serves an excellent breakfast buffet. However, the late evening a la carte dinner was very expensive and not very tasty, service was slow and seemed a bit inexperienced, and they shut down the aircon after 11pm. Overall not bad, but there are better value for money and also much newer hotels in Singapore to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Top marks, Shangri-La is the best!”
Reviews.Author: irishdancer65
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in the Valley Wing. From the moment we entered we felt pampered and very well looked after. Check in done in our room - it took about 2 minutes! The room was spotless and very comfortable. It was cleaned morning and evening. I am a light sleeper and I slept exceptionally well there. A quiet (no noisy aircon) and soundproofed room. Guests can sit in the lobby and have a drink (juice, wine and even Moet champagne) and a snack or afternoon tea for free and listen to the harpist. Very relaxing atmosphere. All the staff in this hotel are wonderful from the bell boy to the maitre d' and you feel that they genuinely like all the guests! They address you by name and love to have a little chat with you. Breakfast is in a lovely room with white linen table cloths and beautiful cutlery and china. There is a buffet selection plus cooked food made to order. Great breakfast. The Line Cafe buffet in the main part of the hotel for dinner is probably one of the best buffet selections I have seen. Basically, this hotel is a great choice and highly recommended. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “The Shangri-La - it never disappoints!!”
Reviews.Author: GoodAdviceSydney
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights for some well deserved R and R.....loved every minute of it!! The hotel lobby is magnificant, the valley wing rooms with balconies clean and in great condition and the facilities, spa, pool, gym as good as any of the best hotels in the world.....this is the only place I'll stay in Singapore.....very highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “What a joy”
Reviews.Author: travellor80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on route to Australia and had an amazing stay at this beautiful hotel. On arrival we were greeted by an enthusiastic and friendly receptionist who on hearing we were celebrating our 30th anniversary and special birthdaysupgraded our room. The staff couldn't do enough to help us and we were thrilled by the quality of attention to detail at every level. Despite the overcast weather we had a wonderful time in this lovely hotel and country.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Service, 4 Star Room”
Reviews.Author: KiwiInPimlico
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights in the Garden Wing, and was quite disappointed with the room. It was a bit old and tired and really needed to be refurbished. I also had an adjoining door between mine and the room next door, and could hear every word that the occupants said when they arrived at 5am one morning! I would commend the hotel on their staff, the service was excellent - everyone I spoke to was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection exists”
Reviews.Author: OddvarS
Reviews.Content: Coming back after 20 years and finding the same unbeatable atmosphere. All details in place, 100% service attitude, great food and that un-definable feeling of being at the top of the world

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for everything!”
Reviews.Author: toddnelson
Reviews.Content: We had an unexpected extend stay in Singapore due to the volcanic ash delaying our trip from Sydney to Europe...my wife and I were fortunate enough to be sent to the Shangri La and the staff there were just super. Friendly and welcoming and helpful. We've transited through Singapore many times going "home" to see family but always plan to spend as short a time as possible there - had heard it was just another city but how wrong can you be? The check in was flawless and we were given a great room and the staff were so helpful and accomodating and recommended room service as we were so tired after spending 20 hours + at Changi. The food was quick and delicious. We were there the following night (Friday) and went up to the Blu bar for drinks - and had the fun added bonus of 60% off our drinks as my wife was wearing a four inch heel! Very cute and fun! Can't praise the staff enough at Shangri La...lots of nice touches. The lift carpet is even changed every day so you know which day it is!

Reviews.Title: “So let down by my second visit.........”
Reviews.Author: slc1
Reviews.Content: having visited this hotel 18 months ago i decided to return with my mother,wanting her to experience the wonderful hotel we had. The welcome upom arrivel was still just as good,effecient check in ,smiling staff,wondeful lobby etc, It is here the story cahnges. Our room was dirty,.....thick drink stains on the bedside cabinet,filthy skirtings,dusty worktops,thick dust around carpet edges. We had 2 wholes in 1 duvet cover. The office style chair was so badly stained they had to remove it from our room. Upon arrival we should have had chinese tea and a friut bowl...after 3 phone calls we got this 8 hours after arrivel. Company policy states all guests should recieve within 1 hour. The pillow menus are none existent.Our room was eventually cleaned.One day we even had to leave a note on the dresses asking for the coffe to be refilled. On our first visit we had no complaints,this 1 was so different.It was 1 of the nicest hotel we have stayed in but now it is certainly no longer up there with the best.Our visit commeced a few days before the flight disruption, so no 1 could say it was due to unprecedented demand.The Line restaurant is making serious failings. We ordered the complimentary birthday cake and never received it. They ran out of roast beef and did not restock....the desserts looked like a load of monkeys had eaten them and left the crimbs behind.....It was dreadful.Leaving a huge bitter taste in my mouth.I did speak to the duty manager regarding this matter who then said he would call me back aat 4pm the next day....he did not I callled him at 5.15pm he then told me he was busy would call back..which he did saying sorry for the poor room.Never offering any explanation. Perhaps the management are responsible for the drop in services............On the whole we had a very disapppointing 4 nights,The issues I raise may be minor to some,but all the small touches of this hotel had made it out shine the rest....Sadly this isn't happening now.

Reviews.Title: “Valley Wing - An oasis in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: JeremyAustralia
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Valley Wing of the Shangri-La on the way home to Australia from our European honeymoon. I had selected the Shangri-La as we often stay at other Shangri-La properties, and thought that the extra cost would be worth it. We arrived at the hotel at about 7:30am (despite check-in usually being 3:00pm) and were immediately presented with an orchid and escorted to our room, where we found roses and rose petals scattered in a heart shape on the bed. Later that day when we returned to our room we found a congratulatory cake and card congratulating us on our honeymoon. We had breakfast in the Summit Room on two mornings (despite only staying 1 night), and found it to be a very pleasant experience with wonderful staff and good food. Overall, the staff were very helpful and the ambiance of the hotel was very relaxing. The staff responded quickly and genuinely to all of our concerns and queries, and made our stay most pleasant. We had 2 concerns though. The first was that despite providing wonderful Wedgewood teapot, cups and saucers in the room, the provided tea was not up to standard. The staff managed to fix this for us with appreciation from my wife. The other issue was the cost. Whilst I was prepared for the higher room costs for a special experience, I was surprised at checkout that an additional 17% was added to the room charges for service and tax. At all other hotels that we have stayed at (including other Shangri-La properties), the quoted rates have all been inclusive of taxes and service charges. If booking at the Shangri-La, you should be aware of this additional cost and factor it in to your consideration accordingly. All in all though, we would be happy to stay at the Valley Wing next time we are in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Shangri-La Singapore - Tower Room 2021, Exec Suite”
Reviews.Author: Lance-Travellot
Reviews.Content: Since moving to Singapore years back, I had not have the opportunity to stay in a Singapore hotel. With 3 free redemption nighs with Shangri-La, I decided to bring my baby son and wife to try out the Shang in Singapore over the Good Friday weekend. The Shang in Singapore is located slightly away from the Orchard Rd tourist belt, and a distance from the CBD. This suited my purpose as I wanted a break from the normal biz trip hustle and bustle. My first night was in the Garden Wing. Everything was OK, except the rattan sofa which had exposed stuffings in one arm. I requested for a room change for the next night. The next room was an executive suite in the Tower Wing. Much newer, and larger room. Excellent soundproofing, the neighbours next door was not able to hear the baby crying loudly. I had access to the Club lounge. Service was excellent, they remembered what drinks I like when I visited the lounge the 2nd time. Finally, the baby found the lounge absolutely blissful. The lounge staff even offered us babysitting services! Next time, I will have a longer stay to try out the babysitting services.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis on the edge of the city”
Reviews.Author: Smiddlet
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel with very friendly staff near to the Orchard Road shopping district. The best feature of this hotel was the lush gardens that surround the hotel which made you forget what a huge city you were in.

Reviews.Title: “Sheer Bliss and Luxury”
Reviews.Author: SouthportRaws
Reviews.Content: A great way to end 7 weeks of travelling around. 4 days in Singapore at this amazing hotel. No. 1 in luxury all the way. Had an amazing garden view room overlooking the pool. Room excellent. Everything you could wish for. The most amazing staff always helpful and always smiling. When i lost my purse they were very helpful and supportive. Breakfast in the Line Cafe was amazing food from all over the world. Morning coffee in the Line Shop sold the most delicious muffins. Even though it was Easter weekend and the hotel was full their service was still top notch. Well done Shangri-la. I would go back tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel and service exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Soniab7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri-La as part of our vacation to Kuala Lumpur, Singapore, and Bali. We live and work in the NYC vicinity. We were travelling with our 2.5 yr old plus 2 other couples, one with 1.5 yr old, and another with no kids. This is an excellent hotel for the price and their service is impeccable. We had a Valley Wing Deluxe room -- the room was luxurious and it offers exclusive amenities -- such as complimentary snacks and drinks thru out the day at the private lounge area and complimentary breakfast. Our friends stayed in the Tower Wing and I would recommend the Valley Wing over it. There is bar/restaurant in the top of Tower Wing that has an outdoor bar area -- this is must do -- enjoy a drink there and the AMAZING views of the city. We also requested babysitting service for 3 nights which was excellent. One of the girls actually took my daughter for a hotel tour/walk (2.5 yr old) and she was so excited that she didn't want to come back to the room. The staff was super friendly towards our daughter and always willing to help in making our staying "perfect".

Reviews.Title: “Usual High standard SL hotel - Horizon club service a let down”
Reviews.Author: parsley6
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in several Shangri-la and Traders Hotels in the Far East the Shangri-la building is of the high standard expected. One big part let it down, the Horizon club staff could not cope with the number of people in the club and it was obvious some of the staffs experience was minimal and to top it all they ran out of wine!! Although to be fair they drafted more staff in before we left. Having said all this it is worth staying at as the restaurants for breakfast both the 'in line' and the Horizon were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shortyperth
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from Singapore and we had a fantastic time! We stayed in the Garden Wing - city view and it was very comfortable. It was really clean with little touches like hot tea waiting for us in our room when we checked in! the toiletries were great too - even provided toothbrushes, hair tie, emery board! The staff were first class - so friendly and efficient. This makes all the difference in my opinion. They had a nightly turn down service which is rare these days. I would highly recommend the Shang Palace for dinner as it has amazing food; great first night introduction to Singapore. If you want an unusual dining experience, try Iggies (outside the hotel) located in the Regent Hotel - but be warned, its very expensive! I would definately stay at the Shangri La again - it really was a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay at the Shangri La S'pore”
Reviews.Author: Almondbutter
Reviews.Content: We have just spend 10 days at the Shangri La S'pore and really liked it! I am a big fan of the Shangri La and they always make you feel very special! the one on Sentosa Island is very good too! but better with kids. We booked at the Horizon Club floor where the service is great but if you are not going on business I would not recommend it. We used the afternoon canapes only once as it was usually full. After 2 days I asked to go to the garden wing as I wanted to have a balcony. Then I really enjoyed my stay at the hotel. The people were very efficient. Fruit everyday, rooms done in the evening as well. The pool was very good and the foot massage at the pool is a must! Gym was excellent! Location is fantastic as you are basically on Orchard road, convenient for shopping! I can't wait to go back, maybe next year :)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Valley Wing!”
Reviews.Author: Fleetcat
Reviews.Content: We were uncertain as to the value of the Valley Wing but very pleasantly surprised at how much difference and indeed value we derived from the facilities. Having a bit of a taste for champagne free Moet all day was a delightful temptation which regrettably we couldn’t maximise (we really tried on our one evening in). However the breakfast was just great and the gracious dining room it was served in just so much more civilised than the main one. The newly appointed room is elegant and very classic and opulent which we preferred to the many cold minimalist options our there. Bath with TV over is super. Special mention of Edward who was delightful. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: tembolac
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, you are literally 5 minutes away from Orchard Road’s shopping heaven! The hotel is beautiful from the moment you get in We stayed at the Horizon club rooms which are very spacious, clean and cozy. I did have an issue with the hair dryer though which is not very good so ladies with long hair I would suggest you bring your own! The bathroom amenities are high standard , the only down side of our room was that we were right next to the lifts and could hear them go up and down all the time, the noise can wake you up especially if you are not a heavy sleeper. The breakfast at the Horizon club is recommended, but nothing beats the hotel’s Teppanyaki restaurant, an absolute must. The staff at the Horizon club is generally very kind but I guess as everywhere you find those 1/2 staff members who could get some extra training for customer service. Taxis were a problem when we were there but it was probably because we were there during the Grand Prix and new years. Overall Yes: We definitely recommend the Shangri La Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “The Valley Wing service level has disappointed on our second visit.”
Reviews.Author: f2s
Reviews.Content: Check in was not perfect.I requested a butler and as last visit I never saw one.I requested shoes cleaned and was asked by a housekeeping boy when I wanted them.When he brought them back they were just as I gave them,dirty. There were dead flies behind the curtain throughout our two days. At the pool we were given only one towel and the garden shower is poor. Room service food was not great. Worst of all what used to be the best of breakfast rooms,the "Summit Room"service was bad,and menu poorer.When the Resident Manager became aware an apology was made. The complimentary drinks and afternoon tea etc on offer from 11am to 10.30pm are still splendid.The harpist plays in the evening. I will not return to the "Valley Wing"

Reviews.Title: “slick hotel in a fabulous city”
Reviews.Author: Ralphsmum
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a holiday to celebrate my mum's retirement. The Shangri la is a fantastic hotel, just outside the bustle of a phenominal city. On arrival we were upgarded to the garden wing, which has its own private reception area. The service is top rate, with friendly and attentive staff. The meals are the price you would expect of a 5 star hotel, but there are plenty of places to eat in the city. Singapore is fantastic. A city for the 21st century. Clean and welcoming. Orcahrd Road is a must for shoppers. The hotel has a free shuttle bus to take you back and forth to the shopping centre. Try a Singapore sling - its a must. However if taken at Raffles as we did, don't expect such a friendly welsome. They obviously don't like just the day tripper. There is so much to see and do in this city, it's a must to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently excellent all round”
Reviews.Author: TechnoProf
Reviews.Content: Attention to detail is a continues trait of Shangri-La at Organe Grove and I was pleased to be able to visit again. The LINE continues to be one of the best eating experiences in Singpore in my view. Despite the large size of the hotel in its different parts, the whole experience hangs together around the amazing pool, inside gardens and outside gardens. Service in Horizon Club seemed to be attentive in my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Shangri-La Experience”
Reviews.Author: Jame5
Reviews.Content: We travelled here as a family as part of a multi centre which included the sister hotel on Sentosa Island. We stayed in the Valley Wing and the Service was out of this world! Hotel A good location. It is near by to Orchard Street but also far enough away so that you feel you are in a little oasis. The hotel interior is stunning. The Valley Wing has it's own reception and the staff here know you are coming and greet you by name. Rooms Again, a very high standard. Probably the biggest city centre hotel room I have stayed in. Even the bath room was larger than some rooms I have stayed in. The quality is there for all to see, from personalised stationary to electric closing window blinds. You have to see these rooms to believe them Restaurants We had breakfast every morning in the privacy of the Valley Wing breakfast room. Evenings we spent out in the town, except one night when we stayed and had the buffet. This has to go down as the biggest buffet I have ever seen. The choice was amazing and the freshness was unrivalled. Pool Was being re-furbished when we stayed there, but on my last visit it was very relaxing! Overall if you are going to Singapore, spoil yourself and stay in the Valley Wing! Any questions, please ask

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in a busy city”
Reviews.Author: FrostyOz
Reviews.Content: Shangri-La is an oasis within a busy city. I love the huge pool set in a tropical garden (not a cement pond within another cement block). Yes, it's 10 minutes walk to the bustle of Orchard Road shops, 15 minutes walk to the Metro. 15 minutes taxi to the CBD. And that's what I like - at the end of the day you can retreat to your oasis, let off steam, and prepare for the next day. Likes - pool, gardens, free broadband internet, gym, steam room, spa, best breakfast buffet in Singapore. Not so good - some rooms a little tired, meals other than breakfast are expensive (a good incentive to eat out!).

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, good for relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Peetsie
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Shang a number of times on business over the years. Tower Wing rooms are contemporary, not huge, but fresh and well furnished. Garden Rooms were very old and outdated. The Line restaurant is great for breakfast and dinner (with freeflow beer option...). Pool area is very relaxing and part of the garden, one of the best pools in Singapore imho. A huge open lobby that reflects this is a classy hotel. Location wise, it's a bit off track - <10 mins to top of Orchard Road but uphill on way back...not that many restaurants close by, MRT is 15 mins walk away. Staff are very good.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing visit................................”
Reviews.Author: Janette43
Reviews.Content: Having visited Shangrila Hotel in Bangkok several times, we were looking forward to our visit to this beautiful hotel, but we were extremely disappointed. The service in the BLU restaurant for breakfast was appalling. On our first morning after 10mins we had to ask a waiter if we could order tea and coffee, breakfast eventually arrived after a wait and not what we ordered!! However on our second morning, we waited 10mins for tea and coffee, then 35mins for our breakfast that we had ordered with the tea and coffee. We waited this amount of time in spite of asking three different people what the problem was. Everyone kept telling us 'we will see to it'!!! We complained and we received apologies saying that it was Chinese New Year and the hotel was very busy, no excuse Im afraid, a 5 Star hotel should cater for these events. We felt as if we were invisible. We did receive a very nice note and a bottle of wine and chocs as an apology but it should never have happened at all in this class of hotel. Door and lobby staff were so polite and helpful but the BLU staff, apart from Fairoz, one of the waiters, (who instigated our receiving the apology gifts), were very unhelpful and disinterested. We dont feel that we would visit this hotel again. In the Club Horizon Lounge where we were guests, there was a couple of waiters who were very good, attentive and polite,but the breakfast experience spoiled things for us. One morning you can excuse but two mornings and the indifference of the staff is inexcusable.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Knight59
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Shang in a club room in the garden wing.I have stayed at dozens of 5 star hotels all over the world in the last 20 years and rate this near the top.Service, facilities,location all top notch.Will definitely return.Singapore has a lot of very nice hotels but the Shangri La exceeded all myl expectations. Hari in the Horizon Club was a gem and couldn't do enough for us.I can one day see him holding a top management position in the hospitality industry. At the end of the day its the people and facilities that make a hotel what it is and the Shangri La Singapore shines in both departments.

Reviews.Title: “Great first visit”
Reviews.Author: Tim S
Reviews.Content: We have just returned to a very cold London after three days at the Shang. This was at the end of a five week round the world tour and we could not have chosen a better hotel. We stayed in the Valley Wing which has a feeling of quiet luxury and the staff could not have been more pleasant. We were up-graded to a suite with a city view which was quiet over the Chinese New Year but become rather noisier on the last day when the major construction site opposite got going. A room overlooking the garden is perhaps the better option until the new building opposite is completed although we liked the city view and the sound proofing is very good. We took breakfast in the Summit room where there is a limited buffet but we prefered the less frenetic pace and the staff were so charming, we wanted to return each day. Otherwise we ate out at the vast number of excellent restaurants on offer in Singapore. The one exception was our last night when we dined at Blu on the 26th floor with an incredible view. The food on offer here is very expensive and the portions small but superb. This suited us well before we were whisked off the to airport in the complimentary Merecedes for the 14 hour flight home. Yes, the location is some way from the centre but taxis are cheap and readily available. We walked the length of Orchard Road on our first day, including visits to some of the many malls, which is not for the faint hearted in temperatures of 35C but we were refreshed by lunch at the Long Bar at Raffles and took a taxi back. A refreshing dip in the vast pool each afternoon was much appreciated and is a particular feature of the Shang. The Valley Wing is in a class of its own and we will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated - Overpriced....”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: Spent a night at the Singapore Shangri La over Chinese New Year - on points from stays at other Shangri Las in the region. Stayed in a suite in the Garden Wing. The room was spacious but very tired and in need of a facelift. Lots of white wooden furniture, old style TVs in large cabinets and non functioning light switches. Dined at the famous Line buffet - very nice, but not worth the outrageous $98++ for lunch. You can get a fantastic Cahmpagne brunch for a few dollars more that that! The other prices for Food/Drinks - $18 for a Tiget Beer, $42 for Fish & Chips, $28 for Fried Rice, $16 for Rice Krispies to name a few - were outrageous, likely due to being a few minutes from Orchard Road , hoping to catch out people who don't know the area. The walls must also be very thin as we were kept awake by noisy Children on baoth sides of our room, although that can't really be blamed on the hotel... I have stayed in many other hotels in Singapore and around South East Asia (including other Shangri Las) and the Singapore Shangri La does not represent good value at all.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!!”
Reviews.Author: no-time-2-work
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. We stayed in the ultra luxurious Valley Wing which is very select and has great service. Complimentary drinks are served for most of the day by some of the most well trainined staff I have met. Superb rooms. Great location just at the top end of Orchard Road and I would stay there again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: maxgrazza
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three days returing from Australia. We were given an upgrade to a Garden Wing room which included breakfast, which was a very substantial offering, and a late check out was happily agreed. The service from all staff was excellent. The room was very well appointed with a balcony and the bed very large and comfortable. I think perhaps the decor was slightly dated, but this didn't really detract from the overall very pleasant experience of staying at the hotel. The hotel was very well situated just off Orchard Road and even Raffles was within (a longish) walk. Taxis are very reasonable BUT the traffic especially on Sunday was so bad iwalking was easier and faster.

Reviews.Title: “Low Key Style”
Reviews.Author: towtaylor
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the sister group Traders Hotel several times previously we were a little apprehensive about what we would find at the Shangri-La following some of the comments made here. We need not have worried. Whilst the hotel might need some sprucing up in places, the attitude of the staff is what makes the place stand out. Polite, careful, low key charm is what strikes most - from the front of house through cleaners and poolside, all were unfailingly anxious to help. During our visit there was a large conference running but the restaurants, pool and public areas never seemed crowded or rushed.

Reviews.Title: “Shangri-La rocks, what a perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Amsterdam1975
Reviews.Content: It's Shangri La charming downtown Singpore. Just 1 block away of Orchard Road. Service, Luxury and green garden in the middle of the city center. The hotel's swimming pool is a relax place to stay. With your partner, family or by yourself, it all fits @ Shangri-La So....book your flight with Singapore Airlines & make your hotel reservation . OK lah, off you go!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are outdated at best, dingy and gross at worst.”
Reviews.Author: nurns28
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel and found my company had booked me in a Tower Room. Based on checking out the website beforehand, I asked if there was any way to switch to a Garden room with views of the pool and gardens, and a private balcony. After walking for about 10 minutes, I was brought to a very old, run down and shabby room - old worn down tiles, tiny outdated bathroom, and a very bland look to the room. They then took me to a Tower room that was actually worse. The bathroom light fixutre was broken and the electrical wiring exposed. There were hairs in the bed that were not mine, and the crappy old desk chair was stained. No modern ameneties. I finally asked to speak to a manager who then upgraded me to the Valley Wing. The Valley Wing was excellent - beautiful, grand rooms and huge bathrooms, but I believe had they not upgraded me for free these rooms are several hundred dollars more per night. The only downside after I moved was that the internet connection stopped working in my room and it took hours to fix. One would think a hotel of this caliber would upgrade to wifi. The one bright spot at the hotel was the staff. They were very responsive, helpful, and really cared about making you happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool”
Reviews.Author: ozden
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a gargen wing room at The Shangri-La just for one night on dec 27th, 2009 on our way to Auckland. What we liked best was the lush green and well maintained garden and the big swimming pool it surrounds. The garden wing rooms in our opinion does not have the general grandeur and the elegance of the hotel, but look more like a resort room. The staff was very kind and courteous, yet a little distanced. Comfortable bed, great breakfast, good service, central location are also among the hotel's qualities which would make us come back.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem on the tip of Orchard Road. Oh, with the best seafood feast ever in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: asimplejazzlover
Reviews.Content: Shangri-La has a top notch rooms and service. The rooms are large, very much comfortable and beautifully decorated. It has a very beautiful swimming pool, surrounded by green lush parks making it one of the most beautiful resort hotel in Singapore. The lobby is massive and it has attentive staff catering to your needs from the doorstep. It has numerous restaurants in the hotel from Chinese, Japanese to international buffet restaurant. Important tips: Try their brunch on Sunday, Shangri-La has the best seafood buffet in town. I have been to many different brunch places in Singapore and Shangri-La appears to be top notch! However, Shangri-La is located on the tip of Orchard Road. It is a bit of a distance to walk down to Orchard Road where the shopping belts are. Admittedly, I love to be in Shangri-La to have a tranquil surroundings in the tropical island of Singapore. Though if you want to have an easier access to the shopping centers, Shangri-La may not be your best option. All in all, I love the hotel. It is very beautiful and the Sunday brunch is super excellent. Love the fresh seafood, I certainly will be coming back for the seafood feast!! :)

Reviews.Title: “A well Organised place for familys!”
Reviews.Author: Bobbi101
Reviews.Content: The Shangri La Hotel has a wonderful pool. It has a great location, very near to Orchard road and thats where all the shopping is!!!!! But one thing that'll make your mouth water is the breakfast! It has a HUGE buffet from asian food, to pastrys, to pancakes, anything you can imagine!the rooms are good and it has room wings, the main wing and the garden wing. It is very well mainted and has lovely staff.

Reviews.Title: “Full of culture and Awesome Restaurants”
Reviews.Author: joeank84
Reviews.Content: On a trip to Singapore, stayed a few nights. the service was great, I loved the fact that the employees were dressed up in traditional chinese attire. the room was spacious, the Nature walk by the pool was a pretty neat idea, kind of relaxing. The best part is the Restaurants they have inside. I went to the Rose Veranda a few times for tea and dinner. great selection of teas..102 of them in fact. The bufffet was delicious and the food was fresh. you could order a la carte as well. If you want to have a nice experience, try this hotel. you won't be let down.

Reviews.Title: “The Shangri-la still sets the standard..”
Reviews.Author: MontagueMelbourne
Reviews.Content: The “Shang” as its often called still exceeds my expectations. On a recent stay during the Christmas/New Year period, it was a delight.. nothing was any trouble for the staff, and all that was promised was delivered. The Valley Wing, like the Shangri-la it self is an oasis of calm looking out on the gardens and pool area. The Valley Wing staff are all professional and courteous and has a wealth of local knowledge that they easily share. On my recent visit and running a tad late, I actually saw the manager run to get me a last minute coffee on my departure after a casual comment about not have a coffee yet!! The rooms are stylish, spacious and very well serviced, and the staff soon remembers your name, past visits and your preferred drink or coffee in the morning. Could you find a better hotel, depending on your requirements, perhaps, could you find a hotel with better consistency of service and attitude, I doubt that very much. The Shangri-la Singapore is a total full service hotel, and I am not aware of any other hotel that offers the level of service, dining alternatives, outdoor pool area and gardens in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Super Experience - Above Par Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rajkot
Reviews.Content: I stayed on Jan 1st this year at the Shangri-La., as I was taking a one day break enroute back to India from my holiday in Penang. The Shangri_La is outstanding. The Garden wing is built like a tropical forest. Rooms are spacious and service is impecable. The most astounding is the Breakfast spread - huge is mild statement. They actually have cross road markers at the intersections, indicating the food type - Chines, Malay, Indian, Continental, Fruits..... The service was typical ShangriLa - superb.
