The dinner at the restaurant The Line, was impecabble and completely enjoyable The location is a little exclusive - in a very quite but upmarket area, but the hotel has regular coach service to Orchard Road malls Overall, completely impressed with the House Keeping, efficient to the T Highly recommended, if you can afford the price - Superb Experience

Reviews.Title: “Needs some investment”
Reviews.Author: tyler018
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in Shangril-la's over the years, they typically offer top facilities & service at a price. I agree with other commentators the peace and quiet is great, however we had chewing gum left in the room, had housekeeping not turn up one day and the Garden wing we stayed in was tired and needed investment in new bathrooms and technical equipment. I agree still grand, but for the price think they need to do a little better than we received.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to Expectations”
Reviews.Author: gankor
Reviews.Content: There was someone to greet / receive us when we stepped foot in the lobby of the hotel, and made sure we knew where to go to check-in. Very spacious rooms and bathroom. though a little outdated ( 80s decor ). Incredible buffet breakfast - huge selection. However alacarte menu for supper was very limited and expensive. Staff was more knowledgeable than usual ( even for the lift attendant ) and helpful ( would go out of their way to find out about internet access ). Big resort-like pool - you do not feel like you're actually in the city. It's a bit of a walk to Orchard Road ( especially with young children ) but there's a complimentary shuttle service every hour.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and facilities but food way overpriced”
Reviews.Author: zousan
Reviews.Content: Room My wife, 9 month old child and I stayed on the 8th floor of the Garden Wing in December 2009. The room had a nice, large balcony with a decent view and nice breeze. They provided a great crib for the baby which was very useful. The room was pretty large and the free broadband internet access was nice to have. General This is a nice hotel, although a bit older than many others in its category so it's not super modern. Overall, our only complaint was that the food and drinks were way overpriced (I know most hotels are like this but this seemed even more expensive than normal). We just purchased a bunch of snacks and drinks from a convenience store and put them in the fridge though so it wasn't a big deal. Facilities They have a nice, large pool and a pretty good gym, sauna and steam room. Location This is a little bit off the main shopping area of Orchard road. It's not too far and could be walked but we took a taxi every time (and I assume anyone with children would do the same). We thought the location was fine, but if you want shopping right at your doorstep, this is probably not the best place.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kigzresident
Reviews.Content: Lovely Hotel, amazing breakfast buffet. Superb service and friendly staff. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Awesome Breakfasts, located away from the masses”
Reviews.Author: WestMidsTravellers
Reviews.Content: I have to tip my hat off to all the staff to thank them for our very memorable stay (with the one exception of a snotty hostess who didn't like us sitting down in the lobby rest area without buying a drink or a meal - please remedy management) The brilliant concierge Johnny Hor, the super efficient bellboys, and the lovely hostess ladies casually drifting around the inner lobby area really do deliver the most personal of services making you feel part of the family. How they remember all the guests names is a mystery to me. I also have to say the service we had when dining in the in-house Chinese Restaurant (sorry the name escapes me) were incredible. Thanks also to the reception staff for the upgrade to the garden wing, good sized rooms in a quiet location, just what we wanted. Many folk will I am sure find the location too far from the action, but transport is very cheap and sometimes it is highly desirable to escape the crowds and noise, particularly if you want a good nights sleep. I cannot remember a single hotel we have visited which has offered such a vast selection of breakfast options - it is worth staying here for the breakfast alone. Worth mentioning that the hotel hosted an evening event for a number of diplomats and other VIPs, if it is good enough for them........then it was certainly good enough for us!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury”
Reviews.Author: sissyhuang2003
Reviews.Content: Shangri-La is just different from other five-star hotel, quite surroundings, first-class service and i love the fitness room. I am very precautious about the bathroom and i really could not find a hair. It is just lovely!!! Enjoy your stay

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scapilli_Adelaide
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 rooms in this hotel through a cousin who apparently has often used this hotel for her business colleagues and associates. We were in Singapore for her wedding celebration and it turned out to be a perfect holiday. Rooms had a very pleasant ambiance and were immaculately cleaned daily. Service staff were very friendly and alwasy helpful (nothing is too difficult for them). Some of the housekeeping staff had very little English but this was not a problem as we can always dial the hotel's Service Centre for requests. Location is right in the city but we must walk a bit to Orchard Road. The hotel provides daily shuttles to Takashimaya and other shopping spots - great service with reliable timing. Fitness centre and swimming pool were so nice: lots of sporting equipments, immaculately clean, pleasant ambiance, very helpful staff/attendants. The lockers are so clean; better than those in most city hotels we have ever stayed. Free internet access with high speed was a great plus. We will come back to this hotel in our next Singapore trip.

Reviews.Title: “Holding on to past reputation but only just!”
Reviews.Author: gary052
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the SHANG on and off since 1973. The old lady can still hold her head up mainly due to the amount of land surrounding the property. This gives you a feeling of being outside the hustle of the town. It was a great hotel 25 years ago but now has stiff competition, My desision to stay usually depends on what deals are on offer, the choice is great in singapore so its worth trying out new properties!

Reviews.Title: “mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: jetlaggad
Reviews.Content: I really have mixed feelings about this property . The location is a major drawback. The Hotel gives a feeling of being to large , like living in Grand central Station. This can be avoided by staying in the tower section , where the rooms are better as well. The rooms otherwise are spacious , but decor and comfort level not up par with newer Shang properties elsewhere in Asia. If you stay on the club level you will have access to the club lounge for breakfast in the morning and snacks and drinks during the day. The club lounge is very nice , actually one of the nicest in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - minor issues”
Reviews.Author: themic_virginia
Reviews.Content: Overall, this hotel earns its keep as a 5 star hotel. The locals call it a 6 star hotel. I would agree, except for two things. I'm going to talk about these two things at length here, but really it's a great hotel. It has possibly the best bed I've ever slept in, and the sun room window in my room was incredible (Tower Wing section). (1) The shower temperature does not remain steady. It fluctuates fairly wildly, especially during peak showering hours, but all during the day as well. This forces you to take a much cooler shower rather than risk being burnt. (2) The air-conditioning works great, until about 3/4 of the way through the night, when it continues to blow air but it is no longer cool. You have to get up, remove your keycard, and stick it back in, to reset the room and have it blow cool air. It only happens in the middle of the night so I was unable to re-create the problem for hotel staff. One last thing, that I shouldn't really complain about, but will... They really really REALLY want to clean your hotel room every day, and don't take "private" for an answer. This is not unusual for a high class hotel, but it annoys the heck out of me anyways.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Shangri-La Singapore”
Reviews.Author: RusNewton
Reviews.Content: Although I have visited Singapore dozens of times over the years, I have tended to stay in the City Hall area of the city (Raffles, InterContinental, Mandarin Oriental, Conrad). Shangri La is a bit out-on-a-limb compared with these hotels in one sense, but there's a fair amount of life at the other end of Orchard Road and the location adds maybe five minutes to the journey time to CBD compared with those other hotels. It's just a short walk to Emerald Hill which has some nice bars & nightlife. Plus of course you're much closer to the shopping in Orchard Road than you would be at City Hall. Not that I like to shop..... The hotel is quite grand - the night I arrived there was a big function going on, with Lambourghini, Ferrari and Porsche sports-cars stacked up outside the hotel entrance and many glamorous people arriving. Arrival was as good as I'd hope for a luxury hotel, with my bags lifted swiftly from cab, tagged and taken to my room while I was escorted to reception and checked in. Friendly and efficient. Room was nice, with decent desk. Comfortable bed. I don't remember eating any meals in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, wonderful room, wonderful island!”
Reviews.Author: holidayaholic54
Reviews.Content: Choose this hotel as it seemed like a tropical oasis in the hustle and bustle of the city and were not disappointed. The gardens are amazing, as is the swimming pool. The staff were friendly and helpful. We had complementary breakfast which was very good. The selection was amazing. It was perfectly placed for Orchard Road and was close to buses and trains (approx 5 mins walk away). However, if you didn't want to walk there was a complementary shuttle. Will definately stay here again when in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Celebrating Retirement”
Reviews.Author: Patreesho
Reviews.Content: My husband and two friends are newly retired. We chose Singapore to celebrate. The hotel experience was ideal. We chose the Executive Floor, as in other Shangri La's, well worth it for the service. The food was all round excellent, for breakfast alternating with the Blu and the Line, throughout the day snacks and canapes in the evening in the Horizon Lounge. Occasionally the service was confused or slow, juggling the numbers with the staff available, example evening cocktails, but when concern shown the staff were immediately willing to put things right. So no big grouch! The swimming pool and lush tropical gardens were very pleasant. Lobby and door staff most helpful and courteous. Overall we enjoyed staying there and would happily return. There are lots of interesting night time venues. Marina, Clarkes Quay, Chinatown, Boat Quay. Singapore is a place you feel safe in. Daytime must see... The Botanical Gardens.. so good we made two trips during our stay. Awesome Orchid Gardens!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect start to our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: UkSharan
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I've stayed in. We arrived here 4 days ago for the start of our honeymoon. We got upgraded to the Horizon club and found our enormous room especially decorated for us. The service here has been fantastic - staff are friendly and always remember you. Our room is spacious and clean with all the mod cons. Although it would have been nice if we also had wi-fi in the bedrooms. (There is a wired connection in the bedroom, wireless is only available in the common areas). The breakfast is great with plenty to choose from. There are also a couple of good restaurants within the hotel...although a bit pricey if I'm honest. If you order room service, you'll be surprised at the level of service - outstanding! The hotel has a top class fitness centre, spa and pool facilities - plenty to keep yourself amused all day. Great location - about a 5 minute walk to the shops and restaurants on Orchard Road. Although surprisingly, the hotel is set back from the hustle and bustle.

Reviews.Title: “A tired Great Dame”
Reviews.Author: jolly999
Reviews.Content: There was a time twenty years ago that staying in the garden wing here was the top hotel experience in Singapore. Today, the hotel is mildly run down and feels very dated with its almost touristy like Chinese decor. Inconvenient as it is long way from Subway and in ned of a complete overhaul. Air condition at 18 centigrade will give you a cold, a sit did with me. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but food disappointing”
Reviews.Author: lloukite
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a stopover for 4 nights with a baby, hence spent most of our time in the hotel. Overall the hotel was great - service , room and facilities. However the room service food was average for 5 star hotel. We liked: Room : We stayed in the Garden Wing with a room overlooking the pool - room was clean and comfortable and it was really nice to have a balcony A/C worked well. Pool : Loved the pool area - nice size, plenty of beds yet didnt feel on top of each other, and pool was a nice temperature. Gym: Decent size and a good mix of cardio and weights area. Also had a massage which was amazing - but once tax added $200 Singapore is just too much for a 90 minute massage. Internet: FREE!!! Makes a change for a hotel not to charge for a service that should be free! Service: Check in and out was fast and efficient, we forgot to order a cot and yet this was delivered about 5 mins after we checked into our room. Room service was as promised in terms of delivery times Location: Perfect for Orchard Road We disliked: Food : overpriced for what it was - quality was disappointing Beverages : Costs! A glass of wine was $25 and a bottle of evian $11

Reviews.Title: “Very Classy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Janny_9
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights Horizon Club room and thouroughly enjoyed the experience. Check-in was very speedy on Horizon floor, however we were glad to be in our room after what seemed like 25 Welcome to the Shangri-la greetings from well mannered staff. Breakfast was amazing. Beautiful Buffet downstairs,in The Line, so much choice. We did eat breakfast upstairs the first morning, lovely, but preferred the relaxed mood of The Line. We experienced friendly service from the staff in the Horizon Club where we enjoyed our nightly cocktails- yum- loved the Singapore Sling-. One of the staff (Edwin if my memory serves me correctly) was particulary helpful in recommending a great hawkers place to eat, instead of Newton Circus- where we had intended to go but was closed for cleaning. The place we went to was full of locals and was terrific great food, affordable and very welcoming.Great suggestion. Housekeeping was faultless. We came back to our room, while housekeeping was there. Very apologetic (no need to be) asked if we were satisfied with how the room looked and how she had cleaned it. The room was fantastic and so was her service. The pool is another wonderful spot at this hotel in the surrounds of beautiful gardens. Paradise so close to Orchard Road. What can I say , as I had booked this hotel as part of a birthday suprise holiday for my husband, everything came together nicely for a lovely memorable holiday. Thank you. We would love to stay at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel but some room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: Karen0101
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the weekend of the Grand Prix in a Horizon Club room. The room was excellent, very good facilities, spacious and quiet. The hotel is well located just off Orchard Road. We only ate at one of the restaurants, Blu, which was superb. Expensive but not excessive for a restaurant of this kind in Singapore and well worth the price for such an excellent meal.The staff were helpful and friendly and the club areas were very good. On a more negative note, being a frequent user of Shangri La hotels I generally found the quality of the service to be below expectations. Our Horizon Club check in took 45 mins, apparently the room wasn't ready but this was 3.30pm. On the first night drinks in the Club lounge tooks nearly 30 minutes and several reminders, however this did not seem to happen on other evenings. Breakfast was the real disaster area, coffee/tea did not arrive, the buffet was not topped up, orders took forever, cutlery was not replaced, orders were wrong and it seemed that everything had to be requested at least twice, often more, before it finally appeared. There was a general impression that the hotel was running less than smoothly such that we felt the need to constantly check such essentials as taxi bookings (one was forgotten) something I would never normally do in a Shangri La. Nevertheless, I would still recomment the hotel, even a Shangri La working slightly below par is an excellent hotel and if you go treat yourself to an evening at Blu.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but plenty of room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: ridgebackfan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week in a Horizon Club level room in the main tower. Asked to be moved from the first room given because housekeeping had done a shabby job. Dust abounded and it looked like someone walked in the bathtub with muddy shoes. To the hotel's credit, they moved me promptly and with zero hassle. They also bumped my room category level up one notch. The problem areas of the hotel were housekeeping and restaurant/Horizon Club staff. Perhaps staffing levels in both were insufficient. Housekeeping staff always appeared in a big rush and they often missed things - For example, I had to wonder if they bothered cleaning the bathroom floor and tub one day because of assorted debris. Another day they failed to empty the dirty towels from the linen basket. One day I asked the front desk manager to provide an extra pad for the bed because I found their mattress too hard. She called housekeeping in front of me; however they failed to show up in my room and I never received an explanation. The next day, I renewed my request at the front desk and this time a manager made certain that it was done. I also had some concerns about service in the restaurant and at lounge for both breakfast and cocktails. It regularly took a minimum of 10 and sometimes as long as 15 minutes to get a cup of coffee. Not only would I be back in my chair after a trip to the buffet table, but I'd be halfway through with my plate before my beverage would arrive. A drink request in the lounge usually required a similar amount of time for delivery. I can live with waiting a few extra minutes for a cocktail but not so much for morning coffee. The front desk staff and the doormen are the shining jewels of the hotel. Unfortunately the food and beverage manager, and the housekeeping manager, require immediate assistance. Also on the plus side, the rooms were comfortable and the bathrooms quite nice. The rooms could stand some renewal however. For example, the peach carpet. I highly recommend the chinese restaurant on the lobby level. I noticed it was very popular with the locals but not many hotel guests made use of it. That's one hotel restaurant that should not be avoided! It was good value and the food quality was extremely high. The hotel location is also excellent - close to everything but far enough away to provide peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressive hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: EfficientTraveler
Reviews.Content: Hosted a business meeting here. Great rooms and great service. Rooms were great. A little off the Orchard Road, which is good for wanting to be away from the traffic. Short walk to Orchard road. Excellent fitness facility and great pool with bar. The buffet was unbelievable...well worth the cost if you are hungry and like to eat different cuisines. Indian, japanese, chinese, and malaysian all available. For sight-seeing, took the city sightseeing hop on-off bus, which was a short walk to the pick-up stop from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk & Reservations...not even close to acceptable”
Reviews.Author: azimthedream
Reviews.Content: We normally stay in upmarket 5 star hotels in cities throughout Asia, and as we flew Business Class on Singapore Air, we were given this hotel for two nights for free. In Kuala Lumpur, we usually only stay at either the Shangri La or its sister hotel, the Trader's and are always satisfied with the service. This time, I barely slept a wink on the 13 hour flight from London, so just wanted a place to rest my head. I was told that we were upgraded from what our voucher had said (A Deluxe in the Tower Wing) to a Garden Wing Room. I foolishly beleieved them because I had status miles with a number of their airline partners. When we got to the room I was apalled. It smelt musty, there was paint chipping from the furniture, it had an old style TV and the room looked as if it hadnt been renovated in close to a decade. This was certainly not the standard I expected from the Shangri La. I decided to just rest and when I woke refreshed I could deal with the matter in a calm and rational manner, but despite my insistence that this was not a room that the Shangri La should be touting as an upgrade, the front office and reservations staff continued to insist that it was. At one point I even called the reservations from my mobile to ask the rack rate for the different rooms and was told that the rack rate for the room of my voucher was more than that of my upgrade....HOW CAN IT BE AN UPGRADE IF THE VALUE OF THE ROOM IS LESS THAN THAT OF MY VOUCHER? Where Im from....this is a DOWNGRADE... It was only on my FOURTH attempt (which I shouldnt have had to make) and strong emphatic insistence that I see the room for which my voucher was did staff confirm with me that I was actually downgraded. What a disappointment. Moreover, I was never oferred an apology, or a 'GENUINE' upgrade. Sure the Garden Wing has bigger rooms with a balcony, but that doesnt do me too much good with a 16 month old baby....Id rather have a cleaner, newer, less tatty room with proper functioning lights, a TV and a nicer bathroom. The food and other amenities were great, but please dont fall for this Upgrade routine if you ever do decide to stay here....after staying with this chain for over 100 nights, Ive lost patience and confidence with them....they simply dont value repeat customers it seems.... Oh well....many many many more good hotels in Singapore fortunatley...

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not wow”
Reviews.Author: BAH3
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at the Shangri la to break up a long haul trip which was our honeymoon. As the hotel knew we were on honeymoon I thought there might be a small gesture eg. flowers, fruit basket or something but there wasn't (pretty much everywhere else we went did something). Overall the hotel is nice but I did expect something more from a hotel such as the shangri la. The rooms were good enough but a bit dated. Service at breakfast was poor. Each day I had to ask several times for the tea and coffee (and then they bought the wrong one) even though its the first question they ask when they seat you. The hotels not bad but I think I'd try somewhere else if in Singapore again. We ate once at the downstairs cafe which was very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great five star service....”
Reviews.Author: kingsroadgal
Reviews.Content: We get to Singapore fairly regularly, and always stay at another, older hotel. However, the temptation of two nights paid for by Singapore Airlines made the Shangri La quite tempting. We were so pleased with our visit, that we would consider staying here again. Right from our early morning arrival at the hotel, the service was fantastic. I would have to say that the front desk clerk was one of the best I have ever encountered. Even though someone else was picking up the tab for our room, the front desk was totally focused on our needs and preferences, even well before check in time. I was so grateful for his kindness. I have never been a big fan of the Tower Wing at this hotel, and the rooms there are quite small, so if you have a lot of luggage, beware. However, the rooms are totally efficient and pleasant. and well-decorated with great linens The bathrooms have new mosaic tile and nice amenities. There is also free internet, and some spectacular views of the city. We were really quite pleased. The room attendant was first-rate, and always made sure the room was promptly serviced. She took a real interest in our comfort, and indeed in the appearance of the whole floor. A slight criticism I would have is that the hallway carpet and elevator carpet going up to the room looked like it could use a bit of a clean, if not replacement. Not horrible, but a bit tired. No significant complaints other than room size. The pool at the Shang is great. A beautiful tropical atmosphere, and the hotel supplies plenty of reading material, which I thought was a nice touch. Lots of young families at the pool, but there was room for everyone, and anyone wanting to chill out had no problems. The Line, the Shang's main restaurant was GREAT. I was very pleased with the quality and variiety of the food. I was particularly impressed by how well kept the food was. For instance, instead of the warm juice you can encounter on some buffets, the Shang has a great refrigeration system. Everything that was supposed to be cold actually was....no room termperature stuff allowed. A really pleasant environment in which to enjoy your meal, as you look out over the Shang's verdant grounds. The hotel's physical site must be one of the most pleasant of any Singapore hotel. The gym at the Shang is very large for a hotel gym.. Lots of equipement of all varieties.. At least six elliptical machines alone, two rowers along with a lot of equipment I have never seen in my local gym.. Everything in good working order. Nice shower and sauna area. The only other complaint that I would have about the Shang is their laundry pricing. It was the most expensive I have encountered in Asia, although many of the hotels I stay in are more expensive than the Shang. Usually in Asia, the laundry is fairly affordable compared to other locales, even at top notch hotels. The Shang really took that to new heights, and I hope they will reconsider this policy. I know they have some room rates that include laundry, so this made the cost especially surprising. Anyway, I would still have to say that the Garden Wing looks nicest to me, but the Tower is quite fine in almost every respect, and any deficiencies were overcome by the great service from all the staff at this fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Trip of a life time”
Reviews.Author: tinman169
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights at the start of our trip of a life time to celebrate our silver wedding anniversary, we were given a free upgrade to the garden wing which over looked the swimming pool, this hotel is amazing, the people are so kind and frendly nothing is to much trouble, everything is on a grand scale, from the moment you step out of your taxi to the moment you leave this place will stay with us for a long time, it is located 5 minutes walk from Orchard road, which is the main shopping and eating area of Singapore, the swimming pool which is about 5 degrees below the outside temperature is open till 10pm and we went for a swim at 9:30pm under the stars amazing. if you get the chance to go to Singapore stay at this hotel you will not be disappointed, we will definately be going back to this hotel when we next go to this side of the world.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Adele66
Reviews.Content: I booked a room overlooking the pool in the Garden Wing. I chose to book the very convenient package that includes airport transfers, breakfast, unlimited internet access etc. I was met at Immigration by a lovely young lady who escorted me to a waiting limousine that took me to the Shangri La, where I was greeted by name on the steps of the hotel and escorted to my room where I was checked in. They upgraded me to a Garden Wing suite which was absolutely gorgeous. I can find very little fault with this hotel. The suite and amenities were wonderful, and I can't compliment the staff enough. Every single person was courteous and efficient and forever cheerful. It was just a pleasure. The spa treatments, although pricey, are well worth it. The food in the restaurants is good, although the main restaurant, The Line, can be a little hectic in the mornings. I was particularly please to see a gluten-free option on the breakfast menu, which is very unusual. I had originally booked to stay at Raffles, and ended up cancelling my booking because I was very disappointed in the service provided prior to my visit. It turned out to be a very good move, because I find it hard to believe that Raffles could have provided me with a better stay.

Reviews.Title: “simply the best”
Reviews.Author: athena01England
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the shangri-la 4 nights as the 1st part of our trip to malaysia, we stayed in the tower wing and had a premier room, with horizon club, from the moment we arrived we were treated very well, from the taxi to the horizion club floor , we arrived early as our flight with singapore airlines arrives very early, this was no problem we were asked to have breakfast, then our room was ready, wonderful room , everything was perfect, later we used the horizon club, witch again was very good , and the staff were wonderful , especially the girls on recipetition, they answered all the questions we wanted to know, we ate at the line on sunday for brunch, this gets very busy , excellent buffett but make sure your not full from breakfast, which was very good , you can eat breakfast either at line or horison club, line is manic in the morning, but with more choice, horizon is quieter with lovely views of the city, less busy , less choice but still very very good, .The pool is vey good it gets busy late afternoon but no problem getting a bed , To su up the shangi-la , i am sure there are other good hotels in singapore but i loved it here the whole place was wonderful, lovely staff , i hope i will come back soon

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: SeamusBelfast
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Shangri LA on our way home from a five week trip to Australia. We had pre -booked but when we arrived we decided to upgrade to the Valley winf (for not a huge amount of money). This allowed us free champers and food and an upgrade to a suite. The hotel itself was magnificent; the staff friendly and the location superb. We stayed over Christmas and enjoyed the celebrations on Xmas eve on Orchard road. All in all a great place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing start to our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: honestreviewsLeeds
Reviews.Content: Arrived on the 27th December after a long flight with Singapore Airways (amazing airline!), greeted by great staff, swift check in with no problems.Great rooms, a little business like, but hey when you're staying in a capital city... it's always going to feel a little like that. Pool was great, although food was a little expensive (£57 for lunch for 2 people...). Spent New Years eve at the hotel - again, couldn't falt the service and party atmosphere. Free flowing champagne, wine - unbelievable food! We stayed in the Horizon Club Suite, and as a result enjoyed breakfast on the 25th floor every morning - which again, were faultless. Great stay, might stay at Raffles if we return. Definately recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Buckstraveller95
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Shangri La en route to Bali. We had not visited Singapore before but friends had recommended this as a place to stay. How right they were. Having flown overnight from London with Singapore Airlines we arrived fairly early in the morning. Our room was a garden room overlooking the pool, and was fantastic, well it was a suite really with separate dining and sitting area! The staff could not have been more helpful, the concierge gave us some great tips for sighseeing and the reception staff were attentive and helpful. My wifes bag broke in the lobby and she was immediately surrounded by staff to help her, fix her bag and then carry it to the waiting taxi! She was stunnned and felt like royalty. We only had breakfast in the Line restaurant but what an experience. The choice was vast and everything was freshly cooked for you, including fried rice and noodles (yes I do recommend them for breakfast). The location is very central and with easy access to Orchard Road. We used the SIA hop on hop off bus to get around the city it is a good way to see the main sights. A 24 hour ticket costs $12 each for unlimited use, however if you fly with Singapore Airline and keep your boarding pass you get the ticket half price. We will return to Singapore and the Shangri La for longer next time. Singapore is a winderful city and the airport is a joy to travel through, it makes Heathrow feel very shabby and tired.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: BKKtraveller31
Reviews.Content: Beautiful gardens, delicious food. The Valley Wing rooms are really fabulous. Mr Ono the Concierge knows everything about Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “World Class Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: traveller0804
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri-La Hotel Singapore, and it was one of the most amazing hotels that we have ever stayed in. The Line Buffet was excellent for food and in the afternoons and evenings there was a chocolate fountain set up. The pool area was fantastic and the pool was very big and clean. The rooms were beautiful. Overall a fantastic stay.

Reviews.Title: “Better than ever”
Reviews.Author: Wattaworld
Reviews.Content: The Shangri-La Singapore is a luxurious experience that really makes a holiday. We were last here two years ago and it was good then, but now it's fantastic in every way. From the costumed doorman who cheerily greets you to the friendly reception staff, it's clear the hotel administration has put a lot of effort into making your stay memorable. Everything here is great fun - it's worth paying a little more for a Horizon Club room which includes daily drinks and restaurant-quality food on the 24th floor overlooking the horizon across Singapore. And there's no better five star big city hotel breakfast anywhere in the world than at the famous Line Restaurant here at the Shangri La. Such variety and delicious food to start the day off well. It was fun wandering down to the pool in our fluffy white bathrobes and white slippers...the pool area is also very attractive and surrounded by greenery and palms desipite being so close to the Orchard Rd shopping precinct. Thanks to the people at the Shangri-La who have made this such a distinctive, pleasurable experience. The Shangri-La truly belongs at #1 in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “dreadful”
Reviews.Author: boomsnap
Reviews.Content: They were doing extensive refurbishment works. The hotel had no right to be open and charging guests. All day all you could hear was pneumatic drills and jackhammers. I will never stay at another shangri-la again. Will it be better after the refurbishment. I shouldn't think so. they appeared to be just doing the rooms. The actual hotel is vast. The restaurants were very poor. I think once upon a time the hotel must have been lovely when it had the giant tropical gardens. But these have long gone. There's much much better.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel... would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: montgod
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife and two sons at the Shangri-la while I was taking some training courses in Singapore. We were able to secure a great rate that included breakfast and internet access. These rooms were designated as Horizon Club rooms. When we arrived, we were a bit surprised at how small our room was. Even though we received a great rate with favorable ammenities, I would have expected a larger room. Other thoughts on the room: - Nice bed - 3 pieces of fruit offered per day - nice touch. - 2 bottles of water at no charge (will provide more if asked). - Shower was a bit dated along with the rest of the bathroom. Not a huge deal though. - Can't turn on the bathroom lights in the evening because there is a fancy glass divider separating the room from the bathroom - hence anyone who is sleep, will be bothered by the light. - Door to bathroom and shower have awkward entrances. Bathroom door crowds bath area and shower door opens inward when the shower is already cramped enough. - Nice flat screen tv. Limited channels to watch, but you should be out exploring anyways. - A/C works very well. - Wierd lighting system from the different wall mounts that work sometimes and other times drive you crazy. On to the rest of the hotel. With the rate we received, breakfast was included. We had the choice to either dine at a restaurant called the Line or the Horizon Club lounge/The Blu. Both had excellent breakfast buffets and the attendants/chefs/waiters/etc, were all very helpful and courteous. The difference between the two is that the Line is a larger brunch location with more variety, but has a busier atmosphere compared to the Horizon Club lounge/The Blu where it's a lot quieter and private but a smaller variety of food. I recommend both of them depending on how you feel in the morning. I will say that the Horizon Club/The Blu has a great view from atop of the hotel as you eat. Some of the other great features of the hotel that we recognized are listed below: - They have a great gym with various cardio equipment, all in one type weight machines, smith machine, and free weights. I was impressed. - Pool is excellent for children and adults. Has two child pools that are great for your little ones. - Always many staff members around to help you at a moment's notice. Very helpful and courteous staff. On one occasion, we ordered room service and they sent up the wrong order for my wife and my portion. They didn't charge us for our son's meal and corrected the order promptly. Now, I will remind you that this is a five star hotel so you will run into those who believe they are more important than everyone else and they act accordingly. My wife and I didn't let them get to us and just smiled and kept going. Again, I am talking about hotel guests, not the staff. As I read before we came, this hotel is near the Orchard shopping area. It's about a ten minute walk, but not a bad walk at all. Before we came, we read about the walk and thought we would be walking a great deal, not the case at all. Its a very good location off the beaten path. Not as central as other hotels, but not a negative either. So overall, not a bad hotel at all. We enjoyed ourselves and the breakfast brunch will linger in our minds.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: travellingduo_9
Reviews.Content: What a FANTASTIC hotel, that more than exceeded our expectations. We stayed in one of the tower wing rooms which was more than adequate. Fantastic views from the bedroom windows, great air conditioning etc . We ate at Shang palace, and had an excellent cantonese meal. Breakfast at The Line is outstanding, a foodies dream come true! Location is ok due to the shuttle bus service to orchard road, and the very reasonable priced taxi service. Whilst staying in sinapore we visited the botanic gardens, beautiful, which included a fantasic orchard garden for an extra charge. We also went to the night safari which was a new take on a zoo visit, flying squirrels were fantastic! Overall, we stayed in singapore for 4 nights, before moving on to bali, and were so impressed with the high standards found throughout. The staff at shangri-la are organised, kind, welcoming, polite and very gracious. We cant waite to return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: SteveandSonya
Reviews.Content: From the time we checked in until our check out we had a wonderful time at this hotel. Service is beyond what we would have expected. At all times we were treated with such courtesy and kindness. Nothing was too much trouble. We stayed in a Horizon Club room which was serviced twice a day and was very clean and well supplied. Breakfast at the Horizon Club is a great start to the day and we received fantastic service from Barak each morning. In the afternoons Zul and Fairoz were extremely hospitable. The Horizon Club food is delicious and beautifully presented and they are very generous with drinks. We received wonderful advice regarding tourist attractions and restaurants. Fairoz was a wealth of information and we had a great night at Newton Circus on his recommendation. If you go there make sure you try the bbq stingray and chilli lobster from Stall 2. Fantastic! We loved Singapore and would love to return to the Shangri La with our children. The hotel provided such wonderful service, was very clean and well furnished. We found it to be in a perfect location for us. An easy walk to Orchard Road but in a lovely quiet street. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: nautilus360
Reviews.Content: Loved the place. Very nice room. Pity I was travelling alone and on business, would love to go back on a vacation! Staff was helpful and polite. Room service is great, didnt have to wait long for anything. Ate at Summit once and liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, on nostalgic trip”
Reviews.Author: Bonnieandtoby
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Shangri-la on 1st May for a 4 night stay. The hotel entrance is stunning, and check in was very quick, with friendly staff on reception. We were on the 14th floor, in a room with a pool view. The room was lovely, with a huge bed and a lovely bathroom. We had tea making facilities, with a nice selection of teas, which we used, not however the mini bar or snacks, as they were so expensive (e.g £3.50 for a Kit-Kat). Bathroom had very nice complimentary products, lovely fluffy white towels, robes and slippers. We'd read reviews saying it was very expensive to eat at the hotel, so we didn't eat breakfast there. However, complimentary fruit was left in our room every day, and we started our day by eating that with a cup of tea/coffee. The hotel has a courtesy bus to take you to Orchard Rd, which we used a couple of times, but it's not too far to walk, with the heat though, you need to stroll! We thought Orchard Road was lovely, it felt safe, and was just full of life. There is a large shopping mall near the MRT called the Wisma Atria, the food court (food republic) upstairs is great, we had some lovely meals there, really yummy, and not expensive. On our first night we went on the MRT which is great. We didn't buy any kind of travel pass, we just bought tickets as we needed them. When looking at the travel map, a local quickly offered help, seeing us looking a bit unsure, and we thought the Singaporeans were really lovely. Having chosen your destination it tells you how much it is e.g $2.20 and you pay an extra dollar, which you get a refunded after your journey. The MRT is very clean and easy to get around. We visited Clarke Quay, and thought is was very nice, but we had a drink in the Highlander, which was very expensive, 2 small Tiger beers (to make a pint) for hubby, and glass of orange (well half a glass, and loads of ice cubes) for me, cost $43.50!!! Over £20... Husband nearly fell over. Visited botanical gardens (free) which was pleasant, and later that day got the train, followed by a bus to the night safari zoo. Arrived at 7.50 and were a bit fed up when paying entrance fee, as the girl asked us whether we'd flown with Singapore airlines (which we had) but we didn't have our boarding cards. Would have been a bit cheaper. As it was, it cost $64 ($32 each), and we queued from 7.50p.m to 9.20p.m.( one and a half hours) for tram. Tram ride was pleasant, but only 40 minutes, so by 10p.m it was all over and we left, all in all with the long journey there and back not really worth it. We also visited China town, where we had the only meal we didn't enjoy. As my husband had served in the British Royal navy in the 60's, he'd been based in Singapore. We took a train to Sembawang, and a taxi to see if there was anything in the area my husband recognised, a sort of nostalgic trip, but there was nothing, it has changed so much. No little Kampong villages, all modern highrise flats, and malls. We also went to Sentosa, not on cable car. We made a mistake here. We remembered our boarding cards this time, and somehow found we could get there using Singapore airline bus (so we thought). Got on the bus in Orchard Rd, there was quite a long wait. Told we would have to change buses, can't remember which way round, but we had to change at Suntec city, and little India. So 3 buses, and a good 20 minute wait for each, so took ages to get to Sentosa. Once there we had a really nice meal at Coasts and enjoyed the gardens and sights of Singapore museum. On the Singapore airlines bus on the return, there was only us and 2 girls. They were more clued up, they had a map showing bus stops, we picked a stop nearest to our hotel, and the return from Sentosa only took about 20-25 minutes, a fraction of the time it had taken to get there. So we made a few little mistakes, as learners do, will know next time! All in all we had a fabulous holiday in Singapore, the wonderful hotel, wonderful people and yummy food. Would love to go again. From there we went on to Bali (will put post on about that) Fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Valley Wing!”
Reviews.Author: fudgiesfriend
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a stay here on route to the Maldives and it surpassed our expectations. Service was excellent - nothing was too much trouble and the staff were so friendly. Our room was lovely and very spacious with all the nice touches you could ask for. We had breakfast in "The Line" and the Summit room but preferred the Summit as it was less confusing and very tranquil. If you want to go on a round the world tour at breakfast then eat in The Line. Afternoon tea, all premium drinks and hors d'oeuvres in the evening were complimentary and served with finesse. It is a 10 min walk to Orchard Road but that's nothing and taxis are so cheap if you don't want to walk also there is a free shuttle every hour. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Top of the World”
Reviews.Author: diamond_directs2003
Reviews.Content: HI It was One of our dream come true to stay in this Hotel. We were staying in a Delux Suite. The Best suite ever seen. The best hotel ever seen in a clean country by name Singapore. We came to understand that when the US President came to Singapore, he also stayed in this same hotel (came to know from some sources). One can keep the dream of staying in this hotel atleast once in their life.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous - very memorable stay.”
Reviews.Author: Mei_C
Reviews.Content: Lunch on Saturday at The Line (international buffet): 4 tables of 21 pax. Here to celebrate a pre-Mothers' Day family lunch. Despite it being a Singapore public holiday and also a Saturday, the staff were full of smiles. The food was good as usual. With the various live cooking stations, there was plenty of options for everyone. I was really relieved that the background music wasn't loud. Previous times I came, there were occasions where me and my guests didn't feel too good due to the loud music. This time, the ambience was a lot better. I have a recent tripadvisor review posted under The Line. Check-in: After lunch, half of our group left the hotel for their own activities. The rest of us had booked for an overnighter under a Mothers' Day package. We had tried to check in before noon but the rooms weren't ready. Claudia at Front Office was terrific. She had offered to let us have a look at one of the Tower Wing Executive Rooms (Exec) to help us decide whether we wanted to upgrade or stick to the Deluxe Room. We were very lucky that there was a room for viewing. She tried her best to accommodate families on the same floor. And during lunch, she even personally popped into The Line downstairs to pass us the room keys! In the end, some of us stuck to Deluxe Rooms whilst the rest upgraded for a fee. The Rooms : The Deluxe and the Exec: Difference is the bathroom toiletries, the sofa and added desk for business. The Exec has one additional enclosed balcony so that meant that both my hubby and I have our own private reading niches complete with very cozy armchairs. Turndown service in the evening included 2 bookmarks, a change of all used towels and placement of hotel bedroom slippers beside the bed. Switches are all at touch panel beside the bed. Convenient. Btw, the bedroom slippers are super comfy and padded but if your partner is a sound sleeper, bring your own cos the hotel slippers do make a noise when you walk about in them. Horizon Club Lounge: Now 6 of us had Horizon Club access and was it worth it! It meant that any time we wanted, we could go up to the lounge and get a drink. Finger food available 6-8pm daily was so delicious that some of us skipped dinner after having the seared tuna, cocktail prawns, mini smoked salmon buns etc. Even the biscuits for the cheese were very fresh and crispy. Drinks available included 7 types of juices, coffee, tea and during cocktail hour, wine was also free flow. Zul at the Horizon Club lounge provided very good and cheerful service. Free usage of internet was available with 3 computer stations and hardly anyone used them. The Pool: Huge pool. And plenty of deckchairs. Some secluded for peace and privacy (away from the noise of children playing/swimming). And the towels have been designed not to fall off the deckchair. Though the pool towels are not very moisture absorbent. You may wanna bring down the towel from the hotel room if you plan on swimming. And once in a while, the pool crew comes by with rolled up face towels that have been chilled. Very refreshing. This time round, the weather was so hot, we were even offered fresh pineapple slices to cool us down. Breakfast: Additional venues such as the Waterfall Terrace, Garden Terrace were available because it was Mothers' Day when we awoke. However, I propose you go to The Line for a proper breakfast cos minor details such as butter for the bread, light soy sauce, pepper and salt shakers were omitted. The staff of course was helpful but i guess the place wasn't equipped. In the end, we headed for the Blu restaurant reserved for Horizon Club and oh, we should have gone there in the first place. I mean, the Belgian waffle was incredible. It came with oats and maple syrup. Fresh blueberries and raspberries and a side of whipped cream. Yummy!! Even the standard breakfast items were up a notch. I'd upgrade just for the breakfast at the Blu. And Simon was also another cheery staff. Checkout: Very speedy. And we were given complimentary parking coupons which would have otherwise cost us each S$12 for the 2 days we were there. In a nutshell: We all loved it -- we're already looking forward to our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “World Class”
Reviews.Author: Littlegull
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in the Valley Wing on our way back from Oz . The Hotel and in particular the Valley wing just oozes class. The service in the lounge and rooms just makes you want to go back (this is our second stay and there will be more). The Manager and all the staff have the ability of making you feel welcome. We have stayed in a few 5 star hotels around the world but this is number one.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice.”
Reviews.Author: DerelictShip
Reviews.Content: I had a choice of some of the big business hotels in Singapore and decided on the Shangri La based on a colleague's recommendation. I was not disappointed. Room was a good size, view of the city was pleasant, service was fantastic, pool and spa area were ideal and location was convenient for walking, public transportation and taxis. Not perfect: needs wireless internet in room (wireless only available in lobby), bed was too hard and was just two smaller mattresses put together. Singer in lobby bar (Mikki Brown) was excellent and buffet was expensive but worth it (especially the S$10 unlimited beer offer on weeknights!). Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: pacmusic08
Reviews.Content: We came here on a four day stopover for our honeymoon on our way to the Maldives. We were pleasantly suprised by how good the Shangri La was. It exceeded all our expectations. Firstly we were lucky enough to be upgraded to the Valley Wing of the Hotel. If you can afford it, book here because it has so many extras that you normally would have to pay for anywhere else in the hotel. We had our own breakfast dining room with personal waiter service, free snacks, drinks, cocktails, tea/coffee all day long in the lobby/foyer, free internet business room area and little suprises each night in our room (chocolates, flowers, fuit). The staff are excellent and eager to please. The pool area, restraunts, gym and lobby are world class. And you are only 5 minute walk to the main shops on Orchard Road. Singapore is a very clean city and we felt very safe here as all the locals seem very friendly and courteous. We loved this hotel and Singapore overall. If you can, extend your stopover and try this hotel for a few nights if on your honeymoon. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: sarahipswich22
Reviews.Content: Out ofthe 3 Shangri La's we stayed at for our honeymoon, we found the service best here (also stayed at Tanjung Aru and Kuala Lumpur). On arrival the concierge were right there to open the txi door and take our bags. We were taken to check in at the garden wing where we had been upgraded to for being honeymooners. Check in was very smooth even though we were early, very polite, friendly lady who insisted on going with us to our room and helping with our bags. Soon after arrival we went out to explore the local area, when we came back an hour or so later there was a bunch of roses, a chocolate cake and bottle of wine, rose petals on bed and card. Very thoughtful, we did not get anythuing from the Kuala Lumpur shangri La and just rose petals on bed from Tanjung Aru so were really impressed and touched by this. We were very pleased with all aspects of the service by all staff we came into contact with. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel, it excelled itself with the service.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: bl0wingbubbles
Reviews.Content: We had spent the previous week at the Rasa Sentosa but cut our stay short there due to the school holidays and the place overun with children. This meant our booking here was to be extended from 5 days to 7 days and on arrival we were informed the hotel were going to upgarde us from our previously booked garden room with pool view to a room in the Tower Wing and enrolled in the Horizon Club for our stay which included breakfast and free cocktails and snacks between 6 and 8 each evening. Impressive arrival and the room was exceptional but were just a little concerned that the Tower Wing room did not have a balcony were we could sit and relax early mornings and in the evenings. After 2 days we found the Tower a little too closed in and thanking the hotel greatly for their offer asked if we could go back to the original plan and move to the Garden Room. No problem but you wont get the cocktails free as this is part of the Horizon Club. Shame but no big problem. We then asked about the complimentary breakfast, NO you wont get that either. Now the cocktails I kind of understand, the Horizon Club is in the Tower Wing and is there for those guests but the breakfast made no sense. I asked why they had upgraded us in the fist place the response was because you had booked 7 days and were a valued guest but it appears your only valued in the Horizon Club. I argued if I was valued why are you taking away the complimentary breakfast as it made no sense. This clearly threw them but still they continued to refuse it was back to the garden room with no breakfast for you matey. Still bemused by the hotels claim of being valued I had one last try. I asked to see the Manager. The young lady on the front desk asked the purpose and I told her my issue. No problem of course you can have a complimentary breakfast Sir your a valued guest. I just dont get these places at times and as with the Rasa Sentosa they seem to try and make you feel welcomed but then somehow they seem to mess it up by not following through, Its a great hotel very well kept and our Garden Room with balcony was just want we wanted but I do find the place just outrageous with its costs. One evening we came back and ordered 2 coffees in the longe and was presented with a bill for 37 singapore dollars. I guess they have to recover the costs of those complimentary breakfasts from somewhere! Overall great place but if like me you dont like paying 37 dollars for 2 coffees I am told there are just as good hotels around in Singapore that are a little more reasonable. I just felt a little ripped off by this place

Reviews.Title: “Perfect antidote to a horrible journey!”
Reviews.Author: ginge33
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I stayed at the Shangri-La to have a few nights together after our wedding in Australia before coming back to the UK. We'd had a horrendous journey from Melbourne which meant we were delayed by a day (another story!) and needless to say we were pretty fed up by the time we got to the hotel. But when we checked in, the staff were so amazing (James Dean in particular!) and did everything they could to help us enjoy what was left of our stay. They found out we'd just gotten married and arranged for rose petals to be put on the bed in a heart and sent us chocolate cake and wine - just amazing. The room was lovely with a great view over the pool. The breakfast buffet was incredible - I honestly don't think there's a single thing that you wouldn't be able to get there! Their omlette's made in front of you were amazing. The staff were lovely and friendly and honestly nothing was too much trouble. We got a pretty good deal staying with them as we'd flown with Singapore Airlines who have cheaper rates and it made what would normally be a hotel we'd stretch to stay in, really affordable. Appreciate some of the comments about location but it's a short walk to Orchard Road and I liked that it wasn't too noisy or crowded. Cabs are really reasonable too so we didn't find the location a problem at all. Go! Stay as long as you can! It's wonderful! And tell James Dean we said hi!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: lilacrose
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here prior to going on the Eastern and Oriental express, it was a perfect start, we stayed in the Valley Wing which was beautiful. The staff were lovely, our room was superb, loved the drinks in the lobby. It was very hot and humid outside and it was like coming back to peaceful haven to walk into the lobby and have cool drinks served. We ate at 3 of the restaurants and enjoyed them all. The pool was another joy after hot sightseeing and I thought the gym was brilliantly equipt! Would certainly stay again, we have stayed at the Kowloon Shangri la several times so knew we would not be disappointed. We found it an easy little walk to and from Orchard road and the MTR station. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kingseat
Reviews.Content: We booked the Shang for our 2 nights en route back from Perth. We decided on this hotel as we stayed at Naumi Hotel for 5 nights on the way out where we saw and did everything we had planned then. Our 2 nights at the Shang were pretty much for R&R plus they guaranteed an 8 pm check-out for us which was fantastic as we were travelling with our baby son. We arrived at the Airport to be collected by a driver who took us direct to the hotel. We were met immediately by staff and taken straight to the Garden Wing. We received a complimentary upgrate to room 585 which was the Garden Suite. Huge room with separate living area. The room I think was slightly dated but sptolessly clean with a great bathroom and lovely L'occitane goddies. We also received some tea and fruit which were complimentary. As we did not arrive until 10 pm we put baby to bed and fell asleep ourselves. I read reviews on breakfast and was really looking forward to it. We were not disappointed. The spread and choice was absolutely fantastic. The food was also very fresh (I find at some hotels the food has been made earlier in the morning and looks and tastes that way!). We ate just about a little bit of everything but I particularly enjoyed dim sum and they also served the most delicious yoghurt I have ever tasted! We enjoyed breakfast so much we decided to give dinner a go. I don't mind a dinner buffet but my husband does prefer table service in the evening but with the quality of breakfast he gave it a shot. Again, not disappointed. Food was fantastic. I was concerned about the price of everything in Singapore, particularly for alcohol - we are not big drinkers but a couple of beers and a glass of wine of an evening on holiday are pretty common for us - drinks prices are expesive - not just at the Shangri-la but everywhere. The Shangri-la take $19.20 for a beer which is around £9 and the same for a glass of wine. If you are at the pool during the day take a look at the digital screen above the bar area as they detailed the current specials on for the time we were there. For instance on one night the buffet came with unlimted local wine, beer and juice for $88.00. We ate on the second day poolside. Just sandwiches and these were pretty standard - nothing really special. The pool attendants were around but didn't pester or bother you but were on hand if you needed them. The frequently brought us jugs of iced water during the day. Poolside foot massages are also availalbe and although I didn't take on I think I heard a rate of $57 for half an hour. The pool is super which a great area for children. I can't however see how they would cope if the hotel was full as there are just not enough loungers. Towels are provided and there is a stand with magazines etc for you to borrow or leave behind for other readers. I used the spa as a treat for my birthday. Very, very expensive but a good relaxing couple of hours spent in there - be warned though they will try and offer you additional treatments during your massage or facial - my therapist wanted me to take an eye treatment at the cost of $125 for 15 minutes! Just be prepared and say no if you want to. I used the business centre to catch on on banking. All very pleasant and I wasn't rushed to finish what I was doing either. Limo took us back to the airport. All in an excellent stay. Part of me does wish we stayed at the Shangri-la at the start of our trip but I do think having to take a taxi in the heat to get anywhere from the hotel would have annoyed me so still pretty sure we made the right decision with Hotel Naumi. We are emmigrating in September and if our flight takes us through Singapore we'd definitely stay again but this time I would like to try the Valley Wing.

Reviews.Title: “What a Bliss - cannot recommend it enough”
Reviews.Author: jaejaez
Reviews.Content: Ask a local Singaporean which hotel they would consider to be the most luxurious and the response will typically be the “Shangs”. Now this is surprising given it is an old property and also one with sub-par location. Nestled away from the bustle of Orchard Road, the hotel is difficult to reach on foot. Having stood its ground as the top hotel amongst the newer rivals such as the St. Regis and the Ritz despite such flaws, Shangri-La Singapore (hereafter SS) is still the ultimate symbol of refined luxury for business travelers and tourists alike. So how do they do this? I have stayed here four times – three at the club room (called the Horizon Club). Firstly, one would never guess that SS is several decades old upon entering the rooms. Smart lighting highlights the textures of rich wooden furniture and plush carpets. The view is soothing & is to die for. As for amenities, it has everything you would expect. Big LCD TV, separate shower with two sinks, speakers in the bathroom, steam iron, big cushy sofa etc. Many hotels in Singapore disappoint their guests upon entering the rooms as they are typically less grandeur compared to the lobbies. SS is an exception – the rooms escalate your senses upon entering and put you at the center of luxury. Now this is not to say that the lobby of SS is any less overwhelming – far from it! What the smaller hotels try to achieve with style & design, SS achieves with magnificence. You actually feel ‘smaller’ standing at the lobby with extreme high ceilings and wall decorations that are the size of their standard rooms. The service is professional, although at times feels less ‘personal’. Their procedures in interacting with guests have been very ‘standardized’ that at times you actually feel like speaking to robots. The service is also inconsistent. Those seated by the elevators at the Garden Wing, I thought, were very unfriendly (during all four visits) while those at the Club Lounge were exceptional every time. Perhaps this is a given as the lounge will welcome much higher-valued guests, but the gap should never be this huge. The breakfast at SS is something you have to experience to believe. You will need a good 5 minutes to walk around to see all the foods available. They have everything from sautéed mushrooms to fresh Kimchi! (I’m Korean btw). The foods at the lounge are plentiful and the staffs approach you frequently to refill your drinks. No issues with bringing guests into the Lounge unlike some other hotels. The swimming pool is also bliss – although choosing the wrong time to swim will put you amongst a throng of children. All in all, one of the best hotels I’ve stayed in although a bit on the expensive side. Choose this hotel to reward yourself with a luxurious atmosphere that does not disappoint. Not the best location & a few kinks with the staff attitude, but this is as good as it gets with a Singaporean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: NatsyLondon
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Everything was very beautiful - entrance, grounds, rooms. The service was amazing. I stayed in the Garden Wing and the room was great - as good as it looked in promotional pictures. I loved the view over the pool and lush plants. The breakfast was amazing. Have never been to a breakfast buffet like it. Ate there for dinner and enjoyed that too. I thought the location was fine as I wanted to shop and it was very close to Orchard Road. Singapore is a small place and taxis are so cheap you can easily get around. Would have liked to have spent more time at the hotel, enjoying pool etc. Luxurious and would love to stay there again.One of the best hotels I've ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad but below my expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Korean_rookie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night while on a stopover. Honestly, I was expecting much more from a Shangri-La hotel...the rooms were a bit old and they look so much better on the website! I was staying in a Garden Wing Deluxe City View Room and instead and all I can see from my balcony was constructions going on...not the kind of view I had hoped for. The balcony was a bit dusty and it looked a little grimy too and I will much rather stay indoors. Service was impeccable although they have a Chinese staff who can't really speak English attend to me when I asked for assistance. Love the room service and the restaurants though.

Reviews.Title: “Lacks any kind of atmosphere whatsoever!”
Reviews.Author: RobMo
Reviews.Content: It may well have been my fault for choosing to stay in this type of hotel as I am sure I am the wrong target market for them. Anyway, the oppolunce was apparent but entirely distasteful. It appealed to a certain type of traveller with over-priced everything, lots of marble and enourmous chandeliers. The service was 'official' but to me this came accross as a little stuffy. As with the communal areas, the room was luxurious but again lacked any kind of taste. It could have been better even if it was just made to feel more 'homely'. As it was it was just totally inpersonal. On the plus side, it was certainly more luxurious and if your idea of sophistication is marble, chandeliers and 'offical' service then this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: Peig_Sayers
Reviews.Content: I won't go into huge detail on this hotel as I think it's all been said before. We stayed in the Valley Wing. The room was super and the service even better. It is expensive but for once I actually felt it was worth it. The pool is lovely. Free broadband in the bedroom was also very useful. The only downside of staying here is that every other hotel now disappoints in comparison!

Reviews.Title: “Very,very good!!”
Reviews.Author: Tokkelosh
Reviews.Content: Everything has already been said about this hotel!!We stayed in the Tower Wing where everything was excellent!!We were picked up at the airport by limo,greeted with flowers and went straight into the lounge where we were fed champagne and canapes.Our 17 year old son shared our room(no other 5 star property would allow this,but their child policy is for up to 18year olds) which made the room cost that much more affordable.All in all a very nice experience.Downside?I did not like the location as one had to take their shuttlebus to town,but hey,who wants to leave such a great hotel if you can indulge yourself with afternoon tea and all the other hotel attractions!!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Pauline_1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Shangri La on our honeymoon. On arrival at Singapore airport we were greated by a member of staff from the hotel and taken outside where they had a car waiting for us. On arrival at the hotel we were greated by several members of staff who all individually welcomed us and congratulated us on our marrige, we were then taken straight to our beautiful room in the Garden Wing. Our room had a massive balcony and overlooked the beautiful gardens and pool. There was a gift of wine and a lovely cake along with tea and a big fruit basket. They had also arranged rose petals in the shape of a heart on our bed and put large bouquets of red roses around the room! It was wonderful to be greated like this - we were treated like royality. All the staff knew our names and would help with absolutely anything you needed. The hotel is in a great location. Its close to the stunning Botanical Gardens and the beautiful Orchid Gardens - the gardens are simply stunning and its a lovely way to spend a morning. The Line restaurant served excellent food, and very large beers! We had breakfast here every morning and it was excellent too - there was every kind of food you could imagine, it was expensive but worth it! The lobby bar is lovely and after a day of site seeing it was a great place to sit back and relax. One afternoon we treated ourselves to the champagne trio, which is 3 large glasses of Veuve Cliquot - the original yellow label, rose and the vintage, each came with canapes. It was delicious! Blu is in the 24th floor and has great views over the city. We didnt eat here, but relaxed on the balcony with a glass of champagne looking out at the city lights. The pool area and gardens are lovely and very well maintained. If you ask any locals what the top hotel is they will tell you its the Shangri La and we can see why, its simply faultless! This is a stunning hotel and should we return to Singapore we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Breakfast Experience”
Reviews.Author: Walton2
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Shangri La in Singapore for three nights en route to Borneo. We were very pleased with the room which overlooked the front of the hotel . The service in the hotel, with the exception of the poolside, was excellent, as you would expect from a 5 star hotel. We were on a Bed and Breakfast tariff and found the breakfast in the 'Line Restaurant' fantastic, a really world wide food selection and brilliant service. We did not eat in other than breakfast as we were exploring Singapore. The one area we were disappointed with was the less than expected service around the poolside. The pool itself was very nice but unlike the Mandarin Oriental in Kuala Lumpar which is also 5 star, you had to chase after your own towels and there was no iced water nor attentive staff. We found some great restaurants at Boat Quay and Clarke Quay and in China town had a fantastic meal in Da Dong (Smith St). Overall Singapore is expensive and the Shangri la is very expensive (cup of tea by the pool £7.50 - we only had that once! ) but it is a five star hotel, awash with staff and that is what you are paying for. The hotel is about 10 minutes walk from the top of Orchard Road and 15 minutes from the nearest tube, Singapore is a lovely clean city with lots to see. We will be back again and we would use the Shangri La again ( but make sure we had the B&B tariff again!)

Reviews.Title: “Still no. 1 for us”
Reviews.Author: WestAussiePerth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri La for five nights as a stop over from Europe. This was the second time our family have stayed at this hotel and as usual it was fantastic. We arrived at the hotel at about 7am, way before official check in time, but were given our rooms immediatley. After a 12 hour flight from Europe it was very much appreciated. The rooms were very spacious and had everything we needed. All the staff are so friendly and helpful. The pool is fantastic and the buffet breakfast is unbelievable. The hotel is a short walk from Orchard Road and taxis are always available for longer trips. We will definetly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelerExplorer
Reviews.Content: Shangri La Singapore is spectacular. If you are thinking about it, think no more. I would highly recommend it. It's certainly expensive but it's well worth it. The place is awesome. I stayed there one night with my wife and two young children. It was the perfect place. The staff is amazingly friendly, efficient, and professional. The property is beautiful, and the restaurants are second to none. We stayed in the Valley Wing. I'm sure all the rooms are nice, but book a room in the Valley Wing if you can. You pay more for the Valley Wing rooms but you also get so much more. There are snacks and refreshments throughout the day and breakfast at the Line is complimentary if you stay in the Valley Wing. I noticed that the bill at the Line was about $90 for 2 adults after service charges and etc. Again, the Valley Wing is expensive but the package included that $90 breakfast plus snacks, drinks, butler service, and a beautiful room. I believe there's a separate breakfast room when you stay in the Valley Wing. However, we ate at the Line because it was more suitable for a casual family breakfast. The food at the Line is superb. It was breakfast, but it resembled lunch buffets provided at other hotels. The variety of food would please anyone. We also spent some time at the pool. Again, it was a great place to relax and ideal for adults as well as children. The pool area felt like you were in a tropical resort because of the beatiful trees and garden that surround it. The pool was large and there's also a children's pool attached to the main pool. As for the hotel's location, it's a little distant from Orchard Road but there's a shuttle service provided by the hotel. The shuttle runs on a timetable and it stops at the Trader's Hotel, then at the Orchard MRT, and finally near one of the shopping malls further down Orchard Road before it loops back to the Shangri La. We took the shuttle to Orchard Road and walked back. The walk can be tiring, but it's not too bad. It should take less than 10 minutes. In any event, the way to get around in Singapore is the taxi, and there were always plenty lined up at the hotel enterance. We stayed at Shangri La for a family vacation. It was perfect for us, but Shangri La would be suitable for any type of traveler. The hotel is very accomodating. Shangri La is the best in Singapore. It certainly will be my favorite hotel in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds but hotel and food disappoint for the price”
Reviews.Author: bearshark08
Reviews.Content: We stayed only 1 night on a stop over from Bangkok to San Francisco. Booked a standard room through the hotel's web site and easily arranged for airport transfer. Airport transfer met with no problems and it was only a short 15-20 minutes to hotel. The Shangri-La has a nice check in policy of showing you immediately to your room. This was much appreciated and is a very nice feature. The hospitality specialist that handled our check-in was professional and efficient. Our room was spacious with a great view of Singapore and everything looked updated on the surface. Nice bed linens and comfy bed. The vanity area was set up well with a hair dryer...very convenient arrangement. If you look closely though, things are worn and a little dirty...much like the rest of the hotel. There was a substantial amount of mold in the shower. We were brought some tea right away which was nice and two plums which were were mealy so we tossed them. Walking around the hotel we noticed an odd smell which we were never able to place and we didn't like. Lunch at the cafe was extremely pricey and mediocre. Even by "hotel food" standards. Service was slow and unfriendly. The dessert bar area is a nice touch and we purchased some excellent chocolates. The counter person there was very nice and helpful. The pool area is fabulous and is the reason to stay here. It is great for kids with a several areas of varying depths. Pool area had lush greenery and beautiful fountains. The jacuzzi could be warmer but the jets were great. We checked out the Blu bar on the top floor of the the hotel which has incredible views. The restaurant manager was very friendly. Very pricey but really, you can't beat the view. Overall, the vibe of the hotel seems to cater to older travelers or people on business trips where family comes along. This may not be fair, but after the hip fresh D2 in Chiang Mai where we had just came from this hotel seemed stodgy and did not positively compare. This may just be our demographic. Overall, service in the hotel, with the exception of the main cafe, was excellent but something just didn't seem to come together for the total experience you expect from this level of hotel. I think for the price you can get more value for your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: janetravelsKent
Reviews.Content: We were met at reception straightaway, and upgraded to garden view rooms which were spotless, we had four rooms allocated all next to each other which was good, because we were travelling with children.
