That night we ate in the restaurant in the hotel which was buffet, there was so much choice and children loved the chocolate fountain, would recommend as the food was very good and so much choice. The staff were so helpful and the service first class. I would definately recommend a garden view room, very spacious and you get your own balcony. Overall nothing but praise for the shangri la.

Reviews.Title: “Easy to see why it's number 1”
Reviews.Author: malndebs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the final 2 nights of our Honeymoon and although the other hotels we stayed in were all excellent this place was something else. We arrived at reception and rather than checking us in we were taken upstairs to private check in on the Horizon Club floor. This was a nice surprise but the real surprise was when we were shown to our room. We had booked a Garden Wing room (which I have no doubt would have been great) but they upgraded us to a Premier Suite! It was amazing with a huge bed and while it had every comfort you would expect it was the little touches that made it so memorable. A congratulation cake, jasmine tea and fruit were waiting for us and the bed was decorated with rose petals, it's this attention to detail that really marks this hotel out as something special. The service was all that the Shangri-La group reputation would lead you to expect and more. Excellent breakfast and cocktails in the Horizon Lounge, we also had a superb Chinese meal at the Shang Palace restaurant. In short if you are staying in Singapore and want to make it special stay this is the only place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good facilities, location not so good”
Reviews.Author: MikeCMelbourne
Reviews.Content: High quality hotel with good facilities. You need to walk quite a distance to Orchard Road though. What you have is a quiet secluded resort in the heart of bustling Singapore. Can't find any major issues with this establishment

Reviews.Title: “Very Good but not Excellent”
Reviews.Author: DesertWoman
Reviews.Content: First impression from the outside is that it is very dated, but most of the inside tells a different story. When I say most, we stayed in the Horizon Tower and, in my opinion, this is showing its’ age. Don’t get me wrong, the room was very clean, adequate and a comfortable bed, but I didn’t think “ooh this is nice” when I walked in, it just felt like a normal good standard room that could do with a bit of updating. Other posts have mentioned that their rooms had recently been renovated, I can only assume they hadn’t done ours yet. One other comment about the room, although not a major issue, is that it didn't have a separate shower as mentioned on the website room description. We booked directly with the hotel, their website gives different package options and they say they won’t be beaten on price. We decided to go with the club room and glad that we did when we found out the price of food and drink at the hotel, and outside for that matter. We took breakfast in the Blu restaurant on the club floor, this was excellent with plenty of choice with the buffet and a la carte menu - and the fried eggs were cooked exactly to order, not an easy thing apparently judging by the other hotels we stayed at on this trip! If not included in the price, breakfast costs SG$40 a person. All the staff on the club floor were very pleasant, attentive and would help with anything you asked for. We did make the most of the club lounge and went to the early evening cocktail drinks each night. I’m glad we did as the first night we went to an outside restaurant, nothing grand, a can of Guinness cost SG$18. We also found out later that the cocktails in the hotel were SG$25 a go, so the additional cost of the club lounge well and truly paid for itself. We also tried some of the local food outside the hotel. We ate at the Maxwell hawker centre in Chinatown, limited choice of mainly chicken and rice but food was excellent and cheap at SG$3 a meal. The lady concierge at the hotel recommended a good roti pratta café near River Valley Road, fantastic! It was a true locals place and the roti and chicken curry were excellent and less than SG$10 for two. Overall the service and staff at the hotel were very good and the hotel is in a convenient location within walking distance to the shops, restaurants and bars of Orchard road as well as the MRT. For the price though, I have stayed at better hotels and would probably check out the others if I were to return to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Mini Bar Madness”
Reviews.Author: Funkydad
Reviews.Content: Yes folks I have the price list in front of me.Small botle of Evian $8.50, Kit Kat Bar $7.00 but best of all a packet of two [yes 2] shortbread biscuits is $7.00. Next I have to mention that although the pool is very inviting there are nowhere near enough sunbeds so we have the ridiculous situation of bagging the beds with a towel and a book early in the morning even though you might not want to swim until the afternoon. When we enquired at the Customer Relations desk if they could come up with a solution they simply told us you have to get there early. In a 5 star hotel this foolishness should be solved by buying about 100 more beds, stacking them somewhere so no one needs to bag a bed. The staff apart from the Customer Relations person????? are unfailingly pleasant and anxious to please. Service is a bit hit and miss at times - dirty towels not removed from the room, running out of breakfast food at Blu but everyone seems to be working hard to make your stay a good one. Unlike many reviewers I find the menu at Line somehow " not what you want" and a bit limited. At the Park Hyatt down the road they have a much better grip on it in my view. So - I might stay again but they need to sort out the pool. Probably I would look around a bit more before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kathy S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri-La in October for 2 nights, we had booked a Club Room and on arrival were escorted up to the private check in area. The room was lovely with modern, comfortable furnishings and the biggest bed I have ever seen. Breakfast at the Line Restaurant is absolutely amazing with so many stations serving different foods. We could have taken breakfast in the Club Lounge but had heard such good reports about this restaurant which were not wrong. The grounds and the pool were lovely; a nice way to cool down after a day of sightseeing, there is even a mini golf course. Overall this hotel is beautiful and the staff are faultless, this is one of the more expensive hotels in Singapore but would definitely stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Locatio”
Reviews.Author: fulstoneflyer
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Shangri La for 3 nights on route to Australia. We had booked a Club Room having had similar at the Grosvenor - Dubai last year. The room was OK but certainly not of the standard in Dubai. The room had good views over the city but sadly lacked a balcony. The Club Facilities were again OK but not special, I,m not sure it is worth paying the extra for a Club Room. The location of the Shangri La is ideal for Orchard Road where most of the shopping/eating/drinking places are situated. We used the subway (MRT) to get around which was cheap and efficient. We went out of the City on the MRT and visited the Chinese/Japanese Gardens. Great place to walk around and free!

Reviews.Title: “Great stop over hotel”
Reviews.Author: M90_AMT
Reviews.Content: Loved the Shangri La on a 1 night stop over. The service was excellent from when we arrived in a taxi and the doors were opened for us and we were met by a receptionist who took us from the taxi, to check in, and then took us to our room. The bed was really comfortable, the room a reasonable size, well stocked mini bar, complimentary water, nice bathroom with bath and walk in shower, lots of fluffy towels, bathrobe and slippers, nice toiletries- very comfortable room in the tower wing. We opted to buy breakfast and I don't think I've ever seen such an amazing choice at a breakfast buffet. From dim sum, sushi, all kinds of fruit, omlettes, english hot breakfast, all types of yogurt, breads and pastries - the number of chefs on is the most I've every seen at a breakfast buffet, all at their own world station - it was expensive but worth it. We took our bags to check out and as soon as we got out of the lift there was a bell boy to put them in storage so we could enjoy the rest of our day. There were loads of staff on and this made it a wonderful experience as there was no queueing, and they immediately attended to your requirements.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location.”
Reviews.Author: JAW130
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel by any standard and deserves to be at the top of the list on tripadvisor. Service is how you would expect in Singapore (second to none) and the location of the hotel is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Finest Hotels in the World”
Reviews.Author: LondonSteve2008
Reviews.Content: The Shangri-La in Singapore in January 2008 for 3 nights. The memories are blissful - this is what all hotels should aspire too. Stayed in a Club Room, very large room with lovely, modern, comfortable furnishings. Choose your pillows from the pillow book. Breakfast is absolutely amazing with around 20 stations serving different foods. Quality is top notch. For dinner, the Shang Palace on the ground floor was an outstanding chinese restaurant. Service was faultless. Grounds and swimming pool are also good (but perhaps not what you come for anyway). Stayed in a Club Room in the Mandarin Oriental for 3 nights directly after this stay. As a comprison, the Oriental is completely outclassed on all levels - its just no contest. Going to Singapore and can afford it? Stay in the Shangri-La.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Neachell
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic, they make you feel like royalty. The staff are excellent, the standard all round is the best you will ever find.

Reviews.Title: “absolute luxury”
Reviews.Author: CleopatraHampshire
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights in the Valley Wing, it was beautiful. rooms were very comfortable, and I found the beds very comfortable. Moet and Chandon champagne when required. gardens lush and a wonderful oasis in the middle of all the bustle. Nibbles with drinks were a weak point, especially as I then stayed in the Shangri La Bangkok. Here afternoon tea and evening canapes were far superior. Would recommend this hotel for luxury , superb staff and a quiet oasis in the center of Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, loved it”
Reviews.Author: marthasmum
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on my honeymoon a few years ago. It was fantastic, they did upgrade us cos of the honeymoon. But I absolutely loved it. The staff were sooo nice. The food, at breakfast was spectacular. The rooms are just outstanding. The signature smell of lavender will stay with me forever.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: paul826nas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri La, Singapore on the first 2 nights of our honeymoon prior to moving on to Australia touring, as a little bit of a luxury. after being picked up in a top end mercedes limo from the airport, we were whisked to the hotel and checked in without any fuss. the palatial lobby is something to behold and it takes your breath away. we were informed that we had been upgraded to a better room, and upon arrival at it, we found that there was a celebratrion cake and fruit in our room. the hotel was marvellous and the staff bent over backwards to ensure that our stay was memorable, which it most certainly was. the food and drink although expensive was very good, but then for a 5 star hotel were not too bad. this hotel is well placed for the shopping centre and fairly close to Raffles Hotel, which is of course obligatory to visit to enjoy the Singapore Sling. all in all a great place to stay to pamper yourself, would definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Valley Wing package very disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: Travelauthor
Reviews.Content: OUr agent recommended the Shangri La for the two nights we would be in SIngapore following our cruise. We paid for the Valley Wing which was the more exclusive accommodation and were told the price covered breakfast, afternoon tea, canapes and drinks in the evening. We had stayed at the Shangri La Hotel in Hong Kong and been very impressed with the wonderful hot nibbles that were offered on the buffet. We are not big drinkers but we did enjoy having the evening canapes that were freely on offer. However we soon discovered that the SL in Singapore was quite a different proposition. The breakfast was fine, no complaints there and we were never in the hotel during the afternoon tea hour. However when we arrived home from shopping and touring and went down to enjoy the canapes, we were suprised to be given merely one plate each with three very small and mostly cold offerings. No buffet as we had been expecting and a very stingy offering. Certainly it was nice to have the two glasses of wine we enjoyed but as far as the canapes went, that was it for the evening. After that we were told there were cookies available. Not very enjoyable with a glass of wine... Apart from that, our room was certainly large with a nice aspect but the bed was very very firm. Both my husband and I ended up having to take medication for our sore backs. We ordered room service one evening but the food was very ordinary and not worth the money. We ate a hundred times better at one of the food malls on Orchard Road. So, despite paying the extra for a Valley Wing room it was very disappointing and not worth the money. WOuldn't stay at the SL in Singapore again.

Reviews.Title: “mindblowingly beautiful - the shangri-la group have done it AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: bekky707
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Valley Wing with my mum and my toddler and just though it was AMAZING. STAFF - exceptional! CLEANLINESS - brilliant ROOM - Just LOVELY Have stayed in Singapore many times and this is just one of the best............step out into the buzz of Singapore in just minutes.....or stay in the hotel for South East Asian luxury, tranquillity and tropical beauty. Don't get me wrong.......I have stayed in more luxurious hotels.....but the Valley Wing is just a gem. Understated, unpretentious and discreet.....no footballers' wives feel here! I just feel everthing about the hotel and the rooms has been perfectly thought out ...... to the point one is supplied with small packets of laundry powder in the room for washing underwear if needed. If u are looking for a haven in the midst of a vibrant city then this is it!

Reviews.Title: “A Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: wel0veh0lidays
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in the Shangri La in Singapore for a two night stop over en route to Bali. We arrived at 6am after a direct flight from the UK. The reception staff were really efficient and we were able to check in to our room even at this time. The hotel lobby is grand and our room was a good size with a nice bathroom with large walk in shower. The bed was really comfortable! Breakfast was included with our room price and was very good. There was a large selction of food available on the the buffet breakfast. Sign posts direct you to different stands with various styles of food available at each one. The coffee shop next door to the restaurant serves beautiful homemade cakes. Well worth a slice or two. For those of you who like to work out there is a large well equipped gym and the pool is very good too. However be wary of the price of drinks by the pool side. We ended up paying approx £8 for a large bottle of water! The location of the hotel is great for shopping and sight seeing. You can easily walk to Orchard road for shopping and taxis aren't expensive. We would recommend a vist to Singapore zoo. The flyer is big! and Clark Quay was a good night out. Try the chilli crab. It's delicious. No trip to Singapore is complete without a Singapore sling in the long bar at Raffles. Overall Singapore is a safe and clean city and the Shangri La is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel but a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: Le066
Reviews.Content: the hotel itself is very nice, on a huge plot with pool and gym at the centre. I stayed in the garden tower which had a really big room and nice balcony overlooking the gardens in the middle. I was disappointed in the location though, it was 5-10 min walk to orchard road and the metro station. the tv was quite old fashioned as well - with this price and type of hotel I expect a flat screen tv in this day and age.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in the world”
Reviews.Author: Eric060
Reviews.Content: I have once again stayed at the Valley wing at Shangri la. As always the experience is unbeatable. The room, the service, the pool, the friendliness of the staff - everything was exceptional. The champagne bar is really something special - free champagne or wine or whatever I wanted all day long. The champagne is Moet et Chandon which is my favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile ...”
Reviews.Author: The_bald_gourmet
Reviews.Content: For many people, Singapore is synonymous with Orchard Road, huge air-conditioned malls, immaculately dressed locals, sweating tourists and five star deluxe hotels. Say Orange Grove Road and Tanglin to many people and they will look at you with slight bemusement. That’s unless they have stayed at the Shangri-La Singapore because that is where you’ll find this luxury hotel tucked away just a few minutes off Orchard Road. The Shangri-La is slightly odd in one sense in that it gives you the feeling that you are in a destination resort and at the same time wrapped up in sophisticated opulence. Delightfully odd! True, the time before my most recent visit happened to coincide with a major international security conference whose attendees included the US Secretary of Defense, Robert Gates. Suffice it to say that security was tight! However that didn’t affect my feelings about the hotel. Far from it! The ease with which this complex, high profile event was managed with only minor inconvenience for people like me speaks volumes. From the time you arrive at the hotel you will encounter some of the best hotel staff to be found anywhere in the world. The brightly costumed and incredibly polite guys who open your car door tend to rather be outshone by the graceful and beautifully dressed young ladies who will greet you with a smile and warmth that will melt any jet-lag. The front desk staff are the definition of efficiency and really make you feel like you are the only guest in the hotel. In my experience no request is too large and there is never that sense of “please don’t ask me … ask the other person … it’s their job” that one sometimes finds in large hotels. The lobby is a large expanse of cream colored marble with tall columns leading your eye to enormous crystal chandeliers. Off to one side you will find a lounge area with comfortable chairs and sofas and is a good place for coffee and meeting people for business discussions. Order a cappuccino and you will receive a terrific cup of coffee delivered with four choices of flavors that will be stirred into your drink before your very eyes. A very nice touch! From the lobby you will either be shown to your room in the Tower Wing or will be taken to the Garden Wing of the hotel. The Valley Wing has a separate entrance and as I have yet to stay in this part of the hotel, I will leave it to those lucky people to describe that part of the Shangri-La! The Garden Wing rooms are large and airy with a décor that is somewhat reminiscent of destination resort in style. Mine overlooked the large pool and had a flower festooned balcony on which I happily whiled away the odd free hour. The Tower rooms are not quite as spacious but have (I think) been relatively recently renovated. The bathrooms are excellent with both a walk in shower and bath tub and are separated from the living area by a wall of glass blocks that make the space feel light and spacious. Add to that the ubiquitous toiletries and soft fluffy towels and bathrobes and you may have found your bathroom heaven (well that may be over stating the case a bit!!). Many people will visit the “Line” restaurant for breakfast, lunch or dinner. True, it isn’t inexpensive but it is an unusual experience where one can select food from various “stations” spread around the restaurant. It is difficult to explain, which I have clearly just demonstrated!! Anyway, it’s worth a try. “Blu” is set atop of the Tower Wing and has wonderful food, a great bar with excellent cocktails and occasional live music. Whenever I have been there it has been quiet and relaxing and a haven from the crowds at Boat or Clarke Quay or the various Orchard Road “haunts”. Singapore for me is like a second home. I adore the people, the food and even the weather! I used to stay at the Hyatt but I really enjoy the Shangri-La. OK it may not have the “edginess” of newer hotels or the colonial grandeur of Raffles but it has everything I need on my trips with one added luxury; the smile that comes from staff who either really enjoy what they do or are unbelievably well trained … or maybe it’s both.

Reviews.Title: “Treated Like Royalty”
Reviews.Author: topcop999
Reviews.Content: We decided to have a 3 day stop in Singapore whilst en route to Cairns, Australia for our Honeymoon Sept 2008. As it was a special occasion we decided to treat ourselves to a 5 star hotel and as it was only 2 nights, the cost was manageable. We paid about £250 per night for a Garden Wing Room which although we didn't request, did overlook the pool; what a bonus. Tower wing rooms are cheaper. I was thrilled to bits with the service from landing at the airport. We booked a limousine pickup through the hotel and upon exiting the airport which wasn't at all crowded like some arrivals areas; we were met by an immaculately dressed female with our name on a board. She promptly ushered a driver across and both took our luggage. We were given a guided tour of the city en-route to the Shangri La by a very knowledgeable driver. The limo was immaculate, air conditioned and free bottled water available. (I think the pickup cost was around £45 - well worth it for such a treat) Taxi’s even cheaper and the MRT mentioned later runs right into the airport. Upon arrival at the Shangri La, a reception committee awaited and again we didn't have to touch our luggage. Another wonderful receptionist called Cherlyn ushered us to our wonderful spacious room in the garden wing, closely followed by our luggage. We didn't even have to attend the desk to check in - it was all done in our room within seconds. From landing at the airport we were in the room within 55 minutes! We took advantage of a very comfortable and large bed to catch up on a little sleep before admiring the large pool and Jacuzzi in the gardens. The pool was open until 22:00 hours and just the right temperature. Each day we had fresh fruit in the room, on the second day a lovely decorative heart made from petals on the bed and two roses on the pillows. They also sent us a cake congratulating us on our honeymoon which I only mentioned at the time of booking, 7 months prior. Normally Hotels of this grandeur become so enveloped in their own success they forget about minor details such as this which really meant a lot. Every staff member was courteous and friendly and couldn’t do enough to help. This must be what makes the Shangri La stand out above the rest. If I had one criticism only, it would be that the price of the drinks and food in the various restaurants around the hotel was beyond our normal budget. I am sure though that this hotel is really geared up for those earning slightly more than we do. That aside I would still return and remember, you don’t necessarily have to eat there – just enjoy the splendour of the rooms, pool, service and ambience of the hotel in general. Upon venturing out, it was quite humid and I would recommend shorts and T shirts unless you are eating at the Shangri La. (Long trousers and a shirt more suitable) The Shangri La is situated just five minutes walk from Orchard Road and only ten to fifteen minutes to the Orchard MRT station – mentioned later. I would suggest a copy of the Berlitz pocket or Rough Guides guide to Singapore; very concise and informative. It is worth looking up when the festivals are happening and booking to suit these dates. Singapore being multicultural often has Hindu, Buddhist and Muslim festivals. When we were there it was Hindu Deepavali (Festival of lights) everything was colourful and pretty in Little India. Singapore has a fantastic MRT (Mass Rapid Transport) underground system. It is very cheap, clean, air conditioned, graffiti free and trains run every 2 to 6 minutes until midnight. Many stations have a ticket booth where you can buy an EZ Card. (Orchard Road has one) Basically you charge the EZ card with an amount of cash and simply swipe it upon entering and exiting your relevant stations. We put the equivalent of £7.50 on a card and didn't even use half of it in 3 days despite going everywhere on the MRT. Some bus routes also allow the EZ card to be used. The MRT stations have a map available to assist you in getting around. Singapore has many areas worthy of viewing, Little India, Chinatown, Raffles Plaza, Clarke Quay, Marina Bay, Jurong Bird Park, Sentosa Island (Via cable car from Harbour MRT station) In Little India we went to a great restaurant called Komala Vilas, 76 Serangon Road for a lunch time THALI BIRYANI. As it is mainly Hindu, much of the food is vegetarian. I was amazed that beetroot curry could taste so wonderful!. At this restaurant we ate our THALI (A sample mixture of curries, pickles, rice and chapatti) from a banana leaf with our ‘right’ hand, just like and with the locals, all for around £4. I also recommend the delicious mango lassi (Yoghurt/fruit smoothy). Eat upstairs, it is less crowded. Onto Chinatown, look out for Smith Street where there are around ten stalls selling freshly cooked Chinese noodles, fish, shells and meat dishes for as little as £2. You find a seat, go up to any counter you wish and it is cooked immediately in front of you in minutes. Again, clean and full of locals and culture. The Buddhist temple is well worth a visit – be careful not to be scantily clad. If you fancy a little more upmarket then there are various 'food courts/hawker centres' dotted around. They are all open late and are very clean with a cleanliness grading system from A to D (Government run cleanliness initiative) I recommend the food court near to NEWTON MRT station. It is open late, has a very good range of MALAYAN, THAI and CHINESE food, obviously fresh and served with lovely cold TIGER beer at around £3.50 per large bottle. We had chilli squid and huge grilled prawns for around £8 – never had squid so fresh and tender. If you want even more upmarket air conditioned food courts they are located in the big shopping centres off Orchard Road and at HARBOUR MRT. No doubt they are more upmarket but for me they lack local ambience and are pricier due to their locations. I found little difference in the food. Orchard Road is a shopper’s paradise, though I doubt there are any bargains to be had. Everything is already priced up and bartering for goods only really takes place in the Markets in Little India and China town. Be sure to have a look round all stalls before you commit. Prices can be three times less on a neighbouring stall. Clarke quay is the place to be at night for late pubs, disco’s and gourmet eateries. No doubt it is quite pricey compared to the food courts and don’t be surprised to be paying £8 per alcoholic drink. In Singapore however the choice is yours, you can do it on a budget, or split down the middle as we did. We even ate at raffles Long Bar with our Singapore Sling – the food was cheaper than the cocktails! The Swisshotel is well worthy of a visit near Raffles Plaza. After 3pm the bar on 71st floor opens and the views are amazing, right across to Malaysia. You can just go up to admire the view and play in the high speedlift, but it would be good manners to buy a drink for that free view! All in all I wish I had booked a week or more there, I could have definitely filled it and I will be back. (Most definitely at Shangri La) No need for jumpers and coats, just brolleys in case it rains. If it does, it is however nice rain, warm and normally over in an hour. We spent around £200 in 3 days and did’t go hungry!! Enjoy!! (No spitting or chewing gum either)

Reviews.Title: “Valley Wing - Amazing 10/10”
Reviews.Author: browa32
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during our Honeymoon. The valley wing is worth the extra amount of money, from the quality of the room, to the breakfast, Moet Champagne, Canapés, High Tea Delights, Service from the butlers, and much much more. The Shangri La Valley Wing is without doubt the best place to stay in Singapore. Hotel is an excellent location, it is a 5 Minute walk from the top of Orchard Road, 10 Mins to the Botanic Gardens. I would go to this part of the hotel again. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Tobocop
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this amazing hotel for five days while on honeymoon in Singapore. Its probably the best hotel we have ever stayed in. Every element of our stay was perfect, we stayed in the garden wing and our room was excellent. Breakfast at the line restaurant is something truly special. Hotel is in a good location a 10 minute walk from orchard road and the staff are all so friendly and helpful. We wouldnt be back as soon as we can.

Reviews.Title: “As good as it gets.”
Reviews.Author: welwyn_steve
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a couple of days on route to Borneo. It was great for a stopover hotel. The basement breakfast bar is the best I have ever seen, and I have stayed in plenty of other 5 star hotels. The location is fine, walk down the hill and you're on Orchard Road, plent of shops, bars and eateries. Service was excellent and with two older teenage children to impress (they're not easily impressed) the staff did a fantastic job. From treating them like adults, checking them in, delivering them to their own rooms, nothing was too much trouble. I wouldn't hesitate to go back again if I am travelling to Asia or Australasia with the family.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: whatithinkofthis
Reviews.Content: All the good points have been made in previous reviews but I would like to just emphasise how good the service is here. I stayed in the Valley Wing and, though very expensive, the free afternoon tea, canapes and drinks go some way to mitigating against the high cost. The eggs benedict for breakfast was the best I've had and the Singapore Sling was far better at the Shangri La than the ready mixed mediocrity being served at Raffles. It isn't as centrally located as some hotels but taxis are pretty cheap and it's worth a few minutes in a taxi if it means you can stay at such a wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Junkster
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Shangri La twice and been very impressed with the service and facilities. We managed to get upgraded on our first stay as the room we had booked wasn't available. The staff's attention to detail was most impressive and nothing was a problem. Shangri-La puts on one of the best breakfasts - everything is catered for and it filled us up for the whole day. The pool and garden areas are very attractive. Shangri-La is a pleasant and peaceful oasis just 5 minutes walk to bussling Orchard Road. It is a 5 star hotel that makes everyone feel welcome, comfortable and at home.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic city hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TK_NAK
Reviews.Content: The Shangri La is the perfect hotel if you are looking for comfort and good location. The rooms (we stayed at the garden wing) are very nice and the serivce is excelent. The hotel is located only 5 minutes walk away from Orchard road. It is a quiet oasis from all the noice in the city. It is just perfect to enjoy a swim in the lovely pool after a day of shopping. You also have to enjoy a drink at the skybar. Fantastic view of the city skyline!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Kouran
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights in the Shangri-La on a return from Bali to London. The Hotel is very pleasant with wonderful rooms. We were in the Tower Wing with a 14th floor room with wonderful views of Singapore. The hotel is in an ideal location for strolling down to Orchard Road without being in the hussle and bussle of the busy streets surrounding Orchard Road. We loved Bar Blu and would definately go back - forget about Raffles, the cocktails in Bar Blu are just as good, cheaper and you get a far better service with views to die for! The service is fantastic with a great room and the grounds are huge and worth an explore.

Reviews.Title: “Great for special break”
Reviews.Author: Headhunter13
Reviews.Content: We tacked on 5 days at the Shangri La staying in the Garden Valley wing at the end of our SE Asia Honeymoon and I cannot praise it highly enough, the garden valley wing is an all inclusive break and it's free champagne (Moet) and high class food from 11.00 am till 10.00 pm. The rooms are spacious and luxurious and the staff are very attentive, a reasonable location and a much better option than the faded grandour of Raffles.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: PipkinsLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of the Singapore Airlines stopover package (which is well worth it!). We missed one night's accomodation due to a problem with the airline so on arrival they instantly upgraded us to a "Garden Room" which was a nice surprise! Check in was swift and the room was huge! It had a large balcony which looked over the swimming pool with two sun loungers on. The room has everything you could wish for and more. We had a meal there which was very nice. This is a five star hotel but with out the stuffiness!

Reviews.Title: “Needs a refurb”
Reviews.Author: chookie69
Reviews.Content: Time for a refurb - rooms are starting to look old and tired and for the price better hotels around in Singapore. Had issues on check in but they were sorted easily. Breakfast is over rated and too expensive. Wouldnt go back to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not my cup of tea..”
Reviews.Author: Salimmmmmmm
Reviews.Content: Great service (as you wouold expect in Singapore), good facilities, has a nice pool/spa/gym and excellent restaurants (the japanese one is fantastic!!). The rooms are very spacious however they feel old and too pretentious for comfort. The views are great but they lack charm and character. It is NOT located in downtown Singapore, about 5-10 minutes by cab ride. It is great for families, not for singles and the young crowd. Offers the luxuries and services for business people but is far from where the action is. overall a good hotel you wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, rooms and breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Equality_7-2521
Reviews.Content: From the Mercedes pick up at the airport to the fantastic buffet breakfasts, this place is simply wonderful. We stayed for 3 nights with our 2 children aged 15 and 8. There was a slight problem with our booking caused by our agent - not the hotel and we were immediately upgraded to a suite at no extra cost. This gave us free breakfast, drinks and internet access. The hotel is a model of hushed efficiency. The service is attentive but never noticeable or constricting. I could easily compare it to Gleneagles. Everyone from the immaculate girls in the foyer to the chefs in the restaurant were wonderful. Our room was on the 17th floor and had a great view north over the skyscrapers that seem to emerge from the Singapore jungle. The bathroom was huge and they brought an extra single bed into the room to make us more comfortable. The highlight was possibly the chocolate birthday cake that appeared for our son as staff had noticed his birth date at reception. A lovely and highly appreciated touch. I couldn't think of a better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Zoballoos
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location - just a five minute walk and you are at one end of Orchard Road. The hotel staff and service is quiet and wonderful. The breakfast has everything you can think of and more. Wonderful swimming pool and again quite quiet. The rooms are large and very clean Drinks etc in the bar are extremely expensive £20.00 for a small wine and small beer!!! So I would suggest that you go onto Orchard Road and go into Muddy Murphys Bar which is cheaper and has all of the locals in there.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Patrick055
Reviews.Content: It's over 3 years since I visited Singapore (May 05) and stayed in the Shangri-La. I feel slightly guilty that I have written 3 reviews for TripAdvisor and all have been negative, so I'd like to write about the fantastic stay my girlfriend and I had in the Shangri-La. Our travel agent was offering a deal where guest could avail of a free upgrade to the Garden Wing. The room was excellent, as were the rest of the facilities. The spa and pool areas are luxurious and well-maintained. As other reviewers have pointed out, the Line restuarant does a fantastic restauant buffet, well worth the money if you don't have breakfast included in your room rate. My girlfriend and I would normally rise late and eat "brunch" in the Line which would fill us up until our evening meal. Although we might have a snack pool-side later also! The pool really deserves special mention. The staff were wonderfully courteous; bringing guests fresh towels, a cold facecloth, a complimentary non-alcoholic cocktail. We spent many, many hours relaxing in and by the pool. It is truly wonderful. We also ate in the hotel's Chinese restaurant "Shang Palace" which, as far as I can remember, was very nice. The only things about this hotel that are remotely negative for me are the location and the fact that the hotel doean't have a "bar". The beautiful lobby serves as the lounge bar; it's nice, but it's not very intimate for having a pre-dinner drink. The location, as other reviewers have noted, is not great. It's about a 10 minute walk to the subway (more painful than it sounds, given Singapore's humidity), but taxis are cheap and plentiful. Despite staying there 3 years ago, the Shangri-La is very much in my mind at the moment as my girlfriend are booked to go back there as part of our honeymoon in November. It being rainy season, we may not get a chance to leave the hotel, but we don't mind, it's that good! Seriously, don't consider any other hotel in Singapore, it's fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Serenity & luxury”
Reviews.Author: Boyfromoz_8
Reviews.Content: We recently had a week in Singapore and were very pleased to have chosen the Shangri-La as our base. The hotel was built as a flagship, and whilst it may be a little dated in some areas, the grandeur is still very evident. After a busy day of playing tourist it was always a delightful experience to return to the cooling, lush garden environment and the friendly welcoming staff, that are Shangri-La. The buffet breakfasts were always a great start to the day, and dinner in the Blu restaurant, with spectacular views of the city skyline, was something special. Overall, we had a superb time at the Shangri-La and would be happy to return when next in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning..”
Reviews.Author: pk475
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in June 2008 on a stopover to Phuket.. As it was part of my honeymoon i emailed the hotel prior to let them know and on arrival we were met at the airport (i had booked a transfer in a hotel car prior to arrival) and infomed that we had been given a complimentary upgrade to a 1 bedroom Suite in the Valley Wing (i had booked a tower wing horizon club premier room to start with)..Check in was brief and carried out in our suite by our personal butler and we were informed of all of the benefits of the Valley wing itself, too many to mention here. Complimentary champagne was available on tap at any time of the day or night in the valley wing lobby along with numerous sandwiches etc and breakfast was taken in the private summit room although we tended to opt for the line restaurant (great food and impeccable restaurant design). On a couple of nights we had cocktails in Blu, the bar at the top of the tower wing with great views over singapore. The pool area was great and generally quiet with pool staff tending to our every need. Ignore some reviewer's comments about the location of the hotel, it is about 5 minutes walk maximum from Orchard Road and taxis are everywhere if you don't fancy the walk. I had also read reviews saying that the location in Singapore was relatively out of the way for tourist spots, well i suppose it is but if you look at the fact that it is in a quiet corner of the city out of the way of the hustle and bustle..that is a positive rather than a negative, and when a taxi costs no more than £4 each way to get you to Raffles or indeed, anywhere else, i would say it's a no-brainer. I think it is also important to mention that this hotel is the flagship of a large luxury asian hotel company and as such, the design is pure asian...i think that this is something that is missed in all of the other large american hotels (four seasons etc) and is an important part of the ambience of the hotel, when in Rome, do as the Romans if you know what i mean. I could have stayed in the Four Seasons or the Ritz Carlton but they are just too generic. As a conclusion, i would say that having spent a good ammount of time at the hotel in those 3 days, i would easily class it as one of the best i've stayed in, the facilites are second to none and the staff are only too happy to help you in any way. I would love to visit Singapore again some time and i honestly couldn't imagine finding anywhere that would even come close to this place...

Reviews.Title: “Top Class Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: GoldfinchWindsor
Reviews.Content: I visited Singapore for the first time this year on a business trip. As a female travelling on her own I can honestly say that I felt very safe and comfortable at this hotel. I stayed in a "Garden Room" which was fantastic everything from the comfortable bed, wonderful pillows to the fact that they had a decent hairdryer which is a must for ladies with long hair !. The restaurants and lounges were second to none ! The staff at this hotel were wonderful and always smiling. I cannot fault this hotel in anyway. Would love to go back one day as a tourist !

Reviews.Title: “Excellen Service”
Reviews.Author: dc_irl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for the first 2 nights of our honeymoon on a stopover to Oz. The hotel was really luxurious and the service was excellent. The rooms were a little dated but everything in the room was of a superior quality. The Bathroom had a really good shower with an excellent range of toiletries. We got a complimentary bottle of red wine as it was our honeymoon - great start to the trip

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: seasonedtravellers7
Reviews.Content: The Shangri La Hotel is a beautiful, modern and contemporary hotel just 5 minutes walk from Orchard Road. The foyer of the hotel boasts some magnificent chandaliers and a lovely piano bar. Check in was quick and easy after a 12 hour flight and we able to use our room straight away even though we arrived at 7.30am. The garden rooms overlook the pool area, which is a blessing in the humidity and after a shopping spree down Orchard Road. The MRT (underground) is about a 10mins walk away and is easy to use and very efficient. Afternoon tea at Raffles Hotel is definately worth while, booking in advance is advisable as it was very busy. Also worth a visit is Singapore Zoo but give yourself a day to do this trip as it is a good way by MRT and bus from the Orchard Road area. The food malls, in most shopping centres, are a cheap and lively way to eat in Singapore. We loved Singapore and will be going back next year. Next time we will stay by the Quays area as we did not get to see this vibrant area of Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “favourite hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: vally-wing
Reviews.Content: it was a dream come true they were the most nicest people the treat you like royalty when me and my family walked into the hotel they gave us flowers beautiful flowers and for my daughter they gave her a lunch box with lolly pop teddy bear toothbrush and tooth paste it was just amazing i just dont know what to say

Reviews.Title: “Not the best 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: SussexDoubledutch
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a bit of a disappointment. The entrance lobby is superb but that is where it finishes. The tower block rooms are small and not really suitable for two people. The garden wing rooms are much better and have balconies, but are looking tired and in need of refurbishing. The Line restaurant does not suite everyone’s taste being like a giant modern ‘Butlins’ dining room. Food is very good but the service is very slow if you do not want the self service buffet. Self service buffet is expensive for what you likely to eat. The swimming pool is very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Valley Wing - Superb”
Reviews.Author: Monkie
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in Jan 08 on our way to langkawi. Previously stayed in an executive tower wing room but decided to try the Valley Wing - Not dissapointed at all - The rooms are plush and decorated to the highest standard - the mini bar is quite an experience as is the room service. Champagne and shorts free from 10am and you really can drink as much as you like. Free nibbles and sandwiches. The al a carte breakfast is the best we have ever tried. The eggs benedict is a really gorgeous meal. Staff go beyond the call of duty and make the stay very very special, nothing is too much trouble. The only problem we can see is that once you have done the valley wing experience nothing else compares!! Cant wait to go back .

Reviews.Title: “Blew our minds!”
Reviews.Author: Search
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Shangri-la for a post 3 night stay after our Superstar Gemini cruise to give us something to look forward to. We had booked into the Horizon Club in the Tower Wing which gave us some extra luxuries like buffet breakfast, late checkout etc. When we checked in we were told they had upgraded us to the Valley Wing which was a wonderful surprise as I had read about it on Tripadvisor so knew what to expect! The rooms were magnificent... with every little luxury you could imagine.... L'Occitane products in the huge bathroom, t.v. in the bathroom, chocolates everynight, complimentary fruitbowl, complimentary Chinese tea,... the list goes on. To say the breakfasts were to die for is an understatement! The fresh fruit was so beautifully laid out and exotic that I even bypassed the pastries every day just to eat the fruit. I overindulged so much just at breakfast because it was so irresistable and never ever had to eat lunch while I was there. Moet champagne was free flowing and complimentary every day and the waiters were always around ready to top your glass up or tempt you with a cocktail of some sorts. Sandwiches and afternoon tea were always served every afternoon and between 5 and 7 you always got a little plate of beautiful canapes to accompany your drink! The staff here were amazing and never once did we feel like bogun Aussies sitting there in their beautiful lounges... they were always so friendly and respecful and we were always greeted with a genuine smile and hello. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and if you can afford it, upgrade to the Valley Wing as it is so well worth it. We will definitely return as it really is a lovely slice of heaven!

Reviews.Title: “Utterly devine”
Reviews.Author: PoppyTT
Reviews.Content: Wow! The Valley wing is superb. Initally we were booked into a garden wing room which to be honest wasn't really want we wanted. Its a resort style room(laminate wood floor, very small bathroom, cheap furniture etc) thats surrounded by vegetation. I asked to be moved into the valley wing which they did straight away and for the extra £50 a night was worth every penny (I was surprised that they still charged us as it was our honeymoon and they were not at all full!). The room was massive, huge comfy bed, great pool view, luxury marble bathroom with separate shower/bath (even a TV next to the bath!) etc. The breakfast was fantastic and M+ C Champagne was free in the evenings!!! Plenty of restaurants the Shang Palace being our favourite, albeit pricey. The Line was a popular choice if you like buffet food. The swimming pool was open until 10pm which was perfect if you had been out sight seeing all day. The staff were so helpful, everyone knew your name. Edward and Amin especially who gave us so many tips about getting around etc. The location of the hotel was ideal for Orchard Road or the underground (clean, safe and cool) to get to other places. Overall, one of the best hotels out there!

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast to die for !”
Reviews.Author: IndiosEyes
Reviews.Content: This Shangri-La has the most extravagant breakfast menu I have encountered in any five star hotel. The variety and choice, from pastries to Thai and Japanese dishes, is absolutely bewildering. During my last visit, I counted eleven different sections serving specialist dishes.Even if you don't stay there, just go for the breakfast !

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: rj_booth
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 0300 and hotel full. Were upgraded to Valley wing. Beautiful ...very large room with walk in shower large bath dressing area huge bedroom and included ewaiter service breakfast...thanks to Qantas for the delay. Brilliant servi ce throughout our stay, staff could not do enough for you. Always very pleasant and obliging. Would recommend this jotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel, there is a "But" though.....”
Reviews.Author: Typhoon21
Reviews.Content: We Arrived at the Shangri La at the end of March for a two day stop over before flying onto Borneo for two weeks. This is a very good hotel with a lot of nice touches. On arrival we were greeted by friendly staff dressed in traditional costumes and led into a cool (compared to outside), large marble lobby. The staff made us feel very welcome and offered us an upgrade to their Horizon Club option, at 100SD per night extra. For this you get to have compilmentary breakfast on the 24th floor with a nice view over city to the south west instead of the usual restaurant at the bottom of the hotel, a room upgrade and compilmentary beverages all day. Also on the 24th floor there is a business centre including internet which the upgrade gave us free access to and also an area where canapes and cocktails are served between 6pm and 8pm. All free to Horizon Club patrons. An option I absolutely recommend. The cocktails served were very nice, the wines exceptional and the canapes simply delicious. The rest of the hotel facilities were excellent. Really nice pool area and fitness centre and if you walk round the pool area and look close enough there is a water fall/stream they've created which you can walk up. The room was really nice and there was more than enough space for the two of us. Everything was clean and well kept. The location, although out of the way was good (in my opinion) as its on a quiet tree lined road a hundred yards or so from the busy Orchard Road. We used the bus tours a lot (two days for the price of one, bargain!) and the yellow route bus stop is at the end of Orange Grove Road. And if you don't use the buses, there are more taxis than you can shake a big stick at and they are very cheap. Here is the "But". On arrival we explained to the reception staff that as we would be leaving at 6am on our day of departure we would be unable to take of advantage of the compilmentary breakfast which is served from 6am onwards so we initially declined the offer of the Horizon Club upgrade. After consultation with the manager we were offered free room service to compensate. On the day of departure, a beautifully laid and served breakfast was delivered to the room at 5:15 (ish), however on examining the bill when we left, we were charged for the breakfast (my own fault for not checking the bill close enough, Doh!). Anyway, after a phone call from the airport and initial denials that a deal had been made over the breakfast, and then after having a conversation with the Reception manger of the Shangri La Rasa Ria near Kota Kinanbalu (another fantastic Shangri La hotel) two weeks later who was very helpful, we were refunded for the room service. I put this down to a lack of communication and details lost in translation. This will not stop us from staying here again though. Overall, I heartily recommend this hotel and was very impressed by the services, staff and high quality standards they have set for themselves. We will be going back (and checking the bill closer next time)!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - best Buffet ever”
Reviews.Author: Nord20
Reviews.Content: Good quality hotel, clean, good service (typically Singaporean). Only complaint I would have is the lack of flexibility (the coffee bar closed at bang on 9pm, so don't try and get coffee after dinner there!). The outstanding feature was the buffet (breakfast, lunch and dinner), which was by far the best we have ever experienced - particularly the Indian section. Having just spent a month in India, we found the Indian food at the Shangri-La to be even better! The hotel amenties are very good, lovely pool with attentive staff. The location is good - a ten minute walk to Orchard road (which is actually quite a long way when you are returning to the hotel all hot and bothered), but it's very central so you can get a taxi to pretty much anywhere on the island quite quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Shangri-la heaven”
Reviews.Author: wigery
Reviews.Content: I have just arrived back home after a wonderful 3 week holiday, in Singapore, Koh Samui and Bangkok. After reading the reviews about the Shangri-la, my husband and I decided to upgrade to the Valley Wing. It was a short stay of 3 nights but I have to say it was well worth the extra money and as with most things in life, if you want the best, you have to pay for it. The service was exemplory, with the waiters even remembering our preferences for tea/coffee. The suite we were given was spacious and luxurious, right down to the personalised stationery and not to mention the frequently refilled champagne glasses ! Unfortunatley, we did'nt experience The Line restaraunt as this semed to be popular with the locals and was very busy. If we return to Singapore we will definatley stay in the valley wing again. My only regret was that we did'nt stay in the Shangri-la whilst in Bangkok.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: dannikki
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels me and my girlfriend have stayed at! So much so I even had to write a review, which is something I have not done before for any hotel! Amazing food, great room, really good gym, great service and reasonable price! The only diapointing part of my stay was the fact I had to leave to go to Bali which seemed like a real let down after being in this hotel in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “valley wing”
Reviews.Author: boltotraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights. The service in the lounge is very good but the music is terrible and the harp playing is a bit depressing. Even though you get free canapes you dont help yourself so you only get 3 each. You can have free flow champagne but the lounge is soo boring you dont want to stay. The room was quite nice but i have stayed in better at $s1000 dollars a night its expensive for what you get. Also the service at the pool was bad

Reviews.Title: “A bit dissappointed”
Reviews.Author: bethi
Reviews.Content: We booked a two night break in the Shangri La on our way from Australia to the Maldives. On arrival we were very pleased and impressed by the atrium/lobby and reception; it was all very opulent and check in was quick. It was 2.00am in the morning so perhaps this wasn't surprising. We had booked a Tower, Club room which overlooked the garden and swimming pool. This was very luxurious but very, very small and we were disappointed. We had had 4 weeks of travelling and many club rooms, sometimes we even had been upgraded to a suite, this room was less half the size most of the other rooms and about a third of the size of the Sheraton at Noosa which we had just left. By this time it was about 2.30am so all we wanted was sleep and as we only had two nights there we decided not to complain. The bathroom was also very small but like the room was luxurious. We had breakfast at the Blu restaurant (Club room breakfast area). The view was fabulous and the choice and quality of the food excellent so we decided to book evening dinner here and a waitress made a note of our booking and request for a window table but as she couldn't make the reservation herself told us it would be confirmed later and we gave her our mobile number for this. No-one contacted us! At about 5.30pm we returned to Blu restaurant to check on the booking; although they had the note which clearly stated our request for a window table and time etc. they had done nothing about it. So at this late time we had to make the booking needless to say all the window tables had now been reserved! We said OK we didn't mind a table a little back from the window as we could still see the view. We went back to our room to shower and change and then to the Club lounge for pre dinner drinks and canapés. It was about 6.45pm and we were stunned to be told there was no seating available so we would have to wait in the nearby Blu bar where our drinks would be brought to us. We went in here and with great difficulty (I am only 5ft 3”) we climbed onto the very high chairs. We perched uncomfortably here waiting for our drinks - they didn't arrive!! . This bar is extremely cold, so much so that condensation had formed on the outside of all the windows and you couldn't see the fabulous view so this was not a good experience. Eventually my husband went to find the drinks only to be greeted by 'Oh, there is a seat for you now, didn't anyone tell you?' Well we finally got to the comfort of the Club lounge but only for a short time as we were now due to go for dinner. When we got to the Blu restaurant we were shown to table in an alcove (the only one without a view!). We protested to no avail! We should have left then but decided to stay and to be fair had a very excellent meal. I must say though don't go to this restaurant if you have a big appetite or a small wallet. Most of the next day we spent at the Botanic gardens, and then came back to the hotel for a welcome hour or two around the pool. This is lovely but, for the size of the hotel, too small and consequently it was very crowded with children everywhere and it was difficult to find two sun-beds. There is plenty of space for another pool in the grounds and I think the hotel would do well to do away with the tiny four hole par 3 golf and put in a second pool. Prior to our holiday I checked the website and was pleased to see that club rooms had a complimentary late check-out as we were flying at 1.30am (this influenced our booking). When we asked for this late check out we were told check out was at 12.00md. It took a lot of persuasion to get a change on this but finally they did relent and it was granted. I think the rules must have changed between booking and our stay. So, if you have stuck with me this far you may we wondering if we would stay here again. I am afraid the answer is that despite the obvious luxury and reputation of the hotel we would not. We were not made to feel special or a valued guest in any way, and next time would return to the Mandarin Oriental where we have stayed previously. This was wonderful and, although it too is a large hotel, the staff made us feel like royalty!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: beccx
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Valley Wing for two nights in March as a stop over on our way to Australia. I can honestly say that this is the best place that we have ever stayed. The room was beautiful and spacious, with lovely touches that made it extra special - welcome jasmine tea and chocolates, daily replenished fresh fruit and personalised business cards. The bathroom was lovely with the best shower that I have ever used. The bed was incredibly comfortable, my boyfriend and I usually wake each other up with our tossing and turning, not so in this bed, we had so much space and the matress was of such quality that we both slept exceptionally well. The service in the champagne bar and lounge was impeccable and the freely flowing champagne made the stay exceptional value. Breakfast was available in either the Summit Room or the Line restaurant, we tried out both and enjoyed both - the Summit room being more formal with table service and the Line having a greater variety of buffet style food available. We didn't really see much of the main hotel, the facilities within the Valley Wing meant that this wasn't really necessary. All the staff that we encountered were friendly, polite and efficient. They even came out to our taxi as we left to wave us off! Overall a fantastic stay and very good value for money. We will definitely be back at some time in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, superb service”
Reviews.Author: JohnEO
Reviews.Content: The Shangri-la is a superb, top class, hotel. The rooms are excellent, as is the staff, and quality of service. Unfortunately, we could only stay for one night on a stopover on the way to Australia. It’s a 30 minutes taxi ride from Changi airport to a friendly welcome from the efficient staff on arrival. Despite our early arrival (11am), check-in with our prebooked voucher was a breeze. Our heavy luggage was whisked up to our deluxe room by a friendly bellman (with a bright red jacket and pill box hat) who delighted in showing us all the room’s facilities. The room in the Garden Wing on the 10th floor was spacious with chairs, a desk, broadband, a large well-appointed, bathroom, and a comfortable bed. The gardens are really nice with luxuriant flowers and other vegetation; we did not have time to use the nice swimming pool. The buffet breakfast offered good, wholesome, hot and cold food with a wide variety of choices, including good back bacon (not the cheap streaky/fatty stuff offered by US hotels). Really excellent and hassle free. Had a sumptuous Cantonese meal at the hotel’s (expensive) Shang Palace restaurant. Truly a culinary experience with excellent service. Although you are near to Orchard Street and various shopping malls (Singapore prices are not that cheap!), the hotel’s suburban location means a lot of (cheap) taxi rides. In the one and half days we spent in Singapore, we visited Chinatown (don’t miss the China Town Heritage Centre on Pagoda Street, which provides a poignant portrait of the territory migrant history, the Islamic Mosque (Don’t expect much if you have visited Istanbul or the Middle East), and Little India. Not having visited India, we were enthralled by a visit to the Sri Mariamman Temple temple on South Bridge Road and the Sri Veeramakaliamman Temple on Serangoon Road in Little India, where we witnessed a remarriage ceremony, which involved the man and woman being doused by successive dunks of water, and numerous believers receiving “blessings” from the numerous swamis. Expensive but good value for money given the quality and location of this hotel. The staff is excellent: every time we passed a staff member, we received a friendly smile and solicitation. We would have liked to stay longer and were sorry to leave. One negative: no free in-room internet. Given the cost, this is rather sad.

Reviews.Title: “shangri la singapore”
Reviews.Author: MrsMKent
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 days in Singapore and stayed at the Shangri La. A good hotel but expensive for food so beware of the extras. Try and get a deal on the cost of breakfast - the breakfast is amazing- about 7 areas serving international food! I opted to stay in the Garden wing which is a bit dated but near the pool with better views of the beautiful gardens. The tower wing and valley wing are very swish, but you could be anywhere and they are not worth the extra cost in my opinion (I was shown all three to decide) the pool is wonderful and service is good. The room key system is a pain (kept failing) and you need it at all times even to activate the lifts. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay”
Reviews.Author: nomis7
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my honeymoon and it was a fantastic time. We were only there for 5 days before travelling up to Thailand but I wish the time had gone slower. It is by far the best hotel I have ever stayed at and I have stayed at some very nice hotels. Everything from the grand entrance, the staff and the room to the breakfasts. It was all fantastic. Get breakfasts if you can!!! they are great only downside maybe TOO MUCH to choose from. We had an amazing time and the room service is a snip for the food and service you receive. I stayed at Raffles the year before but this wipes the floor with it. Check out the Blue restaurant..............

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Rubee1402
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights coming back from our honeymoon in Bali on our way back to NY. I lived in S'pore when I was younger, and have been to Singapore more times than I can count. However, this was the first time for my husband. More than anything I just want him to have a good experience. All I have to say is, the Shang have helped made my husband's first trip to S'pore enjoyable and memorable. The positive - Very warm greeting and service upon arrival and throughout the stay. - We booked the deluxe room at the Valley wing and they upgraded us to a suite, when they heard we were on our honeymoon. Also gave us a lot of free perks. - Great size, very well furnished, and great amenities. - Perfect location, 15 minute walk to Orchard. Close enough but not right in the middle of the craziness. I read someone wrote that it's a 30 minute walk....I'm not quite sure where they get that time from. - Great selection and quality of breakfast at the Line. Love it!! - Love the free Champagne and canapes on the lounge - The hotel staff is very friendly and always eager to help The negative - The concierge service is very inconsistent. Some of them are very knowledgeable and some of them have to keep on checking with other people for everything and unable to give you a straight answer. They also screwed up on one of our dinner reservations, but we were still able to get a table in the end...so no big deal. - The other breakfast room (other than the Line) called the Summit room?? or something like that. In any case, for the summit room, they do not allowed anyone wearing sandals or shorts. I find this to be a bit too much, too forced an effort to make the Valley Wing more posh than it already is. Don't get me wrong, my husband I always dressed up for dinner, no matter where we are in our travels. As a matter of fact we love dressing up. But for breakfast and lunch, especially if we're travelling in a hot + humid country and have a full day of walking and sightseeing ahead of us, we like to wear our sandals and shorts. It seems silly to make your guests dress up for breakfast, then they have to go back upstairs to change into their comfortable everyday clothes. To make long story short, we went to the line everyday for breakfast. Other than that, the Valley wing at the Shang is very impressive and beautiful. I recommend anyone in staying there, but be sure to book the Valley wing. The main wing is still nice, but looks exactly as it did in the 80s. It's in need of a face lift, especially compared to some of the newer and grander hotel around S'pore. But just as I remember it as a child, I still love the Shang!

Reviews.Title: “Great Valley Wing, but was it perfect?”
Reviews.Author: pjkeay
Reviews.Content: We recently enjoyed a 4 night stay at the Valley Wing at the Shangri La in Singapore. Overall we had a great stay BUT we had a couple of minor issues and one significant issue that necessitated us calling the hotel General Manager to resolve (a first for us). All credit to the hotel they went quite a way to sort the problem out and make recompense, more later. We arrived in Singapore after a great stay at the Rasa Sayang in Penang. We arrived at SIN at about 12.15pm and think we were in our taxi on the way to the hotel within 20 minutes. I recall we arrived at the Valley Wing lobby about 1310. Don't think we would have done it much quicker if we had booked the hotel limo service. We were ushered into the lobby by the doorman and asked to take seats. After about a minute we were greated by a guest relations officer who proceded to escort us directly to our room (1259). On the way she took time to explain to us the privillages of the Valley Wing - free drinks in the lobby from 1030am - 1030pm, snacks all day long, free use of the business centre including internet access. She also explained to us that one of the two lifts was being refurbished but we would be free to use the VIP elevator that takes you directly to the private VIP entrance of the Valley Wing. This, as it transpired, was very conveniant for us, because the VIP lift was very fast and was about 10ft from the door to our room. Each floor of the Valley Wing only has about 10 rooms on it, with each pair of rooms set back from the corridor allowing them to be paired up and shut off. The corridors are very quiet and despite being told that the hotel was virtually full we never saw a single person on the corridor (including any housekeeping trollys throughout our stay). Access to each floor by lift or stairs is only by key card. This is a hotel that has to take security seriously owing to the number of VIPs attending. There was an Asian PM in residence whilst we were there. But more about security later. We were surprised when we arrived at our room to find that housekeeping was still in attendence making up our room. Rather than being immediately allocated another room we were surprised that we were taken in, sat down on the sofa, amongst a scattering of pillows and bed covers and checked in. This was most disappointing and gave a perculiar first impression. If the room wasn't ready they should have found us another room or asked us to wait 10 minutes in the lobby and had a drink. The room itself was very impressive, measuring a good 50m2. Laid out in a fairly traditional fashion with what I would describe as very traditional european style decor of a seemingly very good quality. We were allocated a city view room, with a view that wasn't bad but it was a little disappointing to note that half of the rooms in the Valley Wing get an excellent view of the Hotel incinerator / boiler stack. The room came equipped with a large desk with personalised business cards and writing paper. My partner was a bit miffed that it was assumed that only I would require the use of such things (i didn't). I'm sure, had we asked, she would have received a stash. A large minibar (not free) featured a wide selection of wine, beer, premium brand spirits in large bottles and tasty chocolates. Disappointingly, the room only has a CRT TV. It does have a BOSE stereo and DVD player. There was no inhouse movie on demand - only the dire movie channel (Vision 4, I think - which has to be the worst movie channel ever) and HBO. The bathroom was large and decked completely in white marble making it very light but a little stark for my tastes. The so-called mood lighting was pretty naff, seeming to just switch a couple of lights off. The mood lighting in the bathrooms at the Peninsula in Bangkok was much better. The room featured a seperate toilet and Bidet, bath with TV, double sinks, and a reasonably large walk in shower. The shower featured a fairly naff and ineffective rain-head shower which could be switched over to a conventional shower which was okay, I've had much better showers elsewhere. There was a good selection of Aigner bathroom toiletries, replensished twice daily. The bottles were the same size as standard Shangri La toiletries (Unlike at the Horizon Floor at the Shangri La in KL, where 4 years ago they were twice the size). Overall the room was very well kitted out and in excellent shape. In the evening delicious home-made mint chocolates in little boxes are left Drinks service is in the Valley wing lobby, where, somehow the butlers know who is and who is not stopping in the wing. They very quickly work out what you like and by the second day most had worked out our names. The selection is pretty good with brand name spirits, Moet Champagne, and reasonably good French and New World Wines. A glass of this wine or champagne will set you back about £10 in the main wing of the hotel, so you can see how the savings will add up. Breakfast is taken in the Summit Room, and consists of a small cold buffet followed by an A la carte selection cooked to order menu. However, the chefs will endevour took what you want when you want it - this extends to 24 hour room service. The only problem we noted was that the room cannot cope very well when there is a rush on. People were waiting in excess of 30 minutes for a table. You could dine in the main hotel buffet if you wished, which was good but very busy and noisy. The wing also has a small patio area reserved for Valley Wing guests. We found that the rules over whether you could eat and drink in this section seemed to depend on who you asked or maybe who you were. We were told you could take your own drinks outside but food wasn't allowed and there is no table service in that area (something to do with smoking rules) however we saw a couple of vocal business men barking orders to staff to bring them food and drink which they did The big problem - On the second night we left our room at 5pm and returned at 10.30pm to find that the housekeeper had left the door ajar when she had turned the room down. We immediately called the Duty Manager, My partner was very upset, I was just angry. The Manager and I checked the room and safe and confirmed from a preliminary inspection that nothing seemed to have been taken. The Manager promised to review all the security footage that night, all key entries to the room and the Head of security was ordered to interview the housekeepers. We arranged to see the General Manager the following morning. During our meeting with the General Manager he confirmed that the Housekeepers had been the only people to enter the room that night and he offered us the opportunity to view the security footage, which we declined. He was most appolgetic and said he had sent wine and chocolates to our room. He also offered us a compementary meal in the hotels top restaurant, BLU. Whilst we were extremly disapointed over the lapse in security at a hotel that prides itself on the issue we felt in the circumstances, and given the fact that nothing had been taken, the offer was more than reasonable. We later received a personal hand written letter from the Manager appologising. We also received VIP treatment when we took the manager up on his offer of a meal, with various hotel management coming over to introduce themselves to us and ensure we were having a good time. We didn't take the [-] with the courtersy offered with the free meal and only ordered a moderately priced Chablis (it was still £40) but when we came to pay for the wine we were told that the Manager was picking up the complete cost. The hotel has excellent grounds with a wonderful pool. Be under no illusion that the Shangri La is a big hotel with several ballrooms and function rooms. When the hotel is full the main lobby area in the main wing can resemble a busy train station concourse. Considering the Valley Wing was only remodeled a couple of years ago I was surprised with the conservative layout of the bedroom, but maybe that's what the regulars like. Similarly, the lobby is very traditionally laid out, we would have preferred the lobby to have been broken up a little to be more like a lounge with perhaps a slightly more contemporary feel, it never really felt like you were sitting anywhere else than on a thoroughfare. These are minor observations and don't really detract from what is a great hotel to stay in Singapore. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay. it wasn't perfect and perhaps at the prices it charges it should be. That said, the free drink on offer makes for tremendous value if you enjoy a drink. The rooms are very comfortable and the staff do seem to try very hard to make your stay special. __________________

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel BAD location”
Reviews.Author: SurferChick
Reviews.Content: I booked the Shangri La based on the reviews on Trip advisor. Unfortunately even though the hotel itself was lovely the location was a HUGE disappointment. The hotel was beautiful, the ladies changing rooms had a wonderful steam/sauna/jacuzzi, the breakfast was amazing (though they added an awful lot of extra charges to our breakfast). The staff were friendly (even though there was a mix up in check-in). However, it was a bit of a trek from Orchard Road. Probably a good half an hour to walk to the MRT. Loved the hotel, but would I stay here again if I visited Singapore - I am afraid the answer is NO!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in the Valley Wing”
Reviews.Author: WellTravelled99
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Valley Wing. I had a one bedroomed suite. It was fabulous. From the moment the driver met us at the airport, whisked us to the hotel in a Mercedes and presented my wife with a beautiful orchid, it couldnt have been better. The room was very well decorated, cool and had a superb view of the large pool and gardens. The breakfasts were amazing with a nice choice and great service. The pool was large and fitted into the landscaped gardens. We ate at the Japanese and contemporary restaurants. Good food and service. The only issue throughout the stay was with the keycards which stopped working continuously

Reviews.Title: “great!”
Reviews.Author: gadlu
Reviews.Content: Great, as usual! (there is not much to say... it's perfect!)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the line restaurant but annoyed about a late/wrong minibar charge”
Reviews.Author: clobbin
Reviews.Content: First hotel in our honeymoon as a 2 night stopover to Australia. Great welcome and check in, very helpful in cutting the lock on our case after we lost our key. We stayed in the Garden wing, think slightly bigger room and lots of greenery on balcony etc. Highlights Good welcome on arrival Bed was really really comfortable - slept really well Electric curtains (unnecessary but felt really special) We got a membership card which gave us half price on breakfast in the line (buffet restaurant). The line was a really great buffet breakfast (best we had on our trip) - great fruit selection but loads of great choice , really modern look and feel and as we grazed we could watch the staff preparing pasta.
