Didn't feel too business oriented Lowlights On getting home we were charged a late charge for whisky from the minibar after we left but given we don't drink whisky definitely not us but unnecessary hassle and not what we wanted Uninspiring views Room was good size and no issues with it (other than seeing a few ants in the room) but does look a bit dated compared to other more modern hotels Rained most of the time we were there (hotel provided umbrella in the room). Did a day tour but didn't feel there was that much to see/do (took a picture of the merlion, saw a temple, some botanical gardens and a factory), so probably worth looking at prebooking a trip to sentosa island before you go.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Marlscat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights from 24th February on our way to Langkawi. This is the second time we have visited this hotel, but our friends hadn’t, and we wanted them to experience the sheer opulence of the place – it didn’t disappoint!! We were greeted at the door and shown to reception where we were very efficiently allocated our rooms. Our room was just wonderful. The service was second to none and breakfast in the Line Restaurant was to die for!! Whatever your nationality, you’ll find something here to please you. The lobby area is just beautiful and the pool is superb. Unfortunately on this trip we didn’t have time to sample the pool but on the last occasion we were there, we used it almost every day. Staff just can’t do enough for you and are very helpful. It was our friend’s birthday while visiting this hotel, and there was a lovely surprise for him that day when he came back to find a cake for him in their room. The location of the hotel is pretty good for shopping as it’s only a fairly short walk into Orchard Road, but the taxis were fairly cheap and we went down to the Clarke Quay area every night to the many restaurants in that area. I’d certainly stay here again if I was having a stop-over in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “The 'Valley Wing' - Heaven in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: ClassyLad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at 'The Shang' in the 'Valley Wing' for a week a few years ago. The 'Valley Wing' of the Shangri-La is one of the most impressive hotels we have had the fortunate experience to stay at. The staff seem to have a 'sixth sense' when it comes to service, the rooms were opulent, the fine dining breakfast screamed luxury in every sense, and the champagne in the lobby just kept on flowing. What more can I say other than TripAdvisor (plus I wish I discovered this site earlier) should have a separate entry for the 'Valley Wing' and add a six star rating option? The 'Valley Wing' was truly impressive.

Reviews.Title: “Super rest at Shangri La”
Reviews.Author: expectant customer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night on a Singapore stopover. Foyer is magnificant, Service outstanding Room was 931. It was at the end of the corridor, which made it quiet. Electric curtains on the windows, remote light switches, very good sized and comfortable bed, meant that a sound nights sleep was had. Amenities in the room are first class. If I had to moan, I would say do a small fresh milk in the room, not UHT pots (all hotels in New Zealand manage it) A quick walk in the garden showed a great pool, nice gardens and a couple of golf greens in super condition (but the kikuyu type grass is too coarse for a good putting surface) Note - the rugs in the lifts are changed daily - they have the correct day of the week in bold letters on them! Look out for that!

Reviews.Title: “Good Service”
Reviews.Author: suejessex
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel for a second time on our way to Langkawi. We stayed for 4 nights and had a Tower room, we did have a couple of small problems when we arrived, but these were soon sorted out by Janet one of the Assistant Managers. The service is excellent as is the location and the Blu Resturant is definatly worth a visit, food and views great. We would stay here again and would recommend it for anyone looking for qaulity and service.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best in the World”
Reviews.Author: DerbyshireEdyth
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just spent 5 days in the acclaimed Valley Wing of this hotel. It is true to say that everything that has been described about this hotel from the greetings and check in on arrival to the beautiful room and equally superb staff, we found to be absolutley accurate. We could not fault anything and we did try!. Sitting in the Champagne Lobby one evening, we were just a little away from the main seating area ,as it was very busy and all the seats taken we were happy to wait to be served when a very smart gentleman came out of the central lift and acknowledged us with a slight nod as he passed. He came bye a few moments later, stopped and enquired had we been attended to, we said no but it wasn't a problem. Immediately he fetched a Floor Butler who not only served us but found us a more convenient place. We asked who the gentleman had been, he said, that was the General Manager of the Hotel. We thought that said it all really. He took the trouble to notice and act to ensure we were looked after as well as they promised. Please keep it up Shangri La we shall return.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: TAMember1234
Reviews.Content: Like a previous reviewer, we expected our 2 night stay at the Singapore Shangri La to be one of the highlights of our Singapore / Vietnam / Bintan trip. But like that person, we too were disappointed. In 2006 we stayed at the Shangri La , Sydney, on a Horizon Club deal. This was excellent value for money, superb room, great complimentary evening snacks and drinks etc. So we booked the same deal in Singapore. Room was fine, but no better than any other Singapore 4 or 5 star hotel. Bathroom did not have a separate shower, just curtain round bath. We queried whether we were actually in a Horizon room, and were told that it " recently been upgraded to Horizon Status ". Other than notepaper with Horizon Club heading, we could see any extra advantages. The complimentary evening snacks were very average, and there were long waits while the empty dishes were replenished. Although the first drinks were brought quickly, the service became markedly slower after that. Eventually my husband tired of waiting for a drink that never came , so we left. Although the hotel has a lovely pool and beautiful gardens, we felt that we had paid over the odds for what we got. We would happily return to the Sydney Shangri La, but not to the Singapore hotel. On our return through Singapore we stayed at the Intercontinental on Middle Rd. Much better value, and better room and breakfast buffet

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: Ninde
Reviews.Content: We started our honeymoon tour from Singapore and what better place to stay in than the excellent Shangri-La! The service is unbelievable. The breakfast buffet (which definitely is worth including in the stay) was phenomenal! Everything you could imagine was available. The funniest we found was that they changed the carpets in the lifts everyday, for Monday you had Monday carpet etc. They really had thought of everything. The location is quite handy (close to Orchard Rd) and taxis are easily available (expect from 4 to 5pm) and cheap. We stayed in a regular Tower Wing room which was spacious and answered our expectations. I cannot imagine how luxurious the suites muts be.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: cornish007
Reviews.Content: This was to be the highlight of my trip, i'd seen the pictures on the website, thought the hotel and grounds looked fantastic couldn't wait to stay. Unfortunately we had been booked into a twin room (hotel fault, not travel agent), they were unable to move us, showed us 3 different rooms and in the end charged us to upgrade to a 'larger' room. Check in took approx 1 hour which isn't what you need after a 12 hour flight. A lack of good English spoken at reception didn't help matters. No apology for the incorrect booking,...nothing Apart from that the hotel was very nice, although it's public areas do seem to have an identity crisis. Is it a bar or a restaurant? Trying to get served at the groundfloor bar/noodle reataurant / sushi?? whatever, was a nightmare. The penthouse bar was nice, good cocktails, excellent views. But our stay was marred by the check in. It really irked me. One thing though, you'll read reviews that the hotel is a bit of a walk from the action. Rubbish, it's just 3 miunutes from Orchard Road. Would i stay again? Yes, if business were paying. I wouldn't rush to pick up the tab out of my own wallet.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed by my first Shangri-La Experience !”
Reviews.Author: JCSide
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife on holiday for 4 nights, we booked a Horizon Club room in the Tower Wing, which I guess is a mid-range option at this hotel. Check-in was efficient and pleasant, on the 24th floor 'Horizon Club' lobby. Our room was on 17th floor, with a nice view towards Tanglin Rd and the new St Regis. The room itself was quite a nice size, all mod cons, spotlessly clean, the bathroom was very nice with twin sinks, walk-in shower and separate tub. We thought the decor was a bit old-fashioned, but no real problems. The gardens and pool area were very lush and tropical - hard to believe you were in the city. The Garden Wing rooms looked very interesting, with a sort of 'organic' architecture. In the evenings we were entitled to drinks and canapes in the horizon club lounge - unlimited drinks from 6 - 8 every day. The canapes were great, and we guzzled a lot of Sauvignon ! Also included was breakfast at either Blu restaurant or The Line (buffet) - we always chose the latter because the choice was better, and the setting magnificent, however if you were on business then Blu would be the quieter option. The buffet at The Line was unsurpassed by anything I had ever seen before - a HUGE choice of all imaginable dishes. In 4 days I still had not tried everything (and I made an effort to do so !). We also had dinner one night at The Line, it was as impressive as the breakfast. All staff were very nice throughout our stay, very polite and efficient service. We checked out at 05:30, not a problem, inaccuracies in our bill were corrected without question. In all, a very efficient and pleasant place to stay - made our trip to Singapore go like a dream !

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, amazing service”
Reviews.Author: Jos15
Reviews.Content: We decided to end our honeymoon tour in Singapore, and had chosen to stay in the exclusive Valley Wing of this hotel. We were not dissapointed. The Wing has it's own exclusive entrance and check-in, where we were greeted by some of the most friendly and professional staff it has ever been our pleasure to experience. They bestowed a beautiful Orchid on me, and a congratulatory bouquet of red roses. We were then taken to our room, where we were checked in in the slickest process we have experienced. The room was stunning, and the bed was adorned with red roses in the shape of hearts. the bathroom was beautiful with extra thought given to things like mood lighting Another great perk of staying in the Valley Wing means you can enjoy complimentary cocktails, champagne, hors d'oeuvres, breakfast, and coffee, juices and soft drinks in the lounge. With alcohol being so expensive in Singapore, it really is a sensible option. Within the grounds of the hotel, are beautiful gardens. The hotel is justly proud of this, and even offers tours to those who are interested. There are several dining options, if you can't decide what you fancy like us try The Line. It offers all day dining with food from all over the world. Because we were out exploring all day, the fact they served until 10.30pm suited us perfectly. Even if all you want is a simple salad. If we had had a longer visit we would have tried the other restaurants too. Fantastic location, only 5 minutes walk to Orchard Road and all its shopping. Would we go back, without hesitation. Amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Shangri-la at a price!”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneFirst
Reviews.Content: I have long been a fan of Shangri-la hotels, and by far the Singapore Shangri-la is the flag ship hotel for the chain. I normally stay in the Valley Wing, which as previous reviews have stated is amazing for service and quality. For my work I normally book up to six months in advance, so as per my normal arrangements I booked the Shangri-la. For a hotel of its quality and reputation, I was surprised to learn that for the upcoming F1 race, the normal room rate of 700Singapore dollars was now 2000Singapore dollars PER NIGHT. Yes a 280+% increase. While I understand that all hotels add a percentage for any new or major event, I would have to question this hotels ethics on this on…

Reviews.Title: “Shangri La is a Heaven and Haven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: escholte
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in the Valley Wing. What a fabulous part of a great hotel. It has its own lobby, free champagne bar and absolutely fantastic service - an amazing USP. The impressive lobby with the chic and elegant relaxing areas have superb and friendly staff. The breakfast is served in the sumptuous Summit Room. The comfortable seating areas are serviced all day with snacks, nibbles and canpes with free flowing champagne or what ever else you want. The room was enormous with a carpet thick enough to sleep on. Big bathroom with nice toiletries and extras. Lovely turn down service with scrummy chocolates each night. A truely wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel Shangri la Singapore”
Reviews.Author: JessieWindermere
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are presently on an extended trip to Australia and Malaysia. We started our trip with a three night stay in Singapore at the Shangri La hotel and what a hotel. We arrived at 7.30am after a long over night flight with the superb Singapore Airlines to find our room ready. We had a swift check in and were able to freshen up and have breakfast. Throughout our stay we enjoyed excellent service with one blot on the copy book. We decided to have a meal in the Blu restaurant which is extreemly overpriced, has very slow service and we were nearly overcharged by $200 for a bottle of wine.The restaurant was fairly quiet and every table made some kind of complaint. In comparrison on our last night we ate in the excellent Line restaurant which had a seafood evening and the food and service was second to none. So all in all well done to the Shangri La but avoid the Blu restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “a stay to remember”
Reviews.Author: alzo
Reviews.Content: had the pleasure of passing through singapore and i stayed at the valley wing from start to finish it was a stay to remember all the staff the food the drinks and i promised to mention the floor butlers as they like to be called they excell in their work and nothing is to much for them ,yes the hotel is a little dearer but belive me when all the above is included that is service ,snacks .afternoon tea ,evening drinks ,top class rooms,and lots more just to have the pleasure of dealing with all the staff and nothing else it would have been good value spend a little more and see what you get alan billington

Reviews.Title: “I was on business, but felt like a vacation.”
Reviews.Author: ptirvine
Reviews.Content: I went to Singapore on a business trip, but this hotel made me feel like I was on vacation. Good looking hotel, great food, great service, great gym, what can i say. I thought it was great. I wish I could have spent less time at the office and more at the hotel. It just felt like a beach resort, even though I was in the middle of the city. I would definitely come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: readingtraveller62
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in January 2008, and really enjoyed the excellent room and impeccable service. My long-haul flight was rather late, and there is really nothing to beat the care and attention of a truly luxurious hotel then. The Shangri-La was truly outstanding, and so I awoke refreshed and ready to face the Singapore humidity. A hard day's sightseeing later, the hotel again acted as a cocoon. The hotel location is excellent, close to Orchard Road but far enough away to be quiet. The gardens are a haven of peace. We only had room service breakfast, but this was also very good, and delivered quickly. I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and nothing is perfect...”
Reviews.Author: CJH78
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights. I think the reason for differing reviews for this place (other than personal taste of course) is this: If you're used to the best hotels (and I'm not saying I am!?) then the flaws in the Shangri La are there. If you're looking at exploiting exchange rates and the fact Singapore is a relatively cheap country, to stay in a nicer hotel than you might usually, in say New York or London, then you will be very impressed. The Asian service mentality, the eat-yourself-to-a-premature-grave-on-lovely-food-from-around-the-world breakfast, the pool and the reflexology are astoundingly good. There are some nice touches, such as a fresh cake in the room and the turn down service when they leave you a pot of jasmin tea. In some parts I think the hotel could do with a makeover, the upgrade options upon arrival ("if you pay x dollars you can get this room, with breakfast in this special restaurant, or you could change to the other wing for x dollars") reminded me of a second-hand car showroom and charging $10 for valet parking? You would tip the valet anyway but to ask at a 5 star hotel seems a little tacky. I would stay here again for the breakfast and the service overall, it is a beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: UKCultureVulture
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights, but wish it could have been longer. The accommodation and level of service are impeccable. Our room in the tower block was well furnished and had a good bathroom. However, there was only one easy chair and one desk chair so it wasnt ideal for sitting around. We had a beautifully served in-room breakfast which was wheeled in on its own table. The pool was lovely, especially after a hot day sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cornish
Reviews.Content: Wow - What to say !!! Stayed for 3 nights before flying on to Sydney. We had booked a Horizon Club Deluxe room and were looking forward to just staying at The Shangri La. From the time we arrived in our limo to the entrance of The Shangri La to our departure we had been transported to a different world. We were greeted personally by a young lady who took us to reception to be told that we had been upgraded to The Valley Wing. From here we were taken to The VW and again greeted by another beautiful young lady welcoming us and presenting me with gift of a boxed orchid. From reception we were taken to our room on the 17th floor (with balcony) for our private check in. The room was fabulous, classic in design & sumptuous furnishings/bedding. Off the bedroom was a dressing room and bathroom/walk in shower/twin sinks/bath with TV/sep toilet+bidet. Towels, toiletries and robes were renewed twice daily. The room was turned down in the evening and a boxed hand made chocolate left with a quote from The Lost Horizon. Apart from the complimentary fruit etc in the bedroom we had privileges of complimentary champagne/snacks/high tea/canapes throughout the day ( when we were there). We had our breakfast at The Line although should have gone to private Summit Room. Swimming pool & surrounds very relaxing. Have never experienced such luxury in a hotel stay before and long to return BUT would we have the luck to be upgraded again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fab food - but checkout problem”
Reviews.Author: Slimdil
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Shangri La for 2 nights on our way back to the UK from Bali. Perhaps we had been spoiled at the Oberoi in Bali where we had had a fabulous villa with our own pool - total privacy, everything was just perfect. Arriving in Singapore was quite a shock to the system! Our stay didn't start off well when we weren't collected at the airport by Tour East. Had to wait an hour and a half! But of course, this wasn't the hotel's fault. When we got to the hotel the staff were very pleasant, although one felt it was rather 'corporate speak', very well rehearsed. We were taken to our Garden Wing room which was very nice, although I felt the bathroom was rather small. However, as someone else said, the white paintwork on the outside of the balconies was badly in need of a clean or a new coat of paint. Our stay was fine - breakfast in The Line was fantastic, as was the buffet dinner there on our second night. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in. The main problem was on checking out - we had a voucher from Kuoni confirming 2 nights accommodation with breakfast - so we expected only to pay for the dinner on the second night. The hotel had been given a copy of this voucher on our arrival. My husband was duly presented with a bill for 2 nights stay, 2 breakfasts, dinner and $64 for 'telephone calls'. Of course my husband disputed this and the accommodation charge was quickly deleted. However, they said the telephone charge was for 'internet use'. We didn't have our pc with us and hadn't touched the phone for anything at all! The charge was grudgingly taken off the bill and we paid what we had expected to pay. However, my main grouch was that there was not a single word of apology from the reception staff about their error. This marred what had been a perfect holiday up to then - it left a rather bitter taste in the mouth, so to speak. Would I stay there again? I know my husband would flatly refuse - but I think I would give it another go.

Reviews.Title: “Room cancellation charge”
Reviews.Author: Asia_traveler_8
Reviews.Content: Due to flight delay had to cancell room at the hotel. Had travel agent cancell & re book my trip. Unfortunetly the hotel is still trying to chagre me for two nights stay! Even their reservation staff emailed that "they could not waive the cancellation fee for two nights and that I should contact the airline for reimbursement". I will never recommend this hotel again, even after staying there several times for business! Their arrogance is unbelievable and not business friendly!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SimonSouthampton
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Valley Wing as a stop over to Sydney. We were dropped by the taxi at the wrong entrance, however it was not a problem as we were personally escorted to the Valley Wing. Check in was a breeze particularly after a 14 hour flight. Everything was wonderful from the room to the service in the lounge, champagne and service was great. The only thing to be aware of is buffett in the restaurant, It is good value if you are very hungry however can be expensive if you are not very hungry.

Reviews.Title: “I just don't get it!!”
Reviews.Author: daccas
Reviews.Content: I've used Tripadvisor for 5 years now and it's NEVER let me down....until now. We stayed in the Garden Wing and i have to say it all felt very dated. The room itself was "OK" but the bathroom looked old fashioned and the whole balcony area, front doors and the general presentation looked very tired. The walls of the garden wing were a very off-white and badly in need of a new paint job. Funnily enough, on our last day we noticed they had started doing just that. The food was very good with lots of selection but on our final day (a Saturday) we were horrified when we went down to the restaurant to get a table only to be told they were fully booked! We couldn't believe that as guests of the hotel we had to book a table! The gym was quite good and the pool was of a decent standard but the other major issue we had was the location of the hotel. It's a good 15 minute taxi ride to the city centre so if you're only staying in Singapore for a short period of time I wouldnt recommend this hotel. Furthermore, it's not cheap and i didn't feel we got value for money. Would not stay here next time.

Reviews.Title: “The Shangri-la is a Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gl0betrekkeruk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Shangri-la for three nights on our way home from Malaysia. This hotel is a wow. If you want the best, then this place can guarantee it. Unfortunately for us - very much out of our price range for eating and drinking. For example around £7:00 for a beer. Having said that eating and drinking outside of the hotels is still expensive. Nothing is too much trouble for the staff and they were extremely friendly and helpful. Despite a 12 noon check out we were able to keep our room on until 7:00 p.m. at no cost. A truly fantasatic hotel but you will need a big wallet to fully enjoy what the hotel has to offer. The hotel is around 10 minute walk to Orchard Road.

Reviews.Title: “The most wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: FionaHenderson
Reviews.Content: We had a 10 night stay in Shangri-la last year. The hotel is beautiful and the staff are lovely. We had a garden room with a balcony overlooking pool - it was very clean and quiet. The pool is clean and has a lifeguard, he was needed as a man took ill in pool, and they spotted it right away and helped. The food it is wonderful, but the line rest. is quite dear - but you can have a what they call a High Tea in the Rose Varanda - its really a meal in itself - so we ate there. The line for breakfast was out of this world - the staff again wonderful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone...................is you want spoilt for a resonable price ----------------go to Shangri La. You can book your trips there, or just hitch a taxi and go out yourself. Dont miss the Dragon Boat tour - great. Jurong Park was ok. The Night Safari and Zoo are wonderful but do them on different days. China Town - wow And try Tangs Store - lovely shop and helpful staff. Singapore is the most wonderful city, very safe, and very clean and you can eat any kind of food. We are picky and we were never ever hungry. Cant wait to go back and it will be to the Shangi-la Go and enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: Christo8
Reviews.Content: Our taxi driver from the airport described the Valley Wing of the Shangri-La hotel as being '6 Star' and he was right. This trip, at New Year, was our third visit to the Shangri-La in five years and we were not disappointed in any way. This hotel has all the fixtures and fittings of a top class hotel, but what makes it, and the Valley Wing in particular, special is the staff. They are an impeccable team who ensure that every aspect of your stay a delight. Perceptions of the excellent service are enhanced by a bar in the Valley Wing that is “complementary” (albeit built into the room price) and generous to a fault. Not advertised, but also complementary are sandwich lunches in the Valley Wing lounge. Breakfast in the "Summit Room" spoils you for breakfast anywhere else ... but do have dinner one day at "The Line" (the hotel's main restaurant) which is fantastic. The hotel hosted its own New Year function but we chose to go to IndoChine at Empress Place – an excellent evening and an annual event. If you’d rather save your pennies there are excellent fireworks at The Esplanade and the subway stayed open to 2am.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: overthereoverhere
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived at the Shangri-La we were treated like royalty, our limo doors were opened for us and our luggage taken straight to our room,check in was quick and efficient and we were shown to our room. The room was everything we had hoped and more at first the bed looked short but we soon found that far from this it was exceptionally wide giving the impression of a short bed. Everything you could need wheteer staying on busines or pleasure had been provided right down to an umbrella & street map. The room was very spacious with wonderful views. We were welcomed with a bowl of fresh fruit and brought some rather nice jasmine tea, we were en-route to Australia where we were to be married and the Shangri-La delivered a complimentary congratulation cake to our room. The entrance foyer is very impressive with spectacular chandaliers, the hotel has a great pool and lovely landscaped gardens. We dined in most of the restaurants during our stay and found them to be all very diferent experiences: - Blu - Located at the top of the tower is the best dining experience we have ever had anywhere in the world, it doesnt come cheap but was well worth it, the food was exquisite the service second to none and the champagne the best I have tasted outside of Reims. The view was also spectaclar. The Line - A collection of small kitchens serving many different foods i.e. Indian, Sushi, Fish, deserts etc they also have a special night where you can eat and drink as much as you want from any or all of the kitchens, this was really good value for money and gave us the opportunity to try food which we had not had before. Shang Palace - This is a chinese restaurant wonderful decor but we were disappointed by the service and the menu, if you are used to Chinese restaurants in the UK you will find it difficult as nothing on the menu was anything like we get at home, unfortunately it was also very expensive. Rose Veranda -an english afternoon tea experience, fantastic food a selection of tea and coffee which would be difficult to better anywhere and all served by beautiful and immaculately dressed waitresses. We will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to Fault”
Reviews.Author: grantmac
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in the Valley Wing. Suites are huge - even managed to impress our teeenage son, which is quite an achievement. Room decor is hotel classic ie: will disappoint those looking for chic, but clean and very well maintained. Facilities are excellent. Best features of the Valley Wing are 1. Separate dining room. Families with attendant screaming children encouraged to use the main hotel dining room. Makes for a very pleasant dining experience; 2. Canapes and drinks (including Champagne) served in the main foyer area gratis from 3pm onwards. Service and friendliness is absolutely outstanding - the best we have come across. One of the reasons for this is that the Wing Manager is in constant attendance. Spoke to guests at breakfast, drinks in the afternoon and saw him very sensitively deal with an elderly complainant. Also saw him plumping the cushions and making a presentation to a guest who was celebrating his 70th birthday. In most hotels, even the top ones, the manager is never seen and far to important to deal directly with guests. This manager positively relished the task. In my view it is this approach which makes the difference. Would not hesitate to recommend or stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Shangri-La”
Reviews.Author: Hampshire123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri-La's Valley Wing over Christmas 2007. The rooms were great and everything worked really well - breakfast, lounge area, laundry service, room service, housekeeping, business centre internet access - the staff were really helpful and extremely efficient. We stayed here before some years ago and knew it was a 10 minute walk to Orchard Road. We used the MRT - getting the oyster like cards on the first day at Orchard and topping them up once with cash at the same desk. The MRT and buses are easy to use. It's worth checking the websites of places you want to go as they are very precise about combinations of MRT and bus to get there. The Zoo is fantastic, as is the Jurong Bird Park. Sentosa is massively developed since our last trip but our teenager is studying WW2 so a trip to Fort Siloso helped his understanding. We attended St Andrew's Cathedral on Christmas Day and they were very welcoming. There's loads of brilliant places to eat in SIngapore - we would recommend Bombay Woodland in Tanglin Road Shopping Centre, just down the road. The Straits Kitchen at the Hyatt in Scotts Road is OK - obviously lots of Singaporeans celebrate their birthday there. We were at the Line on Christmas day for one of their excellent Festive Buffets - probably like one of their unfestive buffets but with turkey and a very good local choral group singing Christmas music. We never got to the pool but it looked inviting. The Valley Wing was great - we'd recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: Shastar
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two-night stopover at the Shangri-La's Tower Wing on the way back from New Zealand. Our expectations were high given the hotel's impeccable reputation - and not quite met. We had to change the room twice, which is a bit unusual for such a short stay. To keep it short: room#1 had a very bad smell (hotel was aware of the issue, so the room change went very quickly), room #2 was directly facing the elevators, which were extremely noisy - no sleep after 6 a.m. at all. Room #3 was finally ok. Although issues of this kind can happen at every large hotel, we haven't heared even a single word of apology from the hotel stuff or management, which was somewhat disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Shangri Singapore”
Reviews.Author: MissyGalway
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights and it was wonderful. We got an upgrade without asking and complimentary breakfast.The check in staff and porters were fantastic and really helpful.The room a garden suite on the seventh floor was amazing large and very comfy and clean.The restaurant aline serving breakfast was just unreal so many types of international meals at different stations you just wandered around and helped yourself. The rooftop restaurant was a treat for us on our last night and was it worth it. My husband is anaphalextic toshellfish and fish same as the well known peanut allergy It was never a problem in either restaurant the level of service and personal care is the best we have ever experienced particulary as it is one of the main foods of the Asian countries. The location is brillant a one minute stroll from Orchard Road. Thank you shangri La for making our visit to Singapore extra special

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: Scousie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri-la for two nights during our return stop-over from Australia to the UK on a Singapore Stopover through Singapore Airlines. We were really looking forward to having a really relaxing stay after a month travelling... unfortunately this was not to be! It turned out that the ASEAN summit was on at the same time and as lots of bigwigs were staying at the Shangri-la it was like a fortress getting in and out with airport type security scanners and police with guns patrolling outside. The lobby area was taken up with press people which made it feel more like a train station than anything else, and while I do believe the hotel did its utmost to help guests, it did spoil it somewhat. We paid £130 per night but thought it would be worth the experience of staying at the Shangri-la after reading the comments left by other travellers. First and foremost - the staff are amazing! This is the place to be if you want to be looked after. We were personally shown to our room and greeted when entering the hotel. Staff remembered who we were (and with the amount of people there that was quite something!) and were very helpful. The hotel itself is really nice. The communal areas (lobby, pool etc) are outstanding. There are plenty of places to eat and a small gift shop. However, I was a bit disappointed with our room. We were upgraded to the Garden Wing which I had longed to book but was out of our price range. The pictures on the website looked so pretty with the balconies and the bougainvillaea. However, our room overlooked the carpark and the flowers were pretty dead. The room was fine but as a twin the beds were only a few inches apart. One of the electric sockets wasn't fixed to the wall properly. The bathroom was spacious with a good shower but not enough countertop space for toiletries. There was a small sofa and chair which was nice and a lovely touch was a pot of jasmine (I think) tea waiting for us as a welcome when we arrived. Fresh fruit was also left at no charge. We had breakfast in our room one morning which was excellent. We had journalists staying in the room adjoining and we found that the soundproofing could be better! My other comment about the Garden Wing is that the sound of the tropical waterfalls can be really noisy, especially with the birds in the morning!! The last thing about the hotel is the location - Its about 15 minutes walk from Orchard Road although there is a free shuttlebus that leaves every hour from the hotel and will drop you off at the MRT or by the malls. Doesn't sound like much but walking it in the heat is not that great! We stayed at Raffles the Plaza on the way out for 3 nights and to be honest, we would be more likely to stay there than go back to the Shangri-la. The hotel room felt more spacious and I preferred being more centrally located to shops and the MRT. Don't get me wrong - this is a great hotel and the fact that the ASEAN summit was on wan't their fault! And if you want to be looked after, you can't beat the staff. But in terms of rooms and location I think you can get better elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A winner on the service”
Reviews.Author: ajhaeh
Reviews.Content: We were met at Changi Airport by the pre booked hotel driver who delivered our tired and jet lagged bodies to the brightly lit front doors of the Shangri La Hotel… As soon as the side door of the carrier opened we were whisked away by our ‘greeter’ to be checked in. If Carlsberg ever did Hotel check ins! We were taken to the Garden Wing and to our rooms on the 8th floor.. Our bags followed and the check in was actually done in the room. Then followed a bowl of fresh fruit, traditional hot jasmine tea with pouring jugs and small cups and a turn down service. It was service at its best and was a starter of things to come. Walk out of the hotel and turn left and within minutes you are on Orchard Road, the hub of activity. The efficient and cheap MRT station is close at hand to take you to all city destinations and there are numerous shops, malls and restaurants to choose from. The hotel lobby & reception area were beautifully decorated with Christmas trees etc. and there was always a smiling face and a greeting on hand. The large pool on the 1st floor was accompanied with a very warm Jacuzzi and again a smiling face and greeting was at hand with bath towels. The nearby gymnasium was kitted out with all the state of the art machines The rooms were spacious, with desk, chairs, settee, balcony overlooking the pool and city and an extremely comfortable king size bed and down pillows. A pillow menu was at hand together with sewing kit, umbrella, robes, slippers, comb, toothbrush, iron etc. etc. It seemed that everything had been catered for. A hair dryer was provided, safe, mini bar and fruit and ice were renewed daily. The turn down service left a poem on your pillow and the whole room electronics were operated through a ‘control centre’ at bed side. Electric curtains, air con and a LAN provided internet service made the Shangri La probably one of the best hotels I have stayed in. The bathrooms again were very spacious and catered for everything. Large shower, bath, double sink and so on. We ate in the Blu Room on our final night, not an extensive menu, but quality rather than quantity. Sea bass with caviar & oysters. Food and service was just exceptional. The night time view over the city skyline was breathtaking. The price being very reasonable. Would I recommend this hotel to friends and family. Most definitely. Would I stay here again?. Without hesitation

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: mrsraynor
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the shangri-la hotel on the 16th November 2007, one of many stops on the way to get married in Fiji. We booked a tower wing room. But on arrival got offered an upgrade but at a cost of £80 for three nights. The room was beautiful,overlooking the city. On the table for us was a gorgeous congratulations cake. The staff were fantastic, and spent each of our three night stop, sipping cocktails. Book this hotel for that special occasion. Its worth every penny

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Hotel... in a Fantastic country!”
Reviews.Author: mandymoo32
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days in Singapore on route to Bali for our Honeymoon, and we wish we had stayed here longer! The hotel is lovely, the staff are so helpul and the pool area is great - you do not for one second feel as though you are in the middle of a city! We stayed in the Garden Wing and our room was a good size with a balcony over-looking the pool area. We ate at the restaurant Blu one of the nights and it was great, a bit pricey but well worth it. It is then really nice to go through to the bar area and have a few champange cocktails as the views from the bar and restaurant are amazing! We had breakfast at the Line, again, you really cannot fault anything about this place - the choice of different types of food has to be seen to be believed and although it is buffet style, the turnaround of food is so quick that nothing gets cold! I never thought I would eat curry for breakfast though... :) ! When we go back to Singapore.. and I say when because we definitely will, this will be the hotel we stay at, without a doubt! p.s. there is an area of Singapore called Clarke Quay which has really cool bars/restaurants/clubs - it is defintely worth a visit. We didn't find out about this place until our last night there which was a bit of a shame!

Reviews.Title: “Shangri-La heaven”
Reviews.Author: MadSci
Reviews.Content: Where do I start. We arrived at the Shangri-La on the 12th November for the start of our honeymoon. We were staying in the Valley Wing and as soon as we entered the reception, we were whisked away upstairs to our room for check-in. Upon entering our room, I became slightly confused as it was not what we had booked. When I questioned this, the check-in staff member replied that the Shangri-La had upgraded us for our honeymoon. We were upgraded to a City View Suite and had our own Butler!!! Though for the life of me, I wasn't sure what I was supposed to ask the Butler to do, so we didn't use him on our two night stay. As soon as we had been checked in and the door closed behind our Butler, both my husband and I started jumping around like school kids. The room was absolutely beautiful, there was complmentary chocolates and a congratulations cake for us, and I was also presented with an orchid on arrival. We even found our names printed on Business Cards in the desk drawer!! The bathroom was something else, with doube vanity, seperate toilet and a tv above the spa!! That evening, before dinner, we went downstairs to the lounge for some free drinks. The lounge is beautiful, but we felt very out of place, as we were dressed in what I would call Smart Casual clothes, but everyone else there was dressed in Chanel and Prada and Gucci etc. We ate in the Line restaurant that night and had the buffet. It was amazing, so much choice, and very fresh, but for S$90 per person, you would hope that it was. It was worth it though, and we were on our honeymoon, so why not. We had breakfast one morning at the Line and one morning at the Valley Wing Summit Room. The Line was much more inviting and comfortable to us, as the Summit Room was a little too posh for us. The pool was probably the best that we have seen in Singapore, almost a resort feel, with lots of greenery and squirrels playing around in the trees. Overall, our stay was fantastic, and I would certainly stay at this hotel again, just maybe not in the Valley Wing, as we felt very out of place, which you really don't want on your holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!”
Reviews.Author: Brianally
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel, with staff that smile and greet you politely but BEWARE of improper credit card authorisations, lost bookings and very slow response to rectify these problems. My husband and I recently stayed at the Valley Wing for two nights prior to a cruise on Superstar Virgo for our 25th Wedding Anniversary. The hotel had incorrectly cancelled our booking and not reinstated it even though I presented the voucher showing all the details. Unbeknown to my husband and I, instead of just using the credit card details they took for hotel incidentals, they took SGD1800 to cover our booking- even though I had booked and paid in full more than a year earlier. It was a full 24 hours later before they sorted the mess out and a cake and flowers were sent to our room- too late I'm afraid. To add to this, we stayed at the Tower wing for one night post cruise. We presented our vouchers for both accommodation and breakfasts, and were sent to our lovely room where roses, wine and cake were waiting. Lovely! But again, I am now going to have to wait TWO WEEKS for them to refund the breakfasts of SGD87.10 they incorrectly charged to our credit card. I have had to ring them 4 times and sent an email that was replied with basically a "get lost and get your travel agant to try and get it back". So be aware, they are unscrupulous and superficial. I will not be going back no matter how prestigious the hotel is. Their behaviour has soured our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!....But!”
Reviews.Author: KKmad
Reviews.Content: Wow!....But! Wow!! Returned on Wednesday from 5 nights in Singapore’s Shangri La where we celebrated our 25th Wedding aniversary. Our first impressions were Wow! We arrived on the 16th November and stayed in the Horizon Club Premier Room and it was fabulous. Huge room and bathroom with everything you could possibly need at your finger tips. The staff were so friendly and the pool and gardens are magnificent. But……!!! On Sunday the 18th November things changed dramatically. We discovered that the ASEAN Summit was to be held at our Hotel and our paradise very quickly became a prison. To get out of the hotel we had to fight our way through crowds of reporters and photographers in the lobby. To get into the Hotel was a nightmare with security inspecting every thing and every one. The Hotel and its surrounding area was heavily patrolled by armed police and the army personnel. Taxis’ were reluctant to go through the security inspections to get to the hotel. We tried to work our activities around the shuttle bus only to find the Rasa Sentosa Resort/Shangri La Hotel shuttle that was advertised did not operate any more and on Monday evening the city shuttle was cancelled with out any prior warning. What did the hotel do to compensate its guest – you may ask? On the first 2 days of the Summit there was a team of hotel personnel who stood at the exit of the security screens. They came up and offered an obviously pre-instructed sincere "apology for the inconvenience" and that was it! With the taxi situation we were told rather secretively by the commissioner that he could be arranged a car for $25.00 for what we then found was only $6.70 taxi ride. The same guy also pushed a Limo service for an extra fee and slipped us a piece of paper with his name and number in it. Sunday pm I consulted reception with concerns about the environment we found ourselves in - hoping we could transfer to the Rasa Sentosa Resort (Shangri la) but was told that there was nothing they could do because we were booked through a travel agent. I did not pursue the matter as it was obvious the staff had bigger fish to fry and we just had to do the best we could. We have returned home feeling a little bitter from the experience. This was a special occasion for us and the atmosphere at the hotel was extremely tense and uncomfortable. I just wish we had prior warning so we could make other arrangements

Reviews.Title: “1 week of relaxation (complete with balcony)”
Reviews.Author: Dave5650
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel from the 21/10/07-27/10/07 (6nights). Arrived at the hotel at the hotel at 07.30 and although you cant officially check in till 14.00hrs, i was suprised when the receptionist wanted to charge me an additional full nights stay (£175) even though my room was ready. I challanged the receptionist and they agreed to charge me for half a day. The Hotel is in general excellent. We stayed in the garden wing as my wife and i wanted a balcony. The room has everything you need, from toothpaste, cotton buds, sewing kit, shampoo, dressing gowns, slippers (some guests chose to wear these around the pool) tea + coffee, mini bar, you name it it was available and even if it wasn`t the hotel would have provided it for you. ( we asked for an extra sunbed on the balcony and it was there before i could say Boo) We had room service the first night, served on the balcony, the quality of service and the standard of the food was excellent. We slept in most days till lunch time (i blame the fabulous comfy beds) and the staff would always have our room made up late afternoon. There was also a turn down service. You can be served food and drinks around the pool all day and the food is brought to your sun lounger on a small table. The poolside staff also provide foot and full body massages and the pool is open till 10pm which is nice after you have been out all day There rerstraunts are always busy but are quite expensive, the quality and service are what you are paying for. The Blue bar on the top floor of the Tower wing is worth a visit, cocktails start about £15 ahead but the view is outstanding. The gymnasium is ultra modern and has a great view of the pool. On the down side, the hotel has many function rooms and is used by buisnesses during the week and for weddings at the weekend, however this should not put you off as the intereference is minimal. Taxis are plentiful outside the hotel entrance. The hotel is situated at the top end of Orchard RD and Orchard Road is a short walk (10 min max). Here you will find many bars, restraunts and shops, every one you have at home and more. One recommendation to travellers is goto the Irish Bar Muddy Murphys, about a 12 min walk from the hotel (dont worry you are perfectly safe in Singapore to walk about at anytime) Great atmosphere, good food, the Guiness is outstanding (especially when its free on Halloween) I was in Singapore 13 years ago and prices then seemed extortionate, now there is so much competition prices have stayed the same. Prices are about the same as the UK like for like. A truly fabulous holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Shangri-La experience”
Reviews.Author: icedkachang
Reviews.Content: I had been to singapore when i was 18, and had wandered into the Shangri La lobby to take a peek, and i was so impressed i was determined to make it back someday. too bad it took 15 years but better late than never! this is a fantastic hotel, check in service was speedy and impeccable. our rooms were booked in the Tower Suite, but they werne't ready (this was around 2 in the afternoon) so they offered to upgrade us to an apartment suite, which we accepted. this was lovely and had a kitchen, living room, two bathrooms, and two seperate bedrooms. it also had its own pool which was an added bonus, since the pool in the main hotel looked extremely busy and there weren't any empty seats. we got a welcome basket of chinese tea, and on the last day we were given a box of compelmentary chocolates because they were sorry about giving us a different room. absolutely stupendous service! all staff were wonderful. the location is great, just 5 minutes away to orchard road which is the main shopping street. they even have a shuttle service to and from the hotel, they will take you right to the MRT (subway) which is superconvenient and easy to use. breakfast in the Line resturant is expensive, but sooo good... many many choices to be made. they even had dim sum, muslim food, an entire wall of muffins and pastries, tropical fruit, 6 different types of juices. the hotel was busier than usual due to ASEAN summit (lots of police, secret service around) but this had no impact on our enjoyment of our holiday beds were so comfortable and everything was lovely, including lavender toiletries. highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: cezar1
Reviews.Content: Left a bad review of a different 5* so to give balance here's a great one. We stayed last year as friends live in Singapore. The Shangri-La was just wonderful from beginning to end. Rooms great, service top-notch and best of all the location - just out of the way enough to be a quiet oasis but central enough to be convenient. I would recommend eating out every night though. The food in the hotel is great but the food everywhere in Singapore, street corners to restaurants, is both fantastic and cheap (for instance don't but bottled water from the hotel unless you want an expensive suprise). If you're flying over from the UK go with Emirates then you've got the best hotel combined with the best airline.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Surfachick
Reviews.Content: The best hotel in Singapore for ovcerall ambience and service. Great for families with a big free form pool and spacious rooms with balconies overlooking the pool and lush gardens. The Line restaurant in the morning or for lunch is a real experience and the food is delectable. Will return again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: doc-dragon
Reviews.Content: OK, I may be biased, having been upgraded to the top suite of the Valley Wing on arrival, but the Shangri-La, Singapore is the best hotel I have ever stayed in. My wife and I plus three children arrived tired and bedraggled after a 12 hour economy flight from the UK and were immediately made to feel like the most important guests they'd ever had with all the ladies, including our three year old, being presented with orchids. The reception team seemed more excited than us at being able to give us a complimentary upgrade. I could go on at length about the exemplary service, the beautifully appointed rooms, the variety of dining and drinking options, the pool and the location but this is a hotel best experienced rather than read about. Simply outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel you cannot better it!!!”
Reviews.Author: kevinsreview
Reviews.Content: I have only one thing to say FANTASTIC!!!! the best hotel i have ever stayed in for food and service just book it and go you will not be dissapointed tip, get your nembership of the horizon club on rooms above 16th floor and get all the free drinks and breakfast

Reviews.Title: “100% Perfect - Valley Wing is heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: flyingdutchman06
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in the Valley Wing, and was upgraded to a suite. It is bliss. From the moment you arrive at the airport, you feel like a Head of State: an attentive staff member greets you, takes your luggage and guides you to the limo that awaits. When you arrive at the Valley Wing entrance you are greeted warmly, and whisked away to your room (a suite in my case), where the check in formalities are taken care of swiftly. The suite is huge (85 sqm), and nicely decorated and has a separate seating and sleeping room. A very large fruit basket was waiting for me, and a complementary birthday cake with a personalised card, along with chocolates and cookies. Ample amenities in the bathroom, including razors, toothbrushes, mouth water and the likes. The suites have butler service who take pride in running your bath and give you tourist information. The free Moët & Chandon champagne flows in the lounge from 10 am to 11 pm, with some snacks. Breakfast is complementary, and cooked to your liking. Staff is very nice, the nicest anywhere I've seen. They cannot do enough for you. When I asked them to book a table in a restaurant, they had informed the restaurant that it was my birthday - so I was surprised with a birthday cake! Check out was even more impressive. They collected my suitcase and the moment I exited the elevator, the hotel door was opened, someone else opened the limo door (engine running) and within a minute we were on our way. If you can afford the Valley Wing: try it - you'll love it. One warning: entry into the real world is exceptionally harsh after such an experience.

Reviews.Title: “What an Oasis”
Reviews.Author: tnstvlr
Reviews.Content: The Shangri La, Singapore was built in the mid 1970s and is on the west side fo the City - It is about a 10 minute walk to the beginning of Orchard Road - tons of shopping and people watching - bring your wallet! Since it is on the outskirts of the city, it is literally an oasis. There is an incredible swimming pool in the middle of the complex. We stayed in one of the garden wing rooms (an upgrade from the standard rooms in the tower) and it was fabulous! Bouganvilla on the balcony overlooking the pool and an oversized room was spectacular. The only complaint might be that the air conditioning was not quite up to the job. Everything else was spectacular. A great place to get away from the downtown crowds.

Reviews.Title: “garden wing rooms good :)”
Reviews.Author: rackoala
Reviews.Content: just stayed in ShangriLa for 2 nights... had a room at the garden wing side... the surroundings are very nice, full of greens and you just feel so relax.. away from the busy city.... but of cos, it is still very near to Orchard Road... Feel better if you have transport..as walking may be a bit tiring as the hotel is located uphill... room: stayed at 9th floor..(highest floor in garden wing).. nice view, check in was fast..... room size is good... balcony is spacious enough.... overall is good.... as i here for business purpose and it suits well for me... yap.. had buffet lunch at The Line... quite a lot of choices ... not bad... can try :)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Shangri-La”
Reviews.Author: dRobke
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Shangir-La in November 2006 on a business trip (3 nights) and enjoyed the calm surroundings and excellenta accomodations. The hotel reception is friendly and personilised. We had someone sit down with us in the reception area, and she took us through the check-in procedure in an enjoyable manner. the rooms are spacious and luxurious, and well suited to accomodate business travelers (internet connection, desk, ...). We had buffet dinners special for our group, so I cannot comment on teh restaurant service, but usually the quality of the dinner in the buffet were OK (not amazing quality, but above average). Same applies for the breakfast, which was served in the confernece area. The swimming pool is not ig, but very calm and well kept. Towel service was fast and the towels were clean. I enjoyed the swimming area a lot. The confernece rooms were good, with an old school chiq feel, which is nice if you have all day meetings. The hotel is situated close to orchard road (5-10 min. walk), which is nice to shop. The bar at the top level, served nice drinks for a good price, but got a bit crowded around 10-11 pm.

Reviews.Title: “A Dissapointing Return”
Reviews.Author: spurious
Reviews.Content: I have previously stayed at the Shang and enjoyed it's unrivalled Valley Wing experience. This time however, I booked through Singapore Airline's 'Singapore Stopover' programme. As attractive as this may first appear, I'd advise against it, not only because their so-called 'special prices' are easily matched by certain websites, but also, and chiefly, because you are not able to specify what standard of room you desire, meaning you will be lumped with the basic (Tower Wing) and have to hope that there is availability in your desired level when you arrive. When I arrived, the Valley Wing was fully booked and I was upgraded to the Garden Wing, which comes with a balcony. The room was of a good standard, although the $100 difference between this and the Valley is immeaurably better value for money then the $100 per night upgrade I paid for the Garden Wing upgrade. The level of service and helpfullness of the staff is everything I have come to appreciate from a hotel widely regarded as providing a world benchmark in this area. My only real problem came on checkout. I was provided with my bill showing me what had been deducted from my deposit. I found that despite taking the upgrade fee on check-in, it had been re-applied and removed from my deposit, meaning effectively that I had paid it twice. I was not provided with a receipt for the upgrade on check-in and was refused a refund for it, met only with vague promises that they'll "see what they can do" and email me in due course. On top of this, I was charged for the complimentary breakfast and had to argue my rather obvious case that the charge should be removed, which it eventually was. Given that the hotel is as good as the price you pay for it, I'm forced to mark the Shang down considerably for this. Because they did not provide a receipt for my upgrade and charged me for it twice, I ended up paying the equivilent of a Valley Wing stay. My advise? Don't go through any airline 'deals' programme. Book exactly what you want before you get there and you won't run into this problem. If you do, make sure you get a receipt for everything and be prepared to have to show it on check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Valley Wing = Champagne Wing!”
Reviews.Author: DRKR
Reviews.Content: The Valley Wing at the Shangri-La is a must! Familiar atmosphere, the absolute friendly and warm staff members knew our name from the first day. In the Lobby all Champagne (Moet Chandon) is free, you will get a glass even when you wait 3 minutes for a taxi... Service is Top-end, nothing to do better. Rooms are beautiful and large, garden and pool-site are very relaxing, so I spent most of the afternoons in the pool with our baby-daughter. If you go to the Shangri-La, book the Valley Wing! Enter the Lobby, sit down, relax and sip your Champagne... Thanks a lot, Achem!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: niadan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the second part of our honeymmon. Right from the moment we arrived it was fantastic. The staff were so friendly and polite, nothing we asked for was a problem. We stayed in the garden wing. It is a bit seventies style and could may be do with a little updating but we had a lovely pool view and nice big balcony. The bed was super big and comfortable. The bathroom was lovely with a seperate shower and bath. Plenty of lovely toiletries. There was everything you could want in your room. It was spotlessly clean. There was fresh fruit and chinese tea and a congratulations cake for us. We ate in the Line for breakfast and lunch which was lovely and an amazing selection. We had room service most days which was really tasty. We had dinner in Bleu which is fine dining. Don't be fooled by the "barfood" title as we were. There is a dresscode. the food was really tasty and service exceptional. We also had drinks in the bar and had a nice view of the city. (Not as nice as the view in Equinox restaurant the next night at the Swissotel.) We also had lunch in the lobby bar and was very good. All the staff everywhere are a pleasure to deal with, nothing is a problem. The location is great, just a short walk to Orchard Road and a short taxi to anywhere else you want to go. All in all fantastic. I cannot recomend this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “All that you need in a 5 star hotel, but it is missing....”
Reviews.Author: alainef
Reviews.Content: AMBIENCE!!! Feels like a convention center hotel.

Reviews.Title: “honeymoon bliss??”
Reviews.Author: wendigirl
Reviews.Content: the Shangrila Singapore is must stay destination in Singapore. just up from Orchard Rd it is ideally situated. It may not be the cheapest but it is the best. Just check out the chandeliers in the lobby! Limo pickups are easliy arranged. SERVICE is guaranteed and every possible food combination is available for breakfast alone. The stunning pool area has artistic ambience, especially at night! Warm tropical and romantic, you couldnt find a nicer or more luxurious stay. Upgrade to the garden wing for the extra little priveleges. You dont need to be on your honeymoon to stay there but it will seem like it before you leave. Opulent luxurtY and fist class service and facilites. Everty amenity is available. One negative word, - dont try the poolside pizza!! I have stayed there 3 times already. Go on spoil yourself!!!!! YOU are guaranteed to return!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay!”
Reviews.Author: 123cat
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed here a second time for the start of our honeymoon and we could not have asked for a better start to the holiday. We upgraded to the Valley Wing and it was worth every penny. The lounge includes Moet champagne and yummy cocktails free flowing from 10am until 11pm, afternoon tea with freshly baked scones and finger sandwiches, a la carte breakfast. the staff were very attentive but not overly so. The room was fantastic very comfortable, a great view with large window, extremely comfortable bed, lovely bathroom, close to Orchard Road. Although we did get out and about we couldnt wait to get back to the welcoming comforts of the hotel after a long day. The outdoor pool is wonderful a nice place to relax. Everything was Perfect! And we had a yummy chocolate mousse cake delivered to the room as a honeymoon gift.

Reviews.Title: “Kids loved the pool”
Reviews.Author: Aussies1
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at this hotel for 3 nights on our return to Australia from Europe in early October. Unfortunately, we had a bad start which did impact upon our stay. Upon arrival early evening after a long flight from Rome we were faced with a mistake with our booking. I had booked and paid for two 'Garden Wing' rooms (breakfast included) with Asia Rooms (locally RMG Tours). We were told that only one room had been reserved for us and that breakfast was not included. After about 45 minutes of questioning with no apologies and being made to feel we were at fault, we were finally given two rooms (not interconnecting and only one with a view). We were told we could change to interconnecting rooms the following evening. (This did not happen as two interconnecting rooms with garden views did not become available). The hotel said they would contact RMG tours in the morning. (This was not done and my husband had to call RMG Tours himself). My husband also requested from the hotel copies of the paper work they had received from RMG tours (This paperwork he never received). RMG Tours confirmed that we had booked and paid for two 'Garden Wing' rooms although they were unsure about whether breakfast was included. They called the hotel and late the next morning (after breakfast) all was finally confirmed. We were never able to ascertain whom was at fault. We did however receive wine and chocolates from the hotel. My advice don't use asiarooms.com and certainly don't use any website that asks for payment prior to travel. Always call the hotel a few days prior to arriving to confirm your booking. Overall the hotel was very nice - what you would expect of a 5 star hotel. Our teenage kids loved the pool. It wasn't too tricky getting a seat as can be at some hotels. I think this was because the staff removed lonesome towels regularly. Breakfast was excellent (but the best ever is the Jumeriah Beach Hotel in Dubai). Beds were very spacious and comfortable. We would stay here again but I would book directly and confirm prior to arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore”
Reviews.Author: ARMR_7
Reviews.Content: Upon entering was greeted with a warm welcome. Arrived at Reception desk and was poured a glass of champagne - what a start. The lobby is magnificent and the room was everything I expected of a 1st class hotel. The bar at the top at nightime is great for a cocktail. Will certainly be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms & Food”
Reviews.Author: anahira21
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the Shangri-La were absolutely beautiful. Really modern and clean with a nice free fruit and chocolate basket waiting! Book a high floor to get a great room and great service. Must visit The Line Restaurant for an experience like no other. Chefs cooking different cuisines from around the world will whip up whatever you want from ingredients on display that you can choose. It's kinda like a buffet, you just walk around to different stations and order or take whatever you want. The dessert station is fabbo! Don't book in the resort area - those rooms didn't look very nice. Stay in the corporate tower.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Shangri-la”
Reviews.Author: fazsmr
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner arrived at the Shangri-la early in the morning around 7.30am. Thought of keeping our luggage at the concierge and then come back to check in later. I was attended by their Manager. Very kind of him to let me check in eventhough it was very early. He then showed us to our room. Room was spacious and well decorated. Standard of the service in this hotel were awesome. Staffs greeted you by name. Professional and attentive. Swimming pool area perhaps was the best. Can see why it is fulled throughout the time. And health club was good too. Had dinner at The Line. Food was very well presented and the quality was indeed good. Concierge were very helpful and gave me late check out at 4pm. I have found my shangri-la. Paradise on earth, the Shangri-la.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not fantastic”
Reviews.Author: ppoh
Reviews.Content: I guess this hotel has won all the possible awards there are. I have stayed at three room types lately: standard Tower Wing room, Horizon Club in the Tower Wing, and this time in a Garden Wing room. One attribute for all the rooms is: a bit old. I mean everything is clean, staff is nice, location is fine, but the rooms just feel a bit old to call this a great hotel. My current room in the Garden Wing was nice but the traffice noise (I was on 5th floor just above the road the taxis take to the reception) was a bit loud. Nice touch was the separate reception - my travel agent just did not tell me about that. The Horizon Club room was enormous and the special reception upstairs exclusive. But again... a bit old. However, the pool is great - big enough for exercise, the gym is one of the best in hotels I have seen, the massage in the health club was good, and the breakfast in the Line was superb. Staff was one of the best in the world.

Reviews.Title: “A lush oasis in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Lover_HK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so lush and green and really sets itself apart from the other city hotels. Even thought it's not centrally located, it's only a 5-10 minute walk down to Orchard Road where the MRT station is. There are also free hotel shuttle buses which run every hour. Rooms were clean and spacious and there was a daily free fruit selection and newspaper delivered to the room. The best bit has got to be the buffet breakfast at The Line. Simply divine! So much choice and so much food. We spent an hour eating breakfast here every morning!

Reviews.Title: “A heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: Gloucs
Reviews.Content: Superb in every way - room/ service/ cleanliness/ food/ etc We stayed for a couple of nights here and wished we could have stayed a week ! The whole place is so relaxing and the food is excellent. We ate in most of the restaurants and were spoilt for choice The service is charming, efficient and professional. They genuinely seems to care about you. It deserves its five stars. I want to go back - soon!

Reviews.Title: “my very favourite hotel”
Reviews.Author: sraj
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the hotel following our 4 night stay last year and was the stopover on our return from Australia. We had a great stay last year and I have to say I was a bit worried about it not living up to our memories. How wrong I was. From the time we stepped out of the hotels limo from the airport to the time we stepped back in, it was fantastic. We stayed in a pool view valley wing room and made use of the lounge alot. The pool is great, a real resort in the middle of a city, but if you play the mini golf course next to it make sure you spray yourself liberally with insect repellant. It has got us both times. Pool service is great with the usual cold towels, fresh fruit and iced water. Took our breakfast in the line each morning. In my view the best breakfast buffet in the world. The rooms are very large with excellent bathrooms. Every item you could need in the bathroom is provided and it's great to run a hot bath with crystals and lie back and watch tv. The lounge is great. The champagne at night is wonderful and I have to mention Amin, one of the butlers, he really looked after us making a great fuss of my son and keeping him supplied with special fruit cocktails. All in all I would highly reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Plush but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: detoxed
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two days. On arrival, the staff were attentive, even escorting me from the taxi to the reception and arranging for my bags to be sent to the room directly. Check-in was efficient and friendly, although the staff did not bother to offer any information on the hotel facilities. I had to find this out myself by hunting down the literature once in the room. The hotel itself is well maintained with a wide range of dining and relaxation possibilities. As the windows could not be opened, the air in the room tended to be stuffy. The air conditioning system did not help and gave me a headache, so I switched it off. However, the room was large, the bed comfortable and the bathroom well appointed and clean. Room service breakfast was delivered quickly and efficiently. On the down side, the shuttle bus service to Orchard Road operates only once per hour. Internet access cost S$10 for 15 minutes. The hotel seemed a bit impersonal and I had the impression that the management was keen to see guests spend as much as possible. At check-out, there was a mistake on my bill (charges for services that had not been requested). This was sorted out quickly and an apology was issued.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel_30
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Shangri-La for a 3 night city break before flying onto Bali. The hotel is absolutely stunning and is based in a really peaceful location on the outskirts of the city, yet only a 5 minute walk from Orchard Road (the city's main shopping and entertainment area). The hotel provides a free shuttle service to Orchard Road at various times of the day (if you ask at the concierge desk they will give you a timetable). Once you're on Orchard Road you can take the MRT to anywhere in the city. Its the easiest and least expensive way to find your way around. We only had a standard room but this was lovely, very clean and comfortable. It had excellent facilities with a few homely touches. Fresh fruit is placed in your room on a daily basis and a pot of warm tea awaits you when you return in the evening. The remote control at the bedside controls everything from the curtains and alarm clock to the air conditioning and lights. The buffet breakfast at The Line restaurant was pricey but well worth the money. The variety of food available was unbelievable and the quality was superb. Even though we didn't stay very long here, we found this hotel to be exeptional and wouldn't hesitate in recommending it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic place”
Reviews.Author: AAGill
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. It is 10 minutes walk from Orchard Road but is on such a quite street. The hotel is fabulous. We got upgraded to the Valley Wing with free champagne and all the cocktails, snacks and drinks we could have everyday. Also included a really good breakfast. The hotel itself is out of this world. I must also highly praise all the staff as every single person we interacted with was super nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Kirsty78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Shangri-La on the first part of our honeymoon in July. After 22 hours travelling from the UK we arrived at the hotel around 9am to find a mix-up with our booking. We had booked a Valley Wing Room on the hotel's website & when we arrived they said we had booked into the Garden Wing and the Valley Wing was full. After tears from me and several cups of tea later, the manager of the Valley Wing arrived and apologised and said they had found us a room in the Valley Wing. We were so happy as we had wanted the free champagne option as a perfect start to our honeymoon. The manager took us to our room and they had arranged a cake, champagne and a beautiful heart of petals on the bed. Over the 3 days, Sandro (the GM) and all his staff couldn't do enough for us. Sandro also gave us a $25 voucher on the last morning to use in one of the restaurants. I would rate this hotel 6 stars and although we had a bad experience at check in, they couldn't do enough to rectify it. I would highly recommend the Valley Wing as the champagne and canapes are great. The breakfast in the Summit room is lovely and they cooked my husband his own personal breakfast (and remembered that he hates tomatoes on the 2nd morning). We ate in the Line restaurant several nights and the buffet is amazing. The pool is lovely although it can get quite crowded esp late afternoons. If we ever go back to Singapore I wouldn't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “I have a couple of remarks”
Reviews.Author: DohaRgb
Reviews.Content: Our room was a bit musty from the humidity, this could be better attended to by maintenance. Keep an eye out for monitor lizards. They sometimes like to join you in the man-made lagoon and will shock you when you see them swimming especially the kids! Please have a lot at your room service. Needs some upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel could do with an upgrade of facilities”
Reviews.Author: Gregory1972
Reviews.Content: This hotel could do with a major upgrade of facilities ; it feels old and could therefore do with a major renovation. Overall, not a good package for either the business or leisure traveller.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic anniversary weekend!”
Reviews.Author: StrudelMonkey
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted to get out of town for our anniversary and chose Singapore as our destination. It was our first time staying at a Shangri-la property, but it looked like just the place for a relaxing weekend. We couldn't have been happier with our choice. From the moment we arrived to the time of our departure, we were treated to wonderful service. We stayed in the Garden wing with a view over the pool. We arrived to find an anniversary cake waiting for us in the room .. a really nice gesture and a welcome sight after a long flight! The pool was wonderful and we enjoyed spending our mornings there. There were usually few people there before 11:00 and was very relaxing. The service around the pool was fantastic. The hotel is a short walk from Orchard Road ... no more than 10 minutes down the street. We had a great stay and look forward to staying at another Shangri-la again soon. We can certainly recommend the Shangri-la Singapore without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you singapore”
Reviews.Author: LondonMammoth
Reviews.Content: The Shangri La Hotel epitomises much of what Singapore has to offer. Great city views, fantastic hospitality, excellent food, lush gardens and perfect business facilities.
