I wish I could have stayed more than 3 nights in this hotel. My wife and I had booked the cheapest rooms available as we were planning to use the hotel as a base and spend most of our time exploring Singapore. Upon arriving we were very surprised to be taken directly to our room for check-in by a courteous and knowledgeable member of staff, who quickly got the formalities over with; and then helped us with our many queries about Singapore. The room and bathroom were large and had all the ameneties one would expect of a modern 5-star hotel these days. We had a great view of the city and the lush gardens surrounding the hotel. We were so happy with our room we wondered how much better the more expensive rooms could possibly be! The public areas and the huge lobby were decorated in a combination of contemporary and oriental styles. We never had dinner at the hotel, but the breakfast was out of this world, leaving nothing to be desired. You could try something different for many days and still be very full each time. We also had some drinks and snacks by the pool, and like the rest of the hotel the standards were exceptional. I loved the fact that the pool was not gimmicky and was large enough for a proper swim and relative privacy. I took my laptop to the pool one day and was surprised to be able to get free Wifi there. I don't know whose wireless router I was using, but thank you for letting me check my emails! The only problem with the hotel is that because it is in a residential area (a lovely green prestigious neighbourhood by the way), taxis are not as common as the hotels in the commercial districts; and at 'peak times' you can be in for a few minutes' wait. If you've already booked this hotel, don't worry, well done, you've made a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Near Orchard Road (shopping) + taxi ride away from CBD”
Reviews.Author: Woodai
Reviews.Content: I was in Singapore for 5 days on a business trip. Normally I stay at the Fullerton because it's a 5 minute walk from our Singapore office but they quoted rates that were twice the Shangri-la's. What's worse Raffles the Plaza quote rates that were 3 times the Shang's rates! I liked the Shang a lot. The service was great, room service took 15-20 minutes, the breakfast buffet at LINE was excellent, lots of variety to choose from. I even got 50% off at the breakfast buffet because I joined the Golden Circle Club! The only thing that was kind of annoying was that if you had to get to the CBD (ie., Raffles Place) at around 9am and you left the hotel at 8:25am you would be standing in line for a very long time to get a taxi. I don't think this is the Shang's problem, the guys called taxis for us... it's a problem the Singapore gov't should address. You can never find taxis right off the street and if you call for one you have to pay a few $$ extra. Slightly annoying if you're not familiar with these unwritten rules.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: Teale186
Reviews.Content: I stayed here late last year for a business trip. I stayed in the Garden wing, and it was the best hotel experience I've ever had. The hotel and pool area are beautiful, the breakfast buffet is huge and high quality, the staff are incredibly customer-service oriented, and the room was spacious, airy, clean, and beautiful. I hope I have the opportunity to come to Singapore again, so that I can stay in this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic 4 night stay”
Reviews.Author: elsier
Reviews.Content: Well finally it was my turn after having read the review on this site for some time I was really looking forward to going and I was not disappointed. We arrived into singapore airport at 0630 and were taken straight to the hotel who had our room ready without having to pay extra. We were also given a room upgrade to the Garden Wing. The rooms were lovely and clean and the bed was big and very comfortable, we were advised by the concierge that we had 2 bottles of complimentary water in the mini bar and space to put our own drinks as it was more cost efficient to buy from the seven eleven. The pool area is lovely not that we used it as it was our first time to Singapore so we spent every day sightseeing. We were lucky to have breakfast included as it is quite expensive but well worth it with a very large selection of items from around the world to choose from. One thing we did was go to Raffles for the high tea which was an experience and then make the walk to raffles landing site. We also did the Zoo and the night safari which were both excellent. One thing I wanted to do was to go to Lau Pa Sat but unfortunately we didnt make it. Never mind there is always next time. If anybody has any doubts about this hotel dont the staff are very friendly and knowledgeable and there is always a smile and a greeting.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: kagriff4
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the Horizon Club Premier Rooms...what a treat? We were greeted in reception and whisked way to the 24th floor where the Horizen club had it's own private reception. Wine and canapes were provided every evening at 6pm...no charge. The room was spectacular but the bathroom was glorious. I wasn't too keen on a stop over in Singapore but after a very tiring trip last year back from Australia we decided it would be necessary. I loved the hotel and Singapore was beautiful. Spent the morning shopping in Orchard Road and then the afternoon by the pool a having foot massage, cocktails etc. The staff and service was amazing...very gracious and hospitable. Would most definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Still the best”
Reviews.Author: Prof03
Reviews.Content: This hotel in Singapore maintains its reputation for excellence. Wonderful pool setting, ideal for jet lagged travellers to recover. Staff and service amongst the best in the world. One tip, if you like a balcony, and book the Garden Wing, don't be surprised if you are upgraded to the Valley Wing, which has more recently re-furbished rooms, but no balcony!! Insist on the Garden Wing!

Reviews.Title: “High class hotel with service to match”
Reviews.Author: dish2
Reviews.Content: Stayed on return from New Zealand as part of a Singapore airlines deal. Have to agree with previous posts...this is simply one of the best hotels I've stayed in. Spectacular lobby, lounge and piano bar. Our room was spacious and well appointed with a huge bed, luxurious bathroom and an expansive view over the city. Superb variety of top quality food available and the staff are simply incredible. One extra tip: If you book as part of an airline deal, don't bother signing up to any city sightseeing tours - they're expensive and rushed (cabs are so cheap and much more fun).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: GlobalJana
Reviews.Content: The Shangri-La is located on Orange Grove Road - just a few minutes walk to Orchard Road. The lobby of the hotel is gorgeous and there are several great restaurants in the hotel (try the Chinese restaurant there, Shang Palace - and get the avocado ice cream if they still have it - to die for!). BLU is the upscale restaurant on the top floor with great views and a fabulous menu (great for business entertaining as well). The gym and swimming pool are fantastic - the best that I've found in Singapore. The rooms are nice as well (if you can, stay away from the garden rooms - you have to go outside in the heat/humidity to get to them). This is the best hotel I've stayed at in Singapore and definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “simply great!”
Reviews.Author: incrediblepie
Reviews.Content: Fantastic place to stay and very competitive price. There is very little to say about the Shangri-la that has not been said already in some reviews. The hospitality was second to none. I stayed there for 7 nights for a business trip in the Horizon Club. One of my dearest memories was watching the sun come up over Singapore from the Horizon Club breakfast room. Spectacular. The room service, food, room cleanliness, laundry, business services, all super. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who has to spend a few nights in Singapore. you don't really get the feel of the place unless you stay for more than two nights. The prices are well within everyone's reach if you want to spoil yourself for a few nights. Apart from the hotel, the staff really make this place great. The restaurant on the ground floor is also a great experience if you want o get some tastes from all around the region.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: tignook
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after a surf trip to indonesa for three nights, by far and away the best hotel I have ever stayed at! After being on a boat for 18 days it was great to see a huge shower and a king bed. The breakfast buffet was best I have ever had; it must have had 100 diffrent thing to chose from. I never did eat the lunch or dinner buffet by it looked even better then the breakfast buffet! The service was impecable my flight left at 7:00 am and i needed something from the gift shop it was closed and they opened it for me so i could get what i needed, that was nice! In a nut shell i would never stay at another hotel in Singapore, Shangri La is top notch to me.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but we prefer The Marriot”
Reviews.Author: regio
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Shangri-La hotel for 3 nights, the hotel upgrade us to a Executive Suite, so we tought they were very nice with us to do this but when we were going to sleep we found out that our bed was actually two single beds push together, we were very tired (Singapore was our third stop or country in Asia in two weeks) and we did not tell them anything until the check out., we did not want to put everything in our suitcases once again. The Hotel is beautiful, but while we were walking in Orchand Rd we saw the Marriott Hotel and we wished we have stayed there, The Marriot has a very nice outdoor bar, facing the the Orchand Rd, in the middle of everything, cafes, restaurantes, shops,also just across The Marriot is a bar call Indochine which plays live music everyday, We think that the Marriot has a very location for us...nex time we will stay there. P.S. If you stay in the Shangri-La Hotel check your bed before you unpack your luggage

Reviews.Title: “Best in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: KJT57
Reviews.Content: I booked as a stopover with Singapore Airlines, on arival at the hotel I enquired about an upgrade as it was our 25th wedding aniversary. The very friendly check in staff said they had a special room for us and for a small upgrade charge we were shown to a suite in the Valley Wing. I was not disapointed. It was superb. Although we arrived at the main hotel our luggage apeared with no problem. About 30 minutes after check in, the butler arrived with an aniversary cake and a personalised card, a nice touch. I was amazed at how the staff remembered your names and they were all very polite, friendly and attentive, nothing was to much trouble. On two evenings we arranged the time for our return and the bath had been run for us, soft music playing and candles around the bath. Definately a hotel dedicated to the service and confort of there guests. I would definately reccomend the valley wing for special occasions. They made our anniversary very special.

Reviews.Title: “Fit for the Queen”
Reviews.Author: watchd0g
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Valley Wing for a long weekend was an amazing experience. We loved every bit of it. The hotel staff is excellent and made us feel welcome and important, although we are not royalty.

Reviews.Title: “Shangri-La Fantastic Opulence at a Nice Price”
Reviews.Author: colummeehan
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the shang a number of times for business and pleasure as my company has a good corporate rate. Myself and my wife were last there in November 06 and decided to go for a Horizon club delux room as all the tower wing rooms were booked out due to a media conference. Well the extra cost was certainly worth it. As always the staff were extremely friendly and helpful and nothing was too much. As I stated above we booked a delux room - and everthing was fine until we flushed the toilet! It overflowed and flooded the bathroom. Not very pleasant!!! Maintenance and housekeeping were prompt to attend to the issue. However, this happend on 2 further occasions. On the second day we had enough and complained that the problem was becoming intolerable. The Horizon club manager suggested that we transfer to another room and made the necessary arrangements. Well I must say that we were pleasantly surprised when we entered the room and discovered that we were upgraded to a Horizon club suite at no extra cost. We certainly were not expecting this. After the little upset with the toilet issue the rest of our stay was fantastic!!! The horizon club is excellent with complimentary cocktails and drinks each evening from 5 - 7pm, afternoon tea, free business centre and complimentary breakfast in the Blu restaurant over looking the city. For such a small island Singapore is a great place. We lived there for a short time a few years back and have travelled there many times for business and We are returing Singapore in early July to catch the great singapore sales and are booked into the Shangri-la. However, this time we have booked a Valley wing delux room with all the benefits! Can't wait ! I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel! If you get the chance definitely stay there, its worth it just for the buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: julieandliam
Reviews.Content: nice hotel level of service excellent rooms very nice

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: emmajSouthampton
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. Staff really eager to please and due to Singapores no tipping culture wanted nothing more than feedback to the hotel about how well they served you. We stayed in 4 top class hotels for our honeymoon and this really was the best for service and room comfort. They didnt know we were honeymooners as our travel agent forgot to tell them but reception sent up a bottle of wine (much better than the expected cake and flowers given the cost of decient wine in asia!). I needed a sewing kit, they took some time- possibly because they arranaged a lady to come up and do my sewing rather than a kit! On arrival were offered a suite and access to a-la-carte breakfast overlooking singapore and cocktail hours in an executive bar with free drinks and fantastic nibbles for around £30 per night. We really felt this worth the money as we had a coupple of free drinks every night sabstantial nibbles and breakfast and the view were amazing. Really clean and plush-they change the carpets in the list everyday so say the day of the week (took me some time to work out I thought every lift had a different name) and staff wear traditional clothes. Good security.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: JJCDubai
Reviews.Content: This truly has to rate as one of the best hotels there are. Although the building is showing its age the team that look after you are truly amazing. From complimentary champagne every evening to in room check in nothing is too much trouble. I stayed in the Valley Wing with its separate entrance and dedicated team. Very exclusive away from the hoardes around the front - highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cleopetra
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel , definitly do the room upgrade with breakfast as the food is lovely. The pool is very nice and definitely have the eat as much as you can buffet dinner (something like £50 each) but amazing so much choice!!! My husband and i did it just before the plane and the food was fabulous - i am very fussy eater and never thought i would reccomend a buffet dinner but this is something else. Staff were lovely and had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “The Best I've Ever Stayed At”
Reviews.Author: Faithful_Suitcase
Reviews.Content: Booked a valley wing room for a two-night (one-day), stopover based solely on the reviews here. I can honestly say they live up to any amount of praise thrown their way. Hotel Transfer: Had arranged previously and the "team" was there to greet me as expected. They even went out of their way to try and locate my gf who was flying in from elsewhere and we had mixed up which terminals we were meeting at. Check-In/Check-Out As soon as we walked into the lobby a lady came up to greet us "by name" and led us directly to our room. On the way to the room she informed us that we had been upgraded to a suite. Once in the room, the butler gave us an "induction" to the room while the clerk took our passports/etc. and filled out the check-in forms. Within 5 minutes our luggage was there and we were checked in and alone to relax. Check-Out was just as quick. We had an early flight our last day and our luggage was picked up and loaded in the vehicle and bill paid for in a matter of 5 minutes agin. Room The room was quite impressive. I think it was the little things that really struck me. the jack so you could plug your iPod into the stereo; the pot of tea in it's own warmer; the selection of chocolates, and the automatic controls of eevrything. Service Best service I've ever come across. Nothing was too much trouble, our butler literally walked us half the way to Orchard road since we said we wanted to walk and he didn't want us lost. Probably interacted with 15 different people working for the hotel in the 36 hours we were there and all were better than I have seen elsewhere. Food Never got a chance to have breakfast (Up too late first day and gone too early the next), but did have dinner at The Line one night. I can't see anyone going hungry here......or not finding something they absolutely love to eat. Only thing here I found kind of "over the top" was the 1.5 liter bottle of water that cost S$16, but the food was worth it. Location It is very convenient to the one end of Orchard Road, maybe 5-10 minutes walk, but since it is not right on Orchard, you are relieved fro all the hustle and bustle. I actually couldn't think of a better spot if you want quiet/convenience. I really cant say enough good about this place. Unfortunately on my way back through I stayed at the Marriott for comparison purposes and missed out on another great stay. I won't do the same next time.

Reviews.Title: “Just keeps getting better !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: judyush
Reviews.Content: Just had a fabulous week at the Shangri la Valley Wing. I stayed at the Shang three years ago when my husband was on business. We were thoroughly spoilt. My husband was there for about two months I stayed for three weeks. We had a premier room in the Horizon club Tower Wing. Fantastic. Breakfast may be taken on the 24th floor. Wonderful waiter service excellent food and views to die for. Or in the main buffet restaurant on the ground floor. The best choice I have ever seen for breakfast or even lunch for that matter. Because all cuisines are available. We loved having curries and naan breads for breakfast. Or noodles dim sum and fried rices. Also Japanese which I am not a fan of . English eggs bacon sausage mushrooms omelettes etc American pancakes and waffles made fresh in front of you and anything else you can think of. Wonderful juices and fresh fruits. Pastries and muffins doughnuts and danish the list just goes on and on. We returned the following year for a four week stay. They were busy renovating the Valley Wing and the main ground floor restaurant and we just couldnt take the noise so stayed at Traders just down the road. Sister hotel to the Shang. Ok but not in the same league. But while there heard wonderful things about what was happening in the Valley Wing. Apparently once completed David and Victoria stayed there when in Singapore for the Olympic bids. So daughter and I decided to pay a visit and experience this for ourselves. If its good enough for Posh and Becks....... Valley Wing was wonderful. Bathroom was gorgeous and big enough to accomodate two women !!!!! That alone speaks volumes. Good quality toiletries replenished immediately. Abundance of towels v.v. thick and fluffy. As were the white towelling robes. Nice touch also were the lightweight cotton kimono style robes which were lovely and cool to wear after a long steamy soak in the bath watching telly. Only thing missing was a few soaps like coronation street or eastenders. Seperate dressing room area with loads of wardrobe space. We requested extra hangers and a dozen were brought immediately. Daughter hasnt quite grasped the art of packing for a week and packed instead for a month (incase we stayed on ? I wish....) But no problem there was more than enough room in robes and drawers. To be honest I was dreading twin beds. But they were very big. Just short of a normal double bed in the UK. Daughter thought it was very comfortable. I on the other hand compared it to sleeping on concrete. However I do normaly sleep on a memory foam so perhaps that was just me. Well stocked mini bar though V.V. EXPENSIVE. Two complimentary bottles of fresh water left everyday. A chocolate left everynight. Very good turndown service. With slipmat left at side of bed along with your slippers. Excellent standard of housekeeping. One small niggle was the standard of bedding. Plain white sheets and duvet covers, soft and comfortable and all changed daily but definately in need of replacement. Duvets often had threadbare patches and twice pillowcases had actual holes in them! Not in keeping with a five star hotel. Dont think Posh and Becks would have tolerated that. Breakfast in the Summit room was something else. Magnificent. Half expected the queen to join us . Everything available t the main restaurant (now called "The Line") is available in the Summit room but mostly served to you by the most polite and pleasant group of people. "Nothing was too much trouble" just doesn't do it when descibing the level of service afforded by these wonderful attentive but unobtrusive people. I am loathe to call them waiters and waitresses because they were much more than that. Greeting you by name each morning looking genuinely pleased to see you. Noting that they had missed you the previous morning when daughter had decided to try the Line for breakfast . This standard of service carried through to the champagne bar in the lobby where the same personel looked after us dishing up snacks and treats afternoon tea as good as the Ritz. Delicate hot canapes delicious especially when washed down with copious amounts of complimentary champagne. Moet and Chandon no less. All refreshments were there for the asking. Tea coffee juices coctails spirits. available from 11am thru' tll 10.30pm. And all preferences duly noted and remembered. Very weak tea for me decaf coffee for daughter. Always a glass of water served with our champagne and all prepared with out being asked usually just an acknowleding nod before we even settled in our favourite sofa. And there we would sit for a very comfortable hour or so of people watching pampering and being pandered to. All of this doesnt come cheap but hey if you are staying at the Shangri la anyway for a few pounds extra it is worth splashing out and treating your self. The price of alcholic drinks in Singapore is so expensive it wont take you long to work that it will actually save you money to upgrade to the Valley Wing. Having said that, IF the only way you can afford to stay at the Shang is in the most basic room anywhere in the hotel, then DO IT. Because it will be FAB anyway. The hotel is an experience not to be missed. With wonderful service no matter who you are. A beautiful pool where once again attendants take care of your every need. Coming around regularly with complimentary fresh fruits and ice cold towels. Waiters on hand to take your drinks and food orders. TIP... ask for a glass of iced water. This is free. Order a 1 litre bottleof water and it will cost you 22 singapore dollars, just over £7. And it is not served in an ice bucket therefore will be warm before you can drink it all. I am already planning return trip in September. Once youve have stayed there you are spoilt and wont ever want to go anywhere else. Like I said if its good enough for Posh and Becks.....

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MonkeysUncleYorks
Reviews.Content: My parents and I stayed at the hotel for 2 nights on our way to Australia for a 5 week trip visiting relatives. I had read all the reviews on this site and was very hopeful for our visit. The hotel and Singapore far exceeded my expectations. The hotel is beautiful both inside and out and the staff are friendly and very attentive. It was my mothers 65th birthday whilst we were there and they sent wine and chocolates to her room, a touch which was greatly appreciated. The rooms are spacious and very comfortable; the restaurants are of an excellent quality without being over priced and the pool is large and well maintained. It is situated at the top of Orchard Road and only a 10 minute stroll to all the shops and restaurants. Taxis are very cheap so you don't even have to walk if the heat gets too much!! We are already planning our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Still the best”
Reviews.Author: Degas
Reviews.Content: Returned for third visit - booked a garden room - as I love the bouganvillea framed views and was very gratified to be upgraded to a garden suite. Really good sized rooms and its great to have a separate lounge area - so that you can do your 'awake at 3am' jet lag adjustments without disturbing ones partner. Its been a few years since our last stay and the revamping of the coffee shop area into 'The Line' is great - really clean modern lines and a great selection of food. Had one of the best foot massages ever by the pool. The real strength of this place is the staff - so well trained, from porters to managers - managing to sound as though they really care that you have a great stay- and delivering on every request.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven”
Reviews.Author: deekdeek
Reviews.Content: This was heaven on earth. An amazing hotel. We just could not find fault. service was excellent. And when travelling long haul that matters we had a speedy check in and the room was so inviting after our long journey we had a bath tub and a shower and a beautiful view.

Reviews.Title: “Once Again fantastic”
Reviews.Author: CHabroad
Reviews.Content: This is my second visit to this hotel and I again booked into the Valley Wing, therefore I can't comment on the rest of the hotel. What I can say though is the Valley Wing is spectacular. The personal service you receive from the moment your car pulls in the driveway is second to none. The receptionists is extremely helpful and after being presented with an orchid take you to your room (via a private elevator only accessed by residents of the wing). The rooms are luxurious (although no balcony) and the maid service is first class. The bed is one of the most comfortable I've ever slept in and the bathroom is one of the most luxurious I've experienced in a hotel. All the extra touches are there to make your stay special. The bar area (where drinks are complimentary) is light and airy and the harpists adds to the lovely atmosphere this hotel promotes. The staff are wonderful and will do anything for you (including fetching band aids and tweezers for a splinter!). The hotel is just wonderful and if you get the chance to go there...then GO!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Malcolm100
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife have just returned from our honeymoon where we spent the first 5 nights in the garden wing of the Shangri La hotel in Singapore. I had used trip advisor to choose this hotel and was I am pleased to say that this hotel lived up to the hype in all respects. From check in through to exit this hotel was a dream and the rooms, breakfasts and blue bar were truly something to behold. Cannot recommend this place highly enough! Far enough away from Orchard Rd to not hear the traffic but easily walkable although complimentry shuttle services are laid on throughout the day.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute luxury”
Reviews.Author: Cloughie
Reviews.Content: The vicinity of the hotel is not what you would expect of a 5 star hotel, however once you alight from your car that feeling swiftly changes. We were met by numerous hotel staff who welcomed us to the hotel. The checking in process was highly efficient and as everybody else does we upgraded to the club floor, well worth the extra money. Our room was spacious and luxurious withsplendid views if Singapore. The club floor was an added bonus, wonderful service and excellent food. We have stayed in 5 star hotels throughout the world, the Shangri La in Singapore takes some beating, I would highly recommennd it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: markanddoris
Reviews.Content: I upgraded to the Valley wing (before I left) as a result of previous reviews. Hotel was every bit as good as I hoped. Super room, fantastic bathroom, great service. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - had a relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: Anjali1007
Reviews.Content: I used to live in SIngapore and I've also visited as part of many holidays and business trips. I've therefore stayed in many of the high-end hotels but this was my first time in the Shangri La. I enjoyed my stay and would come back but it didn't blow me away like some of the other hotels in Singapore have done. Service - front desk was absolutely excellent. Check in and check out very quick with no problems and wonderfully friendly staff. However, the service at breakfast and at the Lobby Bar was poor. At breakfast, I was kept waiting ages before I was seated, they brought me coffee instead of tea, took ages to change it etc etc. In the Lobby Bar I timed it - I was kept waiting 25 minutes after ordering a cocktail and then it took them 15 minutes to bring me the bill after I asked for it. Rooms - lovely. I stayed in the Garden Wing and my room was very big and had a lovely balcony which I sat on every afternoon. The bathroom was very spacious and the bed was extremely comfortable. Pool - Nice pool but crowded. I was there for Chinese New Year and by 10am, they had run out of sunloungers and were therefore bringing chairs out of the conference rooms. Food - pricey but good. Room service was very quick. Excellent choice at breakfast (sadly I didn't have enough space in my stomach to try everything). Location - nice location in the leafy residential area of Singapore. Very short walk to Orchard Road. This is a good location if you want a relaxing stay, away from it all. It's better to stay by the river or Marina Bay if you want easier access to restaurants and bars. All in all, this is a nice hotel but I think I slightly prefer the Ritz Carlton and Pan Pacific.

Reviews.Title: “Pampered Paradise”
Reviews.Author: mk702
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived at the hotel on the first leg of a round the world holiday. Fortunately we were upgraded to the Valley Wing which was wonderful with beautiful rooms, spacious and extremely comfortable. The staff were so friendly, courteous and helpful and made you feel special. The hotel set a standard that we never achieved in any other hotel in Australia or USA. We cannot wait to go back as a stopover en route to Australia or New Zealand and would always recommend the Shangri La

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but not "the best"”
Reviews.Author: thmilin
Reviews.Content: I grew up in Singapore and have a longstanding love and weakness for the city. It is known for its exceptional understanding of service, something retained from the colonial years. No matter where you go, generally the staff of an establishment will be polite, willing to help, pleasant, and this is simply by default. Shangri-La would not have been my first choice, in that it is expensive, not exactly centrally located, and that none of the rooms were "my style" except perhaps the Horizon Club rooms. You may think "this is the #1 hotel in Singapore and they gave me AMAZING #1 level service" but the truth is this - you can go to almost any hotel in Singapore and get similar service. The only thing you have to do is make sure the HOTEL itself is physically up to par, and the price fits your budget - and as long as that's the case, the service itself will generally follow. (Thus, if you get a budget hotel - no, you're not going to get amazing amenities.) Basically go to a 3 star hotel in Singapore and you should be generally very satisfied. However, a friend was having a wedding here so I went with the Tower Wing. I was pleased to see that the rooms were very clean, the bathrooms were lovely (as all Singaporean bathrooms tend to be), lots of free (and frequently refilled) bathroom products, and my towels were repeatedly changed even though I didn't leave them on the floor. Quaint doorbell and - I loved this - an automated room system that controls nearly everything in the room (drapes, lights for night/day/reading, warns staff that you not be disturbed, A/C, etc.). Since I am a very late sleeper it was awesome to have that big red light on outside the door so the maids didn't harass me in the morning. Phone offers 3 languages - English, Japanese ... I can't remember the 3rd! Did not love the room key power system - hotels market this as "green" but it also saves them energy - everything turns off until you put your card in. Singapore's a sticky humid place so A/C is paramount - and you want the A/C ON when you get back to the room. Luckily when I left the card in with all the lights off but the A/C on, staff did not remove the card (as other hotels I've been to in the US do). Bed was hard - I've been spoiled living in the US. I stayed at 2 hotels in S'pore this trip, both beds killed my back. Bathroom - huge! However, counterspace taken up by their own little containers and such. Women's disposal bag not refilled. Separate shower - great! However, totally impractal. Amazing powerful water pressure, but a glass door with practically no lip between the interior and the exterior means - flooding bathroom floor if you're not careful. Also, the majority of the floor is super lovely but superslick marble. This means walk everywhere in there carefully when your feet are wet and even better, throw a towel on the floor after showers/baths. Yes, there's a tile mosaic by the tub but you're only safe while standing still on it, not moving around the bathroom. Nowhere in the shower to put your personals other than the floor - their little caddy only holds their amenities, and barely. No place to put your personal products (shaver, loufah, etc) while in there - but on the floor! Agreed with others - tv system was pitiful for what you're paying and the modern requirements of today's travellers. Also, very limited storage space. I had two suitcases (one large, one small) and nowhere to really put them but the bench by the door, which is an eyesore. Did love the use of proper china for the tea service AND - British percolators, awesome! We only get coffee makers in the US. Pool is indeed always overrun by children - note that the hotel provides BALLOON artists and people to entertain the children! So, very family friendly pool area. The Line buffet - amazing. However, incredibly costly. So's the little "new age" smoothie/dessert place by the spa. I'd advise only eating the buffet for Sunday Brunch (special treat, etc.) Chinese restaurant - pretty good, not amazing. If you want every day great food for reasonable prices, don't eat at the hotel! I'd highly advise you NOT eat here because Singapore is FAMOUS for it's amazing array of multicural Asian food and you'd be wasting $ and time eating at the hotel when you can hit Orchard road (Isetan's food court!) and go to food heaven for far less. Celebrated new year's here - they sell tickets to non hotel guests (expensive) then charge $20 a drink or food item (hilarious). They hire entertainment (laughable, especially if you're into music and clubbing), have reservable tables, and if you don't reserve a table (you pay more) you get to stand! Dance floor, emcee, Xmas trees lit up in the lobby - the city always celebrates Xmas well with fabulous decor from hotels to streets. We did the hotel thing to make things easier for friends in my group who had to leave early the next morning. Would honestly not repeat it again - I think a visit to Clarke Quay would have been more fun and required no dressing up and super dry champagne. As I recall, room service ended very early. Again, about 14 channels on the television. DSL super expensive. Business center super expensive. Everything super expensive. Staff super sweet but often clueless. We asked several times about how to a) get to b) go do things (like arranging a hired car for a personal tour of Singapore - you should do it, divided by your group it's not that expensive :) - and they would often mix things up, mess things up, not know what was going on (one staff member would not tell other staff members what they said they would, etc.). For a #1, 5 star hotel, etc., they should be at the top of their game, no worries no confusion, everything perfect. Lobby is indeed busy - most Singapore hotels are. People in the city like to chill in hotel lobbies - the secret? Free A/C and maybe a drink while you hang out in comfy surroundings. Feeling sweaty - you hop into a hotel or a store, whichever suits. :) Lucky, their lobby's huge, no shortage of cabs. Tower Wing rooms looked like very modern cruise ships, and all that implies. Block glass tiles for the bathroom (so don't share the room with someone you don't mind sort of seeing you naked in the bathroom), wavy sort of theme in the cabinetry, blonde woods, modern "stylish" shapes. Garden Wing looked like Hawaiian 90s cheesy (pastels and such) which was why I avoided it. Oh, they are GREAT for weddings. My friend had a 700+ person banquet and the service/food/decor/arrangements/organization - EVERYTHING was amazing. I think that pretty much covers it! For the money, should and could definitely be better. It's kind of like a Rolex. A symbol of something, and it caters to a certain set that wants a name, and the sensation of "the best" - but you may not actually be getting it, though you're getting something very close.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Indulgent”
Reviews.Author: BUSTYBREEZER
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my parents and partner at the Valley Wing last May 2006 and I have to say it was the most wonderful experience; with the private driveway, private breakfast room and cocktail lounge, chefs, moet champagne on tap(complimentory) afternoon tea which was better than raffles and it was all included. What can I say the Crown Prince of Brunai was staying there at the same time and Posh and Becks apparently stayed there when they announced the London Olympics that says it all. It really is the most wonderful place I have ever stayed. I have stayed in quite a few Shangri la hotels and this is by far the best. The pool area does get a little cramped and is not the best out of other Shangri la hotels but inside the Valley Wing definately is an experience. Try the rooftop restaurant in the main hotel it has excellent food and fantastic views over Singapore the Buffet was also good.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic shranga-la hotel”
Reviews.Author: eddieMidlandsUk
Reviews.Content: we arrived at the airport expecting to stay at the sister hotel on sentosa island . But what a supprise this hotel is an oasis of calm in a very busy city. 15 minuite walk from orchard road . the hotel appears to have more staff than guest and the service , impecable and courteous we stayed the tower block standard room which was all but standard , very clean large and airy with a view of the city I cannot reccomend this hotel highly enough after a long flight from sydney , a three day break was needed .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: RandV
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri La for two nights as a stop over on the way to Borneo. After reading other reviews on trip advisor we were not sure what to expect, but the hotel was magnificent. The rooms are very clean and spacious, we stayed in a deluxe room in the tower wing, the bathroom was lovely with a seperate bath and shower, and the bed was very comfortable. Afternoon tea at the Rose Veranda is a must, huge selection of buffet foods including sushi, currys and western food, lots of different types of tea to try and excellent value for money. Our only complaint was that the service in the lobby bar was sometimes very slow. We paid a visit to the hotels spa, which was slightly disappointing as the spa was clinical and more suited to business men. The Hotel is in a great location, just a few minutes walk from the shops on Orchard Road and a couple of stops on the subway to Raffles. Singapore is a fantastic city and we wished we had stayed longer, as two nights isn't really enough....we will definitley come back to singapore and will stay at the Shangri La again.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed in the Valley Wing.”
Reviews.Author: cuffelle
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights and greatly enjoyed it. Excellent service and accommodation first class. My only criticisms concern the welcome received when our taxi arrived at the Tower Wing entrance. It was way OTT being asked for our passports before I'd paid for the taxi! Secondly, we were there the first week in January and only on arrival did we find out their BLU restaurant, Cuisine: Contemporary with French inspirations, was closed for refurbishment. A real disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: murrayn1
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel. Brilliant location, just off Orchard Road and only a few minutes walk. The room was a Tower Wing Delux which was excellent, lots of room and really well presented. The breakfast was to die for - I have never experience a range of food like it. We also ate in the hotel one night which was also very good. Would def recomment this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “should have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: Papabob
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights on a stopover to Australia and it made a perfect break in the journey. Only problems were that we should have booked a similar stopover on our return home and should also have stayed for at least a week. Our mistake! We had planned to eat out in town but opted for a buffet at the hotel on the first night. Excellent food, we of course came back for more of the delicious food on the second night. Breakfasts were equally appealing with such a choice of food it was difficult deciding what to have in such a short stay. Staff were extremely friendly and the whole experience was most enjoyable. We will be back one day, perhaps on our next trip to Australia, and will definitely stay longer....at the Shangri La. On arrival in Sydney we found that the hotel we had booked was located directly opposite another 'Shangri la'....Whilst our Sydney hotel was 5 star it was impersonal and too business like....., nothing like the Shangri La experience. Again our mistake. Guess where we will be staying in Sydney next time?

Reviews.Title: “Over Rated.....................”
Reviews.Author: Antboi
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying two nights at the Shang. Not my ususal choice of Hotel in Singapore but was heavily booked elsewhere at the time. I have to agree with some other travellers opinions in some instances, however my own opinion or feedback is as follows; - Rooms appear tired and old and need a good update very soon. - Not having a flat screen tv in your room for such a high classed hotel is pretty poor these days. The bed is quite a distance from the little old box sitting on the dresser and is hard to see, even though I dont need or wear glasses. - Not having a free standing shower and having to step into a high edged bath is both dangerous and poor as well. I pity old people and disabled as well as I dont know how they would cope. Bathroom is huge but having to squat under a little shower spout in the bath is pretty poor. - Also took three attempts over 2.5 hours the first night to get pull-out bed made up for my child. I rang and requested this be done on leaving the room for dinner. Came back two hours later and had not been done. Rang again and said someone would come. Thirty minutes later, housekeeping still had not come to do it so called the third time and someone was up within ten minutes. Again, not acceptable in this level of establishment and for what I personally was paying.

Reviews.Title: “Fab start to the year”
Reviews.Author: Debs&Mark
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the ShangriLa on our way to New Zealand. On the basis of reviews on TripAdvisor we booked directly into the Valley Wing - we were there for New Year and I didn't want to risk no upgrades being available. From the outisde, it looks a bit dated and the lobbies are rather 80s OTT gold, but our room was the best we've ever stayed in. Massive with modern, understated luxury. The bathroom was bigger than most bedrooms we've had in other hotels and well stocked with things to treat yourself with. We loved the VW lobby with the free drinks and snacks. We were lucky to always find a table in the smoke free zone. It's a much calmer atmosphere than you get in the main reception/hotel. Food in the Line restaurant was fabulous - we had an amazing New Year in there and also ate at lunch and breakfast without ever getting bored - so much to choose from and all beautifully presented. Edward the butler is a dream - not only providing the best service, but also the most insightful information. A couple of gripes - when we were there, a lot of people were there with children and this meant the pool became a kids' zone, even in the jacuzzi where they aren't meant to go. Also, we had to wait ages to get a table for breakfast in the VW private Summit Room. Well worth the wait when you got in there, but it's really not on for the price you're paying. One morning we couldn't wait and ate in the Line. The choice was unbelievable, but it was so busy with families and kids dashing around, that I felt jolted out of my restful state of mind induced by the VW. We found the location great - nice to stroll into Orchard Road at night, but by day we took taxis as it was so humid and they are cheap. We loved the Botanic Gardens - fab for gardeners - Little India for sightseeing and Clarke Quay for a good night out.

Reviews.Title: “super service”
Reviews.Author: cruiser25
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at a Shangri-la hotel and we were very impressed. Upon check-in we decided to upgrade to the Horizon club which in our case turned out to be very worthwhile. There were two things about our room which impressed and I hadn't experienced before. On either side of the superwide king size bed, in addtion to the usual night tables and table lamps, there were wall mounted reading lamps on flexible stalks which allowed one to read comfortably in bed in any position. Also, while most of the bathroom floor had slick marble tiles, there was an approximately four foot by four foot square of mosiac tiles by the bath and sink; the mosaic tiles were much more slip-resistant than the marble tiles and greatly appreciated. Also, it was nice that the bathroom amenities included toothbrush, razor, and even laundry detergent for washing clothing in the sink--necessary since Singapore is so hot and humid. The Horizon club serves a lovely breakfast buffet, and so many high quality snacks for lunch and happy hour that if you want to you can eat three meals a day there for the Horizon upgrade. The staff in the Horizon Club were very attentive and friendly. Altho the horizon club is on the top floor, the views are not great. Internet is about 25 Singapore dollars per day if you use the wired internet in your room or free in the Horizon club which is open 7-24. The location is quiet. If you plan on visiting museums or the financial district you might prefer to stay on the gentrified river, altho the Singapore river is not a large river and has no commercial traffic. However, cabs in Singapore are very cheap for a first world city. The pool is remarkable for being so large. It is a great place for serious lap swimming as well a pleasant place for sunbathing. This hotel tries hard and successfully to get everything right.

Reviews.Title: “Two days of luxury and champagne”
Reviews.Author: trixabelle
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in the Shangri-la Valley wing at the end of our honeymoon. The rooms are huge, extremely comfortable and luxurious. I made a point of booking the Valley Wing as it includes breakfast and free-flow drinks , and canapes, fruit, cheese etc etc from 11 - 10:30 in the lobby. After a minor mix-up at check-in (they had us booked into the Garen Wing, but our confirmation stated Valley Wing) for which we received a personal note of apology from the General Manager and a box of handmade chocolates, we were shown to our room. We then headed back to the lobby to make use of the champagne facilities! The only minor negative point is that the pool area is open to the rest of the hotel guests, and there were a lot of children around. The changing facilities and the towels were of a lower quality than I would have expected. We ate at the Shang Palace (the Chinese Restuarant) which was delicious and also had drinks in the Blu Bar at the top of the Valley Wing, fantastic cocktails. To anyone considering the Shangri-La, I would say go, and make sure you are in the Valley Wing, for approx £25 extra, we had delicious breakfast and then Moet & Chandon on command all day. Bearing in mind a glass of champage in the Shangri-La is about £12.... there's not much more to consider!

Reviews.Title: “Shockingly bad”
Reviews.Author: CarlandSam
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 days in January 07 as part of our honeymoon. We stayed in 4 other hotels during our honeymoon (including another Shargri-la - Bangkok) and with all but this Shangri-la we received extremely good treatment - free upgrades, free breakfasts, chocs etc etc etc. This was our last stop and we didnt get anything from this hotel at all. Whilst it is probably wrong to expect free stuff from a hotel just because its your honeymoon, it really took the cracker with me when we had a bill for 10 cents (3.5pence GBP) delivered to our room. I was genuinely stunned and insulted at the fact that a hotel of this size and stature would have the gaul to invoice a guest for such a nominal sum given the amount paid to stay there in the first place. This bill came immediately after we had "been selected to take part in a customer satisfaction survey". That to me is just plain stupid !!!! Even after a conversation with hotel staff and the manager about it, nothing changed. Highly inflexible. On the whole though, this hotel is nice. I particularly liked the pot of tea which is delivered upon arrival in the room. The views are not particularly good, but what is there to see - skyscrapers, shops... It is a little out of the way - a good 10 min walk to Orchard Road and then you are at one end of it. There is a free bus which is usefull though, but catching it to return to the hotel can be tricky with timings. Soory, but i would definitely stay somewhere else next time i'm in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: RailwayMan
Reviews.Content: We spent a great 7 days here, in a valley wing room, over Xmas. The quality of the service, the rooms & the food is superb. Certainly, the luxury of the valley wing with its champagne, high tea & canapés added to the whole feel. We love Singapore, & have been a couple of times – I will be adding a suggested “to do” list of things we have enjoyed doing. Having stayed in other hotels, this is now our favourite. The sheer customer focussed service, from all, the maids who clear the rooms, the reception staff, the restaurant staff & in the valley wing lounge, Edward & Lawrence is first rate.

Reviews.Title: “Five Stars”
Reviews.Author: xmas2213
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stopped in this hotel for seven nights on route to Australia. We were influenced by the reviews on this site and were able to book a bed and breakfast package at a very competetive rate via trailfinders in the UK. Having stayed at many different hotels around the world I have to say that the quality and service provided by the Shangri La is exceptional. Every member of staff was polite and helpful at all times and the breakfast at the line restaurant has to be seen to be believed. We stayed in a tower room which was excellent value and I was advised by other guests staying in the garden and valley wings that they were better again. The hotel is a five minute walk from the bustling Orchard Road and about ten minutes from the nearest tube station. That said the hotel provide a complimentary shuttle bus once an hour and the taxi's are inexpensive and readily available at the front entrance. In conclusion you would have to have incredibly high standards to be disappointed with this hotel and I for one will book again when I return. Chris M, Newcastle-Upon-Tyne, UK

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in the Tower Wing”
Reviews.Author: CheeryGirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights in Singapore for business trip. The hotel has the grandeur of a 5-star hotel in the 80s...and is situated in a very vast piece of land, given its location to be quite near to Orchard Road. The room in the Tower Wing was supposingly renovated, but still looks and feel a bit old, and smelled a bit stuffy. We walked to the Valley Wing where they offered us free champagne and high tea at the lobby. Shangri-La seems to love doing this concept of having a high-end boutique hotel placed in their traditional big hotels. The cafe "The Line" is a brand-new restaurant with nice white decor. It offers a very nice buffet with both Western and local food. Well worth a try. My only advice is to stay in the Garden or Valley Wing. Personally I prefer to stay in the Fullerton for business.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Shangri La”
Reviews.Author: BobBux
Reviews.Content: We booked the Shangri La based mainly on the consistently good feedback on this site. We were therefore expecting our experience to be 'top notch'. We stayed for 4 nights at the end of September in a Horizon Club room in the Tower wing. We chose to upgrade on booking as, with breakfast included, it made sense for us. From the moment we arrived to the final minute of our departure I can honestly say that the service we received was outstanding. Many organisations here in the UK talk about exceeding customers' expectations - I worked for one until recently - the Shangri La doesn't just talk about it, they do it - all the time! I could list numerous examples, but suffice it to say that when we stupidly left our digital camera in the back seat of a taxi ,the efforts they made to help us get it back were amazing. This was problem ownership at the highest level, the best I have ever experienced. The service quality throughout the hotel was second to none. The Horizon Club was well worth booking - the 'free' cocktails and canapes were outstanding. We were scheduled to checkout around 6am to catch our next flight and we were casually chatting about how sorry we were to be missing the breakfast experience. On hearing this, Charles, the assistant Chef was there waiting at the Horizon Club checkout at 5.30 with a bag of goodies so that we didn't miss out. I need say no more....

Reviews.Title: “Wrong Wing, Wrong Wrong...everthing was wrong”
Reviews.Author: Keslergo
Reviews.Content: The company booked me in this hotel since the conference would be here aswell. Prior to my stay at Shangri-La I had a fabulous time at the Grand Hyatt (Personal Expense). Before the trip I was actually deciding between Shangri-La or Grand Hyatt, but the agency was charging me over $300 US since they booked me at the Garden Wing...which made me decide to just go for Grand Hyatt and move to Shangri-La lateron, anyway so I was pretty confident that I'll get a decent room when I transfer since they booked me at the Garden Wing, but when I checked in I was informed that I was at the Tower Wing...but since the company was paying for it, I never bothered to argue anymore. When I entered the room, The gave me two beds, which house keeping fixed immediately. The room was stuffy...and it was totally not what I expected. I've seen older Shangri-La rooms at Mactan but they were still okay, this one really sucked.

Reviews.Title: “A piece of heaven”
Reviews.Author: Crose.rose
Reviews.Content: What a lovely experience totally pampered. Great service, lovely food lovely rooms in fact the only complaint being it was a little far from the town otherwise I could have stayed for ages.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: JMRM
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 12 nights in the Valley Wing. Loved the location - a short, pleasant walk to Orchard Road for shopping/restaurants or alternatively taxis are readily available if you don't want to walk in the heat or wish to go further afield. This hotel is perfect for a longer stay in Singapore with its spacious and luxuriant grounds, good spa and leisure facilities and choice of restaurants. The welcome was superb and our room everything we could have wished for. Exceptionally spacious and well appointed. Staying in the Valley Wing seemed worth the premium with the various extras including freeflowing Moet and delicious breakfast thrown in. It was lovely to be able to enjoy a quick drink before going out without having to order the bill and sign for it. In addition the Valley Wing had a more intimate, personal feel, although I would stress that service levels were exceptional in all areas of the hotel. The Line is also excellent for a breakfast (although mostly we had breakfast in the separate Valley Wing "Summit Room") or for a relaxed dinner or Sunday brunch. The buffet has amazing variety and is constantly replenished with freshly prepared food. Would definitely choose the Shangri-La again and unreservedly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: beachbabeonce
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, with the taxi door opened by the doorman and a very pleasant lady escorting us to the reception, we had a fantastic time here. The service was marvellous, attentive without being intrusive. Even the lifts had mats showing the day of the week! Our room was superb with every attention to detail. Every evening, the bed covers were turned down with a little quote from "Lost Horizon" left on the king-size pillows, cups and glasses were again washed and the complimentary bottles of drinking water replaced. Breakfast was a wonderful experience, whether taken in the garden room or outside, with so much selection and choices.All beautifully prepared. The pool was clean, with lots of sunbeds and fluffy towels. The cocktail bar was amazing with good views over the city. A truly wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous experience”
Reviews.Author: TravelFan_01
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed at Shangri-La in Valley Wing for 3 nights and had a truly wonderful time. Our arrival at the hotel was a little unnerving- we were greeted with armed guards and metal detectors! This was all on account of the President of United States, George W Bush being in residence. The staff managed this upheaval in a superb manner. They were very apologetic about the unorthodox greeting but it never bothered us at all. We were given a glass of champagne whilst we waited to be escorted to our room for the check in and lady who looked after us was extremely professional and friendly. The room itself was gorgeous. It was a more traditional style than some of the other Shangri-La rooms but with beautiful contemporary twists. The amenities were as you'd expect in a hotel of that calibre with robes and slippers, free local newspaper, mineral water and so on, as well as a welcome bowl of fruit and chocolates. The bed was large and extremely comfortable, as was the rest of the furniture in the room of which there was plenty. The bathroom was very spacious and immaculate, with the tub having the added luxury of a small TV inbuilt in to the wall above it. The seperate shower was amazing- truly the biggest shower head I have ever seen! I also liked the fact that there was plants in the room as seeing greenery in hotels is a rarity and much missed for me. There was also free internet access on two computers in the business centre which was very handy. The food we had at the hotel was all excellent. We had the option of dining in the Summit Room within the Valley Wing or The Line restaurant in the main part of the hotel for breakfast which was included in the room rate and after having our first breakfast in Summit Room, we were very happy to go there every morning. As well as there being numerous choices on the continental buffet, there was also a menu on the table where we were able to choose an a la carte item which the chef made freshly there and then. We had corned beef hash a couple of times and french toast once, which were all fabulous. The service in the Summit Room was amazing too- incredibly attentive without being obtrusive which seemed to be the hallmark of Shangri-La Singapore staff. We had afternoon tea a couple of times in the lobby which was lovely. The sandwiches and cakes on the stand that came with our drinks always seemed to be just enough, and the ambience in the lobby, particularly with the resident harpist playing, was very calming and genteel. We also ate at Shang Palace which we found was delightful (a couple on the next table to us had never actually eaten Chinese food before and the manager of the restaurant could not have been more helpful in helping them choose which kind of things they might enjoy- he even brought them a knife and fork so they didn't have to use chopsticks!) and decent value for money. We also had dinner once at The Line which was outstanding. The array of food to choose from was absolutely mind boggling! There were a dozen or more different food stations to choose from, and it was a case of eating as much as you liked. There was a station for seafood, pizza, pasta, Chinese, Indian, dim sum, carved meats, salad, fruit, desserts, ice cream and numerous others. What set this place apart from so many others in my opinion was the quality of the food. At so many buffets (although it feels like a bit of an injustice to call it a buffet), food can be mass produced so is sat out for a long time, and of a low quality. Not so this restaurant, where it was cooked and prepared freshly and at regular intervals. For people with a smaller appetite, they do have an a la carte menu too but that really would be missing out. The location of the hotel we found to be very good for our needs. It was only a 10 minute walk at the most to the hustle and bustle of Orchard Road and a further 5 minutes to the nearest MTR station of Orchard. We didn't find the walk taxing although the heat and humidity didn't help too much!! We were contacted on our last night by front desk staff about our planned check out time. We assumed that it would be noon, so that's what we said. We were then asked what time our car was coming to take us to the airport. As we had a late night flight, it was 7.30pm. We were then offered the room until 6pm with no extra charge, which was an absolute godsend. It meant that we had almost another whole day to spend in Singapore, and then we could come back and get showered and changed before leaving. We were so grateful for this as being able to have a shower and a change of clothes in advance of a 14 hour flight home was priceless. For the remaining time after we checked out, our cases were left at the bell desk (obviously at no charge) so we could have some dinner before we left. This kind of service is why this hotel is so revered and praised. The small touches in the Valley Wing are what truly sets it apart from other hotels with 'club floors'. The fact that within hours, the staff were addressing us by name. The helpfulness of the staff with even the most minute query. That even the carpet in the lifts are changed every day so it says whichever day of the week it is. The smiling 'Welcome Home' from the doormen as you arrive back at the hotel. All of it just made the place a joy to be in and we probably spent the most time in this hotel than any other before, just because it was such a lovely place to be. If we return to Singapore in the future, there won't be a moment's hesitation in choosing Shangri-La Singapore again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: mup
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Reception to be told our requested room in the Garden Wing was not available due to a "Media Conference". Was not impressed as we had all documentation which 'guaranteed the room". Duty Manageress came back with an offer of a slightly larger room in the Tower Wing. I asked about the view and was told it was a standard 'city view". Again not impressed as we specifically requested a 'garden view'. Must stess I was "quietly controlled, but must have been visibly upset". Duty Manageress went off and came back with a full upgrade to a Horizons Club room with all benefits and although overlooking the front of the hotel, did have a more greener outlook. Normally I guess we would have just taken what was offered and been disappointed but I felt I should stick to my guns on this occasion and pleased I did as they did try their best to come up with a solution. All that aside we found staff extremely nice and nothing was too much trouble. Having been to Sinapore on several occasions we knew location of Hotel and were prepared for the walk to the top of Orchard Rd, which is really no big deal. We did a nice gentle stroll in under ten minutes. We are no spring chickens either. Obviously used taxi's if we wanted to go further or it was too wet. Pool area was lovely but could see that it could quickly become very hectic on a really hot day with a struggle to get a lounger. Most days I was able to chill out with no problem. We had breakfast included in our deal and found "The Line" was excellent. We also used the H.Club restaurant on a couple of occasions and again, top service but with a more limited choice of course. I would definately stay again but as with a lot of Hotels I think everyone can relate to a 'good or bad' experience, even during the same week!! We were lucky enough to experience a great stay in a delightful room. Mups

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brighton9
Reviews.Content: I was in the standard tower wing but still had a great room. The only downside was the glass wall between the room and the toilet which coould have been a problem if I had been sharing. On arrival the porter takes your bag, a gorgeous girl then escorts you to reception and makes arrangements for your bag to be delivered to your room - very nice. Staff were all friendly and helpful and, unlike some countries, seemed genuine, not after tips. Great, huge outdoor pool with good service and huge towels. Easy walking distance to Orchard Road and the bus stop used by tourist tours. About 10 minutes walk to Orchard MRT station but not recommended if you have luggage. Cab from airport is about SGD 18. Continental breakfast was excellent and cost SGD 31. If you go to the Night Safari, get a cab there and the shuttle bus back (the Orchard stop is the first pickup so it takes ages, but is the first drop off).

Reviews.Title: “Shangri-La Singapore”
Reviews.Author: SenD
Reviews.Content: FIRST CLASS - stayed in the Valley Wing which was wonderful. There on business/holiday and had my 11 year old daughter with me. Lovely stroll down Orange Blossom Road to Orchard Road, service - faultless, in fact, everything was PERFECT! Have stayed there many times and have very fond memories even before the Garden Wing and Valley Wing existed. Home away from home!!

Reviews.Title: “Great, typical Shangri-La.”
Reviews.Author: J123456789
Reviews.Content: Location not so good if you don't know Singapore and want to walk / take public transport. The Line restaurant is excellent but designed to confuse with its geometrical shapes, just for good measure they play disorienting music!!! We stayed in a tower room which was spacious, excellent and comfortable, except on last night after "regular electrical maintenance" when the air-con controls stopped working properly. They use a fancy touch controlled unit which simply stopped working and if you adjust the temperature at night it kindly swiches on a light, waking up your partner. The temperature control buttons are mixed in with the light buttons making life more difficult. Oh for proper knobs and switches. The garden rooms looked very nice, good if you want to treat it as a resort also. The hotel is opulent with helpful staff. Breakfast is typical Shangri-La which means excellent as is dinner. Great hotel if you can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Bliss”
Reviews.Author: God-Bless-Air-Miles
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place to break a journey from Australia, though we also once stayed for a wedding. Superb, unobtrusive service, gorgeous, extensive gardens and huge pool, large, well-equipped room in the garden wing, with balcony overlooking that beautiful pool. For shopping addicts, it's walking distance to Orchard Road. Unusual for a city-centre hotel to possess such beautiful gardens and pool, rather than a thing stuck on the roof. On arrival, around ten at night after a very long and tiring day and flight from Sydney, I found myself instantly relaxed once I stepped on to that balcony. Highly recommended for a holiday (rather than business) visit, esp. garden wing rooms, with balconies. Would go back like a shot.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Over-priced for what you get”
Reviews.Author: sankar
Reviews.Content: The Shangri-la is a good hotel, no doubts on that. However, it doesn't deserve the premium positioning and pricing it seems to occupy. We'd booked a Horizon Club room, but since the hotel was full we ended up getting a standard lower flloor room instead of the Horizon Club Floor. We were later moved to another room on the Club Floor but this was a strangely shaped corner room without a separate shower stall in the bathroom - the website advertises all rooms as having a separate shower stall. And on 2 days, the international paper we had requested was not delivered and we had to request it twice after which we got the local paper. Small issues, i know, but you don't expect these in a hotel of this class and cost. The rooms and services are good and comfortable, but nothing special. The location is also poor, a long walk from Orchard Road's major shopping areas, no public transport or pretty much anything else nearby. I had stayed at the Mandarin Oriental last month at half the price and I would rate that stay on par with or slightly better than my stay this time at the Shangri-la. Stay somewhere else, it's not worth paying so much for the brand name.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: paulyorks
Reviews.Content: we stayed here on october 14th for 3 nights with our family,we read the reviews on here first and we were not disappointed with anything at all.the staff,rooms,pool were all great and the fitness centre was good too.Be sure to try breakfast at the line resteraunt at least once,you will be amazed.fantastic hotel that i would recommend to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: teacher17
Reviews.Content: We travelled here as part of our honeymoon, coming from staying 4 nights at the Shangr-La in Kowloon (Hong Kong). The Singapore Shangri-La was just as fantastic as the Kowloon hotel. Service amazing. Staff so helpful. Loads of free gifts for honeymooners. Ideal location. Huge room. We were upgraded to a deluxe room in the garden wing - well worth it - views over the swimming pool. The food was fantastic - had room service dinner as we were on honeymoon! What I loved most were the door men dressed up in their outfits! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Superb !!”
Reviews.Author: becksred
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri La hotel on our trip to Australia and on our way back to the UK. It was a First Class hotel . Excellent service and restaurants were superb !! I can recommend Eddie who works at the fitness centre with whom my husband and I had reflexology sitting on our loungers around the pool !! Fantastic !! It really is the hotel to stay for your trip or stayover in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel... and the food!”
Reviews.Author: SteveVB
Reviews.Content: The Shangri-La is an excellent hotel. This was my wife’s and my third stay here in the last year. Set in a treed residential area only a 1km shuttle bus ride from Orchard Road shops, the Shangri-La offers near-resort ambience and facilities for business and leisure travellers. Entering the vast lobby, the mature tropical trees and pool around which the hotel is built on three sides are already on view through ceiling-height windows. Unless you are economising on an overnight stay, forgo the rather bland Tower rooms and take a spacious Garden Wing Pool-View room with balcony to make the most of the palm tree and rainforest surroundings and to have more direct access to the outdoor areas. Our room was meticulously equipped and maintained. The large lagoon pool, popular in the Singapore heat, includes a good area for children, and there are tennis courts and a gym. A memorable aspect was the seriously good cooking in the three hotel restaurants we tried. The two-course Peking Duck in the Shang Palace Chinese restaurant was as good as we have had anywhere. The small lunch buffet in the Rose Veranda, easily missed in its mezzanine location overlooking the garden, had a great range of taste treats being constantly refreshed. But the showstopper is the “The Line” restaurant, an ultra-modern design tour de force on the pool level that is open for breakfast, lunch and dinner. A la carte is available for the weary, but take the buffet option and stroll around the sixteen “theatre kitchens”, marvelling at and sampling the staggering variety of top quality eastern and western dishes on offer. The whole experience is fun for diners of all ages. We sat on after dinner, just enjoying the buzz of the place. Staff throughout were friendly and efficient. We really felt at home throughout our stay. Drinks of all kinds are expensive, as are business centre charges. Nevertheless we would recommend this hotel absolutely without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel......except....”
Reviews.Author: Smith_P&L
Reviews.Content: ....they forgot to send the limo to collect us from the airport! We stayed for 2 nights (22nd and 23rd September 2006) on route to Oz. As a treat to ourselves we arranged for a limo to collect us from the airport (and one to take us back two days later). The information desk at the airport kindly rang the Shangri-La to ask where our limo was and were told we had not booked for collection. Fortunately my husband had a copy of their confirmation fax and by the time we reached the hotel by taxi it was obvious they, too, had found a copy and realised they had made a mistake. They were sorry....we know they were because they kept telling us over and over and over again! The result was a free limo when we left but it did take the initial shine off the start of our holiday. Having said all that, we cannot fault the food, staff and general cleanliness of the hotel. Our room (garden view) was spacious and lovely and the shops in Orchard Road were within easy walking distance. We would stay there again without hesitation, however, we would not bother with limos as the taxis are plentiful and cheap (often with a running commentary on what to see and where to go).

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ScottishGal123
Reviews.Content: I can see why this hotel is No.1 in Singapore. We stayed in a Deluxe Garden Wing room. Lovely, spacious room with a huge bed! Huge corner balcony. The staff at the hotel could not do enough to help you. The Line resturant where breakfast is served was out of this world. Hotel is located within 10mins (walking) of Orchard Road. Taxis are very cheap and efficient so it was never a problem to get around Singapore. Worth doing is the Sunday brunch at the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Still the Best in Singapore but with a small complaint”
Reviews.Author: inviso
Reviews.Content: I have been a regular in the Valley Wing Shangrila for a few years. The place is unique and special: beautiful and grand rooms, free flow of wines, champaign etc. Generally immaculate and very friendly service. The only one gripe was when I wanted to arrange for some chocolates to be sent, the receptionist was less than willing to assist. I was hoping that she could provide a one stop service from getting the box of cholocates for me and delivering it via local courier to the recipient. Instead, I eventually had to do it myself (sensing her great reluctance)- to get it from the chocalatier and then to deliver it. From a top hotel, this was dissappointing. But will not stop me from returning to probably the best city hotel in South East Asia.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and Fabuolus”
Reviews.Author: DawnC
Reviews.Content: Just back from a nine night stay in the Valley Wing of Shangri-La Singapore. Arrived and was shown to our stunning room by the assistant manager where we completed a very speedy check in, had a quick freshen up and then went for our first visit to the champagne bar. Our room was very spacious and had the most beautiful bathroom with twin sinks, large powerful shower, sunken bath with a television built in at the end of it and the toilet and bidet were in a separate small room. Every day the fruit bowl was replenished and every night a box with a chocolate was left for us. There was even a pillow menu with a choice of anti snore, lavender filled etc. Breakfast is included when you stay at the Valley Wing and can be taken in either the private Summit room or in The Line resturant, we used the summit room every day where there was a buffet of cereals, fruit, cold meats and cheeses and pastriesand then there is the menu oh my goodness are you spoiled for choice from traditional Japanese and Chinese breakfasts to the full cooked English, waffles served with banana and berries with maple butter, pancakes with berries and French toast served with bacon berries and honey. The staff are wonderfull and after a couple of days remember your preference for tea, coffee white or brown toast. The Champagne Bar in the lobby is fantastic no matter what time of day ( I think between 11 and 10.30 ) you come in you hear the popping of champagne corks Edward and his team of butlers are there to see that your glass is never empty ( or at least not for very long ) of course you can also have beer, wine, spirtis, cocktails and soft drinks try the Singapore Sling you wont be disappointed careful tho as they are strong!!! Tea, coffee and hot chocolate are also readily available as the the selection of snacks afternoon tea, cheese and biscuits and canapes. The pool is lovely to pass a morning or afternoon its very shady with lots of palms and plants surrounding it and waiters come around with slices of fruit and cold towels a very nice touch.
