We ate in Blu one evening on the 24th floor stunning views you need to book in advance for a window table as its quite a small resturant, the food is very good and beautifully presented but it is expensive. All of the staff are lovely friendly and very welcoming we absolutely loved our stay here and would reccomend the upgrade to Valley Wing as I'm sure that for what it costs you more than get value for money

Reviews.Title: “Good yes, great no”
Reviews.Author: IncaWalnut
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in Singapore. This is not a boast, it is simply a result of my relentless search to find the perfect hotel in a city that thrives on business and tourist travel above all else!! The Shangri-la is a good hotel, it is not a great hotel. It is large, busy and the only thing from making it feel totally impersonal are the attentive staff (which you get in most top hotels in Asia - wake up Europe to how things should be done!!) The Shangri-la is slightly dated, it has lush gardens with a huge pool (lovely if you like crowds) the Line restaurant is manicly busy but the buffet is superb. The rooms have hessian wall coverings, cheap wardrobes and baths suited to kids under the age of 5. It is all a bit late 1980's. What Singapore needs is a hotel with a sense of intimacy with rooms refurbished to today's standards. The Fullerton is one, but too much in the business district. There are better hotels than the Shangri-La and I apologise to the sweet and attentive staff in saying so.

Reviews.Title: “Genuine Touch”
Reviews.Author: Plain_Truth
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and very impressed with genuine customer service. Staff went out of their way to at least smile and greet at every opportunity and were knowledgable and helpful. Standard of rooms were very good even in tower wing. General ambience was quite appealing with nice pool and central oasis area. A bit out of the way but taxis are so cheap and comfortable it was worth being a bit removed from the hustle and bustle of Orchard Rd. Attention to detail did not go unnoticed, down to washing detergent sachets in bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: proffitt76
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as the first part of our honeymoon (a stop off on the way to Australia). We arrived feeling a little dejected as the “worlds’ favourite airline” managed to lose our luggage for what turned out to be our whole 3 day stay. We were very impressed with the reception area and when we were booking in we were then asked if we would like to upgrade our room (it worked out at about £30 per night extra). I thought I was getting the usual spiel but I was that fed up, I accepted. All I can say it is the best £30 per night extra I have EVER spent. We were given a large suite, rose petals on the bed in the shape of a heart, cake, Chinese tea, the full works. When the hotel found out about our luggage situation we were given a complimentary clean T Shirt and a wash bag. The upgrade also gave up membership to the Horizon Club. This was a private members area on the top floor. Complimentary breakfast, afternoon tea, internet access and phone use (essential for us at the time) and a huge lounge. Imagine a business class lounge at an airport and you’re almost there. We ate at the Line restaurant. Very stylish and excellent food (and value). We didn’t use the pool but it did look very good. This mush have been the most friendly and efficient hotel I have ever stayed in and wouldn’t hesitate to recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable!”
Reviews.Author: Macros_The_Black
Reviews.Content: Wow! This was amazing! We stayed here because of reviews on here and were not disappointed! I, however, have not stayed in many really plush hotels - so maybe that negates my opinion a little?! We were in the Valley Wing where nothing is too much trouble. We enjoyed the complimentary canapes and drinks that were served every day in the lounge. There is a separate entrance for residents of the wing and the reception is stunning. The room was gorgeous - large bathroom and bed, beautiful view of the pool, very spacious. It was serviced at several points during the day, including when they turn down your bed for the night and leave handmade chocolates on the pillows. There were even business cards printed up with my name on them and left in the desk drawer. The staff were amazingly helpful - tipping is expected for certain services, such as the porter. The only thing I would say is that it IS expensive - and there were a few charges that we hadn't thought about such as the tax that they add to your total bill, and the gratuities that get automatically added to every service that you use. (For example, they add gratuity for the room service if I remember rightly). However, I suppose that if you're in a place like this, you might expect these things? Would love to stay here again, but I think this might have been a "once in a lifetime" opportunity!

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: JRL12
Reviews.Content: Wow - Stayed in the Valley Wing after reading other reviews etc. Without a doubt worth it. Must be one of the best hotels in the world. Problem is because the hotel is so comfortable you need longer in Singapore to see & do everything!

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: Paul Shave
Reviews.Content: Quite simply, the best hotel we've ever stayed at. We stayed in the cheapest Tower wing, so you don't get all the free goodies of the more expensive wings, but I really couldn't fault this hotel at all. The staff are extremely friendly - everyone smiles and says hello. The Line buffet restaurant is excellent for breakfast and evening meals, and the Shang Palace Chinese restaurant was very good. If you can afford it, don't stay anywhere else in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Singapore”
Reviews.Author: sparklequeen
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Singapore, what an excellent hotel, when we got there we were given champagne while we checked in, then they asked if we wanted to pay for an upgrade to the Garden wing and include breakfast, eventhough we declined they still gave us a free Garden wing upgrade without the breakfast. They provided cpmplimentary bottled water daily and fruit on arrival. When we opened our hotel door we were standing outside in a tropical garden. Singapore itself is wonderful, everyone is so polite, the area is spotless clean, we walked along Orchard Road to Raffles then to the harbour and back again, it took about 2 thirds of a day, next day we took the MRT (really cheap!) then cable car to Sentosa Island which was fun. The shopping is excellent I've never seen so many shopping malls in my life! The food is very reasonably priced and there is a good mix of eastern and western restaurants. I would definately recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A superb stay”
Reviews.Author: luckystrike
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three nights in July of 2006 as part of a round the world trip, and were largely very happy with our experience. The lobby was typical of many Shangri-La hotels – huge and marble with lots of comfortable sofas. The staff were beautifully dressed and willing to help in the efficient way in which is typical in Singapore. Our check-in was swift, and we were offered an upgrade – at a cost – which we turned down. Our room was large and nicely decorated, and both it and the bathroom had all that we required, including an ironing board. The breakfast buffet was brilliant – selections of food from all around the world. We also enjoyed a drink in both the Lobby Bar and in Blu on the top floor. Note that the drinks are VERY expensive – a beer and a glass of white wine was in excess of US$20. The view from the top floor, and indeed from the room, was not spectacular, and only offered a very limited view of the city skyline in the distance. My only real gripe is about the location. It is at the top end of Orchard Road, and it is a fifteen minute walk to the MTR station. From here it is another twenty or more minutes to the ‘downtown area’ and Chinatown. Including for buying tickets and waiting on a train, it could take you nearly an hour to make it from your room to, say, the nearest MTR to the Merlion and Raffles Plaza. For that reason, if time was very precious and you only had a couple of days in the city, then I would suggest booking another hotel. When in Singapore I recommend having a drink and throwing peanut shells on the floor in the Long Bar of Raffles Hotel, spending an evening at the Night Safari, and hitting Chinatown for some satay washed down with an ice cold Tiger beer. If you have a few days to spare and you want some rest and relaxation, then I would suggest heading for the Indonesian island of Bintan, only forty-five minutes from Singapore by catamaran – it really is a tropical paradise. The Angsana Resort & Spa comes highly recommended. I would recommend the Shangri-La, but simply because of its location, we would more than likely stay closer to the centre on a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thepminwales
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel You must stay here. Just going on to Bali now after 4 days at the Shangri La and we do not want to leave. The staff are superb and will really go out of their way to make your stay as smooth as possible. We upgraded to the Tower Wing for an Extra $65 per night and it is worth it. Five Star Hotel all round. Try the buffet lunch at the Lime you will not be disapointed !

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amber88
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Shangri La this August with my husband. The hotel is really beautiful. We stayed in the Garden Wing which has a tropical theme, all the rooms come with a balcony, ours was over looking immaculate gardens and the pool, we were given a corner suite which had an extended balcony which was worth it as it was big enough for the sun loungers and had small dining area which would be ideal for a in room service meal. We were celebrating our first wedding anniversary and the friendly reception staff noticed from my passport that it was also my birthday, the following morning the hotel sent up a birthday card, a box of complimentary chocolates and wine, in addition to the complimentary fruit basket we already had, I thought that was a really nice touch. Our breakfast was included which was served at The Line Restaurant in a buffet style, which is truly amazing. Their lunch and dinner choices were fantastic too. They had every type of cuisine imaginable. The main shopping area of Orchard Road is about a 15mins walk away, however if it is too hot to walk the Hotel offers a complimentary bus shuttle service every hour which takes you straight to one of the main shopping malls on Orchard Road. There is a really nice piano bar serving drinks to the sound of a live mellow singer and there is a Blu Restaurant on the 25th floor which has an amazing panoramic view of the Singapore skyline- both well worth a visit. The only criticism was that that Hotel did not appear to have an ATM, the nearest ones were on orchard Road. Overall we had a fantastic stay, the hotel staff are really friendly and cannot do enough, the hotel is very luxurious and well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ipana
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderfull and worth every penny!! Unbelievable service, rooms were spacios and a lot of luxury things (like TV in the bathroom so that You can take a bath and watch TV at the same time...). There was even a complementary champagnebar in the luxurious lobby. You could get champagne and other drinks for free throughout the day! They served also snacs and canapes during the afternoon and evening. Live harp music every night etc. This hotel is truly worth the name Shangri La! We stayed in the Valley Wing which is more luxurious than the Garden or Tower Wing. In the inner court there were a green area with palmtrees etc. in the middle of which there was an enourmous pool and a jacuzzi for about 6-8 people. And the breakfast was unbelievable, the coffee and juices best I've ever tasted. There was also a huge table full of all kinds of fruits; most of which I didn't even know by name. Delicious! You also got to choose a warm plate of scrambled eggs, french toast, japanese breakfast etc. Even the location was good, quite near the Orchard Road but still by a quiet side street so that the traffic didn't disturbe. Recommend especially to honeymooners or couples looking for a luxurious and relaxing stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: JP80-Worldroamer
Reviews.Content: We had free stop-over on our honeymoon and decided to stay here at the Shangri-La Service: Very friendly staff and extremely attentive. Rooms: Good size suites with a view overlooking the city. Location: Good. Rather misleading as you not actually on Orchard Road itself. You would need to get the courtesy bus in or go by back (10mins) Breakfast: The choice is incredible. We ate in the club lounge for the first morning and then decided to boycott it in preference to the great atmosphere and vast selection of cuisine in the main restaurant below.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning”
Reviews.Author: Ateve
Reviews.Content: Hi, Had four night stay in July, and were bowled over by the opulence, style, service and friendliness of the hotel. It was my wifes birthday whilst we were there, and we returned from a trip to find wine, chocolates and fruit i the room with a letter/card from guest relations. Breakfasts awesome......a superb yoghurt bar being a highlight. Love to return

Reviews.Title: “Top Class”
Reviews.Author: HolidayAid
Reviews.Content: For sheer class, this hotel takes some beating. From the moment you are welcomed by one of the "Guest Relations Officers" you are made to feel you are in a special hotel. I didnt take my business cards with me (after all I was on holiday !), so I was surprised when I was asked for one to assist with the check in. My wife had one of her business cards, which saved the day. We stayed in the Tower Wing overlooking Orchard Road, and had inter-connecting rooms so that our two children (13 & 10)were always near. We ate at the Line for breakfast on the first day, which although expensive, was excellent in terms of quality and quantity available. My wife and I also went to the Blu Bar on our last night, which is on the top floor overlooking Singapore, and had a Singapore Sling. The pool area was clean, spacious and relaxing although there was trouble obtaining sun beds if you wanted them in the sunny aspect. Service was very good, and taxis so cheap to the Night Zoo, and to Sentosa, where we swam with the doplhins in a pre-arranged "training" session, and also went on the Luge. We also used one of their four tennis courts for a game, and our son played on the minature golf course. The only down side was we were told we could use the Health Club to shower and change before our evening pick-up at 8 p.m on the way to the airport. Unfortunately when we got there, we were shown to one of the small individual spa rooms, which had limited facilities, and our children had to go out of the Health Club to use the toilets as they were not allowed inside the Club, even if accompanied by one of us. This seemed all a little pointless and gained a small black mark. The hotel is a comfortable ten minute walk to Orchard Road, and the wealth of shopping opportunities take your breath away. Also went on the "bumboat" ride" for free as we were on the Singapore Stopover with SIA. All in all, a hotel with an experience not to miss.

Reviews.Title: “Inefficient”
Reviews.Author: MattDC
Reviews.Content: A 2 rating is adequate but some problems right? I was very familiar with this hotel and chain, having stayed here for nearly 3 months from December to February. I have also stayed in Island Shang HK and Shaon KL. This stay in Sing was for 12 nights. When I checked in after a long haul flight followed directly by a meeting I was half asleep and was pestered by the receptionist to have 'A much better room', free breakfast, free Internet' The next day I asked to have the room I had originally booked because I wanted a balcony and did not need free breakfast, and also because the Internet was not free as stated - I am sure that the staff get bonusses for achieveing an 'Upgrade'. Anyhow, the new room in the garden wing was noisy: I could hear noises everytime someone flushed their toilet or let out a bath, and could also hear stomping of people on the landing. Quiet is very important to me when I stay away from home. I bought ear plugs. There was only a trickle of hot water. The air con was either too hot or FAR to cold. The Line restaurant used to be cool, but has lost something, it seems stressed. There was never enough room around the pool. A soft drinks convention that was staying meant that great big red branded umbrellas appeared by the pool ...bright red - not at all stylish. The outside of Blu bar stinks of cigarettes. The reception staff seemed very stressed, I kept well clear. There are other good hotels out there...

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Shangri La”
Reviews.Author: Travelaholics
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri La for four nights in July at the start of our trip to South East Asia. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from Orchard Road although the hotel has a frequent shuttle bus to take you there and back. We took taxis to most places that we visited due to the fact that they are incredibly cheap e.g. we went to the night safari about 35 mins away and the taxi fare was around £3. We had booked a hotel in the tower wing which was spacious and had a floor to ceiling window overlooking the pool and gardens. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom had lots of toiletries that were restocked twice a day. We also recived complimentary jasmine tea on our first two nights as a welcome which was a nice touch. Breakfast at the Line was included in our rate. It was absolutely fantastic. The choice was greater than we have ever experienced before - dozens of different cuisines to try and you could eat as much as you liked. We also went to the Line for dinner one evening and the dinner buffet was definitely along the same lines and we would recommend this as well. We had dinner at Blu on our first evening and had their signature tasting menu which was excellent. The views of the city from the restaurant are well worth it. If you didn't want to spend your money in the restaurant there is a bar that serves cocktails where you can get a similar view for a fraction of the cost (note alcohol is not particularly cheap in Singapore). We made use of the pool and spa facilities, both of which were excellent. The spa, in particular, was very reasonably priced and the therapists were very friendly. We cannot fault this hotel which set the standard for the rest of our trip - the food here even put the food at the Mandarin Oriental in KL in the shade - and would definitely recommend this if you are visiting Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!”
Reviews.Author: miabailey
Reviews.Content: Out of this world, This was the first leg of our honeymoon and was fantastic! Service excellent hotel was magnificent the roof top bar was great residents only nice and quiet relaxing whilst overlooking the city. Just a ten min walk from orchard road thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Valley Wing”
Reviews.Author: Clare_Lee
Reviews.Content: We had originally booked a room in the Garden Wing but having read the reviews of the Valley Wing we decided to splash out and stay there instead. I'm so glad we did! Upon arrival we were greeted by name and I was given a beautiful orchid. Check-in was in our room which had a view over the gardens and pool which made you feel like you were in a million miles away from the hustle and bustle of the city centre, even though its just a 10 minute walk to Orchard Road and the MRT station. The room itself was stunning - very spacious with a seating area, desk, large bed, dressing area and bathroom. Fresh fruit and flowers were put in the room every day and chocolates were put on the bed each night. There are also some really nice touches such as a choice of 6 different tea leaves, a lead to connect your iPod to the in-room stereo system, a tv in the bathroom, a choice of 4 pillows and personalised paper and business cards. The room was very comfortable and had everything we needed for our stay. Breakfast can either be taken in a room within the Valley Wing and order from a menu or have the buffet, or you can eat in The Line restaurant which all other Shangri-La guests go to and choose from a mammoth buffet. We also enjoyed the complimentary champers and cocktails which are available throughout most of the day in the Valley Wing lobby area. The staff at the hotel cannot do enough for you, from making up your favourite cocktail to trying to cheer up two very unhappy England fans after the England v Portugal game! We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “A Touch of Class!”
Reviews.Author: AvidHolidaymaker
Reviews.Content: I had originally booked the Swissotel Merchant Court for our 5 night stay in Singapore - but, after reading recent not-so-favourable reviews of that hotel, decided to change to the Shangri-la before we left home. Best move I ever made! We sought out the Swissotel to see what it was like "in the flesh". Location excellent for the Quays, and an MRT station, but not so good for Orchard Road. 2 sides of the hotel are completely surrounded by a huge building site - not appealing to me in the least. I can't comment on the interior, obviously, but we are SO glad we switched to the Shangri-la. NOW THIS WAS A REAL TOUCH OF CLASS! Can only concur with other reviews about this first class hotel. The welcome is warm and genuine, nothing is too much trouble, and everyone greets you with a smile. You just know that the staff are proud to work there, and so they should be. All public areas are beautifully designed and immaculately kept, as are the bedrooms. We had a deluxe room in the Tower wing - only their standard room but it was gorgeous, with wonderful views across the city. We told them that we were going on to Bali to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary, and they left wine, chocolates and fruit in our room as a gift, decorating our bed with rose petals in the shape of a heart! We used "The Line" buffet for our breakfast each morning, and for dinner on our last night. The choice and quality was outstanding. The pool area is huge and a real oasis for being in the centre of the city. Have a drink in Blu Bar, on the 24th floor - a bit pricey, but worth it for the views! What more can I say? I would DEFINITELY go back!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious? Not in the Garden Wing!”
Reviews.Author: MRIII
Reviews.Content: My partner and I visited Singapore in late June and decided to test all the top luxury hotels. We stayed at Raffles the Plaza, The Ritz-Carlton, The Four Seasons and the Shangri-La. Our final stop was the Shangri-La hotel where we stayed in the Garden Wing. I'm sorry, but the Garden Wing was downright shabby! ROOM We reserved the Deluxe Room in the Garden Wing which is one step above the Tower Wing and one step below in the Valley Wing. We were disappointed from when we first stepped into the room. While the room was big and had a good view of the pool and gardens, it was just too shabby, rundown and so 1980s in terms of its furnishings. There was a medium sized regular TV, an "executive" writing desk made of plastic, Internet connections, a sitting area with a huge window and balcony, and controls by the bed to open the curtains. BATHROOM The bathroom was disgusting! The toilet and bidet were not in a separate alcove, but there was a separate shower cubicle and a regular bathtub. The hotel only provided no-name Shangri-La amenities and to top it off, there were huge yellow stains on the sink and around the bidet. HOTEL FACILITIES/RESTAURANTS The hotel offered a fitness centre/Spa and a pool, but we didn't use these facilities. There were numerous restaurants to choose from, but we only dined at The Line restaurant for a late dinner. Their range of food was limited and the staff seemed more interested in the soccer game on TV than serving us. The food however, was acceptable. The lobby area, the pool and the Valley Wing however are truly beautiful and luxurious. SERVICE The staff were all very friendly, curteous and full of smiles. The only big complaint I have (and this is a complaint amongst many luxury hotels these days) is their tendency to use internationally unrecognised geographic names (i.e. "Arabian" Gulf as opposed to the correct "Persian Gulf") in their brochures can be insulting/politically insensitive to certain guests, especially someone of Persian descent. SURROUNDINGS The hotel is 10 minutes away from Orchard Road on foot. I recommend exploring the area on foot in the evening as it's less crowded than during the day. CONCLUSION This is a luxurious and generally well-maintained hotel ONLY in the lobby (and perhaps the Valley Wing). The rooms (in the Garden Wing) need major renovations and are quite disappointing! Not at all worth the amount they charge!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: TRNC4ever
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at the Shangri-La and had an absolutely wonderful time there. From the moment we arrived to the day we left, the staff and everyone concerned with this hotel could not do enough to help us with anything, and I mean anything we needed. I booked in here to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversay and it was worth every penny. We stayed in the Garden Wing in one of the corner suites - it was so so comfortable. We had a cake marking our anniversay, fresh fruit every day, rose petals all over the bed (in a romantic heart shape), the bed was huge, we had everything in the room and more. The hotels location to Orchard Road and the shops is fabulous, and the hotel has a courtesy bus that takes you there as well if you didn't fancy the 10-15 minutes walk. If I visit the far east again, then I will definately stay at a Shangri-La hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Shangrila”
Reviews.Author: Yorkshirelass74
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Shangrila as the last leg of our honeymoon in June. What a superb hotel. You'll probably not notice the host of Lamborginis and Ferraris parked outside as you are immediately stunned by the fantastic lobby. The hotel overall is beautiful and the outside pool (heated) area is fantastic. We stayed in the tower room which is just their standard I think. It was lovely - imagine the upgrades would be fab. Breakfast at the Line is an experience not to be missed, every conceivable breakfast dish is available and the quality of the food is superb. If only I could eat more I would have stayed in here for hours - a must for food lovers! Lounging by the pool is a real treat - the staff here are very attentive with cold towels pieces of fruit , foot massages etc, we never wanted to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing gardens, decor and great hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: Jill_Downunder
Reviews.Content: We arrived for a four night stay in the Shangri La in June, 2006. On arrival, we were upgraded from a Tower Room to a Garden Room, which was situated in an atrium of garden and tropical shrubbery. The staff were consistently polite, helpful, courteous and efficient at all times. The only difficulties we had were trivial and were quickly fixed - the toilet didn't work properly on one occasion and was fixed on the same day, and we were incorrectly billed for a minibar item which we had not used - this was removed from our account. The breakfast buffet, which was included in our package, was absolutely amazing - there is every conceivable style and type of food available. Pastries are displayed on glass shelves. For Western guests, there were several different types of bacon and eggs, scrambled eggs was made on order right in front of you, and there was a very large selection of Asian cuisine for breakfast as well. Endless number of juices and fruits as well. The concierge service n the hotel was wonderful - nothing was ever too much trouble, and the concierge was a mine of useful information about local touring, the weather, currency, postal services and other enquiries we had during our stay. In all, the hotel was an excellent experience - staff were absolutely superb, and facilities were everything you could ask for and more. Given the choice, I would go back in an instant.

Reviews.Title: “I foung my Shangri-La”
Reviews.Author: NictheCarver
Reviews.Content: As is typical for this chain, my first stay at this S-La was a class stay. Had a tower deluxe room, which had great views and quality of room interior and bed etc was brilliant. Pool area was really relaxing and size of pool outstanding, food quality good and backed up by the faultless staff that is normal of Shangri La hotels, my stay was wonderful from begining to end and i am coming back. Top quality.

Reviews.Title: “Blown Away!”
Reviews.Author: Cumbriabuggyer
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the end of a visit to Thailand, and were completely blown away by the Shangri-La. As advised in some reviews on this site, we upgraded to the Valley Wing on arrival. We'd seen photos of the rooms on the hotel's own website so had some idea - but the detail was still amazing. Twin light switches for the bathroom according to the level of lighting you wanted, powered curtains, iPod connection for the sound system - all great. But really it paled into insignificance beside the level of service from the staff - not at all formal or servile, they just seemed to care - remembering your name and your preferences and anticipating your needs before they'd even occurred to you. (Or was it just our reflex reaction to an offer of more champagne?!) When we had a problem getting the shower to work, the butler had summoned 2 engineers within minutes. When we asked for a fruit juice at breakfast that they couldn't produce, the look of horror on staff faces seemed genuine - it was there the next morning though! Criticisms? None, unless you count the poor pedestrian access to the Valley Wing entrance - but that really is nitpicking. We'd love to go again.

Reviews.Title: “amazing 5 * 10 out of 10”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the shangri la for the first three days of our honeymoon the hotel is amazing everything you need after a long flight the bed was huge and views spectacular we stayed on a bed and breakfast basis and wow what a breakfast the dining area was lovely and the choice phenomanall all in all nothing bad to say about this hotel at all 10 out of 10 for a short stay hotel.

Reviews.Title: “valley wing review”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: april 2006: 3rd time at the valley wing and still very happy with it. we are 2 plus 2 children and the interconecting rooms (2 rooms with a shared hallway and door to the corridor) work well for us and are very large/luxurious. swimming pool at the hotel attractive for a city hotel and good for kids. restaurant outlets all good although we were less enamoured of the line, the new 24 hour restaurant. valley wing guests get free canapes, drinks etc and a special breakfast area of higher quality than the usual hotel fare, even at this 5 star level. we travel extensively and believe the room rates to be good value.

Reviews.Title: “Valley Wing perfect, the rest of the hotel... not as impressive!”
Reviews.Author: Fige84
Reviews.Content: If you book the Shangri-La, stay at the Valley Wing! Stayed twice there in April and I must say that during both stays, everything was simply perfect. Not one thing to complain about... Tough the entire hotel is rather large, you feel like in a small intimate oasis in the Valley wing... I arrived very early in the morning (7am) from Europe and my room was ready. Checking-In is incredibly fast and takes place in the privacy of your room. Free sandwiches and drinks in the lobby in the afternoon are a nice extra and breakfast is included... definitely worth evey cent! The only thing this hotel misses in comparison to the Ritz, Oriental or Swissotel Stamford is the view which is definitely not very spectacular... The other parts of the hotel are a bit less impressive and very much in the style of the 70's... seems a little dated! Food at the poolside restaurant was a bit bland and the service was not very attentive... The gym is large and well equipped but you better take your jacket with you as the room is definitely undercooled. If you're looking for a quiet retreat in the city center to relax after a tiring day in the tropical heat, Shangri-La's Valley Wing is the right choice. Location is probably not the best (except for shopping) but at least you do not have all the noise from various construction sites near the other luxury hotels closer to the sea.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch luxury hotel lives up to it's name”
Reviews.Author: Navigator10
Reviews.Content: I wanted to try out two hotels on my first Singapore vist. Picked the Ritz Carlton and Shangri-la. This hotel is about four blocks off of the famous Orchard Road. I chose it because of it's reputation and it's convenience to this shopping area. Many designer shops here. Better than Rodeo Dr. in Beverly Hills. A par with all the world's large cities. I took a cab from the Ritz. Arriving here, my luggage was taken and I was directed to the reception as I expected. Beautiful, classic interior lobby. My room was in the main tower and I had a partial view of one of the pools. There are three towers to this large complex. I believe I was in the oldest one. This room was large, quiet, clean and well equipped as expected. From looking at photos of the bath, I think the newer wing has a bit larger bath with two sinks instead of one. See my photos. I was happy with the separate shower. As I had read on this site, the hotel operated a free shuttle van to the center of Orchard Road all day and into the evening. I used this a few times. I found the most convenient subway stop was a block away from where the hotel guests were dropped off by the van. I took the train to the city center. Central Singapore is hard to get around for an outsider because the streets are not in a grid patern. Used my compass to help orientate me. Much shopping is underground to avoid the heat, which isn't bad in March. There is a Chinese restaurant in the lobby of the hotel, one of several restaurants. Had a very nice dinner here although it was expensive. The staff was great. Had several extended conversations with them. With their suggestion I made a quick cab trip to the National Botanical Gardens near this hotel. I caught a cab rather quickly back from the gardens because the cabbie told me that he likes to use the convenient restrooms by the parking lot of the Botanical gardens. Large pools and landscaped grounds. Better than the Ritz. The bay view at the Ritz-Carlton beats anything at The Shangri-la. Bath is nicer at the Ritz too. All in all I liked this hotel very much and would hope to meet some of the staff again.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Robert87
Reviews.Content: Living in Asia, one gets rather used to high standards from hotels, especially from local chains like Shangri-La. My 3 night stay at the Shangri-La Singapore together with my wife and young son helped to raise expectations further, however - together with the Pensinsula Bangkok, this now ranks at the top of the Asian league, in my opinion. Particularly impressive was the breakfast, with superb stylish presentation, creative variety and excellent ingredients all round. Our room was spacious, impeccably clean, very well thought out with lovely details to be found in the choice of bedclothes, pillows and suchlike. Staff were very efficient, helpful and relaxingly reliable. A real plus is that children are made to feel positively welcome all round by the hotel's staff, and my son greatly enjoyed his stay. Bathrooms were spacious, and first-rate all round. Location-wise the fact that it is 5 minutes from Orchard Road means that one is well plugged in. On leisure facilities the pool is very pleasant, although not as elaborate in other Shangri-La hotels - very good tennis as well. As for price, not really cheap, but compared to what one gets in Europe for similar prices, it then seems a real bargain.

Reviews.Title: “A real dump”
Reviews.Author: treadlightly
Reviews.Content: Ok, ,maybe that's a bit harsh, but not for the prices they charge and what you get. We went on our honeymoon on the way back from the Maldives. We arrived after an overnight flight at 6 am jetlagged and wanting to rest. To their credit, they gave us our room straight away. We put up the do-no-disturb sign and fell asleep. Well, maids came in about five different times despite the sign and us telling them not to-and we were on our honeymoon! But that's not the worst of it, our room smelled horribily of mildew, even our pillows. There were ants all over our room, and the entire hotel felt extremely dated. We complained but were told we were in the best section of the hotel-the garden wing-which we just couldn't believe. Also, the food is very ordinary and really overpriced. I've stayed at Shangri-La in Hong Kong and it was extremely nice, not so here. Save your money and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Even better than expected”
Reviews.Author: SpineyNorman
Reviews.Content: On the recommendation of Tripadvisor I stayed here with my wife and son for three days in April. The reviews had been so consistently good that I expected to be disappointed - at least on a 'nothing can be this good' basis. However everything was perfect in every way. We stayed in the Garden Wing, which is really beautiful with delightful flower covered balcony. Apart from that I can add very little to what others have said but would give this example of their attention to detail. My wife was slightly unwell one morning and I asked them not to make up the room till midday. When we returned back to our room in the evening, there was a letter from the management saying they hoped my wife was better and asking if there was anything they could do for us. How's that for service?

Reviews.Title: “Fab Shangri-La”
Reviews.Author: birdybird
Reviews.Content: The Shangri-La Singapore is a fantastic hotel. My boyfriend and I stayed in the Tower wing for three nights in February and couldn't fault any aspect of our stay. Our room was absolutely lovely, very big and plush decoration with a city view. The range of food available for breakfast, lunch and dinner was immense (food from 60 countries avail. for breakfast alone). The concierge couldn't do enough for us. The decor is fantastic, it's all very grand. It's in an excellent location, just round the corner from a busy part of Orchard Road. The pool is devine and the grounds are lovely, would have loved more time to enjoy it. We've stayed in a fair number of hotels worldwide and this is the best, defintely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “greatest afternoon tea?”
Reviews.Author: leuca
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel to cap off a long holiday to Aus & NZ. We were upgraded to the Garden Wing and our room was at ground level at the front but somehow 4 storeys up ar the rear-you could walk down through a garden and cascading waterfall complete with pools full of KOI carp down a walkway to the swimming pool. Nothing is too much trouble. The service is immediate, attentive but not intrusive. We went to the top floor bar which has floor to ceiling glazing and affords a great nightime panorama. very good restaurants as you would expect. A swimming pool in a garden setting-very striking in the centre of a city. Afternoon tea is sublime-don;t have much lunch! It was fifteen pounds -30 dollars but worth every penny. There is a tea list with over a hundred different teas and the buffet as everything ranging from Dim Sum, Sushi to strawberry tarts Fabulous -allow yourself at least an hour ---or two perhaps!

Reviews.Title: “Shangri-La Indeed!”
Reviews.Author: The_Pickles
Reviews.Content: From start to finish, my short stay at the Shangri-La was an excellent one. No sooner had we walked through the door than we were offered a refreshing glass of sparkling wine whilst we checked in. Check in itself took no time at all and staff were extremely ammenable when it came to our requested room upgrade. Breakfast was superb, with lots of choice, the rooms well appointed and large and the hotel gym and pool were simply stunning. Singapore was a fantastic place, my lasting impression of which will be my stay at this hotel. Thoroughly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Most Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Gordy2
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at the Shangri La on a room only basis on 13th floor in the Tower Wing. Room more than adequate. Reception staff on arrival were efficient, but not particularly welcoming.We stayed 3 nights at the Oriental a week after this and reception staff at the Shangri La could learn a lot from the staff there.Breakfast at the Shangi La good with plenty of choices. Pool staff very nice. Preferred the Oriental for location though as Shangri La is just out of things a bit. Booked both Hotels through Asia Rooms - absolutely no problem and highly recommend them.

Reviews.Title: “simply the best”
Reviews.Author: ace30
Reviews.Content: Simply the most beautiful hotel we've stayed at. the service was impeccable. there really wasnt anythin we could find fault with.

Reviews.Title: “Pampered in Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Blusouq
Reviews.Content: My husband and I resided in the Valley Wing of the Shangri La for 4 wonderful nights. I say "resided" because we were welcomed as if it were our home. From the warm welcome, the staff greeting us by name everytime they saw us to the personalised stationery. Our roomy suite was packed full of goodies and I immediately phoned home to tell the children our bed in the Valley Wing could surely accommodate a family of 6!! The inclusive drinks and canapes in the Valley Wing lobby provided the perfect finishing touch to a busy day of sightseeing and shopping. Yes, the Moet went down very nicely. On our final night we had planned a dinner at Indochine and I was chatting to our Butler before we set out, lamenting the fact that I had not purchased some henna tattoo paint for my daughters when we visited Little India. He said that he would get some for me. When we returned from dinner we found a pack of the Henna from Serangoon Road had been delivered to our room!! Now that is service. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff and we appreciated every luxurious moment of our stay. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Truly heaven on earth!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri-La on the way back to Canada from Australia for 3 nights. We were initially registered for the Garden Wing, however were invited to upgrade to the Valley Wing on arrival, and I am delighted that we did. The additional cost was more than worth it when you consider what was included - complimentary breakfast (choice of restaurants)and free-flowing drinks and snacks in the Valley Wing Lounge. The room was superb, nothing was missed - multiple bath products, bath robes, slippers, etc. And the biggest King-sized bed I have ever seen! We were escorted to our room by a delightful lady who explained everything and welcomed us with complimentary tea. A daily fruit bowl was delivered as well.The service at breakfast was excellent, the food first rate. The free-flow of drinks in the Valley Wing Lounge was just that! Moet & Chandon and a full range of other alcholic and non-alchoholic drinks were readily available and various sandwiches/pastries/canapes and snacks provided. And what can I say about the staff? They are the most gracious, professional, friendly people - delightful and courteous to all and genuinely interested in any conversation held with a guest. A huge thank you to Lawrence, Siu and Khar for making this stay so memorable. Would we return to Shangri-La? In a heartbeat! They made this a trip to remember forever.

Reviews.Title: “Can't praise it highly enough”
Reviews.Author: BagpussLondon
Reviews.Content: We booked the Shangri-La for a bit of luxury at the end of an extended holiday around the southern hemisphere. However, nothing could have prepared us for the Shangri-La. Like a previous reviewer, we originally booked the Garden wing but were upgraded to the Valley Wing upon arrival. On reflection, the Valley Wing is the only way to go. Complimentary breakfasts, free drinks all day (including chmapgne), own check in desk, fantastic concierge, very friendly wait staff, free internet and newspapers, and a butler on call to run your bath!! The only down side was the elderly pearl women who felt it necessary to look everyone up and down (in a very obvious manner) each time they passed which did annoy after a while. I also urge everyone to make use of the spa facilities. My partner and I have stayed in many top spa destinations but never have we had a massage as good as at the Shangri-La

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Shangri-La”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself & my husband stayed in the Shangri-La in Dec 05 for four nights, on our way to Australia. Over the course of our trip we stayed in many top class hotels, and this was one of the best. Our room (in the Tower wing) was excellent and service in the hotel was fantastic. We had only one complaint. We ate dinner in the hotels chinese restaurant one night, and found that it had no atmosphere and the service was bad.

Reviews.Title: “shangri la”
Reviews.Author: dmb100
Reviews.Content: This has got to be the best hotel my wife and I have ever stayed at. Outstanding service. The room was light and fridge level air conditioning if you wanted it. The lobby is probably the largest I have ever seen; impressive given the cost of space in Singapore and the usual "cosiness" of city centre hotels. We travelled independently with friends and stayed here for four days during our tour of Malaysia. This was certainly the best hotel for cleanliness, atmosphere and general hospitality of the staff. We booked a deal to include breakfast, which is certainly the way to go if you don't want to get stung by "expense account" breakfast charges. There are so many places to eat out in Singapore that it would be shame to stay in the hotel, even though the food is excellent. Try Little India for curries, or the wharf area for seafood. Raffles for "Tiffin" is unmissable.

Reviews.Title: “What's the Fuss??”
Reviews.Author: A_TravellerAdelaide
Reviews.Content: Based on the Number 1 rating of this hotel, I booked it for an extended overnight stay (30+ hours) en route between Australia and Europe. Frankly, the standard was quite ordinary. Yes, the lobby is impressive and yes, like all of Singapore, the staff courteous and efficient and were quite happy to accommodate my early arrival. BUT, the room (in the Garden wing) had certainly seen better days. Little things like stains and chips to furniture, mould in the shower, dead plants in the balcony window boxes etc to more signignificant things like an A/C that struggled to keep things cool, making for an uncomfortable stay. The pool was nice, but crowded during most of the day. For me, the most disappointing thing was the wildly expensive prices charged for 'extras'. My package didn't include breakfast and, although the buffet was excellent, I found a charge of $35 (plus service charge!) for a cup of coffee and a croissant really over the top. Other examples were $80+ for wines that retail in Singapore for around $12, $10 per 15 minutes for (slow) internet access etc etc. In all, I was disappointed, partly, I suppose, because I was expecting something special from a hotel that was rated number 1 by Trip Advisor. I dont think I shall be returning.

Reviews.Title: “It was an Experience”
Reviews.Author: Holyoke_Herm
Reviews.Content: Shangri-La Hotel impressed from moment I arrived. The palatial lobby and the friendly hotel staff started my experience. The location is off the busy Orchard Road by a few blocks and is very quiet. My room was not up the standards of the rest of the hotel but still very nice. It was old but has seen some recent remodeling. The controls for the lights and environment of the room were something I have only seen in Singapore. The LCD control pad also controlled curtains. There was TV a speaker in the bathroom too. There are different levels of rooms as my colleagues had nicer rooms than me. The buffets both breakfast and dinner are unbelievable. The best I’ve ever seen. I enjoyed the local food with suggestions from the concierge desk. When I left Singapore I was actually tired of seafood. This is a very nice hotel but I did have some disappoints that kept this hotel from my best ever rating. Free wireless Internet either in the room or lobby would be nice as many lesser hotels offer this service. Their shuttle bus service was not good, as it did not follow the schedule published in their handbook. The actual schedule and drop spots were not very convenient. Walking and cabs were more reliable. The Shangri-La must be a good hotel, as one morning there were four red Ferraris in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top Class at the Shangri-La”
Reviews.Author: Holliday
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Shangri-La for 4 nights in early December - truly first class. Booked the value rate on their website and this includes return airport transfers. Arrived at the hotel to be found we had been upgraded to the Valley Wing. This was truly first class, everything we could ever want. The room was huge and full of little luxurys, complimentary fresh fruit, bottled water, magazines etc. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful, nothing was ever too much trouble. The pool area is great too, very tropical and a huge pool. The complimentary iced water, fresh fruit and cold towels make you feel very important! I will return to the Shangri-La, truly first class, go and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Pure luxury!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri-la from 8-19 November. We stayed with family in the sumptious Valley Wing and were blown away by the extreme luxury of this hotel. We were fortunate to receive complimentary drinks from 10.30am-10.30pm as part of our package and this included unlimited Moet & Chandon, as well as any cocktail you could think of. Little canapes and cakes were served throughout the day too. Staff were exemplary and incredibly attentive, going so far as to learn every guest's name. The hotel itself is huge with a wonderful pool and leisure facilities. The rooms were totally out of this world- massive, beautifully decorated and luxurious fixtures and fittings- we even had a flat screen TV in the bathroom! All in all a fantastic hotel and relatively cheap in comparison to its equivalent in London or New York for example.

Reviews.Title: “Valley Wing only”
Reviews.Author: Holly03
Reviews.Content: Would thoroughly recommend the Valley Wing. Initially booked the Garden Wing but when shown to our room was a bit disappointed as lacks luxury feel and bathrooms dated and unremarkable. The Valley Wing is much more intimate and works out good value as price of breakfast alone is almost half the upgrade cost. Add in afternoon tea and a glass of champagne and you have your moneys worth very easily. The spa & gym could do with an update as neither is particularly impressive in such an Asian environment and to match the current ever greater hedonistic standards in spas. Staff are excellent as many have already mentioned.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Holidayze
Reviews.Content: My family and I have just returned from a trip to Singapore, staying at the Shangri-La for three nights before a cruise and three nights after. We had two horizon club rooms and cannot praise the hotel or the staff enough. Nothing was too much trouble and when we returned after the cruise it was like coming home, and the staff were so pleased to see us. Whilst we were there it was my son's birthday and the staff presented him with a cake and sang to him. By the pool we were regularly serviced with iced water, cold towels and fruit. The restaurants were a little pricy but excellent. If I had any criticism it would be that the canapes in the lounge in the evening were slightly repetitive. Would definitely recommend the hotel and would love to stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we stayed at during our RTW trip”
Reviews.Author: peterokUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri La during a three day stopover on our way to Australia. The hotel was busy on our arrival and we found out at check in that the room type that we were booked in was not available. We were instead offered a 2 bedroomed suite in the serviced apartments adjacent to the hotel. To compensate for this inconvenience we received free breakfasts throughout our stay. In reality the alternative offered was a major upgrade. As such I can't comment on the main hotel rooms but can say that the service levels were superb throughout our stay and upon finding they they had a problem they made sure that we were looked after properly. The breakfast restaurant service is truly awesome offering an immense variety of dishes. Try this out at least once during your stay you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “How quickly can I book for next year”
Reviews.Author: Wullieesso
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from 5 nights in Singapore and this is the question I am now asking.I also stayed for 2 nights in the Shangri la in Dudai before returning to the UK.Both are 5 star however the Valley Wing wins hands down for the quality of service and the personal touch. From the moment you arrive at your own check in desk to the personal tour of your room by the staff you know this is somnething special.Never mind the standard of the breakfast, the complimentary canapes, sandwiches, coffee,champagne, the ice cold water and fruit at the pool, the first class rooms etc,etc, for me what sets this hotel apart from others is the service from the butlers, both in the Summit Room for breakfast and in the lounge.Nothing was too much trouble for them and to be welcomed by the staff each day, who all seemed to know your name, made this hotel something special.Its minutes away from Orchard Road and I would recommend a visit to Holland Village and an Italian restaurant, Michael Angelos,15 minute taxi ride(£4)Excellent steak at very reasonable prices as was Dan Ryans,Tanglin Road,Black Angus,Orchard Road both within walking distance and great for steaks in particular.The Hard Rock Cafe is also close by if you are looking for some live entertainment. I would recommend the Valley Wing to anyone looking for something a bit special.All I need to do now is find the number of my travel agent to book for next year.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Singapore Holiday”
Reviews.Author: jobbo
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed in the Valley Wing of the Singapore Shangri-la in September 2005. We had booked 2 rooms interconnecting but when we checked in we were upgraded to a suite with a connecting twin room. All I can say is unbeliveable. The rooms have everything you want and more. The staff are very friendly and will do anything for you. We requested toasted sandwiches for breakfast, and they did them no problem. The hotel is only an 8 minute walk from Orchard Road. The pool is fantastic situated amongst beautiful trees with heaps of lounge chairs. Even at night after dinner and a nice walk you can have a dip in the pool with the fountains going. The Line Restaurant is fabulous, especially the chocolate fountain and the seafood. Room service is very prompt but a little expensive. If we ever return to Singapore, and I hope we do, we would not stay anywhere else. Our 2 sons aged 15 and 11 enjoyed themselves especially the butlers who couldnt do enough for them. Special breakfasts and remembering what they liked and what they didnt like. If your pocket stretches and you can afford the Shangri-la, do not hesitate as you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hertfordshiremember
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent Hotel. Everything one would expect from a Five Star Hotel and more; much more. My wife and I stayed at this Hotel for three days in late September, on our return journey from Australia. We stayed in a Valley Wing Room; the facilities included complimentary breakfast with snacks and canapes throughout the day, as well as (unlimited) free drinks including champagne and spirits, from 11 am to 10.30 pm. On this same trip we also stayed at the Shangri-la Hotels in Bangkok, Sydney and Cairns and we found the Singapore Shangri-la a splendid Hotel; all the staff were very helpful, friendly and pleasant. A word of caution: if you stay at this Hotel on your outward journey, any other Five Star Hotel you may stay at subsequently may come as a bit of a disappointment !

Reviews.Title: “Takes your breath away”
Reviews.Author: JOHNandAMY
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shangri-La for 3 nights as the first part of our honeymoon. As soon as you walk into the hotel it takes your breath away. It is truely amazing. The staff are amazingly friendly, and made us feel very special on our honeymoon, with an upgrade, honeymoon cake and fresh green tea, and roses on the bed. I cannot praise this hotel enough and highly recommend a late night 'Revolt' Champagne cocktail in the hotel's Blu bar overlooking the City. Amazing. If we go back to Singapore I would not consider staying anywhere else, as the hotel has the added advantage of being only a 5 min walk to Orchard Road.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: wow what a fantastic hotel, if you want to be treated like royalty then this is the hotel for you, on arrival at the hotel the reception staff were there to welcome you and showed you to reception and then on to your room, after a few moments in the room we were brought a basket of fresh fruit and a basket which contained a pot of herbal tea which was very nice and refreshing. the rooms we had were the deluxe tower room and it was imaculate the view from the room was of the pool and was breath taking. the food thow expensive in the hotel was excellent with every sort of dishes you could imagine. service was very quick and nothing was to much trouble for any member of staff, finally you must try the cocktails in the lounge they were out of this world ( well we were most of the time ). very highly recomended we will be returning again in 2006 but for much longer as there is plenty to see and do

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel ive stayed at”
Reviews.Author: freckles
Reviews.Content: Well what can I say, we arrived at the hotel ( the Valley Wing) at 9pm, was greeted with an orchid, as soon as we told the staff our name, they realised we were on honeymoon and I was given a beautiful bouquet of flowers, we were shown to our room to be checked in and were told about resturant times, etc.. on the way. We had been upgraded to a suite, (paid for by the travel operater as they made a huge mistake on our previous hotel in Koh Samui) the room was fantastic, huge living room, with enough chocolates for a week, and a cake with ''happy honeymooners'' on it, bedroom huge, bed looked lovely with the flowers on it, bathroom great, husband loved the TV in there, double sinks. The suite was clean, with lots of flowers and plants, and nice little touches, eg.. stationary with my husbands name on it, choice of 6 different sorts of pillows, different air-con temps in different rooms, TV in every room, fax in room, The butler was lovely, he spent a long time getting the lap top we requested working as there was a problem with the connection, but he got it working, (laplops are free if in a suite you just pay the connection fee) Laundry service was excellent, I had just had a tattoo done on my lower back and had got ink on the waist of one of my skirts, but it came back like brand new, and the same day, Food was excellent, ate in the buffet (the line?) the first night , fantastic HUGE choice, also ate in ''Blu'' again excellent, the breakfast were superb, which were complimentry in the Valley Wing, as were the drinks and nibbles provided thoughout the day. does nothing for your waistline staying there!!!! The staff were very on the ball, very attentive, smart, pleasant, polite but without any snobbery, loved the guy on the door. we have stayed in some fantastic hotels in the past all round the world, and this one will will visit again, we were only 3 nights, and wish it was longer, Singapore also fantastic Jenny

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarieC89
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Shangri-la for 3 nights with my family as a stop over before moving on to Australia. I've travelled to alot of places in the world and, been to many hotels and, this has to be the best yet. When we pulled up to the front door it looked stunning and, walking into the main reception left me speechless for all the right reasons. The staff were really polite and, the service was exellent. We upgraded our room to a superior room in the tower wing and, the view over the city was amazing, probably because we were on the 22nd floor! The pool was lovely and, the food avalible in the restaurants was so delicious im suprised we got to see any of singapore because, the hotel was so magnificent. I never been so in awe with any hotel in my life. I'll definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing place!!!”
Reviews.Author: monsterdog
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Singapore for 2 nights on our way to Australia last year and I feel compelled to agree with so many others that this hotel was something quite special! We specifically chose it over many other wonderful hotels for its luscious grounds and gardens, something at quite a premium in Singapore! I had booked a room in the Garden wing through their website and breakfast, laundry, airport transfers and free wireless internet access were all included in the price. We were met at the airport and whizzed away in a state of the art new Mercedes and instantly made to feel like royalty! Upon arrival we were taken to a special reception where they did super fast check in and were given a complimentary upgrade to a suite! Not bad we thought Well this was our first experience with Asian hospitality and hotel service and we were totally blown away with their friendliness, efficiency, professionalism and kindness. The room and bathroom was fantastic and the view over the gorgeous garden and pool was stunning. The breakfast buffet was the biggest and most incredible spread we had ever seen and quite delicious too! They offer a whole series of courses such as a cookery class, ice sculpting class, yoga etc... The pool was so refreshing as it is a very hot and humid place and was very welcome after a long day of sightseeing. We thouroughly recomend doing the night safari, a visit to Sentosa Island with the cable car, a visit to the aquarioum and afternoon tea at Raffles is a must! And you will have never seen a metro station this clean!!!! All in all, our first encounter with Singapore was super and we were overwhelmed with the Shangri-la & would definitely go back over and over again!
